gBizFtpsyylKReCL5Ilc_A.text: One of my favorite breakfast/lunch restaurants! The service is always excellent and I absolutely love the pots of bread with the cream cheese icing!!!!

39kgMorFavv7EO4CZIxCWg.text: The cinnamon raisin pot of bread is enough of an excuse to go to Jamms.  But then there  Is the rest of the food.  Made in-house corned beef hash, delicious, eggs Benedict, and oh so many other wonderful selections.  I luv Jamms.

y3vYdetC2i3gA63FPvS6Xw.text: The food is good but the presentation is too simple and unappealing. The two thin chicken strips that came with my "Chicken & Waffles" meal were disappointing but tasty. If you're looking for simple home cooking this is place is for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you&#39;re looking for simple home cooking this place is for you!

-cC-OQMj3OPUChsPtZR_Tw.text: I love Jamms... they have one of the best breakfast restaurants in Vegas.  Their pot of bread is a must!!

zX5L4HhB-VQNHhpsOLbHtg.text: Steak and eggs disaster!   Eggs were undercooked and steak was very overcooked.  The cut of steak was meager peace of flat steak, not best choice for the dish.  Would rather have a better steak and pay more, seriously Albertsons is next door.  Gave the opportunity to correct the steak, got it back rare with no seasoning/salt.  Sausage Gravy (for biscuits and gravy)  Very smooth due to the absence of sausage.  It was a strange yellow color.  (Side note:  should be able to order with pot of bread if you so choose)  Omelet and breakfast potatoes   Large and stuffed nicely.  Potatoes well cooked and not mushy.  Coffee wasn't refilled as promised twice, then presented with a $5 coupon for next time... there won't be a next time.  Pot of Bread was excellent!

LtvPEYBX_qXKNujgtZDOiQ.text: Very good food great service. Love it here. Coming back for the 2nd time. Yummy food. Brought my mom and she loves it also.

c4qj9NQ5THcYmKM4q6sUEQ.text: First time here and the omelet and biscuit I had were delicious. The place was packed on a Saturday morning but we were seated quickly. Service was a little sketchy. We had to ask for our server and again for the check. Not a deterrent at all. I will definitely be back.

PMcpjCPQ0Y9EtIRve2VMpA.text: Service: Friendly and efficient (nothing spectacular but good none the less)  Food: Near perfect breakfast (perfectly browned and crispy hash browns and not too oily, Rueben Benedict was my breakfast of choice, hollandaise was creamy although i do prefer just a touch more tang, eggs poached to perfection in all its yolky splendor, tender corned beef atop a golden English muffin that was not soggy. Winner winner chicken dinner! The famed potted bread was a bit dry probably not the freshest, but it was now noon so I'm not mad at it)  Prices: standard ($24 after tax and 10% discount for 2 and a coffee with standard American breakfast portions aka BIG) **10% OFF when you post their food on some form of social media! (;   All in all great experience. Thanks for breakfast Jamms!  Side note: they serve Illy coffee so that is a gold star in my book

jtyRV2Kn_XS2IEpy7VTcvQ.text: Jamms will be my go to place next time I'm in Las Vegas. The Illy coffee they served was delicious. Loved the pot o bread, I had the cinnamon raisin type, my breakfast was the chicken and waffle. The servers were attentive, friendly and quick. The decor is classic diner/coffeehouse, casual. My kind of place.

_1xAgp58jLTZ42OLcdSBuw.text: This is the last last time I will be coming to this restaurant owner prohibits employees from speaking Spanish! Racist racist will never be here again and I will make sure I will pass this along to my family members who also frequent this restaurant weekly!

6L3-nWwuwJrnjQSeas-Rfg.text: I love this restaurant. Their cute decor makes it a home-y feel. We came for weekend brunch and the place was packed. My party of 4 and I had to wait about 5 minutes for a table.  In my opinion, Their breakfast is almost, if not better, than the Egg and I. Service was awesome, food tasted great...everything came out pippin hot and fresh and the prices are on point.   Also, anybody who loves biscuits and gravy would loveeeee it here. Their gravy had chunks of meat in it. Yummy!! =)

OIM5CVpFzJtmI96Q-Kk6Fg.text: Jamm's is a breakfast/lunch jem of the Vegas valley.  The food is excellent and the staff is friendly.  My 2 year old loves the potted bread and does my wife and I.  Our only wish is that there was more than one location but being they are a mom and pop restaurant, we completely understand.

zw7kQvhMjGWHm0bmJ2RyOA.text: Don't be afraid of the wait.  This place turns tables fast.    Hash and eggs are homemade.  Don't forget the freshly made pot of bread.  Always great food.

igEVPELTcJxKuhOIwv4Mtw.text: Thank you, Yelp, for introducing me to this fantastic breakfast spot.  Great coffee, refilled frequently. Provencal omelet (tomatoes, provolone, fresh! spinach), delicious. Pot of cinnamon raisin bread, light, fluffy, and perfectly addictive.  Cannot believe Jamms has been right there all along and we never noticed it. Now that we've found it, though, I expect we'll happily become regulars.

XdfhYTUTblFwhNrs-7m8cQ.text: I keep forgetting to come here and enjoy the restaurant.  Portion are huge and everybody seems to know everyone. Great experience

JahJyuuh7gArctSE3gVbEQ.text: So good! My friend and I both got the Bamalama omelette. His was traditional, and I substituted tomato for the bacon. Both were winners. Even better, the pot of bread! He tried the cinnamon raisin, and I went for the cranberry coconut. Absolutely wonderful alone, but add the cream cheese spread for pure heaven.

3I40U_8Gq5feuBMVff92eA.text: My husband and I decided to have a late breakfast.  I ordered a typical breakfast; pancakes, eggs, and bacon. My husband ordered a bacon, tomato, avocado, green onion omelette with breakfast potatoes. We also ordered something called a pot of bread. The pot of bread was homemade bread that was baked in a muffin ten. You could tell that this bread was  homemade and freshly made. It was very good. The service was excellent and we would definitely come back to Jamm's restaurant.

TH949fMs3IDy6_yfstXDJg.text: Deliciously friendly food! Strong coffee and large amount of food! Will definitely be back THIS WEEK!

gF9dbXz4Y3w6Su13uOokeg.text: I recently stumbled across Jamms and decided to check the reviews before visiting.  The reviews and food pics got me interested.  I'm new to the Vegas area so always on the hunt for a good restaurant.  I had some (southern) family come visit so figured that this would be the perfect time to try it out.  There were 7 of us that arrived around 11 on a Friday morning.  As any great restaurant/dinner should be, they were packed out.  We only had to wait about 5 minutes and the lady at the cash register was super nice.    Once seated, we were immediately greeted and got our drinks only moments later.  Everyone decided quickly what they were going to eat so we got down to business.  Our choices ranged from breakfast items to kids meals to the crazy awesome french dip sandwich.  Our food didn't take long to arrive and we were all surprised by the amount of food that came out.  Everyone had more than enough to eat and between the 7 of us, we managed to finish off everything.  The pancakes are to die for!  Kids loved the grilled cheese sandwiches, chicken tenders and the chicken nuggets.  And they all loved that the fries came in a "frying basket" for each plate.  The service was great.  Our drinks were never empty and we were checked on several times during our meal to make sure everything was great.   The menu gives a great variety of choices and we will definitely be back to try something different minus the 4 kids under 7 we were accompanied by originally. Between the 7 meals, 7 sodas/teas and a couple of extra add ons, our meal totaled $68.  Considering the amount of food we consumed, that was a great $68 spent.

_MSj1iWFnCuykIXXdfhTdQ.text: Love this place . Came here for brunch and was seated quickly and food was served in no time at all .

6fk890G7s7EazdGzB05KCw.text: Oh. My. Gosh. Seriously SO GOOD. I've heard many good things about Jamms, and I work right down the street so I stopped in this morning for a veggie omelet to-go. I don't know if I can ever eat an omelet from anywhere else ever again. Seriously... 5 stars is not enough. I will be back again and again and probably again!

zpXbLfUmuURW5ZU8xc2zdQ.text: The interior is very worn down. I felt a bit like being in an old bowling alley, but without the ambiance.  The floor was so dirty it's probably criminal, and needs new carpets badly. Outside on the window they proudly present themselves as "best of Vegas", but  not since 2006, and those 9 years show...  The 'thing' I ate was featured on a TV show, and was interesting, but poorly executed. It had almost no taste, just a lot of "meh". The fries were dusted with powdered sugar, which made no sense, and mostly made a mess. It needs spices, herbs, crunch, and more to salvage.  Price would have been OK, if the food had been OK. Service was fine, although there was some ruckus in the kitchen that was rather noisy. I had to ask for a refill, it wasn't offered, and I got it just before I left.   In a couple of years, unless they get their act together, this will be on Restaurant Impossible...

9Q186Ul452vi4g88-1LT1w.text: The food was Not good, I just tasted bland and they are pretty pricey compared to other places great customer service though but if you ask me I much rather eat something good

Xqsy2gdyjoDe6gvCqG0_vA.text: Wonderful breakfast, on this beautiful fall Saturday.  Great food, great server, Shirley was very friendly informative and welcoming.  Enjoyed the morning.

kjmVFyspyRb1syRjFWwCig.text: This place can rival Babystacks, and they are just as busy as Babystacks!  While Babystacks has their red velvet pancakes, Jamms has their pot bread!  Not only in plain but you can choose from cinnamon raisin and the special of the week.  And this week was Spice and More...which I will not disclose the detail of it but all I will say is, you must head on over there and try it!  I ended up ordering the ordering Babalama omelet instead of the Sandy omelet, as there was there was the  SOUR CREAM in the Sandy's omelet.  But the rest same, loaded with bacon, avocado, tomatoes, and melted Cheddar cheese.  OMG, it was so delish!  I ate so fast that  I ate so fast my tummy was telling me to slow down!  Pot bread comes with pot bread already and your choice of potato fries or hash-browns.  I choice the hash-browns.    The rest of my part choose the chicken fried steak with three eggs, your choice how preparation, and a Provencal Cheese omelet with fresh diced tomatoes, spinach and provolone cheese.    This is definitely a place worth trying and repeating all over again!  Great staff and your coffee is always full!  CAUGHT'CHA READING!!!

G4mEUuNbm_8S_If3rVlh4w.text: Disappointing change in attitude by management. We've been coming to Jamms for years. They have always been accommodating to my celiac spouse. Today he ordered his usual skillet and mentioned that he was gluten intolerant. The server screwed up her face and told us that none of them including the chefs had been trained to handle allergens. She acted like she wanted us to leave. What the heck???  There are three possible explanations for this change.  1. The server isn't willing or able to deal with allergies. 2. Management has had a change of heart and is no longer willing to deal with dietary restrictions. 3. The chefs really haven't been trained to handle allergies.  All of these options are disturbing.

-YakPw0mK76z5XoG4MWicA.text: Great breakfast. Pot of bread is unique and delicious. As good an omelette as I've ever eaten.

z9rnlbfhMko5-zK-yn5AaQ.text: I love this place!  It's always busy, which is a good sign.  The service is always quick and no-nonsense, which I also like.    I would have given 4 stars, but some of their food is not consistent.  I've had their Cuban sandwich, which ended up being super dry pork.  It felt like the sandwich was just dry pork and bread, when a Cuban sandwich typically has pork, ham, swiss, pickles and mustard.  Maybe they were having an off day that day, because their menu states the sandwich ingredients as such.  Their signature salad - the Jamms salad is cabbage, almonds, green onions, and sesame dressing is absolutely amazing!  It's light, crunchy and not over-dressed.  Very very good.  The corned beef hash and eggs is fatty fantasticness.  Their chilaquiles special sounded amazing, but was far from it.  It was under-seasoned, and loaded with tons of cheese.  Some may think that's a good quality, but this time it wasn't.  I wanted to taste the chips, eggs, and sauce, and the gobs of cheese made that difficult.  The beans that accompanied the dish looked as if they had gone way past their hold time, with the crunchy, crusty bits that form on the pan when they've sat there too long.   Their pot of bread is their signature, and they do that perfectly!  It's got that fresh-out-of-the-oven temperature and smell, and when you pull it apart, it reveals light, pillowy, steamy deliciousness.      All of these dishes were had over a couple visits.  I'll definitely go back to Jamms, but I'll get something different every time to figure out what's good and what isn't.  Right now their signature items (salad, and pot of bread) are the front-runners.  The ambience is homey, but clean.  Service is very attentive, and there's free gum at the checkout stand!

W8qDKNmuDLzO8ReA7XTPWQ.text: I was not impressed with this place at all today. First we get there around 12:30 and they say 15 minute wait. No problem. We wander over to the vape shop next door. I go back about ten mins later and our table is ready, but they won't seat me as my whole party is not there. Whole party??? It's just me and my boyfriend. I tell them he's right next door and will be back in a minute but they still refuse to seat me. I guess that is just their policy, but it put a bad taste in my mouth and everything got worse from there.   Our server while nice, messed up our order. I wanted to try the weekly pot O bread, which was strawberry almond, but she brought me out cinnamon raisin. Womp womp. I ended up just eating it, because I don't like to complain. It was pretty good though. Boyfriend ordered a Philly with no mushrooms, and it came out with shrooms. She admitted that was her mistake and offered to correct his sandwich, but he decided to order something else instead. He chose a chili burger. This was the smallest burger ever and you could tell the chili came from a can. I ordered the eggs benedict with home fries. I got about 2oz of home fries, which are potatoes with bell pepper and onions. They were good, but I had two bites and they were gone. The hollandaise on my eggs did not have much flavor, so the whole dish suffered.   I paid just about $30 including tax and tip which is wayyyyy too much for just an ok meal. I probably won't be back.

TMAJP1bFCIi4OIefCfl8aA.text: Pretty good for breakfast! The pot o breads is what I mostly came for and they are pretty darn good! Service is very good and they also have healthy options .. They have a pumpkin marshmallow pot o bread sometimes as well!!

K3A5-CnBUVle-XtUt0BI5w.text: I've been to this location several times, but only because my friends enjoy going (not sure why when there are so many other breakfast places that offer better food & service).   The food is OK, but nothing spectacular.  I feel rushed every time I'm there, like they just want you to quickly eat and get out so they can seat the next customers that are always standing waiting in the teeny, tiny "lobby".  There is usually a 5-10 minute wait before the server even comes to the table to take our order and multiple requests for coffee refills etc.

GoDq0BRZjHBQs14sdvFasw.text: LOVE Jamms! They have THE BEST Eggs Benedict! And the fresh baked cup o bread...so good!

RtpFpuzDIfFz7VO5S60h7w.text: This is where you have Sunday breakfast if you're an old Jewish couple, or a non-old Jewish couple who happens to want some kick ass breakfast for a pretty reasonable price.  I've been here a few times over the years and it's always busy, but consistently good service.  The menu is what you'd expect:  pancakes, waffles, french toast and a bunch of egg-based platters, salads and the usual sandwiches such as the Club; point is, it's all good.  Most menu items can be ordered small, if you're watching your weight. Don't forget about the free pot of bread with Yelp checkin!

9QiTZofTjylcVqiFUR-8DA.text: Seriously soooo good! Has a small diner feel with delicious and creative dishes, but without the pretentiousness or price of alot of brunch places. It's honestly my favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas.  Feels like a hidden gem.

TSSz19h0vpTs5dZHkLT_yg.text: The fact that Jamms is so close to my house is really just the cherry on top of the cake that is this lovely breakfast joint in Las Vegas.   We tend to visit here at least twice a month, usually on Sunday mornings (which is kind of a mistake because that's when after church crowd tends to swarm it) so there's always a wait, but believe me it is worth it.   The omelettes are nice, big and fluffy and the home fries are just right. The orange juice is delicious (I'm not sure if they claim its fresh-squeezed, but I have my doubts). The coffee isn't spectacular, but definitely passable.   One of the things that set Jamms apart: a rotating variety of "pots o' bread" (Management: If you're reading this, PLEASE make the cheddar jalapeno pot o' bread a permanent menu item!) - ranging from season flavors to standard fare.   But what I love more than anything is the service. From the hostesses, to the bus people, waitresses and waiters, everyone is friendly and treats you like family. There are seriously staff members who are genuinely happy to see you week after week.   That's what keeps this place going strong; nothing fancy or fussy, good food and great service.

NCHHOSy-2LPVQ7ygGzlHkQ.text: we are here and loving it.  great food and friendly service.  the top breakfsst restaurant on my list.

mrg86GYXdmvlA5tn_-4MDg.text: Service was a little scarce, seems to be only one server for our half of the restaurant. Biscuits and gravy are bland, bacon is good though. This is my first time here, so I'm sure they should have other menu items that should be good to constitute a 4 out of 5 star rating.

ADHLrwq07pYNCYKHUBE4oQ.text: A nice homey place for breakfast with  friendly servers and decent food. The Pot of Bread is tasty and soft.

HDtRxWSQGqGqMAm-DhwkxA.text: Best corned beef hash on the damn planet. Seriously.

x0ZfV9RDVoLoVPaMGpQJAQ.text: First visit today to this restaurant and it is awesome. I cannot believe we have not been there before.  My hubby wanted breakfast and I wanted lunch.  Hubby ordered corned beef hash and said it was homemade and delicious.  I had a tuna melt which was very yummy and so filling. Hugh portions and the service is excellent.  We will definitely be back as there was so much on the menu that i want to try.

c8fsoUcmY7p2fuFcH76mNw.text: Break away from boring strip breakfast and come over here.  This place is an absolute gem. You must try the Jamms French Toast.  I do not even like French Toast that much and this is good.  Sandy is among the best servers I have had.  I had not been there in 4 months and she remembered our names.  I promise I am not just saying that because Sandy's omelette is the best egg on the menu.  Cannot say enough about the pot of bread.  Try whatever the special is.  I have never gone wrong.  Worth the wait, but if you avoid weekends from 9:30-noon you should be fine.

yAwaQ9mrJbaNFfRK2JlrOg.text: The chicken fried steak is awesome! My favorite though is the potato pancakes!!

nrK71Ym0MFW8vX29l1pRpw.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I have been there several times.  The food is great and the service is excellent.  I love getting the pot o' bread and they know how to make an omelette (which most places just mix it all together)!!!  I highly recommend this place because it's not over-priced and I love that I have never had a bad breakfast there!!!!

IgS8SneQeCnxn10aUMS5NQ.text: I wanted a different breakfast experience than another restaurant with the word 'egg' in their name so based on Yelp reviews, my husband and I decided to try this place.  We drove a little ways from our side of town and would do it again to come back here!  It's a cute little place in a strip mall off of Rainbow & Charleston. Upon entering, we were immediately greeted and seated. Our drink orders were taken, literally the second we sat down. Our very cheerful and friendly server asked to take our orders very soon after our drink orders were taken. Being this was our first time here, we needed a couple of minutes.  I ordered the veggie omelet and my cute husband had bacon and eggs. I really liked that the food was NOT greasy! The omelet was huge and stuffed with perfectly sauteed veggies. I had home fries that were seasoned just right, AND I really liked the fact that they didn't drench my toast with butter! My toast had just the right, even spread of butter, which is rare.  All in all, the service was great, the food was very good, and the prices were pretty much average to most other places. I would definitely make the trek to have breakfast here again.

hYw5zqz2q-ks5olQHnG5ZQ.text: Signature omelet and Sandy omelet.  Comparable to Black Bear Diner.

wb4jhq6Q8lZM5JKhQafe8g.text: I left my hotel at the Wynn Encore (awesome hotel) and all of the splendors of the adult "bathing pool" because I had seen this place with Corn Flake french toast on the Food Network and had to try it (I make this at home). I took a surprisingly lengthy (twss) and expensive round trip cab ride way out on Rainbow rd where you could still kinda see the strip but it was still $30 away. Anyway, after passing the strip mall where this place sits a few times, cabbie found it and I settled up to the counter in a surprisingly empty restaurant (well it was about 3pm on a weekday). A very friendly waitress greeted me and the french toast I ordered was well worth the journey. If you haven't had corn flake french toast before, this is a good place to try it. Perfectly cooked on some good bread and quite tasty. The corn flakey crunch adds so much to the french toast experience, you may never make french toast the same again. Awesome.

5ZCYBOarbhUcF_9f7s5GIg.text: Jamm's is the absolute best breakfast restaurant in all of Las Vegas. The staff is wonderful, impeccable service. The food is always perfect and I have tried all sorts of items on the menu. I highly recommend the Hungry Lion and the pot of bread  is amazing. They also have great lunches. If you are in the area of Rainbow and Charleston look no further.... go eat at Jamm;s.

mt4pr5VJMCTgjZEuM56jKw.text: Went here on a Monday morning and the place was pretty busy, still lots of seating available, but a good first impression. I sat down and my drink order was taken immediately. I looked over the menu, knowing of course I was getting the pancakes!! My waitress came and took my order and asked what I was drinking. She came back with another diet soda and a caraf!! Scored some major points there cause I guzzle soda!! I ordered the home fries as well bc the pics looked sooo yummy!! I was dissapointed that they came out as little chopped up bits of seasoned potatoes with peppers and onions...did I order the wrong thing? I'm confused on what the potatoes are in the yelp review pics that look like they are super crispy on top, almost looked like a mound if mashed- are they the breakfast potatotes? The guy next to me had a dif style but they still looked shredded. Either way the pancakes were amazing, little crispy on the side and barely needed any syrup they were so tasty. They are def the buttery version as opposed to a dryer type like at maple tree, cracked egg and weiss deli. I will def be back to try and get those potatoes. Very friendly atmosphere....would have been 5 stars had I gotten the right homefries!

dB3J6x1GWEOeuaBDFCPzCA.text: This place can get super busy, and there's a reason why. Everything I've tried here is great. To the point where I had a friend come in from out of town and she loved it. The next time she was in town, the only thing from her last trip she insisted we repeat- Jamms. Any time a tourist wants to go to the same place twice, you know it's awesome. And the people working here are always super friendly. They treat you like family. And yum goes the food. Try the bread bowl! It's their little specialty.

F8DEs2h7G-WE5_Njn7vZww.text: We went to Jamm's for a late morning breakfast. Never having been there before, and new to the state, we didn't know what to expect. We were greeted by a very pleasant lady and seated at a booth. Immediately we were served our coffee. A very nice waitress came to take our order as soon as we got the coffee. After she answered some questions she put our order in. They have seasoned home fries, and sweet potato fries.i had the sweet potato fries. They sprinkle them with powdered sugar, they were yummy. They serve them in a little fryer basket. They also have the original bread bowl. It's bread made in a little muffin cup, the bowl. They have white, wheat, and cinnamon raisin. I loved the cinnamon raisin. They didn't keep my coffee cup full, but did give me a second cup before I left. Over all, the food was great,very original presentation, very pleasant ambiance, service was good with hardly any wait. It's a place you want to return to. Oh, they serve breakfast any time of day. Price for 2 breakfasts for us was $22.00, but you could spend more if you want. Great place to take friends.  I will be a regular.  Dan

I50QRR6SKJFBDyuxv-FuZg.text: First time they're just ordered a standard breakfast sausage eggs and the country potatoes were were delicious got a side of gravy and I'm glad I only got two side the gravy was horrible service was great the best boy was awesome he kept her drinks refilled

4YloY7uwtp-BXybA_gzrsQ.text: Tried two items from Erica's small plates. This was a great option to try more in one sitting without breaking the bank or having a bunch of left overs. The omelet was hearty and the perfect size. The waffles had fresh fruit toppings, a generous side of syrup and delicious whip cream, but the texture was more of a beignet.  The servers were polite and attentive, specially with coffee refills.  Will return again!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Erica&#39;s small plates: Omelet and waffles

x9QY1VaMheOg__gbmO-laQ.text: Best breakfast ever! And lunch of course! Had eggs Benedict my fav. I use to be able to go more often than now and I am pleased to say that they are the same as the we're then! I couldn't recall when they opened that location but 22 yrs in business? Goes to show you what consistent means! Food, customer service and of course their coffee!

6C4FKsiQBB06RmK-GDQewQ.text: Great comfort food for breakfast or lunch. Jamms restaurant is located on Rainbow and Charleston. I love this mom n' pop restaurant...quaint interior with dated decor that makes you feel at home.   In terms of service and food, I prefer this place over other breakfast places like Egg & I, Egg Works, Original Pancake House, Cracked Egg, and so forth. It's definitely not a healthy breakfast and can be slightly heavy for some but I still like its tasty home cooking. Service can be hit-or-miss with some servers being very attentive while some completely forgetting your existence. Either way, all servers are super friendly and their uplifting spirit will help you start your day on a bright note.   My favorite is Jamms signature omelet ($9.99) which comes with sliced steak, onion, mushroom and cheese topped with bearnaise sauce. I have no idea what bearnaise sauce is but based on Google search, it's a sauce made with butter, egg yolk and wine vinegar. I thought it was similar to gravy but it was more fragrant because of herbs. Tip is to ask for sauce on the side because they give you a lot. This omelet is meaty, cheesy and filling, easily my top favorite here.   French dip ($9.99) is another meaty/filling dish that comes with generous slices of roast beef. These slices of beef are in stack of three to four and comes in a hero roll. Their au jus was little different from what I had expected and almost felt like it was a french onion soup. I was surprised that I actually liked the sandwich without dipping in their au jus.   Philly cheese steak ($9.79) is nothing special here. I wouldn't order this unless you are craving philly cheese steak.   Pot of bread is free with Yelp chek-in. You can get the original, cinnamon raisin or special of the week. On my recent visit, I redeemed my check-in offer for their peaches and cream pot of bread. Bread itself was doughy and had small chunks of peaches inside. Cream cheese was provided on the side.   Inarguably one of the best breakfast joint in town. I hope to keep coming back here for many years ahead.

G_qcssWgDQP2e_pl58nxaQ.text: DOG LOVERS BEWARE: On a scorching hot day, I was stranded in a plaza for four hours. I came in with a bowl and asked the front desk waitress if I could use the sink in the bathroom to fill the bowl for my two year old dog, Egypt, a sweet and loving two year old pitbull, that was suffering from dehydration. She said no. I said the dog is in pain. She said that the restrooms were for customers only, no exceptions. I said you must hate dogs. She said no. I said fine but asked to speak to the owner/manager to tell them that this decision is wrong. The waitress went to her and said there's a guy who wants tap water from the restroom for his dog. The owner/manager snapped at her: NO! Then I stepped in and said that's fine I will respect your rule but that you are wrong and should consider certain situations as they come. Then - THE BEST PART: A customer overheard the whole thing, grabs the fully iced water glass on her table, gets up from her chair and fills my bowl. It was priceless and so satisfying. She made me proud. I thanked her and walked away with what I came in to get without saying another word. And EVEN BETTER: the place was packed and the customer's action made the room stop. The way the owner/manager yelled NO! grabbed everyone's attention. And another positive outcome: I put the bowl next to Egypt as I sat next to my car where I was stranded in 111 degree weather, and customers started coming out and filled her bowl with thier iced glasses! A beautiful act of protest. There are still many blessed people in the world.  And yes, this is a review based on emotion and how my dog was cruelly treated. The only thing I can comment about the restaurant itself was that the atmosphere was 4 out of 10 with bad lighting and the vibe as I walked in was one of negativity. I hope this makes someone's day, or changes someone's apathy towards needs of dogs. I had to get this off my chest. Peace and love to all who read this.

7P7ZN9KhFZXPhMvbqgDukg.text: Nice clean traditional looking diner in a strip mall.  Not expecting much, I had the pork chops and egg breakfast. Wow, it was really good. All of the staff, including our server Shirley, were very friendly and helpful, and the soundtrack is yacht rock. Would love to eat here again, or every day. Thanks guys!  PS. The OJ here is delicious.

Dtss8pw_nqtkJ72ySMND6w.text: I'm a fan of their food, just not a fan of the slow service. When I first moved out here, Jamms was our go to breakfast/brunch because my boss loved this place.  At the time, we loved it too because we knew that our breakfast or brunch would take at least an hour of our work day.  The wait and the service usually takes awhile.  On my last visit, the wait was better and the our food came out faster.  But it still took a while, in my opinion.    As for their food, there's a big selection of your typical breakfast items.  Price is actually pretty good and taste is not too bad.    My Past Orders: -Jamms Signature Omelet:  This is the king of all omelets here.  Steak and mushrooms dominate this omelet.  This is all you need because you are definitely stuffed after eating this one.   -Chicken Fried Steak & Eggs:  Actually my favorite dish here.  Their chicken fried steak is tender and the batter is not too heavy.  Portions are huge as well.   -Jamms French Toast:  Their french toast has a different look to them. I always thought that they were over-cooked, but they're not.  The french toast is crispy on the outside and after it's drenched in syrup, soft in the inside.  My second favorite.  -Steak & Eggs:  I had this on my most recent visit and can only say...stick with your favorites.  The steak had no taste and was a bit too dry.  I felt like I was eating cardboard.  But then again, stick with your favorites when you come here.    Overall, Jamms is just okay.  With all the other breakfast joints in our beautiful city, it's tough to say that Jamms ranks above them all.  But if you're looking for a decent breakfast with a lot of options, Jamms is the way to go.   YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE - (056/366)

rWvjLVE4sDrveZyAbHzSjQ.text: I had heard great things about this place and was excited to try it. I had the chicken fried steak and my girl friend tried the waffles. It was ok...it's hard to screw up breakfast but it's even harder to make a great breakfast.   This wasn't great my plate seemed a little dry.

J2q84AiS8aIkqTXtxugmXw.text: This one was a recommendation from a co-worker at Century 21, yes years ago- we ordered breakfast items several times on a group order. It was very good. I never forgot it and had always wanted to go in person. We were on that side of town and since the Red Apple Grill wasn't open for lunch, this was Plan B. I had never been inside until last saturday, with my husband. It's a small but busy and popular restaurant located at a strip mall next to Albertson's on the corner of Rainbow/Charleston. There was a short wait- I gave my name. It was about five minutes or so. Not bad. My husband said it reminded him of a smaller version of The Cracked Egg. It was decorated for Halloween. We sat in a booth- I was facing their Wall of Fame- numerous "Best of Las Vegas" awards, as well as a travel site award.  The drinks were brought over to us pretty quickly (quick refills too BTW). We ordered from the lunch menu- Reuben & Jamm's Philly (with mushrooms, and onions)- and split it (our usual MO). Your choice of side- fries, sweet potato fries, potato salad. All sandwiches came with lettuce, tomato, and pickles- cut generously. Most items on the lunch side were priced at $8.50 on average. We both got the sweet potato fries- very generous helping (next time, my husband said one of us will get the fries and the other will get something else). Both sandwiches were equally very good. Not super greasy either, which can be the case with both sandwiches. (We saw a sandwich that was going to another table that was super stuffed- wonder what that was, but I don't know how that person could even open his/her mouth- would have to take out an inch of meat from it. It was that big.) My husband liked this place; he recommended it to his mom and step-dad. I'm sure we will be back again. The staff is warm and very friendly- I noticed that there were regulars here (a good sign).   The bill was $17 and change- pay at the front counter. Free gum at the counter. On a side note, we noticed that there are omelets named after us, our nick names anyway, and they're right next to each other- how funny. Never saw that before in a menu, so we thought it was cute. Good diner on this side of town, reasonable prices, fast/friendly service, cozy atmosphere, only open until 3 pm.

Pfrd7P7hDIOtRkrUZeQTSQ.text: I like the atmosphere. It's sort a place you would want to walk to in your neighborhood, grab breakfast, and read the newspaper.  Jamm's has been a voted favorite for awhile and I can see why. But there is always room for improvement.  On the first trip, I ordered the Provencal omelet. It came with spinach, tomatoes, and cheese. The omelet was very soggy probably because of the main ingredients, but it should never be presented to the customer in the way that it was. It looked more like soup. I have to add, I never appreciate places that put a slap of cheese on top to melt. It tastes better when inside the blanket of egg.   The pot of bread, which this place is known for is a cool idea. However, if they want to make a pot of gold serving the carb in a cup, they need to perfect the recipe. It's dry.   Second trip, I ordered the turkey melt on texas toast. It was good. Just make sure you ask for dry toast if you don't like it to be buttered up.   This place is one of the better breaksfast joints in town. With a few quick improvements it could be even better.   3 1/2 stars.

7VTo7MOuE0GnxL50RIxJhA.text: The food was very good! Loved the Pot of Bread and Sandy Omelet!! The coffee was a bit of a bummer, watered down. The service was fabulous and prices were reasonable. We will definitely go back!

419Mq6WAbuV-ezqZayACuA.text: All the yelp, trip adviser and various social media stickers on the door made me feel like I was going to enjoy an amazing breakfast and that was not what I got!  The restaurant is located in a strip mall location and looks like a good find when you search for it.  There was a long line for a wait and the locals told me I would not be disappointed when I questioned the 20 min wait before a flight so I stayed with my friends who are locals.  The wait wasn't too long ..our server took a bit of time getting to us because they were busy ...my fresh cup of coffee (there's a portion on the menu that says that we all deserve it to be fresh) was never refilled ...after I asked for it it came as I was almost done with my meal.  My gauge of a good breakfast is always a Benedict ...I've had multiple variations of it and it's my go to ...must be the sauce ....the menu talked about how you should get turkey if you want it but I guess it only applies to sausage and not bacon ..no beef or pork for me.  I opted for the Benedict with spinach ..egg was ok ..I asked for over medium and it came out over easy ..don't like it when the egg white is still liquid ...the hollandaise was average - nothing extra added to it and the spinach fairly bland.  I did order the bread in a tin and that was decent - I got to sample the plain, raisin and finally red velvet - the cook on each was different and I did finish the bread the only part of my meal that I polished along with the coffee.  I'm pretty limited in some of the things I can eat so when there's an item on the menu that excites me and its executed well I am pleased.  Social media is definitely something this restaurant does well and I think it contributes to their awards and recognition because the food is ok just like any other standard breakfast place out there.

UQoRGtCmjskpNnloIvxUjA.text: A locals restaurant, for sure, but super friendly to non regulars and THE FOOD!!!! The best french toast I've ever tasted, hands down. Amazing omelets, chewy super cheesy (the way I personally like them) The bread pots are like risen pots of yeast heroin. If I think too much about the bread pot I'll be right back there tomorrow morning consuming my entire day's  calorie consumption on multiple bread pots with the addictive cream cheese topping. They keep the coffee filled and the food out fast. Been coming here for over a year while out monthly for work and has been consistently excellent!

HYXeNue-lM8pDr9q0stxIA.text: I'm always looking for great breakfast places.  I came across Jamms on yelp and wanted to try it due to the yelp reviews.  My husband had the cornbeef hash, which was good but def was salty and I had the stuffed French toast which was light and tasted amazing. The coffee was ok and service was friendly.  I wasn't blown away by this place but I would def go back to try other items.

vr-SLmVmsNHjRS8Tvx8Evw.text: My family and I have eaten there several times now and have never had a bad meal.  Make sure you go when you're hungry because the portions will fill you up for sure.  Be prepared to wait in line on the weekends, especially Sunday.  The line does move pretty quickly though and it is worth the wait.  It is pretty small inside so it does get a bit noisy, not a huge deal for us.  The staff is always warm and friendly and makes you feel welcome.

NTWgPTiijG-NR0fYZGGboQ.text: I went here for the first time today and the food was incredible. Had a Denver omelet with hash browns and home made cinnimon roll. It was a little pricey but the food was worth it to me. I would definitely go again and try the flavored pancakes, they looked amazing

b4UsSWJqE9pR2Xmbi-usBA.text: Just checked this place out for the first time.  I love going to mom and pop places.  Place was hopping and I sat at the counter.  The coffee  was decent, I ordered the pancake combo with eggs and bacon.  Portion was huge and pumpkin pancakes were fluffy with good flavor.   However, the inferior pancake syrup they used, brought it down a notch for me.  Service was good and friendly.  Menu was extensive.  The omelets looked great co. gwNfediJXGibWcKbjGtN5A.text: My fiancee and I went there this morning.  Awesome food, ok service.  He got the S'more pancakes I got the meat lovers omelet, it could had more meat for my taste but it was still delicious.  Both times we have been there, there was a wait but always very short.

-81fANv_ux-k4UbsNP2Uhw.text: If you are staying in Las Vegas I would highly recommend leaving the strip and driving to this restaurant. The service is excellent. The French Toast tastes great. Coffee was good. They do bring milk for cream so it you want the classic cream taste ask for the half and half. The server asked me if I want a fresh cup of coffee with the cream. I noticed a lot of regulars and locals coming in. The hostess was very polite and cheerful. She also wondered on how we found the place. It looks like positive reviews are bringing people in. On the way out I noticed all of the social network ratings including Foursquare, Yelp, and Trip Advisor. Google needs to advertise Places.

8P189nUsQZAaKy8R0Iw3QQ.text: Had been hearing about this place and decided to stop by yesterday. Had the chicken fried steak, scrambled eggs, hash browns & cinnamon pot of bread. The best thing was the bread. Steak size was kinda small & gravy was bland. Small amount of hash browns. Not worth $12

EibUFe8mT2i9YkohfuapoA.text: Items ordered:  Coffee Nutella Almond Pot of Bread Red Velvet Pancake S'mores Pancake McBeth - French Toast, Ham, Turkey, Swiss Grits  Another long-term fixture of the local food scene, and one I'd unknowingly been driving by twice daily every Thursday and Friday since relocating to Las Vegas, Jamms Restaurant quickly earned a spot on the 'to-visit' list when my server at Mary's Hash House mentioned the quaint local eatery as another "great place" serving up home-style breakfasts at a fair price - a 7am opening perfect for another Saturday of dining.  Nondescript from the exterior but cozy and kitsch inside as a friendly staff bounced between tables with endless refills of coffee from Illy at a mere $2.75 it was to a diverse menu and a hot, yeasty 'pot of bread' slathered with Nutella and toasted almonds that I arrived and after perusing the menu at length an order was placed, a server named Shirley warning me that it would be "a lot of food," but failing to inform me of noted upcharges of $2 for a single Red Velvet Pancake and $1.25 for grits in place of potatoes.  Jovial in spirit with tunes ranging from Sinatra to Madonna playing overhead it was perhaps a ten minute wait after the bread that the rest of my meal arrived and with each item larger than expected in size it was indeed a substantial breakfast with only the cocoa-less Red Velvet failing to impress...the flavor merely that of a decent buttermilk pancake gussied up with $2 in dye.  Speaking to the rest, suffice it to say that it would be hard to mess up something as decadent as the signature "S'Mores" with ample chocolate chips and chocolate syrup finding balance in bold buttermilk, marshmallows, plus a dollop of whipped cream and yet as good as the pancake was, the un-fried riff on the Monte Cristo easily stole the show as golden Texas Toast dipped in custard housed Ham, Turkey, and Swiss of good quality and quantity, all just waiting for a sweet gilding of maple syrup to make flavors pop.  Never one to quibble prices but a firm believer that upcharges should always be disclosed Jamms strikes me as a good-enough place in a city with plenty of similar options; a bit better than some and a bit worse than others...the sort of place I'm sure to revisit at some point for the Waffle Sundae or the Stuffed French Toast, but not before investigating other family owned spots or before second visits to Blueberry Hill, Hash House, Egg & I, or Baby Stacks.

GivQcLlv3ekIpasuWy1LfA.text: Let me start this review by stating that the service at Jamms gets a 5+ rating.  Never was my glass empty or my table dirty.  They were attentive and did an awesome job at making sure we had everything we needed.  This rating is based on my meal.  I had a French toast combo and decided to go with the Jamms French Toast.  It was very tasteless and needed something sweet to give it a wake up call.  Had the chef done that, I would be giving this a 5 star.  Otherwise, the rest of our breakfast was good and my wife really enjoyed the pot of bread!!  I just recommend asking them to sweeten up the Jamms French Toast because I lost my appetite after eating it.

kBwXAX-6sEu-TYg8V5nCQQ.text: This pace is the bomb for breakfast. We eat here every time we come to Vegas. The homemade corned beef hash is so freaking good I could eat a couple pounds of it. Omelets are huge and the pot of bread is also very good. Wait staff is superb, watch for Shirley - she's a hoot.

Fh2kESgwbYKHyOwO12OOOQ.text: Was looking for a great breakfast spot and we heard about Jamm's and decided to stop in. The place was packed! That's always a good sign. Waited no more than the quoted time (5 minutes) for a table. Was greeted right away. The waitress recommended the chipotle mozzarella bun. It's was wildly flavorful! There was a lot to choose from on the menu. I will have to go back and try them all. We were happy with the food and the service.

cHC1u-FCDbNwkLLVitA0lA.text: On Fathers Day I simply looked up "breakfast restaurants" + my zip code. Wanted to find someplace a little different from where we normally go for family breakfast. Our waitress was funny and courteous, the food was absolutely outstanding and their signature POT OF BREAD was out of this world!!! I will definitely frequent this place many times over!

97vHbyr9pKPJFcTPALGHHg.text: I would always see a line out the door for this place, so decided that it must be good! I had asked my friends about it and they warned me about how dirty it was. I figured that it couldn't be THAT bad, so I thought I'd give it a try. Such a bad idea!!! I ordered French toast, pretty hard to mess up. I couldn't even finish it. I had the corn beef hash and eggs, bread pot, hash browns, and toast. The CB Hash is the real deal made from scratch with bit pieces of CB throughout. Eggs were poached and exactly to specification, bread pot was delish! Yelpers that did not rate this establishment higher need to try it again, because it seems they have listened to your suggestions/complaints and have acted upon those making the needed corrections.  I will return!

si7Tus2vMxr-Ghi6Y1TFhw.text: Wow. this breakfast based restaurant is by far my favorite in the whole valley. Luckily it's right by where I go to school, so I come in here for a quick bite in between classes often.   While this place is practically always packed, it's worth the wait. Usually the staff is working very proficiently and the wait isn't even that long. The breakfast food is very good, and they have a few vegetarian options.   The pumpkin pancakes were my favorite when they were in season, but there's plenty other crazy combinations to choose from. The eggs benedict is usually what I get and the sauce is awesome. Yeah, awesome sauce.

FAA3aEExow58QITi4qrcUw.text: I walked in and the place was packed!  The decor reminded me of an episode of the Golden Girls...  it was charming.  The service was excellent.    I had a Rueben for lunch.  The sandwich was pretty tasty. The pastrami was good, but they were real skimpy with the pastrami.  They had a total of 4 slices of pastrami...  When I was served the sandwich I had to lift the top piece of bread to see the pastrami.    When I eat a rueben I want layers of pastarmi, kraut and dressing slopping out the back of the sandwich when I eat it.    I like the place and I will probably end up there eating breakfast sometime...

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rueben.

szXrVkb_2OjcEwWLSQCrzA.text: We came here over spring break. The place was packed with a ten minute wait on a Tuesday morning. We were seated quickly and the server was there right away to get our drink order. There are many interesting options on the menu, but we decided on the classics. I got the pancake special which comes with pancakes, bacon or sausage, and I eggs. When I asked, they had no problem swapping out the eggs for hash browns. The pancakes were very thick and fluffy, easily the best part of the dish. The bacon was decent sized and just the right crispness. I could have used a little more crispiness on the hash browns, but they were pretty good. My boyfriend got the more super sized version which also came with sausage and a ham steak. The ham steak was average sized, cooked nicely. We got a free pot of break with check-in. We got the weekly special which was rainbow sprinkles. It was soft, flaky, and delicious. This is a great spot for breakfast!

5qeADa46kYpWQMU0aCiJXw.text: I have been holding this in for sometime now, and I feel it is important information to share. A few weeks ago my husband went to eat breakfast at Jamm's here in Las Vegas. He ordered and ate his breakfast, and then asked if he could order some bacon to go.. With one request, that it be made in a separate pan so that I would be able to eat it and not have to worry about cross contamination. The server said it shouldn't be a problem. However, when she brought it to him she informed him that in the future if he were to order the bacon this way it wouldn't be possible if they were busy. He was floored. He is making sure that his wife doesn't potentially die and apparently this "special" request was just to much for the kitchen to handle. Seriously?! So he speaks with the manager and her attitude was so non-chalant that clearly life saving practices are not important. So he gets home, tells me this, and now I am questioning if I should even eat this bacon. I open the container and find not only my bacon but hash brown bits as well. Clearly our request was completely ignored. So I decided to call Jamm's and the manager gets on the phone, and when I inform her that I could die if I ate that bacon her response was, well then just don't eat it. I went off on her. Clearly no concern for their patrons is evident. I want everyone in Vegas to know that if you have a "special" request in order to ensure your life isn't jeopardized, won't be taken seriously. It starts at the top people. If management doesn't care then no one else will. I just hope the death of someone doesn't happen due to their carelessness and negligence. I am not asking because I am picky, I am asking because I don't want to die. So please make sure that before you eat there you evaluate their practices. Oh and just so you know no military discount is given, but if you post you are there on social media you get 15% off your bill. Really? I think priorities need to be shifted.

_8L5_0KYD6n9lAdXLYkPRA.text: Home of the pot of bread. Well that was good and the food is good but the service is horrible. Had to wait for a table, but that's typical. After waiting for @ 20 min just to have our order taken it was proof then why the wait to sit takes a long time. I think we had more interaction w the bus boy than out waitress. Had to ask for refills which should never happen. Stay on top of your customers please!!! Finally food has been eaten and plates removed and again another long long wait for the check. Over all the service alone will keep us from coming back. No one wants to waste half a day at this. Your staff can be friendly as our waitress was, but when you fail to attend to your customers you fail to get returning ones.

xf-WPxGLUSRQyoNeSHc7kQ.text: Drove from east side Vegas to the west to try this place for the 1st time. NOT COMMING BACK NEVER AGAIN. My order came to my table and as soon as I removed the top waffle SURPRISE its chicken finger (McDonald's chicken strips are more bigger than what this people gave me) I was tasting more the lettuce than nothing else. hVPPAb5M90PgAWXcp7y4AQ.text: This is a very homey restaurant! It had its own little charm, for being a restaurant that's been open for over 20 years! The staff were very attentive, and I never had to ask for a refill on my coffee, because they made sure to check around with the tables often! I ordered the chicken waffle breakfast with french fries! For $10, I got a full plate, with room for leftovers of delicious goodness! Be sure to check in, and order their pot of bread for free! I ordered the cinnamon raisin pot of bread, and it was gone in five minutes! This is going to be a new breakfast spot for me for sure!

Pf4dMOkCRHafQDNFonQqZQ.text: Great place to eat. I have lived in Vegas 14 years without ever even knowing this place existed. My sister and I found ourselves looking for a place to have lunch after my nephew's baseball game. We saw the reviews and that the restaurant was five minutes away, so we stopped in to lunch at Jamms! The place was packed. We waited about 15 minutes for a table, and another 15 for service, but the waiter kept the coffee coming so the wait was not horrible. My favorite sandwich in the world is the Reuben, and can I just say, #yum!  Freakin AWESOMENESS! I will definitely be bringing my husband with me for round numero dos!

V8E_OTrvsG0pI76h8c_2yQ.text: Was looking to try a new brunch place last weekend and stumbled across this little spot.  I went on a Sunday, toward 2 PM.  Their menu is big and offers lots of substitution or smaller sized items on their "red plates" section of the menu.  Great for someone like me who is often indecisive and overwhelmed by all the decisions.  I decided I wanted to order breakfast food, though they did have many lunch/diner type items as well.  The food was good. I ordered the cinnamon raisin pot of bread as a side since it seems to be popular on the reviews.  It was good, not amazing.  But, nice that it was something different.  The staff was friendly and helpful when I asked questions on the menu, and service was quick.  Very basic interior, nothing IG-picture pose worthy (if you care about that kinda thing, I don't). Only semi-down side was that they don't serve alcohol.  So, no Sunday brunch mimosa for me that day.  Overall, it was a good spot and I would go back.

yGpBM7j5-EfM-e5EIvCcXw.text: Was it good? Sure. Was it great? Nope. We decided to come here since it's been on my bookmark list for a while now and from what I heard it's supposed to be very good. It was kind of a check in the box for me, so if nothing else I'm glad to knock another one off the list.   Came here on a Sunday and the line was out the door, which is usually a good indication the food is worth the wait. And surprisingly, the line moved rather quickly. And thank goodness because we were all in desperate need of nourishment after the night out we had. (Note to self: lots of sake, sushi & shots are a recipe for disaster, ugh!) Lol!   Anyways...first impression: it's a very small busy diner that could use some major updating. Lots of noise and hustle & bustle. Sitting near the kitchen I got a good glimpse of the waitresses & cooks frantically trying to get food out. Even so, our food took a bit longer than expected to make it's way to our table but in all fairness it was a Sunday not to mention, Mother's Day. We should feel lucky we were able to get seated so quickly.   On to the food. The pot-o-bread was good, free with your Yelp check-in. I guess that's what they're known for. Nothing here that really stood out to me. The guys seemed to be pleased with their meals. My omelet was just okay. The cheese on top wasn't melted. And the bacon inside seemed a bit over cooked, as were the side of potatoes which made it difficult to eat. (See my photo and you'll understand).   All in all, it wasn't terrible, it also wasn't the best. Great prices so that's a plus. But there are better options for breakfast around town.
