The portion was a good size, I was very surprised I was able to eat the whole thing.  I will be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito

4ogPtEj09uGroRUjdzg6Lg.text: Awesome food and amazing service.  Nice to see the same staff from my last visit and that they all seem very happy.  There is a reason I try to stop by here for breakfast when I visit Vegas.  Must experience!

JPvlOpUMOoRkTHLN-vIBwg.text: Great as usual. That's why we keep coming back. Food is excellent. Home style cooking. Reminds me of breakfast when growing up.  So comfortable in this place

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes

mbeO2o-oQN3noX0BMSn8eA.text: This place is Awesome! I live in southern California but visit Vegas often and every time we come we have to stop st Jamms for breakfast. We bring our friends and family here too. The food is amazing. The staff is super friendly. This place is a must! And you have to try the stuffed French toast and pot of bread. So so good!

1gV4nNzsYD22p_nvUrwfgA.text: Very good service from start to finish. I got the chicken and waffles, which were great the waffle was kinda regular but the chicken was above average. The hot tea my gf ordered came in a cute tea pot with honey packets. I can also add the side of hash browns were very good and one of the best I've had outside my house.  All in all a very warm feeling restaurant and great food, you won't be disappointed at all, will defently recommend this place to anyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

stLhT6vftZ5H9DhN2AfQ6Q.text: My husband and I went here for breakfast and the service was great. He had chicken and waffles which were delicious. I had a breakfast burrito that was not so great, it was very bland and not at all what I was expecting. I will say that I enjoyed their puff pastry that comes in a mug.

mk4N1Dx5J-b0o9NYGk6PmQ.text: I've been to Jamms a while ago, but couldn't remember if it was good or not. My friend has never been before so I decided to try this place again earlier today.   We arrived @ 10a, and was seated quickly. They got our drink orders right away and the coffee was on point! Another Yelper mentioned the coffee being delicious and I'm a picky coffee person, and this was great! Our server was Sandy, and she was very quick to get our orders and very nice. My friend ordered the steak and eggs and I had the pancake combo. We were both happy with our orders and they came out pretty quickly. Sandy topped off our coffee's a few times which I loved. I'm a sucker for great servers who come around when drinks get half way.   I will definitely be back to try other items on the menu and to request Sandy again. Highly recommend this place. Get there a bit early as there was a wait when we were paying for our check.

Uip8wvbYz7FvQgtUJdbLXg.text: I had the sandy omelet with hash browns and the raisin pot of bread. I also tried the French toast sticks. Everything was delicious!! The waitress was attentive and my drink stayed filled. This restaurant served one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. Absolutely loved it!!

efmEp_7zYtv7NH6kJnXGnA.text: Came here to meet with friends from NY while they were in town, apparently they had been here several times because the food was excellent and we had to get the pot of bread (this was said over and over) and we did, SERIOUSLY, NO REGRETS. It was amazing!! Food was fantastic and we were a table of 4 adults, 3 kids (6, 4 and 1) and a baby and the kids were seriously happy and ate everything put in front of them (parents will know this is seriously a rare occasion when every child not just eats but finishes their food without an act of Congress.) Awesome find for us locals and a place to take friends and family to in the future, a welcome find by our friends from out of town; sometimes that's what it takes to find greatness right in front of you.

mICFCIPDoy8g6ljfSmjS8Q.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in town.They have good food good service. At least me and my daughter go to visit every week I wish I can afford to go everyday

T6qfbx-YhMKh4vsXwOOeVw.text: While off the beaten path, the warm atmosphere of Jamm's, their friendly staff, and great breakfast is a must if you're looking for a new spot!

k7phNd5-cg1LtT0dRoGhfg.text: I really enjoyed Jamm's! We used a yelp check in offer for some delicious free bread too! Ate a fantastic breakfast after a 15 minute wait on a Saturday morning that left everyone stuffed to the gills, whether was waffles, pancakes or eggs. Portions are enormous and service was friendly and relatively quick!

TcwBvOxBDEoePg6HXdSlZA.text: 4.5 stars! I was there this morning. We had three different plates and they were all good. For sure i recommend to ask for their Franch toast....dilucious!!! About the staff?? Having breakfast in a place where everybody has a smile on his face is the best way to start a new day! See you soon!

WrmG--TIFmyObJDI_a4_AA.text: I never let the fact a restaurant in Vegas is in a strip mall bother me, because inevitably they wind up being great and Jamm's is no exception. We came based on the Yelp reviews and had to leave one for others.  The free pot of bread you get with a Yelp check-in is awesome, we had the cinnamon raisin variety and were pleasantly surprised at how much lighter and fluffier it was than your regular cinnamon roll. We had omelets with home fries and it was very filling.  Service was friendly and fast, good value.

tu_lDLbUV3mMR_1LYWhXWQ.text: my first time and it won't be my last.  Jamms could become my favorite breakfast place.  Fantastic omelettes.  The bread choices are better than any around bagel, English muffin, toast, or pot of bread no extra charge.  Service is excellent and staff is great.  Try I  did and was not disappointed.

X_YnP0R1XxASX-ztUMRbkA.text: It was our first time here and the food was good especially the pot of bread. We'll be back again!

2mKn5Lll0wgustc_ZX0YxQ.text: My second time here, my husband's umteenth time (used to live in Vegas for 2 years) & it's still the same delicious food as when he took me here 8 years ago.  The bread in a cup is a MUST, especially when they have the different flavors.  LOVE the small plates choices also.  Staff is super friendly & the place is extremely clean.  Be prepared for a wait if you go on a weekend later in the morning tho!  But, the wait is well worth it!!

lZliBsG37qgl3UhLbjkzBw.text: Great customer service,  food was fresh and amazing, definitely recommend this restaurant,  will come again, was clean and employees were super Friendly

aTkJNeVskrPfpFtc1a628g.text: Not exactly sure what all the hype about...or maybe these people have just been breakfast deprived...but this place was just OK. I have had a lot better elsewhere and was kind of disappointed. The pot of bread (that everyone raved about) wasnt that great..and no one in our group of 12 really liked it.  I got the corned beef benedict. It was alright. I think there was some kind of skillet that was the only thing everyone actually liked.   However, the Service was great though

C0jWT8mI4fQAWPOeAxCFkA.text: Their great bottom line! I left one star off cause it needs its own parking lot. But the service is wonderful. Our waiter was super cool, she had us laughing the hole time. And the food is bomb.

iCMEfNKWEH9WkICvCj-Qjw.text: I have been coming here for 10+ years and never a bad experience. Sandy is the best server, fast friendly and funny. If you want a delicious treat try their weekly pot a bread. Also I love the Erica small plates which allows for us Weightloss patients to order in small portions!!! I will always remain a loyal customer for the next 10+ years!!!

i8N_AdZ7fWmEGirDKW8czg.text: Been going to Jamms for almost a year now, and I love it more every time we go. Friendly staff, great service even when they're packed. Food is really good. Omelets are gigantic and tasty, and Eggs-florentine is really good. I love, love their pots of bread. They always have regular and cinnamon-raisin and they feature a different 3rd option weekly, today was lemon-lime. Last week was orange-cream. Delicious. And they always have a consistently great cup of coffee. It's a comfortable, family-feeling environment, great people and great food.

NOJfrFw-aZro0BiaFpdEOg.text: Good place for breakfast.  They have a big menu w/typical breakfast foods presented different ways   Place is small so there is always a wait.  The Pot-Of-bread is good but just bake fresh bread.  U can get a free one if u check-in on Yelp.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef eggs Benedict
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish Skillet - made w/corned beef.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot &#39;O Bread.  Cinnamon &amp; pumpkin (flavor of the week).

NNFfodlZPDXoPfmAp8-52w.text: This is hands down my favorite breakfast spot in Las Vegas. The portions are huge and the food is delicious. The Babalama Omelette is my favorite but their breakfast and lunch selections are all fantastic. Get the pot of bread and enjoy a warm, fluffy slice of heaven.

VrwDKkJOPwdZrpOoBAKJZw.text: I highly recommend this restaurant if you are in Vegad, the food is very good, and the customer service is awesome.

cAmRy1Ac1B8Sos2D2EWVFw.text: The first time it was here it was awesome. I had Jamms French toast and shared a side of chicken fried steak. It was good, the service was friendly and fast. The second time I went here, there was an estimated wait of 20 minutes. If you're going here for breakfast, make sure you have at least two hours. The staff was friendly, and we were seated in 20 minutes. After we were seated, however, it took probably another 20 minutes for us to have our order taken. This time I got one of their specialty French toasts-- a word of advice, don't bother with the specialty French toasts. Just go with Jamms French Toast. I made the mistake of coming here with only an hour and a half before I had to go to work, and I got my food about two minutes before I had to leave. Immediately I asked for a to go box and left. The food was still good, friendly staff but it took too long. Don't come here during the breakfast rush. It will take an hour and a half to get your food. The pot of bread is delicious, so is the chicken fried steak and Jamms French Toast. It's fried in corn flakes. Classic soul food.

LqCMMwRlg73vO6KeeKqG6A.text: Try their pina colada pot o' bread. It's a nice craving quencher if you want something sweet without having to eat pancakes drenched in syrup.

4SJPMgaX3FPaGkX_HEe_3g.text: Always a great place to eat ... always busy but the food is good and the portions are large

EXhbqyLSImA03s8J5eOmDw.text: Every time I have been here the food has been good - not great - but good. Not so today. I ordered eggs benedict and my wife got steak and eggs. Both were marginal. One of my eggs was hard boiled and the other was perfect. The Hollandaise sauce was basically tasteless. I didn't finish my meal and left the one hard boiled egg - no comment from the waitress. My wife's steak was overcooked (supposed to be medium) and had a strange taste. She ate less than half of her meal. At the check out counter the lady asked how our meals were. I said fair. No comment. I asked about purchasing another cup that I had purchased the last time we were here. I told her that the wording had come off in the dish washer and I wanted one like my coffee was served in - raised printing not just painted on. I was then presumed to be a complainer and she copped an attitude. Her tone changed and I gave up, figuring I wouldn't get anywhere here. Too bad really. You can get a marginal meal anywhere and any time,so it is a shame that she got huffy with me. Oh well !!

1XEl6k7O6V6pB0Tb7L4Q6w.text: Drove out of my way to eat breakfast here based on friend's recommendation. Glad I did. Service was outstanding - fast and extremely friendly and attentive. Great coffee, very good food.

vsE2SLjiGfDR6lTpXFRq5g.text: I love this place for breakfast! Nothing fancy. Just a good neighborhood joint that never lets you down. Super friendly staff, great service, excellent food. They only do breakfast and lunch. Haven't tried lunch here yet, but it's sure to happen.

HUtmT80yu--aqJZD7sIvWA.text: There's always a wait, with good reason. Delightful, home style breakfast in a divey little strip mall. Get the pot of bread; you won't regret it. Great French toast, hash browns, and pancakes. Good service, good prices.

2zSa_At_B6w_o_TfG0dQvg.text: Over the past year Jamms has won me over and become one of my favorite breakfast spots here. A big big part of the upgraded rating is because of the staff. Lots of friendly and just nice people, which goes a long way when they're some of the first people you see in the morning. Lots of regulars too that you'll start noticing if you spend more time here. Just kind of a pleasant way to start the morning. The food has been consistently good. The pots of bread have become something I look forward to, especially with the new special flavors every week. And that free stick of gum on the way out. Those details have really paid off over time.

Rkh-M5bVpTCBMoz342oW0A.text: I didn't think our meal here was fantastic or terrible. It was just okay. My hubby thought the sausage gravy was a bit flat.  Other than that, it was just your standard diner breakfast. The pot of bread was probably the best thing about it.  Service was good.

l3GGhT582k-8iXu8zCwJIg.text: Decent food but nothing special. The corn flake crusted french toast was OK but again, nothing special. I had the Irish skillet and was underwhelmed.

iRgvKrkcABR3yQXxkzbeOg.text: Reuben Benedict and Chicken Fried Steak! Free Pot of Bread offer redeemed! Lovely people and place!

s3ki1N7Rg2_xcIGF5-ArkQ.text: We split an Irish Skillet. HUGE. Neither of us could finish our half. Really tasty. I enjoyed the melted cheddar. The cinnamon and raisin pot of bread was like a light and fluffy cinnamon roll. A nice addition. The staff was super nice and attentive.

Pd_SWLsj32rXXurQ6BrvLQ.text: Had the Bishop Wrap with veggie burger - it was deeeeelish and Sandy is the greatest server. The boyfriend had the Smores french toast and he loved it. Definitely the place to be for breakfast or lunch!

5VL6NOwuQKbYIMJ8GlykVw.text: I'm one of these locals you'll see at Jamm's almost weekly!  I love this place.  The people are SO nice here, and the service is great.  The food is EXCELLENT.  Their bacon is perfect (in MY opinion)-I like it thick and crispy, and they deliver on this!  Their eggs are always perfect, and I love their pot of bread.  They have breakfast and lunch, and they have something for everyone.  Best of all, it's not far from my house!  :)

HRDkR50MoA-feeB9UwfAmg.text: I apologize to my friends @ Egg, but Jamms has the best breakfest in town! Today I had butterscotch pot of bread & the signature omlet. It brought tears of joy to my eyes. The waitress, Carol Ann, my friend, had to pry the plate out of my clenched fists. I had already licked the top clean, but she had a point, no need to lick the bottom. BTW, Carol Ann is an atrocious spellern

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me at Jamms

PIyjhaJ-npjHeEoGvBy9yA.text: Jamms is a great breakfast place.  I found them on Yelp a few years ago and now everytime we come to Vegas, we make it a point to have breakfast here.  I love the pot of bread (use Yelp and you can get a free pot) and the french pressed coffee.  I had never had it before, but always will now.  We haven't tried their lunches yet, but will need to do that on our next trip.  Jamms is a great local place.  I get so tired of the chain restaurants and fighting the traffic on the Strip.  Get in your car and take a short drive to Jamms.  You'll be glad you did.

qgEFWdfhaUqjRxj8-eKu3w.text: I thought Jamms was a nice restaurant. I would suggest ordering their in house items. I got the pancakes and eggs, they were good, but nothing superb, but my boyfriend ordered the french toast and bacon which was incredibly yummy! The service was quick and friendly and I would definitely recommend it!

nCi57-ElZghHrcM4StE1cA.text: We tried the Reeces and Cinnamon Raisin pots of bread. Both were delicious! Ham steak amd eggs was good. Ham steak filled half of my plate. Canadian bacon and eggs is 3 small pieces of canadian bacon. Small, quaint little home town type of restraunt. Nice to go to a place that isnt near the strip for some good food. Would come back again.

ScPc4DNFvKV9xTfq4MwRTg.text: I come here every now and again with my dad. It's around the corner from where I live, but rather than just the convenience I come for the food. It's not super fancy, but everything always tastes good and fills you up. The staff is always nice and friendly, and they will continue to refill your coffee or water until you tell them to quit. They seem really helpful with food suggestions too, from what I've overheard. Had Joe's Omelet today, less the mushrooms which the waitress agreed with me was a wise move lol.

FL-jYj_CiIlAgXRaS3gwTg.text: We dont live over here but make the trip across town...its that good. Always amazing food, always great servers. Homey atmosphere and homey food :) get the chicken/waffle sandwich. Its AMAZING!!! And the french toast dipped in corn flakes and fried up is also a must have!!!

sJlZLjbTVW6xAjK7rVkhYQ.text: If you are a person who loves crispy hashbrowns like my husband and me, this is the place to come. Just tell them what you want and they will deliver every time!  If we ever go out for breakfast, this is where we go.

lIy-mb9OI0LJtuGaWx5p6g.text: Incredible food not too far from the strip. Amazing staff and just down right delicious

d0J824gpFR41nvNgbM_4BQ.text: This place was referred to is by a local. I wanted really good food and not just the stuff everyone is eating that is commercialized. This place did not disappoint. The service was impeccable and the food was outstanding. I had the corned beef hash (instead of sliced corned beef) Benedict and pot of bread. The bread was delicious except that the condensation in the pan it was served in made the bottom soggy. Oh we'll. the hash browns were crispy and their homemade hash was simply amazing. Coffee was on point as well. Husband had steak and eggs and was happy with portion and taste. I want to come back and have more before we leave. I also have to thank the waiter at another restaurant for the recommendation.

L0_jQodr6Zeo-0H0d8_uLw.text: good place to eat breakfast. love the ot bread- freshly baked. portions are huge and tastes delicious.

cexbzMA8R6-IvJXR8TFnHQ.text: The hostess was not great.  I just needed a table for 2 and my boyfriend was about 10 minutes behind me.  Even though no one was waiting, she made me wait to seat me.  I understand if there was a ton of people waiting and I need a big table but it would have been nice to sit and have a cup of coffee while I waited.  Our waitress was a pleasure.  Recommended stuff and was very quick with service.  The food was just ok.  I ordered the hash because it was listed as a favorite.  I didn't love it.

8D3oOR2S2k1aQIcjOmaeog.text: How is this place getting so many great reviews.  The food was so bland and lifeless.  My wife thought it was 2 stars at best, but I guess I am a sucker for any breakfast.  We both got menu items that had a specialty star next to it even.  Service was prompt and friendly so I guess 3 stars is about right.

InPke46KC8pZGDeyYoM7fA.text: Rudest hostesses...ever. Waitress was great, but the food was pretty standard diner fare. We tried one of the pot o' bread, two different benedict dishes and the kiddos split the french toast. Overall disappointing and not at all worth the wait.

ooRO3n0ptyKGXN3Vispb5Q.text: This place is great. The people who work there are super sweet and the food is awesome! Defiantly try the pot of bread it delicious.

jV0JQRtOgK3Y5rU2GGvw3Q.text: Jamms French toast, veggie omelette, and Ruben Benedict.  I like the fact that they serve real corn beef not the can stuff.  The place is plainly decorated.  Not very busy the Sunday after Thanksgiving which was a shocker.  I enjoy the food, but it didn't wow me.  As a visitor, I probably prefer the Bagle Cafe's selections better. BUT, if you have a sweet tooth, I do like their french toast fried with a corn flake coating.  That was pretty tasty.

Hnd3h-Z7Xher2Ek1d0BGkQ.text: Soooo good. I've had their Rueben Omelet and the Rueben Benny. Both were VERY good.

ZmFZlgHrs23eRZGA3LDKfQ.text: What can I say! Well, to start off, Jamm's feels like home. I come from Northern California and so you can say that im spoiled with tasty and fufilling food with a very homemade touch. I feel that restaurants lack the "at home" type of feeling, Jamm's is definetely one of those establishments. As soon as you walk in your greeted with a huge smile and welcome. I waited less than 2 minutes for a seat. Right away we were asked what would we love to drink. Service right away!   The waitress with an absolute contagious smile, was very sweet and helpful. We did not wait for our food no longer than 15 minutes! Awesome, because I get so anxious when it comes to food. I ordered the Sandy Omelette (which I reccomend), DELICIOUS! Goodness, it was GOOD, hey did not skim on the portions of bacon,avacado, cheese and tomatoes.   I strongly reccomend this restaurant!

xBo6W57vup5jWU45oRpCog.text: Solid experience, a mom and pop style breakfast place. Not the best breakfast I've ever had but also not the worst, everything was good, friendly staff as well.

oOMsoOVjwZ7_nOaAmKhTmg.text: First time here for my wife and I and I was cheerfully insulted on the way in!  All in fun, just the way I like it!  Had to try the Pot of Bread, the special was Oreo!  Wow!  Very tasty!  Had the Jamms' signature omelette stuffed with steak, mushrooms and cheese with a side of hash browns!  It was all gooooood!  Have to come back at least for another Pot of Bread!

2WUDMIOngRrDvfdOOwNofQ.text: The food is super good !!! My two favs are the corned beef hash and eggs !! The best in town ..no one comes close ... And the country skillet... if ur running on empty this will fill u up !!! The service is great !!! my favorite part is just hearing Shirley's laugh...makes my day !!! Well worth the wait... because this place gets busy ..

AcOSHWHZqGRH_7zyPKpSVw.text: The only reason I gave then 4 instead of 5 is because sometimes you have to wait more than 30 minutes, outside. Tough w a baby in arms! Food is great, staff are wonderful including the bus boys.

zGTMw4nGWFpxegzfgIJfvQ.text: Drove across town to fulfill my corned beef hash craving at this place. Because of all those remarkable "Yelp" comments on their corned beef hash, I could not get this place off my mind! Not only that, corned beef hash is my #1 preferred breakfast dish!!!  Corned Beef Hash and Eggs: NO Question, the Best Corned Beef Hash I've ever had to date!! They crisp up the top and bottom of the corned beef hash serving which added a very nice subtle touch of texture and the meat inside stayed juicy, tender and tasty as can be! The portion was also Generous! The accompanied fried potatoes were far from dry, simple and delicious!  French Toast - "Jamms Style" = corn flake breaded/crusted: 4 Thick half slices of toast that were a little crunchy, a little sweet and had a nicely executed spongy consistency. Add some of their softened butter and drizzle some maple syrup over the bits of powdered sugar.. Yummm!!  Pot of Bread: Thanks Yelp for the complimentary/special offer!  Extra Fresh, Extra Soft and Plainly Divine Roll of Bread!!   Worth the Drive, Server was Very Nice and Enthusiastic, Prices were Fair and the atmosphere felt like how it should be!! APPROVED!!

VTrdG9LEdYexkAWScFZIaQ.text: I thoroughly enjoyed the great good and huge portions at this great breakfast restaurant.  The omelets are large with a lot of different varieties, as well as the pancakes and French toast.  The Jamms French toast was good, but also not as flavorful as I would have liked.  But I would come back several more times to try all of the other types of pancakes and French toast they have on the menu.

jpNskqzhd9sbkE6pjRkALw.text: Love eating here. Food is fresh and delicious. Staff are pleasant and courteous. Looks as if they have done some decorating. I know they have added new menu items. I like the new "tapas" plates. Can select variety without eating a lot.

SjjvFBIr2cjD0tpy6HeVjw.text: Ham steak and eggs was a good choice. Service was very good and very fast. Glad I stopped in.

EjyTz1m8rT2M3C7eLwBi2w.text: We wanted to try places where the locals go, someplace off the strip, where you don't literally get beat over the head when the check comes.  Found this place and we're very glad we went!  While they didn't have a gluten free menu they were very accommodating.  I had an omelette and hash browns and they gave me some sliced tomatoes in place of the pot of bread.  Hubby was lucky enough to have the french toast sandwich which was totally not what he expected.  It was french toast, made from their pot of bread and had cooked apples on top.  When I say his eyes rolled around in his head while he was eating it's an understatement.  He said it was probably one of, if not the best breakfasts he's ever had!! Service was great.  We would definitely go back!

EtehWaOh34Ip70tKMlLGVw.text: I love this place!! The servers are always on the fly and they've never messed up my order. The sandwich selection is phenomenal, anything you want, they'll get it made.  The food is so awesome, I end up there at least once a week, if not for any other reason than to try the weekly pot of bread.

hVdSp_U3BRDK5n0UsN0yKg.text: The food was decent, but the customer service was off the chain. Super nice people. That is why I gave this place 5 stars!

qArrUT5Km0sNVKl29XuusQ.text: I have to start by thanking my good friend John, who introduced me to Jamms.   Jamms specialises in breakfast and lunch. It is an unassuming place well away from the strip - so most of the traditional visitors to Vegas won't know about it.   The service is extremely friendly and welcoming as soon as you enter the restaurant.   The type of food served is typically diner-style food. However there are a few things that raise them up to a five-star rating:   1. The service is genuinely friendly 2. The steak and eggs (for breakfast) is great - and arrives very quickly 3. Try the chicken-fried steak. It is to die for! 4. Instead of toast, have the pot of bread. You get an individual loaf that has been freshly baked in its own ramekin. Marvellous!   Obviously when I was there, the waitress must have noticed my enthusiasm for the homemade bread because she brought me a second one (which I dispatched with equal enthusiasm).   Vegas can be a mad place, but it is really nice to stumble across somewhere like Jamms every so often.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most important meal of the day
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An unassuming frontage - delights within

6WiLlGrGVICSd6R8vJ178w.text: Very down-home! Great, perky service!  Love this place for the food...

M7P2NiX6LSdtUdzoZZQMdg.text: I read up about this breakfast place online and decided to take a break from the very busy Las Vegas Strip for breakfast. We had a great experience here. The service was good, the food was tasty and there was a line out the door when we got there. That was a sign that the locals like going there as it was so off the beaten track. We would go there again, nice family owned and operated restaurant.

9uD46JMK56gFNYwsKP1k7Q.text: Great food ! Great Service! = Will be returning soon ! The help is always friendly and efficient. The pot of bread is always the way to go. Every week they have a special flavor pot of bread. They will not seat you unless your entire party is present. This is due to the fact it's a small place. You can order French toast coated in corn flakes. Wow. It's unique.

EBOOupkjGGsVnoSZowM8wg.text: You have to visit this place for breakfast when you are in Vegas, you can't leave until you do! You will experience the best breakfast ever and customer service you don't fine in many places anymore now in these days. Prices are so affordable and for me, driving 15 min out of the strip to go and have the best food and satisfying experience, is worth it. Check this place out and believe every single word you read in all of their reviews. May God bless you people and your business!

l7-QmDmomXkDO-YScYtuxw.text: Long time lover of this fabulous, down home diner. Haven't been back in quite awhile. Wish I had stayed away. The service and friendly atmosphere is still fully intact. Wonderful, quick service. One start for that alone.   Unfortunately, I think, over the years, they have tried to become something they're not. The menu has exploded with ridiculous, monstrosities for new dishes. They couldn't just add chicken and waffles. They had to create anything and everything with waffles from a BLT on waffles to a waffle pizza. Yes, I said "waffle pizza."  They managed to get a bit of notoriety on the Travel Channel with a crazy breakfast sandwich consisting of a corned beef hash omelet with sauerkraut and Swiss cheese piled on a huge pretzel bun that has been egg battered with cinnamon and sugar then deep fried. Couldn't bring myself to try it.   The last time I visited, Jamm's had been venturing into exotic coffees and cappuccinos. They were heading in the right direction. This visit, the coffee tasted like it had been brewed through the same grounds all day. I could t even finish one cup.   We went with a couple classics that we remember being the best in town the Hash and Eggs and the Country Benedict. The hash would have been fine without the handful of chopped garlic that was clearly tossed in right at the end of cooking. I love garlic, but that much undercooked garlic ruined what was once a breakfast legend. Since they clearly switched their sausage to a poor quality, frozen patty, they must not have had the flavorful sausage drippings and fond leftover to make a decent country gravy.  They changed their home fried potatoes to hash browns with onions and peppers. Which would be fine, but then don't call them home fries. Call them hash browns O'Brien. Of course, that wouldn't be necessary as they still offer hash browns on the menu.   I am not only disappointed, but saddened by the changes this place has undergone since I last visited. This used to be a place where we new the crew and they new what we wanted and you could not pick a bad thing off the menu. I think they just fell victim to chasing the "foody" trend and lost sight of what was working so well for them.   I hope they find their way soon. Would love to return to the good 'ol Jamms I remember.

YVsqiD6MJA7fzdRMwsAb4w.text: Jamms is my favorite place for breakfast/brunch in Las Vegas.  The wait staff is friendly, the food is great, and the service is great.

QUKjcgU5LVVeEVN1Cx7EHw.text: Great down-home diner. We stopped by here before our car ride back to LA. I had the Sandy (?) omelette which had a avocado in it. Very tasty. I think the sweet part of breakfast was also really really good. Service was friendly and the wait was not very long.

We8K9rHyybraLsPdD41ejA.text: Jamm's Cuban Sandwich was so good! My waitress, Shannon was so nice and took my order quickly. I'd definitely recommend this place to eat at! It's definitely a go to place for breakfast and lunch!

ehIh73b2lEZz6-LyintBnQ.text: Big breakfast for inexpensive prices is the drawing point of this restaurant in a non gross way. Unlike other places that give you a heaping plate of heart clogging ridiculousness, Jamms has more healthy options. I had ordered the veggie omelet with egg whites and no cheese. That was the health nut in me speaking and then the glutton in me decided that sweet potato fries and a cinnamon raisin pot o bread should accompany with it ($10).    Looking around there were seasoned customers and I knew this place was a winner. When you can get a bunch of older locals into a restaurant and have them enjoy a meal, it must be good.   The omelet was massive, filled with tomatoes, onions, mushrooms, and big chunks of broccoli. The sweet potato fries were plentiful and I made sure to eat them all. The pot o bread was nice and fluffy. I just wished with a name like Jamms, they would have homemade jam. Just nitpicking now.   The staff was nice, split checks were not an issue, and our server was quick with refills.

0yJSdb-APA2OWS3iOkkQOQ.text: Food is decent but service was an epic failure. I've been here before & I've had to wait 20-30 mins for a table even when people were done eating & just chitchatting. I've never had an issue waiting because I'll have my turn.   Today a friend and her daughter joined me for breakfast and before I finished my food they brought me a to go box.  They brought us the bill twice & started cleaning off our table before we were done. Then as my friend's daughter was still working on her pancakes they asked if we were going to order anything else if not then they needed our booth for someone else.  WTF?   Mind you we were there for less than an hour & the people behind me were there before us & were still there after us. No one asked them to leave... such a discriminating feeling. I didn't know that this sit down establishment had a time limit on seating.  Rude service is putting it lightly.  We'll never return!

FXSUMnRe7vPWIgJKcBxCMQ.text: I was looking for a restaurant that had good corned beef hash and this place popped up. It's located in a strip mall and it's actually bigger on the inside than it appears. Total hole in the wall diner feel with booths.   Ordered the corned beef hash that comes with 2 eggs, hash browns and their famous pot of bread. I got the lemon and blueberry, which was their flavor of the week and it came out piping hot with sweet butter cream. They also have plain and cinnamon raisin daily. Everything was great! Did not disappoint and it was a good size portion. My pot of bread wasn't quite ready with the rest of the order, so she gave me a complimentary cinnamon raisin also.   Next time I'm going to order the home fries instead. It's not the typical diced potatoes, but they were sliced and looked almost like hash. Tasted hubby's and it was good. He ordered the Reuben omelet, my son had a made to order omelet and my other son had the steak and eggs. Everyone enjoyed their meals and said the restaurant was a good choice. Will definitely be back!

The BF had the country fried steak with home fries, and he loved it. We also had the french toast dippers which were nice and crunchy, as expected. I will definitely be back again.

Xse5wx_w0P74l5KNQ2_Xlw.text: I don't even know where to start!! Portions? Amazingly huge!  Customer service? Impressive! Food quality? Top notch! Pot o' Bread? OUT IF THIS WORLD!   Although it is a tiny location in a strip mall on Rainbow, the wait time was less than fifteen minutes on a Sunday morning. Waiters and waitresses were super attentive and the choice of music for the place was awesome (a lot of Katy Perry, Adele and Ed Sheeran) even though the place was jam packed, you were still able to hear the person sitting across from you and no one was bumping you or your booth.   What did I order? The most amazing skillet ever. It included,  sausage, bacon, the best potatoes possible, eggs, cheese, peppers, onions, all covered in white gravy. Seasoned to perfection and piping hot. Came with a side of perfectly toasted toast (ha, perfectly toasted toast), and I ordered a strawberry covered waffle on the side.   I should not have ordered anything extra because the portions were out of this world.   My boyfriend ordered an omelet which came with sausage, bacon, peppers and a pot o' bread.   That bread...  My god that bread. When they offered it, I should've taken it instead of substituting the toast. My boyfriend inhaled it in a matter of seconds. I was barely able to get a tiny piece. It was just that effing good. No clue what they put in it or how they prepare it, but not only was it toasted and flaky, but when you bit into it, it was rich with flavors I can only describe as heavenly and the feeling in my mouth was simply orgasmic in nature.   GO EAT ALL YOUR MEALS HERE.

It was odd because she started seating everyone else that checked in after us so when I was about to go to the host I  heard him say, you know that couple ( meaning us) was here first. She shrugged her shoulders and grabbed 2 menus came over to us brought us to a table dropped the menus and walked off. Rude nasty attitude all the way.  The server came and we ordered. I got the waffle Benedict and my husband got pot of bread French toast. The server was ok yet after she dropped the food she never checked on us. If she had we would have told her how the French toast was raw in the middle on quite a few of the pieces and eggs Benedict is supposed to have poached eggs with a soft yolk my eggs were practically hard boiled.  The two stars is because the coffee and juice were good. Other then that nothing was good about this place. We wont be back.

jc2gUChPAhGC3iGGAWl9Ng.text: Thankfully there are still some old school breakfast houses still left that are not chains. Jamms is one of these, and is my favorite place to get breakfast in between class or whenever I have a craving for a pot of bread.  They have a great menu, and decent prices (averaging 20$ for two people). It can get busy depending on the times, and it does close early for Vegas time. I have never had slow service or a bad server, in fact, they get me in and out very quickly so I never worry.   They have a great selection of omelettes and pancakes (Smores are the best) and they have a special Pot of Bread every now and then. So far I have tried the Pumpkin with cream cheese and the chocolate brownie with marshmallow, both were amazing but the brownie one was the best.

oO4dsjVR6innOFVwOqsI1g.text: In the summerlin area and was tired of all the stuff we tried before.  We frequent bagel cafe, egg works, cracked egg, and the alike, so we wanted to try something different.  We found Jamms on yelp, so wet gave it a shot. Firstly this place has a great "breakfast" feel, friendly staff, and the traditional specials dry erase board.  My gf had the jamms breakfast sandwich w home fries, and I had the corned beef hash, and we shared their special cinnamon "pot bread", everything was flavorful (not too seasoned) and most importantly fresh. Everything you would want in a breakfast spot. We will def be coming back.

Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some cute art inside

58OgVBjZHAt6z-WVzC30UQ.text: I love the food here however if you don't come with your entire party they would not seat you, they make you wait even if you are dying to have a cup of coffee.

PeSd0MgeOaIhmvHF-E2TYQ.text: This is our favorite Breakfast place!! We love the great food and personalized service! I'd recommend it highly.

QPE7d_CNEzs_LdcbcQ_gsw.text: This place was amazing. The staff was friendly and cheerful. They were efficient and energetic. They checked on us frequently and when my order wasn't to my liking even took it off my tab because I don't eat eggs and didn't know eggs were in what I ordered. Shirley is amazing! We will be back there for sure, food is great for sure but the staff is definitely top notch!

0kSaiJIJXnUpBFsgC_9A6g.text: This is a classic breakfast diner! The food and staff are amazing. This was our first visit, so needless to say we couldn't decide what to get because there are so many options. The portions are large and delicious. Can't wait to come back!

GngvYuB_21s5uZGGFCdRSA.text: Me love breakfast.  Me like Jamms.  Jamms is an okay at best breakfast/lunch spot in Spring Valley. Tucked in strip mall. Jamms is packed on the weekend. I think the reason this little place is so popular is their Pot O' Bread. What is Pot O' Bread, let me assist you. It's fresh bread dough, placed in a little ceramic ramekin, then baked, then delivered to your table. Recently they've added flavors of the week (recent flavors: chocolate peanut butter cup, cherry cheese cake, cinnamon raisin).  Jamms has a wide variety of options found at any dinner. Jamms' food isn't all that special. It's on par with Denny's and IHOP.   The service is friendly, warm, and prompt. Coffee mugs, water glasses, and iced teas are never left empty. The restaurant is clean and loud. There are scattered tables and booths. On the weekends (Sat and Sun), there is looooong wait, so get here early.  On the way out, be sure to pick up a free piece of gum to get the sausage, egg, and whatever else is on your tastes buds.

dmRV4VVUwkn2fMG1az-VTQ.text: Great place for breakfast. Portions were large and the food was delicious. Coffee was pretty good. Went on a Monday just before noon and there wasn't a wait.  Service was good enough, wasn't overly impressed with friendliness or anything but they weren't rude or unwelcoming.  I'll come back again :)   PS- For those of you who like S'mores, beware of their S'mores pancake. It includes a ton of Caramel that's kinda overpowering. Tasted like a Caramello candy bar more than smores.

x9HhPQVpjeoGqktCDcnTbw.text: Was pretty skeptical about eating here but was I wrong. The food was so delicious and the portions are so fair it's incredible. The service makes you feel so at home and the wait is never bad. I would recommend this place to everyone for breakfast. Do yourself a favor and visit Jamms!

O5tOVwKQTzq65UEDbds-CA.text: Oy vey! There was a ninety-minute wait at the Hash House a Go Go and not even a bench to sit around and wait. Damn that Rachael Ray. Alas, I went to the Yelp app on my iPhone and found a nearby breakfast eatery that was also averaging around four stars. It literally took us about three minutes to get to Jamm's and big surprise...it's in a strip mall, our third off-the-Strip place that was in a strip mall. We noticed the place was abuzz with customers but not nearly to the level of the Hash House. There was a fifteen-minute wait here, and the diners were not nearly as fashionably attired.   It's a modest operation, the type that has a cheery hostess and cartoon murals on the walls. The menu is pretty robust, but unlike the nearby Egg & I, there was a lot more thought and care in the execution of the dishes. Jamie W. ordered the $8.45 Reuben Omelet, which was full of strands of corned beef and mounds of sauerkraut. There was also a generous slab of Swiss cheese melted on top and a side of crispy hashed browns (see photo). I went for a similar dish, the $8.50 Irish Skillet, which had the same corned beef accompanied by diced onions, green peppers and potatoes, all mixed into scrambled eggs and melted cheddar cheese (see photo). It was a mess of high-cholesterol goodness well put together. Tasty too.   Jamie, in a moment of insanity laced with homesickness for his Midwestern roots, also ordered the $5.25 full order of Biscuits and Country Gravy, which was a gloppy pool on a plate (see photo). I won't deny it wasn't good in a deep Southern kitchen kind of way with the biscuits sopping up all that gravy, though I attempted to re-purpose it as an extra topping for my skillet breakfast. Bloated was the way we both felt afterward but also sated. Needless to say, I also noticed they decorated the restroom stall with the same cartoon murals. Somebody must have had time on their hands. By the way, the waitress was also cheery, chatty and about nineteen. She was refilling my coffee cup with unadulterated pleasure.   FOOD - 4 stars...country breakfasts with deli twists, well executed with simple ingredients  AMBIANCE - 3 stars...kitchen cozy with Fingerhut touches  SERVICE - 4 stars...cheery thy name is Jamm  TOTAL - 4 stars...good diner-style eats can be found in a strip mall

yAMdkuyj1MajdKy9rvsA5g.text: Babalama omelette had huge pieces of avocado and lots of bacon (too much?) well worth the price. French press was great as well. Definitely suggest it.

cLUheGUblwUOqHEMm6nlEA.text: James is the best breakfast place in Vegas!  Their pots of bread are amazing and every single time we come here the food and service are spot on!!! If you feel like lunch their burgers and sandwiches are always great!

_0d-gJVBgOGm-yRUXmFXyw.text: Great food! Cuban panini was great. French toast is amazing!! Cannot wait to come back next weekend and try more!

4q62CYD4AGd2-xho9qsrBg.text: We had breakfast at Jamm's and enjoyed the hearty food served by the great attentive staff.  I had the bacon burger w seasoned fries...very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TVJDgVEEQHRk8xnGUJPCEQ.text: Really good food.  I always go during off times because that is when the service is exceptionally quick.   This place is so good it should have a truck stop in the parking lot.   It is hard to do better then Jamms.

sHlrie7Xje00aCwAqoH_Qw.text: After reading the reviews, I had to try it.  Overall, a great little diner in amidst a strip mall.  It's quaint, with great diner service and solid good food.  They are well known for their popover bread, and you must get one when you eat there.    Great mom and pop joint away from the strip, and well worth the drive.  I eat here at least once a week because I love their omelets.

Un_wLaeie3CaKk-EPDxgtg.text: This place is great. We go here often, definitely my favorite breakfast place off strip in Las Vegas. Great service, great food. Can't ask for more.

i2l-DmR5nvADUzvAzIfsIQ.text: Thinking of an omelet? This place has them ALL! jammsrestaurant.com I ordered the White Castle Omelet which was stuffed with crumbled burger! It was huge--all of their omelets are huge! Wilson Y. was correct when he said "The Pot of Bread is tasty and soft." In fact, I'd try it you get to visit because the only other place I know that makes it like this is a place called the Summy House located in Manheim, PA. Jamms is located in a strip mall along Rainbow. Inside, it beams with natural sunlight. The decor is upbeat with a lot of personal touches. The staff are friendly and fast.

NcVOp8g8bQ4aroq34YXtpw.text: This was my second time at Jamms and both were excellent.  Pleasant service and great food.  Highly recommend the Jamms French toast and don't leave without a pot of bread.  I prefer the raisin and cinnamon one.  I just wish it opened just a bit earlier since I'm always there for work and have to start too early to go all the time.

ASFt_I77ibv6K_Ah7_gP5g.text: Checked in here yesterday for some good home style food.  At least that's what all the reviews say, right?  Let's just start off by saying that they truly do treat you like family.  Service was very warm and they're genuinely glad to see you there.  I ordered the corned beef hash and eggs.  Great flavor and I absolutely loved the texture of all the caramelized onions and crispy corned beef hash.  Very good.  I also was curious to see what all the hype was about the Pots of bread.  Meh, it was ok, but to me, nothing to write home about.

gBLPIoDFzteaJAzTPY3QMw.text: After visiting Hash House A Go Go, and finding to our dismay, a ridiculous 1 hour wait, we decided to try Jamm's for brunch instead.    Jamm's is unpretentious, unassuming, honest-to-goodness mom 'n' pop little joint (the complete opposite of Hash House).  Service is fast and friendly and they treat you like family (they were really accommodating to my husband's request for hard boiled eggs).  The food was good solid diner fare.  We ordered the eggs benedict, the chicken fried steak and eggs, and a side of corned beef hash. Everything was good, but we loved loved LOVED the house fries and the corned beef hash (which was perfected seasoned and lightly crisped).  Food was reasonably priced and portions were very generous.  Will return if in the area again!

IgefIIFrED00pfIWAOQagA.text: Been here for lunch many times.  I don't get breakfast anymore because they don't know how to cook eggs.  The sandwiches are ok.  The cuban is edible as is the chicken salad.  The burgers are small and over priced.  The place is always kept way too cold for me and the service can be down right rude sometimes.

CRmeeXZAI_zVHzI10wbtYg.text: It's either Jamm's or I-Hop or Denny's.  Until recently Jamm's was the choice.  I haven't had a bad meal there in at least a dozen visits for breakfast.  If only I'm lucky enough to visit when that cackling waitress has the day off. She's a great gal, don't get me wrong, but wow that laugh is tough to take early in the morning.  One time I had a "fluffy" omelet.  Well, it wasn't fluffy.  It was a regular omelet like any other.  I mentioned it to the lady at the cash register when I paid.  "I don't think that was a fluffy omelet," I said.  Just a harmless comment, not a complaint.  Of course she got huffy.  I think she was the owner.  She looked at me like, Who are you the galloping gourmet?  "All of our omelets are fluffy," she insisted in a crabby tone.    OK fine, calm down.  It left me with such a negative feeling I haven't been back. It's not that I'm holding a grudge but an experience like that cuts my enthusiasm for a place.  I don't feel welcome there anymore. Now I go to Red Rock casino or Denny's. Jamm's is so busy that one customer more or less is no big deal. They won't have that annoying fluffy omelet guy to deal with anymore.    Good for kids:  Don't encourage people with "good for kids" votes.  Let 'em invade Denny's or I-Hop with their screaming whining little hellions. This is a small restaurant.  A tantrum will disrupt the whole place.

X3mRDpibngsxL6G9WUeTtQ.text: Great food, great staff, great atmosphere.  The cornedbeef hash and eggs was great, loved the pot of bread, especially since it was free.  I could probably give this place 5 starts, but I'm going to have to eat there a few more times to make sure it's earned.  The staff seem to know and love there regulars which is kind of a nice change.

cv82xOL0KUoqWvjfCqL62A.text: Great food and service! We live right around the corner and go here regularly. My husband always gets the Reuben Benedict and I love the French toast. Biscuits and gravy are really good too.

r3VIwcYltVRAkclpkpH2dQ.text: A great "locals" joint in Vegas.  Awesome breakfast place...plus they have a yelp offer if you check in.  How awesome is that?  Overall great food and great experience.  If you go on the weekend...be prepared for a line!

_267z4F2XmxznJWKU11F0w.text: Had the corned beef hash and eggs over medium.  Eggs were cooked perfectly and were delicious.  No complaints there.   But the corned beef hash wasn't flavorful.  Just salted heavily but none of the delicious flavor you expect from a good corned beef.  Just tasted like salt. Had the pot of bread...I like that it's hot and such but it wasn't very flavorful either.  Just seemed like plain white bread.  Didn't get the yeasty flavor other people liked. Service was great and the staff super friendly.

W9IWYxdc9lNW5yOyIcv1EQ.text: My daughter and I found this little gem on our way out of town.  Outstanding service, great food & a True local atmosphere.  We will be back!

pmOFUPdqAs34VydWhUcr4w.text: if this place didnt close at 3pm everyday i would come more often. i've had the sausage breakfast and its consistently delicious! i've tried their buffalo chicken strips and fries.. sweet potato fries!!! so tasty. i like their buffalo strips cuz they're flat and juicy. not super drenched in sauce so they're not soggy! so.. 1 star off for closing so damn early and another for... slow service. ppl at work usually call in their order so they dont have to wait around. service has always been friendly here.. shoot.. i would be too if i got off at 3 everyday! its right around the corner from my work so i always see ppl from work with leftovers from jamm's and everyone drools. hmm.. i think i shall stop by before work tmrw cuz this review is making me hungry!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. look at that hamsteak!! i ate all of my sausage and hash browns before taking the pic..sorry guys..lol

E8PKRayFPYbgJDtU4xjxsw.text: Mediocre in nearly every way. The food is bland and unmemorable, the pricing is a little high for what you get. The service is generally pretty good. There are better breakfast options not too far away.

9o6W8XCEIOqJmNNwzcNAtg.text: Pretty good service they were nice I didn't have to bother her for our beverages to be refilled our meal was made in a reasonable amount of time and the food was very good also well worth visiting when u want a nice breakfast or brunch dates or arrangements

_s4PqhA1-ibX1dwKluE3TA.text: This restaurant is amazing!!!!!!  It's a great place for breakfast. The food is amazing and the service is good too.  They serve good portions for a pretty decent price. They have all the breakfast classics on their menu including chicken in waffles.  Really good breakfast spot!

sZouOkqYkgmD1f3OdZhxfg.text: Jamm's is a great spot for breakfast/brunch/lunch! The food is always perfectly prepared and the portions more than generous! The staff makes the experience a favorite for us. From the host or hostess to the wait staff to the bussers everyone is good at their job, friendly & courteous. Don't miss the pot of bread; don't miss Jamm's!

0sZSmj60RCuhAKYnCHfMPQ.text: Great breakfast spot!   Excellent pot-o-bread, yumm. The flavor of the week was Oreo and it was devine.   Great pricing for fresh and hearty egg dishes.   Would definitely go to Jamms again and reccomend it to friends and fam.

LSm1LXp1tpzAHqMz5voNxQ.text: Love this place for brunch... they are often busy and they need a bigger location as its always pretty crowded inside. We love their bread bowls,  breakfast burritos and chicken and waffle sandwich. I recommend this place to everybody wish their hours were longer though :)

q0LQQLdXSbzKl5FcBnHwvQ.text: The service is so friendly. Shirley was so wonderful. She knows or seems to know everyone! Her laugh echos throughout the place! The coffee flows and they check on you constantly.  Food is good and they are known for the Pot of Bread.

glafro3OwYf6Z8hXo-G-6w.text: Really good food!! I  have been going here since i was little. I remember my parents knew the owners and they would always be out talking with everyone. I just went back for the first time in over 15 years and one thing i would say is they should make the food look more appealing.. it is good but they need to make it look more appetizing... pot o bread used to be in the little pots and now just in styrofoam... very good

38ek4gAcQws2-8CTEmGrNA.text: The three of us are 4 pots of bread. Why? Because it was delicious! We had the cherry, cinnamon raisin and plain. In addition we tried three different omelets. The portions are generous and everything is fresh. Really enjoyed breakfast here and will plan to return the next time we are in Vegas and need a solid breakfast without breaking the bank.  Also, service was perfect! Super fast and my coffee was always full. I gave it five stars because Jamms does classic diner food really well.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g5GrY7eLI1ImLCOwigtJfA.text: We discovered this place through yelp on a recent trip to vegas. We were getting a little sick of over priced buffets and dinging slot machines, so we strolled on over to Jamm's and have made it our go to breakfast trip whenever we're visiting Vegas.   I'm a coffee fiend, I strongly judge places by their coffee, and Jamm's has some damn good coffee. It's got a good flavor and it's brewed strong.  Don't be dismayed by a long wait, it's worth it.  My go to is the stuffed French toast, but if you don't have a super sweet tooth like me, I'd suggest the the Chicken BLT with Green Waffles.   Also make a point to try out their pot of bread.

Wwp79Uw0GxsL0T7Bb0Kcvw.text: The pot of bread! So. Good.  The portions are huge and the food is good. Came with 5 other picky eaters and everyone was content. The garbage salad was bustling over. The pancakes were delicious and fluffy. The omelets (Sandy & Denver) were delicious. Yes I sampled everyone's food. The service was great. Mom was pleased with herself for finding this place on yelp off the strip. Well worth the trip!

d5D2ejxtMXyGLRDIj08c6g.text: Pleasantly surprised! There isn't an overwhelming abundance of breakfast places around here, and diners can be pretty hit or miss- but this one knocks it out of the park! Menu has about ten different omelets, in addition to skillets, benedicts, and the usual waffles, pancakes, etc. along with lunch options: sandwiches, burgers, soups, and salads.  BF and I started with coffee and OJ, then opted for different omelets: the Jamm's signature omelet for me  (bearnaise sauce on the side, I never used it), Joe's omelet for my guy. Each omelet is about $10, and includes your bread of choice (I opted for the plain pot bread, BF had the special: walnut brownie) as well as an additional side (wedge fries for me, cottage cheese for the dude). Good portion sizes for the price, both with the variety of sides and the sizes of individual items.  Omelets were both cooked perfectly: others have said they are drowning in cheese, which is not entirely True. Mine had a good amount, but the Joe's omelet was a little lighter. Both had good amounts of meat and veggies.  The fries are tasty and seasoned, served in a cute little individual fryer basket container (cute!), cottage cheese is standard. The pot bread was a delightful surprise! Preferred the plain flavor: reminded me of slightly-sweet biscuits with dinner, growing up with homestyle country meals. The walnut brownie pot bread was sweet, but no overwhelmingly chocolatey or nutty- the name had made me expect more of a dessert on the table, but it wasn't overkill.  Service, as others have said, rocks. Attentive and polite, not overbearing or annoying. Will be returning to try the benedicts and perhaps a lunch one of these days. And the featured pot bread, of course!

k1bIIaTAK5wcVcV--4jMvw.text: So good. So glad I just happened to see this place out of the corner of my eye. It's the perfect place for a breakfast spot. Provides many great signature options, and there bread in a cup is amazing. I got the blue berry it was so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ddHgStuz7OlVbWf8Eyi2JA.text: Was wanting to try this place for a while. As soon as I walked in, the hostess greeted me and sat us right away. I ordered the egg breakfast with bacon and it came with the Pot O'Bread that they are known for. The blueberry Pot O'Bread was so fluffy and fresh. The coffee was very tasty and the large mug that it was served in kept it warm. Everything was well cooked. Yummy food (and I'm not too big on eggs)

dRssiPaTAldY16s9sidyqw.text: Great food great service been coming for years they never let us down love you guys!!!!  Pot of bread forever

nPq3skUe7nICxwfUwKGshQ.text: This is a great little breakfast joint. I haven't been here for lunch or dinner, but I assume it's good as well.   First off, they serve illy coffee which is a big plus for me. Warm and friendly, the staff is super nice and attentive. The food is good. Like home cooking. To me it is not out of this world but is better than the major chains like IHOP or Denny's.  Service is decent but definitely show up early because this place gets packed pretty fast.
