Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon raisin Pot of Bread.

du0hNKN8R3y6p6qOHjQmFw.text: Great brunch menu. The pot of bread so good. My club sandwich was a little over toasted but the lettuce sauce meat ratio awesome.

vc_VJ5geXBmnyuFGBWooxQ.text: Came here before but I forgot to review. Second time back and it's so delicious! This restaurant never fails me and will definitely be one of my favorite breakfast spots. The first time I came here I ordered chicken noodle soup with blue berry pot of bread, and it was sooooo delicious.  Today I ordered corned beef hash and it was amazing. It was very filling so I shared my food with my brother. Next time I come I will order the steak and eggs because it looks really good too. The service is great and so is the food. Will definitely be back!   *Order cinnamon or blueberry pot of bread!!! Pot of bread will have you hooked!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash and Eggs with cinnamon pot of bread. Pot of bread is so good with the cream cheese!

7ErjrtapQTcfYLtTB3LG7w.text: One of the best mom and pop breakfast spots! Love the pot of breads they serve with a meal! Would like more parking for the restaurant but it's in a plaza so can't do nothing about that. You won't regret having breakfast here

r05e_dfjSUF0arQpMVl6YA.text: First time here. Driving down Rainbow, hungry, checked yelp breakfast. Decided to give it a chance. Glad I did!!  French toast combo was excellent Free pot of bread with check in: today's special flavor Chipotle Cheddar (to go)  Efficient friendly service

xHVcTSINOIIPUzIMIcgVKg.text: *military discount in uniform only* *free pot o' bread with yelp check-in*  Went on Saturday 11-28-15 at 10am and there was a bit of a wait.  This restaurant is located on Rainbow in the same shopping center as Home Depot and Strip N' Dip Chicken Strips.  $28.77 got us a pancake combo, a white castle omelet, and grits.  The white castle omelet has ground beef, cheese, and onions inside and comes with home fries, which are sliced potatoes cooked with onions and peppers.  I thought it tasted a lot like a white castle.  The pancake combo comes with your choice of sausage or bacon and then eggs cooked however you like them.  The pancakes were ridiculously fluffy-they had to have been an inch thick!  They were so tasty and the eggs and sausage were perfect.  They brought out two containers of butter without me asking, which I really appreciated.  There's nothing worse than getting big pancakes and they hand you one packet of butter.   The grits were cooked well but lacked salt.  I liked that they brought butter with the grits without asking. Paula Deen would be proud of my obsession with butter today.

dr79ZXRolYms_N4RarXAgA.text: Very good breakfast. Even though it was Saturday morning, I arrived early enough that I didn't have to wait for a table. The staff was very friendly, attentive and quick. I started with a pot of bread (coconut and pineapple) which was light, fluffy and delicious. Then had the Sandy Omelette which was fantastic. I also loved the rye bread toast.  I just wish it was closer to the strip, which is where I usually end up staying.

eDQfGN5RK3f-om8oAU1ImA.text: Wow, we finally found a great place for breakfast.  The service was astounding and the food delicious!

d5xFBmTcDrQRJwaAhKfwdQ.text: The perfect breakfast place in Las Vegas, potted bread which was free through the yelp check in was provided as we choose our meal, and the service was super quick, and food perfectly cooked.. Our new favourite breakfast place :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front Menu

Dg9UjmQWcqH_847uH61JJg.text: The food was great and tasted amazing. We were sat promptly for being a weekend and once sat we immediately had our drink order taken. Coffee was fresh and our food came to the table impressively fast. I would give the place 5 stars if not for our server. I was finalizing some work related tasks on my phone when she took my order and she shook her hand vigorously saying "cmon cmon!! Very rude and disrespectful. Could have gotten my attention by saying are you ready to order. Once she brought our plates out I thanked her and she didn't bother to acknowledge me. Didn't check on us once while we were there. Older short hair lady with glasses should be more courteous. Outside of her, all else was great.

AS8JZRVCnJHk-dAYE2x02A.text: A last second choice on our way to Red Rock Canyon, Jamms was a great surprise. Everything was great- the atmosphere, the menu options, the workers (even dealing with my indecisive wife who wanted first available, then a booth, then first available, then switched to a booth).   We checked in with yelp and both got a free "bread pot" which was freshly baked and delicious. I ordered an omelet with ham, cheddar and broccoli. There was so much meat and cheese in it I was full until dinner (and needed two rolaids).  We also split a fruit plate which was freshly cut and good even though some of it wasn't in season.   All things considered, probably one of the best breakfast diners we've been to in a while, that's even with the fact it wasn't exactly cheap. Money well spent.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon and plain pot of bread. Warm and freshly baked
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit okate
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham, cheddar, broccoli omelet

1rP95bQS9YIjn3NX4XpnrA.text: This was a nice little gem that we Yelped on the way to our son's football game. We got there about 9am and there was no waiting but the room was full. I ordered an omelet with avocado, sour cream, tomatoes and cheese....the Sandy?....it was delish and creamy. Loved it. We also had their famous original pot of bread. Honestly I thought it would be nothing more than a sweet cinnamon bun. I was wrong. It's really a bread, lightly sweetened, baked in a cute little foil pie pan that you pull apart. It was nicely balanced as a bread and not too sweet. The server and busser were super friendly and always checking if we needed refills. We just might make this our new breakfast spot when on that side of town.

igebIZhqBb73EepZw6vMpw.text: We initially ordered food to dine in but unfortunately had to take it to go due to an appointment I had. Our waitress was kind and understanding about our sudden change.   Jamms reminds me of home cooked breakfast comfort food. Their omelets are generous and those hash browns are so good. They are known for something called a pot-of-bread, which looks a little bit like a tiny Yorkshire pudding married to a dinner roll. We tried the plain and the cinnamon raisin, and honestly you can't go wrong with either. The prices are reasonable and the interior has quite a bit of seating. Service is very friendly as well.   Cute little breakfast spot with good food!

UhHaV6xhj2MVgOcvtrdnbQ.text: Great food and great customer service!! I even loved their mugs had to get me a couple of them.

HiY3LjqzM42cySIFqmnC2g.text: A great place to visit for a family feel, great staff and great service... This is I am assuming a Vegas local spot, because when we got there it was packed. The portions are HUGE so come hungry and ready to eat. The ladies that served us were super nice and we also bought their anniversary mugs! :) hopefully when I am back to Vegas I can come back to this spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YUMMMMM

flV-DFghTkkSKo6KID58AQ.text: Nice hole in the wall restaurant. Love Shirley the server!!   Food is good.  Usually crowded best time for no crowd is around 10am.  Clean environment and friendly

y1kAonVdoPK4kWELcpdWbA.text: The people were great so was the atmosphere. The food was delicious we're glad we ran into this place on yelp. I was impressed with the service from sandy (maybe Cindy) but JUAN was great we would make this our weekend spot after our daughters soccer practice because of him. He was so attentive so polite had no issue cleaning up the miss my daughter made after spilling a cup of water the mess was cleaned up ASAP! Thank you Juan. I recommend this to anyone that likes great food and service.

I50-Uva-Dj442wOJ51WVDg.text: What we noticed was from the moment that we entered the door, everyone was very nice and courteous to us. We're tourists from out of town and they most definitely made us feel comfortable there. It was as if this place was in our own hometown just by the hospitality. We never felt rushed to finish eating.   I had the Jamms French Toast, which was very good. I could not decide if I wanted that or the corned beef hash. I'll have to try that on a next visit. There are so many choices that look very good, we will just have to keep going back to try them all.   My wife had the mushroom omelet and she said that it was very good as well. She had mentioned that she has never had an omelet that good before. And she surely does eat a lot of mushroom omelet so I believe her!   Jamms should be on everyone's list to try out!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamms French Toast
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom omelette! Look how delicious this mushroom is!
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamms French Toast

r2QhbMo5qzR21b0uEm5EJg.text: We happened on this place recently. It doesn't look like much from the outside but we thought, why not? We like local places. From the time we walked in the door we knew it was our kind of place. Down home, more like an east coast diner but with friendlier people. Customer service was outstanding, food came quick, large servings and good old fashioned comfort food. We were there for lunch and will go back while we're here in town.

t432EBbqUxc_QX0BDdsMCg.text: Really great place for breakfast.  Makes you feel at home.  Excellent food and service.

rjnz0RkDqOVGfH3J0t5abg.text: The reviews are right--the service is fantastic!! And lemme tell ya, those Pot-of-Breads are to die for (or to die from!)...even tho the tiny little biscuits pale by comparison. The rest of breakfast was pretty darn delicious, too and sitting at the bar was great cuz not only was there no wait on a Sunday but we got to watch everyone else's breakfast go by! We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oYUE2doPFEO9rXxdNICKTw.text: Nice little home-town diner style restaurant. We came here for breakfast based off the Yelp reviews. Coffee was strong & hot! OJ was good though not fresh squeezed, steak & eggs were good, biscuits were good though the gravy lacked in flavor so we left that. Hash browns came out just as ordered, nice & crispy. The french toast (we ordered the basic one) had a bit too much vanilla in them for us. We would come back if in the area.

UYLeIEXPMQq5gbfBos0E8Q.text: Ever since we shot a promo here for 8 News Now many years ago, I have always remembered the Pot Of Bread. It will certainly keep you coming back!

8APbAnMlVmdRjgF6gSxAKQ.text: If you are looking for good food to excite your taste buds, this NOT it! This is edible food you can find anywhere. I'm not saying the food is bad, just ordinary. I wouldn't make any special trips to go back.  We went for breakfast. I got the pancakes, eggs, and sausage, which were something that would served in the sample isles of Walmart (nothing special). With enough butter and syrup, you could make it workable. The eggs were just ordinary (but hot) and the sausage was kinda tasty.  My wife's french toast was bland (where the **** is the cinnamon?) Then,  the hashbrowns lacked the seasoning that makes a good shredded potato!   Having said that, the place is in a "conditioned" part of Vegas. I wouldn't say it's ghetto, but in a middle-of-the-road type area. Now, the service was amazing, the servers and managers were very attentive and nice! I love good people working together. The 3 stars are for the service...0 stars for the "cooks".  AJ

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Middle-of-the-road interior
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bland pancakes

l7y02-SAQoKd36bKT8V-hQ.text: Small town diner feel in middle of the city. Good service and even better food! Our drinks were almost never empty and the pot of bread just good too. The French toast is great, we never wait very long for a table.

JwIYVadOezRjht7hIvvrwg.text: Thanks Jamms always so happy to come!! Service and food always wonderful! You made brunch more special for me and my Baby Girl. Jamms is family oriented, coffee is great, toast is always on point!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Always leave with a happy tummy!! Thanks to the staff at Jamms I feel like I am Family

BE9ei1G1apRgrkTMoFHKtw.text: Food is always great. 20 years and counting. Service is excellent, no better place to have breakfast or lunch. Tellem Fred sent ya! They also advertise 10% off bill if you check in with Yelp.

sZak5PEYgLxpEeeYcMZC3Q.text: Had the Texas chili omelet and the smores waffle. The chili had great flavor and combined well with the omelet, very good and have never had shutting like it. Can't really go wing with a smores waffle! The chocolate part of the smores were chocolate chips that weren't melted and that was a little weird, probably would have been better if they were. The potatoes or home fries served with the omelet were better than most. The lemonade was delicious, no minute maid here! The service was fast and friendly. The atmosphere was cozy like grandma's house:)  Strange a place called jamms only had the little Welch's packets of jelly!  Check it out, it's worth it:)

Opj2a9U8zRmXeHP4xFH1nQ.text: The food is delicious ! I had steak and eggs and they were perfectly cooked . Red velvet pancakes are huge . Great service and price .

u0VC6PoMBs-tuoePoJLEQQ.text: Love the pot of bread. They have Strawberry coconut fluff pot of bread this week. The service is always excellent & friendly.

wCK79pFi1I9kQrAFA0FUqg.text: Food was ok but was a bit too pricey Denny's is better you get more for your money and much tastier  also we ordered a side of pancakes which the waitress forgot to bring :(

eZCLBQ6w8ENqOPfuKfai8g.text: Hungry Lion is the best!  Happy 20th anniversary Jamms!!!  They have 20th anniversary coffee mugs on sale for 3.25, be sure to grab one!  The staff here is always so wonderful and helpful too!

b6PtXCIP-p2QNE_TPJbjbA.text: A welcoming environment! Food was good  service was great. A menu full of good  food choices .

6TFc1ttwd9xC9jqXy-RVHw.text: I love Jamms! Great service.  Great food. Great breakfast spot. It is our place on the weekend to go when we don't want to hassle with breakfast at home. Great prices.  The staff cares about its guests and the weekly Pot O Breads are delicious

R0ak76VsbDh4KZKD53sYjg.text: Great food. Love the Sandy omelet. Service is great. Really great menu choices. I live in Henderson and try specifically to come here to eat

xuiiyLz1KXByh8UTyd976w.text: I honestly wasn't impressed.  The man who seated us was very unfriendly he grabbed menues and followed with "Come On" and walked off. I hesitated because I wasn't sure if he said "hold on" but then he looked back at me and my kids impatiently so that cleared things up.   On to the food- well let's just say two orders of French toast fries and the pot of bread we ordered was not very impressive. I didn't order food but my 7 and 8 year old did. The French toast came with out powdered sugar (which was a selling point for my children when pictured on the menu) and so we had to wait for the waitress to come back to ask for it bc my daughter wouldn't touch it with out it. End result- I nibbled at it and I not my kids were impressed. Burger King had better French toast sticks... And well the pot of bread... YUCK.   30 dollars to feed my 7 and 8 year old sub par food with moody service?... I didn't even order food... Nah I'll pass. Won't be back.

viQBsb0bWcxS9ai7P2ByMg.text: A+++ for customer service, taste of food, and value. Definitely felt welcome and will return!

_RtAVjb4WkPUkYw4PCdo3Q.text: Stopped here after a quick search before starting the drive back home. Sat at the counter and was quickly greeted and set up w coffee and water. Menu choices looked good. I tried the Denver potato pancake. Also started w the little pot o bread. Excellent! The entree was presented quickly and was very tasty indeed. This will be my new go to for breakfast away from the Strip.

L6KI6oyPFFtPBF8wBgHZRQ.text: Heard about this place from a friend. Love the service from the front door on in. Coffee in big mugs and delish. Many options and they actually offer substitutions-you don't have to ask. Best egg- white veggie omelet!

OSYgwKkYMwojlWB8gO21pQ.text: This is my second time here in 2 days and I absolutely enjoyed the atmosphere and most importantly, the food. You will receive a good portion of food for the price you pay.

-HQwPoqBYzO0LAuJIrtJIw.text: Thanks to Yelp, I found this little place that has the best brunch. I ordered the eggs Benedict and home fries and it was delicious. My husband ordered the build your own burger. He wasn't very impressed.   The Yelp app gave me a free pot of bread which was orange cranberry and it was amazing!!

rTM3vOvooV9us2xwkuK7QA.text: Breakfast always the bomb at Jamms with the family. Fast service, friendly service and reasonable prices. Sandy is awesome!!!!!

ljAtzAVY5WRsLINi04JI-A.text: Food was decent and adequately priced. I could take it or leave it. The people were very nice but the food took longer than expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef with slaw

Vs2cC_6ptVT3kZhjs_eqSg.text: This place is a fantastic breakfast joint. My boyfriend and I usually share the chicken fried steak. It's quite a large portion, and we get the ordered split in the back so you get your money's worth because you get 4 eggs and plenty of homefries. Shirley is a great waitress. She remembers our order and treats us like family. One of the biggest perks of this place is the pots of bread. They have a regular one and then a special one daily.  The blueberry lemon and cinnamon are my favorites.  FYI: stay clear of the biscuits. The gravy is to die for but the biscuits taste like frozen hockey pucks. Lol I asked a waiter if they were homemade and she confirmed they were not.

nkedVgBEpBUJkZy1p_t3BQ.text: Little places like this make me LOVE Las Vegas even more! From the outside, in the midst of the shopping plaza, a tasty little breakfast gem hidden amongst the other stores.  Let me tell you! - This is what locals look for in LV!!  First and foremost....Pot Of Bread! Say it with me..."Pot of Bread" assorted daily flavors, freshly backed tiny single serving of delicious little mini loafs of bready, muffinish,  pop-over type things. Hell YES!!!!  Everything else was really good. Yes, we did have to salt and pepper our breakfast. In my opinion, the seasoning could be turned up a bit...ok maybe a more than a bit. But still all the ingredients tasted fresh and made to order.

gi9uYeVEEHv7DeHnijoq-w.text: The food was amazing the service was great and I would definitely recommend this to anyone who's reading.

yNU-muf8uQp9IMYpjtKuOA.text: Jamms reminds me of the small, family run, hole in the wall restaurants that you'd find in the midwest.  There is nothing flashing about the building or decor, but the staff are warm and inviting and the food was simply delicious.  It was packed and busy on a Sunday morning, but we didn't wait too long, maybe ten minutes.  Our drinks were out quickly and the food not long after.  The portion sizes were huge and for three people, it was only around $40.  The food was delicious with fast service.  Pros: Food, Price, People Cons: Its not closer to my house.

zXWabA-phPe9xDGkqNhu6A.text: For me as a Dutch girl, I see this as a typical American restaurant. The people in there were very friendly! We came here for breakfast and ordered provance and jamms specialty omelet with toasted wheat bread only, coffee and water.  The omelets were nice! But I've tasted them better somewhere else. The toast was very very fat, but I guess that is normal in America. The waitress checked on us several times, which is a good thing! Overall an nice breakfast for American standards.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coffee!

dbv9etgptu61KFtX91474A.text: This is the best place for breakfast in Las Vegas! The food is always cooked to order and the service is great.

zeiNJYqNy8-CHZHmn-pqxg.text: I felt ignored by my server, stopped by for a quick meal before work they were pretty speedy with getting the food out. Me and my family will not be returning anytime soon. Good food, didn't feel like they had good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wfpkSBD1mtZW39NbbF68Ug.text: Came over to the area to shop at JC Penney right about lunch time. Not familiar with the area came across a number of places to pick from and decided on Jamm's Restaurant. DELIGHTED! with the choice. Food was excellent, nice family atmosphere with friendly staff.  Recommended highly.!

LP8CzL3AbBjUa8KIEiwfyg.text: "WHERE'S THE MEAT"  I hope my pic's posted! We went in late, they close at 3:00 we got there about 2:15!  We got a seat right away.  I love the booths, there roomy.  Our waitress was Lorena, she was very professional, she greeted us with a smile.  She took our drink order, and as I was checking in when she came back, I showed her my yelp check in offer.  They have some bread for free.  So I choose the lemon and blueberry!  I have no idea what it is.  It came in this tin thingy, it was really a 1 person serving.  My husband got into it before I could take a picture.  But OMG, it was yummy!  The bread almost felt like it was not done, but it was so freaking good! So I got the pastrami!  Ok, most places that serve pastrami, it's piled on the bread!  This looked like 3 strips of bacon between 2 pieces of bread!  for $10.00  Not worth it!  The skinny fries were good though.  My husband ordered french toast, eggs and sausage.  He loved every bit of it. Next time I will stick with breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where&#39;s the meat?
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastrami, really I can&#39;t  even see the pastrami.

YUO3eLcgXEMeu-JO7ISjqA.text: Always busy cos the food is always good! Waffles, pancakes, skillet breakfasts and grits with their large cups of coffee!

hIn5oprs7brD7-Jg7BReIQ.text: Saw the reviews and was staying down the road, thought why not, better than going to a chain.  Glad i did  Wait staff is friendly and responds quickly, checks on me often. People and the atmosphere, feels like a hometown diner.    Food is pretty good and good sized portions.    Had the meat lovers omelete with cheese and home fries.  Tasted great!  I was not familiar with Pot of Bread.  Its kinda soft fluffy breakfast roll that they flavor and serve with light icing.  Today i tried the cinnamin raisin.  Great!  They also gave me a reeces cup one to go.  Excited to eat it on the plane.  No cinnabun for me!  Give them a try if youre in the area.  Good break from the strip and right on the way to Red Rock.  Off Rainbow and Charleston.  I forgot, also the coffee is pretty good, and im a coffee snob

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamin pot of bread.  Yummy
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat lovers omelete with cheese.  Cinnamin pot of bread

vnUmihMb_P5p5ilFDF4seA.text: Updating....my last review was not very good but since then they have totally redeemed themselves.  I have been there many more times since then and am glad I did not give up o them.  The service has improved and I have not been disappointed again.  My favorite right now is the eggs benedict (minus meat) and is a great place to stop in on the weekends when out doing errands.  It is usually very busy as it seems to be one of the last Mom and Pop style restaurants in town.    However, now the gum at the register is gone.  :(

IdZUzUh3vhoEULH70OVq5w.text: I am one of those lovely ladies who is unusually obsessed with carbs. I say unusual, but in reality I believe there must be a lot of people like me in the world because restaurants like this keep using the bread to draw us in! Their little bread pots are everything I need in life! They always serve the plain and cinnamon and then have a special bread of the day. I never normally like the bread of the days as much, so I stick to the plain. I hate to say this, but the rest of their food is probably a three star total. It's delicious breakfast food but nothing spectacular or different. Come for the bread, get fat for the bread, die for the bread. I just made them a new slogan!   A lot of older people go here, it seems to be their customer base. This is fine, except for sometimes I feel like I don't get good service because of my age. They aren't rude, they just aren't super accommodating. I'm not a teenager or anything but I try to go with my mom to make sure we are taken care of right. Still, love this place!!

-bHPNqNR3oF6H3eMfiXs1w.text: The pancakes and pot muffin are really good.  The bacon was crisp, coffee was margina and the service was decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try the buttermilk pancakes, my favorite! I also liked the breakfast burrito with green sauce .

aB1SaR3HpJHcVoiuuqfF3w.text: Great place to stop in for some solid food.  Places like this is what I love that you dont have to eat on the strip or anything.  I had the cuban panini and my wife had a sub.  So good and they tasted well.  We also had a pot of bread and it was good as well.  Staff was friendly and this is a nice little place to come eat and relax.  Good food and Good Service.

hMt4l1W0x_I2xUPOyHJPWQ.text: I love this place for simple but honest home style American fare. The food is not extravagant but good. It's just simple and delicious.   The staff here are the best around kind, courteous and genuine. Good food great staff is always a good way to get me coming back, even from green valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast with the boys
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Next meal
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Denver omelette wet. No brown on it just the way I like it

56zSXcwhQKTlcPu_Rpo3Hg.text: I do not usually write reviews, but I just had to review this place. The food here is DELICIOUS.  Did not have to wait long at all. I have to say the employees at this place are awesome......Shirley our waitress is one of the best I've seen. Will definitely be coming back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eM2bcsE3Pm0LyqVC4zVxig.text: This place is amazing!! I've been eating here for 15 years! My parents found this place when my brother was born and we quickly became friends with the staff. Everytime we go Shirley and Sandy always give us big hugs and they already know our order. Jamms has the best French toast I've ever had in my life. I've never had a bad meal or bad service here. The chicken wings, tuna melt, Philly cheesesteak and biscuits and gravy are phenomenal! I take everyone here and it's definitely a recommendation for anyone who comes to Vegas

qQ4CJpRr7dacJXYX5iH4Eg.text: Very solid diner spot at the corner of Rainbow and Charleston. We tried their notorious pot of bread a few choice omelettes, and their waffle. Portion size was quite good. Many of the diners here in Vegas either give you a small omelette/skimp on the ingredients or give you an enormous omelette which no normal person can stomach. Jamms gives you a good portion size with quality ingredients for a great price. They also offer tapas plates which is an awesome idea for a brunch to try many breakfast dishes as this meal is by far the hardest to decide in the morning. I very much enjoyed my meal here from the waitstaff to the meal to the 10% yelp check in coupon to the fact that my meal came in at $20 for a solid morning starter. One of the best of its kind in local Las Vegas.

zuP_O1IxccKQ5Qi2BpM0JQ.text: I admit that I definitely prejudged this place to probably have mediocre food just because of the shopping center. I was definitely wrong and the food here is phenomenal. The Reuben and corned beef hash dishes are all delicious here.

WZcvwZSZRHBdAyC62YrbMA.text: Exceptional service and well made food. I came here for the signature pot of bread so the food I ordered was secondary and really the stuff you see made generically at every restaurant (chicken noodle soup and salad). It was all made fast, it was still very delicious, and the pot of bread was wonderful and totally worth it. there was a hiccup early on; my coffee cup had lipstick on it. The servers handled it with speed and humor that I appreciated and the rest of the service was fantastic.

PviUzHvv8V3eGofXs64Q7A.text: I didn't do the review while in the restaurant  because I want to give readers an accurate review without feeling pressured to give a great review because of the ten percent discount so I skipped doing the check in on yelp and taking the discount so that I can give you guys an accurate review which is,  the staff is friendly and the food is OK it could use more seasoning and flavor on his own without you having to put ketchup Hot sauce or A1 sauce on it. I wouldn't recommend ordering the steak because it was not tender and it's very poor choice cut of meat the little bread pots are good the eggs were just loaded with cheese with no flavor  no salt or pepper and I had to send it back the crunchy French toast is OK we did however like the orange juice

7500C6iHXK9UWSYoLJx2lg.text: Delicious dinner with old school vibes and food made with care. Benedict's were perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O15yHYlh98oeAxcgAwsTpg.text: The service is amazing, the food is delicious, and they keep up with the cleanliness   I always leave with a smile (: If you want to feel like family, then come here (:

oYj_nvSL0MKgSfDlbhvQ0Q.text: Decided to stop in and give Jamms a try after a bunch of positive reviews...Carol-Ann has got to be one of the best servers ever, always with a smile, and awesome attitude!  This place was packed with hungry diners and we were lucky to get in quick, as many others were in bigger parties.  As mentioned in other reviews, if you mention Yejp, free pots of bread for you!(Its actually bread baked in a ramekin) we had Original, Cinnamon, and their flavor of the week, Pumpkin Spice.  We also ordered a French Press of Illy Coffee and some OJ...after browsing the menu, wifey settles for the Sandy(?) omelette(according to Carol-Ann, the most popular one) and I go for the Corned Beef Hash with Hash Browns, both extra crispy. we also tried one s'mores pancake, just because:)  Overall, food was pretty good, but Jamm's serves up the best corned beef hash in town!(sorry Du-Pars, you're still king of pancakes though!) Definitely an item I'd order again! ALOHA!!!  YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(30/365) "Order the Corned Beef Hash!"

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pumpkin spice bread
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores Pancake
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEST corned beef hash in town!

wPQOlaom-MW8gWEY_4BNdQ.text: Excellent service EVERY time! Margie, Sandy, Stacy, and Jose really go the extra mile for us Food is consistently delicious and we never have to wait long no matter how busy they get. What else can we want for? Highly recommended!

Ukghet9i3ORwKr_myGA9XQ.text: Great food, awesome service. Perfect place for breakfast. No reservations and nowhere to really sit inside. And everybody must know it's good because we waited outside for 30min for a table. But it was worth it.

K3ih9v_gvb-L9nHoXIlwCg.text: Famous for their pot of bread, it resembles a bread in a muffin tin with different flavors. I. Think that it could be more elaborate in looks and taste, like maybe being more browned and crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Somewhat like a croissant. My friend and I shared the pumpkin cinnamon pot of bread. There is a weekly special. The service was nice, but as soon as I asked for the free pot of bread for my yelp check in, I was told it was for Dine In only. I didn't know, it's not documented anywhere. Anyway, I got a hard time for it. Just sayin.. the lady put it in a to go bag and said I we gonna do it anyway. Thanks. It want that big of a deal! Other wise, the breakfast omelet I had was a big portion and tasted  so so. I'm glad I was able to try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham and pepper jack omelet, seasoned potatoes.

C8B6cM77_CxS1qyFBxgz9w.text: This place is my new Vegas breakfast spot. Although it's a ways from the east side it's well worth the drive. Corn beef hash and eggs was to die for. The Oreo pot bread is like nothing I've ever eaten.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamms French Toast! Out of this world.

fE_DnZMqg8jT0B0YNQ-v3g.text: Always a perfect choice!! The portions are large and tasty, and the service is friendly. Their pots of bread are a special treat! Always a wait but totally worth it. Defiantly A Place to visit....

IFPmrkftDw28o6zEL3VrIw.text: Amazing service, amazing food, no waiting around and everything was so clean. Came from Arizona on vacation and I definitly recommend this place for breakfast and will be back next trip!!!

fdccP-pQ_s7oqxT80g1sKA.text: We were recommended here and it wasn't a bad choice.  I had the steak and eggs plate.  I got my eggs scrambled with American cheese, and sides of hash browns, coffee pot of bread and a plate of red velvet pancakes.  I also tried the raisin pot of bread and their cabbage soup.  Everything was good.  The eggs were cooked to my liking, the hash browns were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the pancakes were fluffy.  I liked the coffee pot of bread better than the raisin but both were good.  The only thing wrong was the steak that I ordered medium but got well done and burnt.  The service was good and we got 10% off by making a Facebook post.  Can't beat that.

Nj8FaWGcnMDdeXHIrYE4oA.text: Good place it's allways friendly and they give a discount for yelping. I love the bread and the menue has allot of healthy choices

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pXaxEK-721Jh-Cw11VLTPQ.text: First time here, we're from out of town. I looked up on my Google maps top rated restaurant and found Jamms. The food was good.

tpHA4gWUIc9imiggyBLuiA.text: They're an okay place to go, they have some pretty nice omelettes but other than that it's a pretty average place.   The French toast tastes more burnt than anything, you'll have to drown it in syrup to be edible. The orange juice taste synthetic and watered down. The pricing is cheap compared to other places and it's pretty cute old fashioned inside.

PvjtPDIYe7_nHO0pZmrtnA.text: After eating here for more than 10 years I thought I had tried all the breakfast potatoes but the home fries was a real treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another great lunch at Jamms.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham and eggs to die for.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best pork chops around.

udZ9PqOxUgwZ4OpxfP_mwQ.text: Don't let the outside appearance keep you from giving Jamms a try. Very pleasant interior and friendly fast service. The Waffle Benedict was heavy but tasty. Terra worked hard to make sure everything was to our satisfaction!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of Bread
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle Benedict

_mvmA-Ej53z8yeFDzrM9Eg.text: Family and I loved this place. Feels like eating at Grandmothers house. The cranberry potted bread was amazing and warm, hit the spot on that cold morning.

it1P65Tj02XcCLdVffEctw.text: I've been coming here for at least 10 years. Always excellent service and the food is amazing. Get the pot of bread every single time. It is soooo good.

When a friend suggested we meet there for breakfast, I was excited to eat some delicious French toast again! That's about as good as it got. I ordered the Jamm's French toast, which was pretty good. I also ordered scrambled eggs, sausage and hash browns. My eggs tasted like they had been prepared with dishwater, and the hash browns has a foul odor to them, that I couldn't even get past to taste. The sausage was average and a bit room temperature. I was pretty disappointed in the food this visit. If I were to come back, I would stick to French toast and avoid side dishes.

4gJttK9nMlxCqsRSSlUdUg.text: I first visited Jamms over 5 years ago. It is a super quaint local spot that gets you off of the strip and into the "real Vegas".   Pros- Great customer service, Pat O'Brien Potatoes, and Pot O Bread.  Cons- Sometimes the Pot O Bread has been sitting under the lamp for too long and the top gets hard, don't be afraid to ask for something fresher.   Check in with Yelp and you can try the Pot O Bread for free (usually).   If you're vegan, try one of the scrambles and ask for no egg plus pat o brien potato.

-XbV8gDN9x2AeJ_H_ME4Mg.text: I love coming to Jamms Restaurant. One of the better breakfast places to come eat at.  Service: 5/5  I came in on a Friday and there wasn't a wait for a table for three. I checked in and got their free pot of bread, which is always good. The place is clean and the waiting staff is friendly. They are always checking up on you, always keeping your coffee filled.  Food: 4/5 Their food is great. They have different flavors of pot of bread every time I come in, and they're always good. The pot of bread is always fluffy and full of flavor. Their french toast is one of the better ones in town, they're coated in corn flakes, which makes them extra crispy. This visit I decided to get the chicken and waffles sandwich. The sandwich is just chicken tenders with lettuce on top of waffles. It was good, but I feel like there are better options on the menu.

k3TBAZMqu7uZ8AzfQy8Uxg.text: Jamms was a great breakfast spot! We discovered this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try when we arrived at the city.   The service is friendly, quick, and efficient. I have to say that the service was truly good and based on that alone I would go back. You can tell that they care a lot about their customers and it really stood out to me that they knew their regulars' names and usual orders. I loved seeing that. You can tell that they go the extra mile and really try to get to know their customers.   The food was also tasty.The portions are generous and the food leaves you feeling full afterwards. I ordered the Sandy Omelet (I was pretty hungry I forgot to take a picture of it) and my husband ordered the California Benedict. The omelet was really, really good and my husband enjoyed his meal as well.   Everything was tasty, fresh, and filling. I highly recommend coming to Jamms.

I probably won't be back

sUU-65IcDplwxWX0Znd9zw.text: Always excellent food .Jasmine was very nice to us And efficient I would recommend Jamms to all my friends.

InZ8DIgJV3rPrWo3vvld3w.text: I was excited to try this place after a coworker kept telling me how great it was. I went on a Saturday afternoon and waited about 30 minutes to be seated. People kept getting in line so I figured the wait must be worth it.   While in line, I couldn't help noticing that there were 3 hostesses/cashiers just chit chatting about their drunken shenanigans from the night before. Not very professional but I wasn't there for them... I was there for the food!  When we were finally seated, a lovely gentleman came by and got our drink order. The server took about 10 minutes to come to our table. Longer than I would have liked, but again I wanted to try this food.   My companion and I ordered two separate dishes with the intention of sharing. I ordered the Sandi Omelet (bacon, cheddar cheese, green pepper, and sour cream) with homefries. My companion ordered the steak and eggs. We both ordered the cinnamon raisin pot of bread.   The gentleman that took our drink order brought us our coffee and checked on us more than our server.  His service was perhaps the best part of our visit.   Cinnamon Raisin Pot of Bread- was disappointing. It was dry and had no raisins on the inside which leads me to believe it's the same dough as the pot of bread that's been brushed with butter and sprinkled with cinnamon sugar and a few raisins before baking.   Sandi Omelet- it's an Omelet that's folded over and has full size bacon strips tucked into the center. Not what I was expecting. It was an average omelet. It's saving grace was the salsa although I'm still not sure how salsa fits into the Irish theme of the restaurant. The homefries tasted as if they had been made in a large batch and were reheated.   Steak and Eggs- had high hopes when I saw that they had a grill to cook their steaks. Big let down. The meat tasted as if it had been in the fridge for far too long. Otherwise cooked fine, but flavor was off.   Overall, I don't think this restaurant lives up to the hype.

1Plfsn7t3I-gQfahicfOPA.text: "Dishwasher not needed" lol. My kind of place,  good belly food. our waitress was full of good spirits and smile's   I asked her for a recommendation and she stated that I couldn't go wrong with the traditional eggs Benedict which is what I ordered, My wife ordered the veggie omelette with hollandaise sauce on top.  I also Asked if I could start with a bowl of clam chowder since it was Friday, The waitress replied of course but would you like a cup instead of a bowl our bowls are quite large  I have been told this many times before  only to find the bowl just a hair bigger than a cup  so I said nope I want to bowl. "Ok doll she says with a smile.  like a fool I did not take a photo of the bowl  but it was funny the bowl is the same size of their plate just deep I could've dropped four cell phones in here and hidden them easily.  I quickly went to work and with every spoon lifted up to my mouth I seen my wife's eyebrows raise as if to say are you really going to eat the whole thing. I explain to my wife that at this point it was my duty to finish the bowl I was warned by the waitress that the bowl was large and I did not listen.   Bottom line great service great food & I forgot to mention earlier the bus boy was fantastic,   This place clearly saves money by not needing  a dishwasher since every plate is licked clean.

I ordered the corn beef hash and I wasn't pleased it didn't taste like corn beef was bland they were cut up squares of what might have been deli meat. It should have probably been cooked till it shredded. The hash browns were deep fried and had the over cooked potato taste when they are cooked till burnt. I ordered a side of gravy because I wanted to try it as this is like a mom and pop shop. The gravy didn't taste like breakfast gravy more like chicken gravy. The color and flavor was definitely chicken flavor. Not sure what the meat was inside the gravy but it didn't taste like anything. I had some sourdough toast which was good except they oiled it with what tasted like a butter substitute for cooking on a flat top. I just wish things were much better.

pc3KXdF2wmt-NbgQG_Fh2Q.text: The Denver potato pancakes are magnificent. I am so happy to have found this breakfast place thanks to all the rave reviews on Yelp! The service is a lot better too...although it seems a bit busy and every server and busser walks hastily through the small diner. The pot of bread was interesting. It lacked flavor, but I'm not much on sweets so it was decent for me - just expected sweetness and it was shocking to taste that it wasn't. We got today's special pot of bread: creamy strawberry (?) and it looked really weird because of all the sprinkles they decided to put on it. They could do without the sprinkles and maybe add a piece of strawberry on top? My boyfriend declined tasting the pot of bread until I told him to look past the child-like mess that sprinkles have painted on them and he actually finished it. I definitely want to try the cinnamon one next time though!   Also, their home fries. Delicious. They are potato masters for sure! I can't wait to go back. I really am inclined to try different items, but I keep dreaming about their potato pancakes... Wish I could eat this everyday!

38wG7pUUitksvpXA-6ey3g.text: We jammin! The cornbeef hash is the bomb, boom! The staff is very attentive. I love the irish skillet with my eggs over medium. Tony really knows how to cook an egg to perfection. The egg white omletes are awsm too. The coffee is strong, and the french press is even stronger. YFOBTeYtu__8DMvnTCr2bA.text: Jamms has won the RJ readers poll for the best breakfast in Vegas basically every year since the beginning of time, but then again, the RJ readers voted Taco Bell as the best Mexican food in town last year, so screw those people.  The Fat Man knows what he's talking about when it comes to food.  You want the skinny on this place from the Fat Man?  I live off of Boulder Hwy in Henderson.  This place is at Rainbow and Charleston.  (About 35 minutes from my house.)  I don't do mornings, and I'm not generally a breakfast eater...But at least once a month, my wife and I get up early and trek across town just to eat at Jamms.    Over the years I've had a few things on their lunch menu, and I'll be honest...I'm not a fan.  But their breakfast....oh baby, their breakfast.  Their omelets are light and fluffy and PACKED with toppings.  They have about 30 omelets to choose from, so you have plenty of options (The White Castle is by far my favorite.)  Their corn flake french toast is AMAZING.  I have often wished for their signature pina colada french toast as a dessert after dinner at night.  (When I start thinking about that is usually when we go to Jamms the next morning)         Their fresh baked pot-o-bread is some of the best bread I've ever had.  It's like a poofy dinner roll baked like a muffin, only airier and fluffier and full of wonderousness. (And yes, that's a word.  I just made it up.) I usually get the original, but they also offer cinnamon raisin and the "flavor of the day".  Ladies and Gents, as I said before, I don't do mornings.  As I often say, "they call it mourning for a reason".  Anything that can make me EXCITED about getting up early is something special.  Jamms is one of those rare things.   The only thing better than the food at Jamms is the atmosphere.  The staff is friendly, helpful, and courteous.  They are always smiling and chatting with the customers.  They are excellent about refilling drinks and making sure you are enjoying your meal, but they also find that perfect line between being helpful and not hovering.  Ronnie (the owner) has great taste in employees, and has almost no turnover.  Almost all of the wait staff has been there since I started going there nearly 10 years ago.    My only caution about this place is to be careful.  Once you have eaten here a few times, it can become an addiction.  I'm pretty sure they put crack in their food to make you crave it more.  :)

4z5rD298Rm7DZqGBOQyi4w.text: My favorite place for breakfast. Bring all my friends food always good.service friendly and prompt

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5tmEOtL0sL2wm0j04smbDw.text: What a great place. There weren't any recent reviews that we could find so we thought we would try it out. I am here to report that it is amazingly good food and lots of it.  In the land of all you can eat, and Feng Shue less is more, they serve you well and you leave having eaten all you can.  both my wife's and my omelettes were filled to bursting. Her bacon and avocado were more than sufficient in the omelette. It was so big she ended up having to open it up to eat the insides and then still left food behind. The hashbrowns were done perfectly, crispy and flavorful and a good-sized portion. The homemade chips are perfectly sliced and served in their own little french fry basket. The bread pots are amazing. That special of the week was the pumpkin and cream cheese glaze bread pot and it was delicious. If you're thinking about coming, do it! This is a fantastic place for breakfast.

vOGOBCOiT54uuSyaH2VfPg.text: Went here several  times. Food is great and recommended many to come here. Sadly to say I have not returned to eat here after our waitress , who come to find out was the manager, had asked if we were finished while I was finishing up my cup of coffee. She stated people were dying for a booth. Keeping in mind we waited over 30 minutes to be seated. Bad customer service and it coming from the manager made it even worse. Host insisted us to come back and be sat at another servers section. I just don't agree in supporting a business who's manager is a server and gives bad customer service. Many other cafes that don't rush you out that I can go too in this town.

0lZXhfydFZdrNDW7DO2vlQ.text: This restaurant is down the street from where I work and myself and a few co-workers frequently pick up food from here for lunch to-go. We also eat in once in a while when we have time. I've been eating here a few years now and have always been extremely happy. I love the food here and there isn't anything I've ordered that I haven't liked. Some of my favorites are the turkey, swiss, and pear wrap, the Irish skillet, and the bananas foster pancakes. They also have excellent hamburgers. Their pots of bread are delicious as well. The staff is always friendly and I love that when we eat in, they will give me an ice tea to-go when we leave. I have no complaints about this place.

VOs0tn2OtoLfmPxeUnqbUw.text: This place is so amazing.  My boyfriend and I come here once a month and we always leave happy and satisfied. The food is delicious,  especially the French Toast sticks!!! Sandy is always attentive and caring!  Love this place!

3Hvv-sqHb5T8YqUZy5dSKQ.text: Taste: 3 Creativity/Authenticity: 3 Atmosphere: 2.5 Service: 2.5 Bang for your buck: 3  Whats with all the hype, maybe because it was on the TV, but i dont really get how people can give it such good ratings. First its packed so be prepared to wait. The interior of this place looks like one of those diners you would find in the middle of nowhere, very run down and dinghy. Our waitress was an old lady who seemed to be somewhere else, just doing her 9-5 so you can imaging the service. I got the country fried steak and eggs with hash browns and a biscuit; my gf got steak and eggs with home fries and a side of biscuits and gravy and we got the free bread bowl with our check in on yelp. First the bread bowl had been sitting on the counter with all the other bread bowls because it was very hard on top and cold so that was horrible, my gf steak looked like it had been cooked in a mirco wave, very dry and chewy (medium rare). On the other hand my country fried steak was great, deep fried perfectly great taste however my eggs were mediocre just your basic mass amount of pre made eggs sitting in the back so again cold and flavorless. The biscuits and gravy weren't too bad, good flavor to the gravy and the biscuits were soft and flakey. Overall nothing special about this place dont see where the hype is, back to Mr Mamas better breakfast

Icwc8LXNN-nKhGJH5nh5Rg.text: Will definitely return. Food was fresh and plenty on the menu to choose from, Service is top rate. The pot-of-bread is great, but not unique to Jamms.

eQCHB3IuKa8-0HhCAzfXyg.text: My good friend and Muse said we were doing to Jamms.   Jamms?  Okay...it's a cool name. I had no idea what to expect.  "Just please don't take me to any hoodrat establishments, bet?"  I've NEVER done much of anything off the strip in Vegas..and so with me now having a good friend who lives there...anyway...  She took me to Jamms and it was the funk!  I had the Signature (steak) omelet, and french toast made with CORN FLAKE BATTER. Whaaaat???  She had the Country Skillett and an order of the Pot-O-Bread. (She was sweet enough to get me one to go). GOOD STUFF.!!! It's like a little..pot..of...sweet bread (blueberry, cinnamon)...  If you're ever in Vegas, you'll have plenty of nice buffet eating (Bellagiio, MGM Grand...)...but if you wanna venture off the strip...go to Jamms.  Jamms is the funk!

5MQN3BsrgQcK_RI0Kc7pvQ.text: The greeting at the front door is warm and inviting.  I love how they change the window paintings periodically.  The wait can be long, so come a bit earlier.  The decor is greasy-spponish, but everything seems clean.    There's so much on the menu, that you can find something you like.  Avoid the steak and eggs.  Chicken and waffles are very good.  Egg white omelettes excellent...in fact everything here is pretty solid.  Kids love the strawberry waffles, the s'mores pancakes (seriously, which kid wouldn't).  The regular coffee is good, but the coffee press is worth looking like a nouveau french pretentious wannabe intellectual.  Yep, it's that good.    Again, a good place to start the day.

j4NFg3pKm8ahcEloX6OYjw.text: Wow. Awesome breakfast, fresh hot very tasty. I think this place is better then Peppermill or hash go go. The service was outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6Trw7cYz5RWOWXr-9huYDw.text: Another great breakfast find in the Vegas area!  Well, it wasn't necessarily a 'find' considering we attempted to roll through during a prior LV trip and the line was out the door. This time, we walked right in and found a seat without a problem.    To share, we ordered French toast sticks and our Yelp check-in came with a free order of 'pot' bread. Who knew Vegas could consistently dish out amazing pieces of breaded sweetness!? The French toast sticks were a crisp golden brown, doused with cinnamon & powdered sugar, buttered and came with a side of good ol' fashioned syrup. The pot bread was truly a surprising delight. Scratch that, the NUTELLA PEANUT BUTTER it came with was truly the surprising delight. Sooo rich, so sugary.. *Sweats profusely* I actually don't like sugar rushes. I triggered one here and don't plan on having another one anytime soon.  I grabbed the chicken fried steak in country gravy with eggs over easy and home fries. I feel like I say this every time I eat this meal at a new location, but easily one of the best chicken fried steaks I've had in awhile. HUGE portion size that could easily feed two; Breaded with seasons that tickle the senses, a milky / creamy chicken gravy, moist insides and packed with a crunch. The gravy wasn't slopped all over the plate either. Right down the center of the steak with the ends just sticking out - you know it's the real deal when you subtract the gravy and have the steak bare.. if it's good without the gravy, then you have yourself a winner. In this case it was a complete winner.. The home fries were up to par too - with caramelized onions, bell peppers, crisp edges and just enough salt.  But really, I can't believe I wasted stomach space on the sweet stuff. I was relatively upset when I realized I was already full just about halfway through.. So, I unbuckled my pants and let the button go. We were finishing this off no matter what. Every bite was savored, and not forgotten.   Our service was great, from hostess, to waitress, to the busser who rolled through and took plates not being used as well as various staff members giving the complimentary coffee / water refill here and there. Nothing weird happened, everyone was smiling, the prices were low and my stomach was appreciative.

kMlBDPHMrbVvq-72egmqfA.text: This is one of my favorites for breakfast.  Try the corned beef, if you haven't already.

93x32-KJsFmpBcLYicQw4g.text: Delicious all American breakfast diner.  That sums up Jamms in a nutshell.  First time eating here and we felt like we were treated like regulars.  We had the French toast, pancakes and bacon & eggs and everything came out fast and hot.  We've been to a couple of different breakfast/brunch places around the valley and immediately this place stands out as a gem.  We will surely come back and bring friends to try this place!

QK3JUjvht1DWJKmAoV61Qw.text: Great food! There is a reason this restaurant has won best breakfast in Vegas numerous times. Great atmosphere, good service.

o1zsWrJgkg6Lx-27dHsztg.text: Friendly staff and delicious food!  We enjoyed this home style quaint diner.  The home fries potatoes are the best in town and they go great with the Margie omlet.  Enjoy.

Wvt9ngEgbq_TeqVdYLsm-w.text: This is the best breakfast restaurant in Vegas! We come here EVERY time we're here!  Everything is delicious! Good variety of dishes! Try their "pot of bread". Today's choice: s'mores waffles! Very friendly and efficient staff!

DkmXLfRH2xUFMk3UndNDuw.text: My husband and I came in this morning around 11 am for breakfast. We sat at the bar so we didn't have to wait. Our server had the greatest laugh! She was personable and funny. A real "at home" feel. He had the corned beef hash meal and I had the stuffed French toast meal... They were both SO GOOD! I never finish my plate but I did today. His was massive! Even took home a small box! The home fries are excellent. Similar to cowboy potatoes. We live no where near here and drove quit a distance. Totally worth it!

WnTxdrxnkduvJbKHkABIrQ.text: Breakfast was average. The pot of bread is just a dinner roll in a tin...people were nice. Comfortable.

LLAx_cwmVAmcMvLoPj3iyw.text: super delicious and huge portions. We checked in on yelp and got a free pot o bread (delicious) and posted a photo to social media with their tag and saved on our bill! Fast service, bomb food and discounts. Loved it

IRW98gUaPVVJvdD158y0bg.text: Duuuude this place is awesome. I've been in Vegas 6 years and had never heard of it until today. Service was phenomenal, atmosphere is charming, like comfy grandmas house. Plenty of items to choose from on the menu, so we pigged out and ordered for 6 people. There were two of us. If you like bomb ass food, good service, and fair prices, go to Jamms. French toast fries. Need I say more?

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was my meal. The heather omelette. Stuffed with cream cheese, sundried tomato, and scallions. Rich, fluffy, decadent.

nAb7Ofl5Xl2z1O826G6-Uw.text: Very friendly staff, great service and good food a great place to have breakfast or lunch ! Bery affordable and great portion sizes for the price.

eT1rEEIHPo5tD-HaXshMfg.text: This was the best breakfast I have had in a very long time. The service was very fast and nice. The cheese grits were awesome and the corn beef hash was just to die for. Reminds me of the way my grandma would make hers. The cinnamon raisin bread alone will keep me coming back again & again:)

YujVBN5dwaxrRXl4FUsWwg.text: Excellent food and friendly staff. Check in on yelp and get a free Pot of Bread, which is amazing!

TOKQoRhD9ONBISSPKnaMxQ.text: A- OK. Huge portions of good, well prepared food. I ordered a low calorie breakfast of avocado, egg, and bacon /w cottage cheese and it was good, and when I left I was not hungry. The wait staff is friendly and attentive. Most dishes appear to come in at around $10, you won't feel burned.

YFpWzDRBmrWOjSO_v10aNQ.text: I love the feel of a local neighborhood restaurant with yummy coffee and pot of bread. The food is plentiful and it is easy to get seating. Sometimes, I take it to-go to have brunch with friends at home. It's worth stopping by if in the neighborhood. A local gem!

9GyNoJtqZTHXGUFcuV-DPw.text: This is a place I'd recommend to anyone.  They are friendly, polite, and best of all make you feel welcome. The food is great. The specialty items make the experience, definitely worth the trip!!

3FK75drI9gbk0EEJ3O8aUg.text: Great service, really good food. Can't decide which omelet you want? Get a couple different ones on the small plate menu for a reduced price. Ingenious and delicious. You have to experience the "pot of bread".

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread

5kK2aN5TH0Xqt90rLa2dcQ.text: First time here and have determined it was a pretty good decision.   There was maybe a 10 to 15 minute wait (0900 on Saturday morning) but we'll worth it.  The staff was very friendly,  the food was quick,  hot,  and plenty.  They have PLENTY of great items on the menu but I went with the basic eggs and bacon with hashbrowns and toast.  Great start to my day.

SJjQJSCmj8donPOgugoj5Q.text: I'm the type of person that once I find a dish I love; I never really try anything else. And at Jamms, the Irish skillet is my favorite! Potatoes, corned beef, onions, and smothered in cheese... yummy! It's a lot of food (can't possibly finish it) and at $10, not overly priced.  Today I tried the pumpkin spice pot of bread and it was alright. Not too bad.    I really like this place. The service is always good and they always give you gum on the way out. LOL

1Ape_y6jHwmy-Dh2OCypZA.text: I wanted to love this place. The potted bread was good, but not tdf or anything. I might go back to try some kinda eggy or pancakey or waffley meal or maybe a sandwich...give them a chance to redeem themselves after the awful corned beef hash, which really was a dire salty pile of mush next to some flavor-free hash browns and perfectly cooked poached eggs. Hormel's cbh is miles better than that stuff was. In future when I want cbh, I'll either have it at home out of a can or pay a bit too much for it at Hash House A Go Go (for all that place's faults, they do know their namesake).  I want to give them more stars as I always prefer to support local family-run places, but for now, it's just a Meh.

BMb1HAVy3Q4jv2xCNBERnQ.text: Was really  looking forward to my usual Irish skillet but about broke a tooth on a rock or pit the size of a small pea.  Luckily tooth was ok but did sent it back for a new skillet.  The waitress was very apologetic and told the manger what happened.  The one star rating was not for the hard pit in my skillet but for not even a visit from the manager or an offer to give a discount.  This was totally unacceptable service in my opinion.  I didnt expect to get a free meal but I did expect the manager to at least come over and apologize, but NADA.  Won't be coming back for awhile, too many other good breakfast places around town.

jUZCG-UuL5WFSWE0JHcx4Q.text: Delicious, tasty and filling breakfast served by the nicest people in a warm and friendly environment.  The potted bread is OUTSTANDING and addictive (try the specials). I had the nutella with strawberry swirl and it was like eating a little piece of Heaven right there and then!  Excellent coffee, good country gravy, unique and delicious omelettes, and fresh fruit.  Jamms is one of my favorite spots in Vegas for the "Power Breakfast Meeting" with my cohorts.

mBdXTcVldVkat-Aojbgxqg.text: 4.5 stars.  The extra .5 is just for our waitress, Shirley, who is awesome with her contagious laugh! (If they served freshly squeezed OJ, then this would be 5 star status).   I am so excited that we finally found a local breakfast/ brunch location that we can be proud to call our breakfast home.  We must have come at the right time for Sunday brunch because we were seated with no problem.  But, after a few minutes- the waiting area was filled to the brim with hungry patrons.    I ordered the Eggs Florentine and after a number of misses with the hollandaise sauce at other breakfast joints- I finally found one that was perfect.  Of course, I mentioned yelp- and even got a free pot of freshly baked bread- and I selected the flavor of the day: apricot.  Yummo! My husband ordered his usual- chicken fried steak with a side of country potatoes and devoured it.  My cousin ordered an omelet and another ordered a sandwich with steak fries which were so delicious.  We also shared a plate of peach french toast and not a crumb was left.  Yes- we were quite the hungry bunch.   Awesome service, awesome food and I love the fact that it is family owned.  We even left with some "Jamms coffee mugs" because we are such fans.  As their motto says, we did "enter as strangers, left as friends".  See you soon, new friend!

sv6x2MR5iinNwOGLydLrNw.text: I can always count on great food here. Service always comes with a smile. And the bread pots...We really like the reduced size plates. The regular omelets are huge.

oM1GSZGvqoOxwCkUgGWpOA.text: I have been going to Jamms for many many years and consider it my home away from home.  Due to some physical conditions I am unable to do much cooking at home because I can't stand in one place very long, hence the reason I eat at Jamms a few times a week.   It distresses me that a review from a Janice on 6-18-2016 was so distasteful (pun intended) because she claims to have found a hair in her French fries and was sad that they only took the price of the fries off of her bill when she clearly was looking for a free meal.   I know everyone at Jamms and my 6 g-kids are regulars as well as g-ma.  we have never found anything, that didn't belong, in our food but if we had they would have either replaced the item or taken it off our bill.  to expect a free meal for that is stupid and reminds me when people used to PUT things in their food in order to get out of paying for it.  Jamms is, without a doubt, THE BEST RESTAURANT IN LAS VEGAS and if you haven't been there yet, you should check it out.

XaE66RiKah2gn0eY5aVRQg.text: OMG - this place is hands down one of the best breakfast places.  They have chiliqueles on the menu, not something offered just anywhere.  The bene's are fantastic!  100% worth the wait!

WBdPMNy_2Af0LGDi9rayXw.text: Where to start?  If you love corned beef hash - stop what you are doing and make a trip to Jamm's!!!!!!!!   They're French press coffee is amazing and I'm now wide awake :D I'm not big into sweets but they're pot of bread is delicious (I had their weekly special flavor - pina colada) and they're s'mores waffles have changed my breakfast regimen.   Service is fast, friendly, and very attentive. Sandy and Jose were great to us. The best $35 spent this year! We will definitely be driving the distance to come here.   I sign off, fat and happy.

iF4YZZeBtojcJ54nE8QdyA.text: Best breakfast ever! Come here far too often and try all sorts of different items. This time I wanted to be a kid... So I got peanut butter and chocolate chip pancakes, and wow! They were good! My girlfriend had the biscuits and gravy with an egg on the side, but put it on top. Lol. That was also super amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon and blueberry pot of bread was this weeks bread pot special... And yum!!!
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O-aZpbEllroerqejpEdWYA.text: I've been going here since I was a little kid (I'm 21) and I introduced my boyfriend to Jamms, HE LOVES IT. This is more than just a place to eat, but more like a full on old school experience. Everyone is personable, so friendly, and the service is great. Fresh coffee refills. The food... MAGIC. This is the spot for home made yummy breakfast and lunch, and it never fails to disappoint. I'm a picky eater and they have something for everyone! Classic foods, as well as creative spins on things. Portions are hearty, and I never leave feeling hungry or over stuffed. The best part... it's not expensive. My boyfriend and I paid 20$ for the two of us to eat, which makes the experience even better. 10/10 would recommend!!

zdyLIhsv21Ta4pA2dbgBlw.text: A True hidden gem of Las Vegas. Very thrilled with the flavors I experienced here. The service was great and very fast...we are here on a Sunday and they are still serving us as if they aren't packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Jamminator. My boyfriend got the Reuben eggs Benedict

2AvIUxNq7_OqF_U9CTX7eQ.text: I wanted to love here, I really did . Upon entering we were greeted by the woman standing at the counter. We didn't see my boyfriends family that we were meeting and we weren't sure if his little brother would make it, so we asked for a table of 4 to 5. She told us she couldn't seat us unless our whole party was there. I understand places that have this policy, but usually they tend to explain it nicer than they did here. The woman's tone was very unfriendly. We asked if it was possible just to put us at a table for 5 just incase the little brother snuck in a little late, not even order and her response was "well it depends if I seat you at a table for 4 or 5" ... Ok so please make it 5? Thankfully right then the little brother walked in and we didn't have to deal with her anymore. We were seated and quickly taken care of by a really spunky and nice waitress, she was seriously great. Big personality!  I ordered the small plate omelet and their pot bread (cinnamon raisin). The omelet was average, I really wasn't blown away by it. The saving grace of the meal was the pot bread which was warm and delicious!  Food was ok, front desk customer service was bad, and waitress was great! Probably won't go out of my way to eat here again when I visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b4n5bAxACphznoQGQPNyQw.text: My favorite place to eat breakfast has ALWAYS been BLUEBERRY HILL. I don't like anyone else's french toast. I ordered a omelet here and was really surprised by the size of the omelet, the amount of vegetables, and best of all the perfect amount of cheese. The omelet was fluffy and didn't have a overcooked patch of burnt on it at all. It was very beautiful. I was there at 8:30 am on Monday and I was so happy that there weren't loud mulitple crowds. It was consistently busy but not overwhelming and annoying. My friend and I sat there for quite a while catching up and best of all the server didn't harrass constantly. They let us talk for quite awhile without interrupting.  The only bad thing I had to say was the hashbrowns were TOO crispy for me. They were overcooked and crunchy and had that burnt potato flavor. Other than that---this is one of my new favorite spots for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm, medium rare steak n eggs! I like it a Lil bloody!  :o)
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend ordered this.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasoned potatoes were so delicious!

iyqvoLGSKKgTBA_RXOlRMg.text: This place is alright if you're in the mood for a slightly heavy, but nonetheless tasty breakfast. The potted bread is fantastic. Anything with gravy is a bit overwhelming and insanely bad for you. Much of the menu is greasy and pretty strange. Some of it is just plain bad. Some of it is delicious. The menu is massive, which is a personal turn off. Perhaps the reason why the food takes so long to come out every time. However, the staff is friendly and on top of service. Great tips for our waitress each time.   Small plate options are awesome. Just little samples of anything you want for an inexpensive or reasonable price. They also offer discounts for posting and checking in on social media. It's a pretty nice way to save a couple bucks on your meal.   Overall, the food can go either way. I've had good experiences as well as awful ones in Jamms. The restaurant is old and outdated (this would usually not bother me, but it does make it look fairly dirty). The staff are great, no doubt. I personally would not eat here again, but my fiance loves the potted bead enough to come back.

8k_TncSiacARUOVxw7cUgQ.text: This place is my favorite restaurant for breakfast! I love this place. My wife and I have been coming here for about 8 years. The menu has a lot of choices and everything is made fresh every day. Yummmmmm

n1IRkqKjjptVR4aUvGPD_A.text: The pot bread reminds me of Grandma's homemade sweet rolls.  You can tell they are made from scratch.  The rest of my breakfast kept up with the amazing roll.

700jTo4nFm3RNjln_1vUHg.text: This place is Jammin!! (Haha) My friends and I were craving some good, chill atmosphere, breakfast food that didn't cost $36 a person like on the strip! This is the place, a little hole in the wall with wonderful, friendly staff! It's a bit of a drive from the strip, but well worth it and affordable!

BNcpOzdmmDPAotJFKgCieA.text: Employes are very friendly, the place was crowded during saturday noon, service is fast, food is very greasy but portions are huge (big), the taste could be improved.

gus79clErY3oNePJJZAbmA.text: Visited this place during a recent stay at Vegas. We wanted to try something off the strip and found Jamms. The menu has alot of choices and everything looks good. I got waffle benedict which was excellent. Also tried the bread in pot which was awesome.

BMEG5obgpaxkgUJa3kw1Zw.text: Amazing breakfast. Pot of bread, salted caramel and cinnamon raisin were delicious. Omelets were stuffed and fluffy. Sweet potato fries with powdered sugar... Dip them in your left over bread frosting... Just wish there was more cheese on the omelets... We will be back...

VeaXd6cIF3F5zvJKOvbjUA.text: Went to jams today and I've always enjoyed it, but today was different first off my chicken fried steak breakfast was not good it and when I told the waitress I did not like it she did not care didn't even try to rectify anything very disappointed on a good note my husbands burrito was good.

o4l9zUaHHVf49zrS3NO2_A.text: Jamm's is the absolute best restaurant in the world to enjoy the very best service and the greatest chefs ever!! You come as strangers and leave as family!

MU7q4E9u8IZwhLRxz6NW0w.text: Omg this place is Bomb.com you definitely have to try it when in vegasand out waitress Shirley is awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omg this place is Bomb.com you definitely have to try it when in vegasand our waitress Shirley was awesome

Q9dZlT9YAnjDKyw92KHrNQ.text: Come for breakfast or stop in for lunch. The food will be just as delicious no matter when you stop in for a bite. If you love sweets, this place is perfect. The pots of bread change in flavor weekly, but my absolute favorite is the cinnamon raisin! My husband can't make up his mind whether he like the Irish skillet or the steak omelet. Little to no waiting for a seat, and the food is nice and hot when it comes out. 4 stars for service. It's a little slow.

cJv8tAB022W06rw7VkgrZA.text: Jamms is a hidden gem when it comes to LV breakfast diners. Starting with the staff - everyone is incredibly nice and pleasant to deal with. I've both called in orders and dined in (many times) and have yet to come a cross a  poor attitude or rude remark. The food is fantastic all around, but where it's really at is the breakfast burritos. It's without a doubt a tough job to find a good breakfast burrito in LV. I'm talkin good ratios of egg/meat/cheese, crispy and well seasoned potatoes (but not overdone), and a quality tortilla. Oh yeah, Jamms nails it. Plus, you can make any of their omelets into a breakfast burrito. I recommend the Denver with crispy bacon instead of ham. God I want one now.

_BgRDVOTpk2w8PKHCYiQpA.text: Excellent!  The Pot of Bread was a very nice "reward" for checking in!   The food was fabulous.   Everything was cooked just right.   (Hash browns were crispy on top,  the sweet potato fries were crunchy [and great with syrup!], the omelet was fluffy and full of good stuff.   What a wonderful little place!

yWf6PFs0L-sy_sIowRWOEg.text: Try the mini pot with the raisins and cinnamon , it's delicious.   This restaurant is to die for. We come here weekly with my clients and we all love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

krGTO0cQqnQOawv5J5Tw8g.text: I don't even like breakfast foods but I come here at least twice a week! It's so good and they have the option to do small plates so the portions are perfect. The bread pots are my favorite!

-8DdesIUWf7uNV1zp2un9w.text: We saw Jamms on television when the chef Guy was checking out different restaurants in vegas. So we decided to try them out, we are so happy we did. The service has that family owned feel where you feel welcomed the whole time your there. Their pot o bread is the best i have had in vegas, i love the variety of flavors and there is always a different special flavor when we dine. So far the nutella banana and the pineapple cream cheese ones are my 2 favorites. My husbands favorite breakfast to order no matter where we dine is the Corned beef and hash with potato and eggs. He says hands down they make it the best in the city. I normally pick an omelet and they are always light and fluffy and taste fresh. The prices are affordable and you get a discount for checking in on social media and you show them at the register. We love this place and it's our new breakfast place when we decide to eat out. I can see why they have so many great reviews and repeat customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bannana nutella pot o bread

UsNFvg2wOqPmm9zNHkAfAA.text: Every time we come to Vegas we make sure to stop in at least once. The food is delicious. Be sure to try the Pot of Bread!!! The service is friendly and efficient. We LOVE this place!

BwAUxI6KsiQRTmUiXBzxWg.text: Delicious food, great prices, great service. I love coming here, always have had an exceptional time. It can get crowded and have a bit of a wait, but it is worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My picky toddler loves the Denver omelette

tlolaw0LzV0IWx59xo5cbg.text: It's good food.... Service could be much better. I've been here for about 35 minutes.... And I'm extremely parched lol. Other than that.... Definitely stop by!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Overrated. Cinnamon pot o bread. Will try a different flavor next time.... Perhaps.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
