sTTzi5RYA3q1gVLNQFMo6Q.text: It's delicious! It feels like a diner that cares. TRY anything with corned beef in it (Reuben, amazing! Or the Hash).. Chicken BLT waffle sandwich was a treasure as well. Shirley was our waitress and she was attentive and friendly. The atmosphere is very comfortable and welcoming. Food came out fast and hot. Overall a great experience. Definitely coming back

Xh0x4Z0cVI_745D-7QVszQ.text: I love this place!  A little ma & pop place & Sandy was my server again.  Super sweet & always packed.  Had an inlet with home style potatoes & a honey bacon bun

p_Y5eii9wEtj-YokTPUCBQ.text: Breakfast past noon? YUP! I had it here.  Good service, friendly staff. I had the eggs and hashbrowns. The hashbrown was nice and crunch on the outside, just the way I like it. The toast was very buttery but my bad for forgetting to ask for dry. Prices are comparable to other average breakfast places. Would go back again.

i9QUXAseyPYbnVs7Yi2C9g.text: I had french toast the first time. It was gud. They put cornflakes on it cuz that's the best way to do it. 2nd time I wasn't feeling gud and so the server said to have the soup and it was gud and made me feel better. so have the french toast if you're feeling gud or have the soup.  Pot of bread is not a literal pot of bread.

H8NZ7a-zUbTqHK8NyZEuLg.text: Great place for brunch. The pot of breads was delicious fresh and hot! We got the cinnamon raisin and special of the week: FIG! My favorite. The steak and eggs was very tender, although the meat was a little overcooked for medium. I enjoyed the food nonetheless and would recommend coming here! Thanks for the great service and food! Oh, plus a free pot of bread with yelp check in and 10% off entire bill with a post and a hashtag of the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs with a side of hash browns. Not to mention, pot of bread: cinnamon raisin and special of the week---FIG) Yummy.

KO5Z4XXdlkGDOexJh2AS6A.text: Amazing food and amazing service. We will be coming back. The atmosphere is very very family friendly. Thank you Jamms.

9-eOOyfv4iAeY0Rhvssx8A.text: Some of the best breakfast in town! Has a very homey family vibe to it! Friendly staff, good food. Sometimes there is a wait, but definitely worth it!

r0cBAo7K7C360d_1E8GEUQ.text: Went here for breakfast.  I had to find out what a pot o bread was.  Took a very expensive Uber from the strip to this place.  Reminds of you of any greasy spoon diner that you find across this country.  The Pot O Bread was very good and you should try it, if you go.

BAzUNjnQZ3C47MNgfDL6Ig.text: Excellent breakfast! We finally found a spot that has a Taylor ham sandwich that we approve of. The only thing that could have been better in our opinion was the roll it came on. But that's more of a preference thing on our part. Service was a tiny bit slow but it looks like it was due to a backup in the kitchen. We got the free pot of bread with the yelp check in and it was great! Will be back soon.

5bZgbJyGlaBx2flTqbRDQA.text: Love this place! Food is always great and service is exceptional. Try the Denver potato pancakes or the Jamms french toast and don't forget the pot of bread it's amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4nSN0U0xEV5nYovK7gjnGw.text: Jamms is always the place to go for breakfast.  There is not a thing in the menu that you can go wrong with.  Service is always excellent and attentive.  My wife and I come here as often as we can because they make you feel at home.

W0t_n0_GLscY6Cawaio6gQ.text: Really great.  The corned beef hash was delicious, my wife's fruit side was totally fresh, and the pot o' breads were soft and fresh. The POB is an individual baked bread the size of a large muffin. It comes plain white (what we had), or cinnamon raisin, or weekly special. I can't wait to try them. The restaurant is cute and homey and the staff is happy and friendly. I'll be back soon, especially to try "The Jamminator".

Egh2c-pSbUyk2tu5ggH_kA.text: The service is awesome. The people are friendly. The food was very fresh, tasty and presentation was great.Lenore is wonderful and she brought us their specialty Pan bread just like a cinabun.

LUzQ5h19WenWS_Q2DOHDIw.text: Went here today for the first time got sausage egg and cheese sandwich and Home made fries. I did not like none of it, it seemed rushed no seasonings no nothing the potatoes was barley cooked. I paid $19 and I can say it was a waste of my money and am highly disappointed. I picked here because of the high ratings, but those rating did not add up to the food I had today. Would I go back again? Maybe to try something else but I highly doubt I would ugh   what a waste of money.

x_D_eSKCZwXuDddQmO2oxA.text: If you are looking for southern comfort breakfast food, this is the place. We usually order the Rueben Benedict and the Chicken and Waffle BLT. Try the pot of bread as well! The servers are super friendly.  If you come on the weekend, be prepared to wait. Don't worry, it's worth it. Also,  they give 10% off for checking in on Yelp!

XnsNp-MislxCSR__A0lmFw.text: Bananas Foster Pancakes were awesome. We make time for breakfast at Jamms every time we are in Vegas. Good food, large portions, and friendly staff.

7l63NjnYV6D4Qi2klTB9ow.text: Burnt hash browns, steak was 1/2 an inch thick and smaller then a steak from south point. Pot of bread is just bread in a tin cup.... Ok? Zagat rated their food at a 25..... How is that even possible? I think they need to reassess their decision. They might have been good in 2014, but not now.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not good

y1IfR1Bpdj8z3SYKIOdOkQ.text: When You  have company come into to town, you discover many new places to eat. Googled best breakfast and this was #2 on the list. We  went on a Sunday morning..VERY BUSY.. but VERY friendly and accommodating..Superb food & service..I Loved my pot o bread which they are known for...Next time I will go on a day other than Sunday.. but no complaints..

ylwwrDDWXgjB_lfpxceWHQ.text: I just tried this place last Sunday with a friend and I loved it! The workers were very pleasant and welcoming, and the food was very good. What I liked the most is that they bake their own bread! I'd definitely come back to this place.

DGtmKVQpa75bd8NzEiOOxA.text: Great breakfast place.  Wide variety of omelets and entrees.  Good service, fast seating.

kQZc1Bh-qEoplNZ-hUnPeQ.text: Worse than the 1st time! This time service was even more terrible and the food was Bleh. They really don't have a kids menu worth ordering from. We stopped at black bears and baby cakes and both had long waits so we ended up here.....crap! We ordered corn beef hash, Lumber jacks kids meals and the biscuits and gravy. Came with the pot of bread which was under done :( Waitress was not nice and patient she just rushed us and seemed to like chit chatting with the other customers leaving us to feel really like we were a bother to her. We will not be returning.  This place seems to cater to certain kinds of clientele (if you know what I mean).  Again--baby cakes is preferred but be prepared to wait long.

wg_n5gZN8KYV-IAWr0cSgA.text: I go here maybe twice a week now. One of my favorite places. I absolutely love the atmosphere. Really homey and inviting. I love when Devin is my server she's always funny and sweet. I had Shirley too.she reminds me of talking to my grandma. She is absolutely adorable. The food is always great. Whenever I take someone new there I tell them you eyes will be bigger then your stomach. And it's True. All in all you will love it

4mFVJtvwz_LMGxFQE5DuGA.text: Came here with the wife on a Wednesday afternoon about 1 o'clock.  Read some great reviews on Yelp, so we thought we would try it.  We really wanted some breakfast.    The wife ordered the rueben Benedict.  The hollandaise sauce was okay, fake tasting.  The corned beef was awesome.  You could tell that they made it in house.  They overcooked her eggs and we had to ask for new ones.  The hashbrowns were crispy and good.  I ordered their Jamms omelet.  It was stuffed with thinly sliced roast beef that was crisped on the grill with grilled mushrooms, onions and cheddar cheese.  This was all topped with a homemade bearnaise.  It was fabulous. It all went perfectly together and I loved the crispy beef.  I also ordered their pot of bread.  It had a crunchy outside and a soft inside.  Very good.   We will return and when I do I will be ordering something with that wonderful corned beef.

Pl3qHxUdJXBlpSrgr9x1Ag.text: I've been coming here since it opened! Great and friendly staff. Best breakfast in town. My go to items are the waffle Benedict and the Jamms signature omelette with steak mushrooms and onions and cheese, the Pot of bread is a must!

gM2w6mbITIEJOeTQXDGeuw.text: Had breakfast with my wife. Had Joe s omelet was grest I hssd the breakfast burrito.  Devyn was great!!!!!!!!

lRCAaj6dRcyuh4C2jegjDQ.text: Great "home-cooking" restaurant with enough unique dishes to keep you interested.  Staff is always friendly and helpful.  Love it.

itOZ-3obrvPaSuLGT39oGw.text: I love Jamms! Their potted breads are so tasty! The fiance and I love going here on Sundays when we want a break from cooking. :)

GB3z0jKCZgens5DRRpaWsg.text: This place was cool but service was a little slow. Fun atmosphere like a ma and pa place but the bacon was fatty. Food was great.

sxaJY-3vV6pvCnoSGVTObQ.text: I wish that I have discovered this hidden treasure before! A friend of mine took me to Jamms for breakfast 2 weeks ago and I've been back twice since. The food is excellent, service is friendly and courteous and I can build my own waffle! Anyway I want it!!! Woohoo!

65AODpL7tBlEnLnjQFefAA.text: I just want to say if u eat here they will put u to sleep for two hours afterwards! Food coma!

ulKzbQuwR-Y1_m71Z2kHlg.text: Very slow, poor service. Out of party of 5, 2 had issues with order. Hair in a BLT and tuna that tasted as if it was out for a week. To their credit they did try to fix things.

6mahMq5pQR8APkZcW7T4MA.text: So GOOD! first time here in all my life of living in Vegas.."pot of bread" was so delicious service was super friendly. .... reminded me of how Vegas used to be :) Dylan our server was awesome! Can't wait to come back.

J8In999ceoRssheTUBrEtg.text: I have been to jamms quite a few times and this time particularly rubbed me the wrong way. The food was great and amazing I give the chef a 8/10. It was well prepared and delicious. Why I am giving this visit a 3 star is because the customer service provided today. The associates were very  and seemed irritable because it took longer than usual to go through the menu of great options. I witnessed my server speaking to other associates about our table and kept getting eyes from the associates she would speak to about the table. My server asked the drink provider to give us more water and he displayed an action of not wanting to do it. I get that it is a job but the people eating should not feel in easy or insecure while waiting for their food. In addition all of the staring eyes as we were sitting here did not make jamms to feel like the homey vibe I am used to. Customer service is my number one priority. I can eat anywhere it is the workers that make this experience and it was not a great customer service experience. I felt singled out and the center of their work gossip. We did speak with the manager about it and she made it more comfortable. So I thank the manager for doing a great job. I will highly recommend this place it has amazing food! I will go again maybe at a different time to have a different set of workers.

4NKDt4oYM-zRhhCBDzVmuA.text: Service was excellent. Food was great. The omelets were so big that the wife and MIL wished they had shared.  I got the Jamms breakfast sandwich. Wonderful and very filling. The wide had the Tomato and Avacado Omelet, which she absolutely raved about.  Wish I had this place in Dallas.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamms Breakfast Sandwich with country homefries

nezbJC8ARlEzYzWUYWUJvA.text: Had breakfast here during our latest venture into town.  What lead us here was reading about their pot of bread, which I had to try out.  The resto is a typical family diner, but not quite that of a greasy spoon.  Menu offerings were fairly standard as they had a nice variety of omelets, skillets, eggs and such, french toast, waffles and pancakes.  I ordered their Corned Beef Hash and Eggs, which was definitely none of that can stuff, it was housemade and cooked to perfection!  It was one of the better offerings of CBH I've ever had; you can trust me on that, I've been eating CBH since I was a kid.  The pot of bread it came with was served piping hot and was yummy.  I added butter and jelly and it was a nice treat.  Definitely skip the toast and go for the good stuff!  Service was very friendly, they kept our glasses full and most importantly my coffee cup filled with hot caffeine goodness.  Which by the way, their coffee was pretty good!  Overall, Jamms is a nice spot for breakfast, we'd come back again!

VBB8iek_u8tp5uKRvTPpEg.text: Best breakfast spot in Vegas!!! Amazing customer service! Amazing food!

WIhxZaugkgsGGishFZrXLQ.text: Wonderful service!! Food is delicious and quick, the right amount of food. Shirley was outstanding and makes you feel like you are at home. Their hollandaise sauce is wonderful, not too salty. We recommend the French press coffee, prefect size for two cups of coffee. Prices were very reasonable and the servers don't make you feel like a bother if you want substitutions!!! We will be back here again and again!

0iXtwVlBzFbBYT5YULCTKg.text: Tasty breakfasts, really good coffee, and a surprise treat that you have to try...pot bread! The staff is very helpful and fun too.

6XfFSPtuidxj9-QwqWhQ1g.text: Great locals place. The service is outstanding. The food is great. I had the biscuits and gravy, wow... The best I have had in a while. French Toast was just as good.

mO5xWl2P6cHmhTKYx-Z4pg.text: I absolutely love this place! Every time I'm in town I have to make a trip here. I usually get their California club with the fat fries. Not only is the food amazing, but the service is 100% too! Definitely recommend

cvJRdEWfVwkqL4uYH1Fq3w.text: Great breakfast place. Eggs cooked to perfection, good coffee, and a special delight...a pot of hot bread! The bread comes in assorted flavors...we ordered the red, white, and blue...delicious! Service is excellent. Meals can be ordered "mini" size. I had the cheese and veggie omelet, mini, and it was still a decent size breakast..only $5.00!!

o--iAherJyMkk3GuqhRz-A.text: I love this place their friendly. I lovethe fresh coffee and veriety of omlets they have.

HpeXvapajiz4tSg_Ei15ag.text: Nice place to grab breakfast.  Of couse got the pot of bread at it was good.  Eggs Benedict hit the spot. Will try this place again when I'm in the LV

I62K2C8zXE52Lwrk-Aaczw.text: Good food and pretty good service.   I was in Las Vegas for vacation and came to Yelp to find a non-touristy breakfast location. This seemed to be the best choice. We made the 8 mile trek from the strip and found Jams.  The first visit I had the Steak and Eggs. The steak was nothing fancy, just a typical cheap diner steak. It was cooked well but it was just okay. The "breadpot" was pretty damn tasty. I had cinnamon raisin and added lots of whipped butter. VERY tasty =D  The second visit (not my idea.... families idea...) I had the Texas Chili Omelet. This visit proved to be much tastier! The chili was meaty and flavorful. They were more than willing to add onions and jalapenos, per my request. I had the pumpkin and marshmallow breadpot with sweeeeet sugary frosting =D.   Overall it's a great local place. The staff was quick and friendly. Refills were pretty quick.   Only thing that bothers be is the gramatically incorrect wording on the front page of the menu.

3fnuDgiMbBHzznbW3c2MAQ.text: Great food and packed but they know how to turn tables quick. Great food, great service but much need of gluten free option for people who can't have it. Will be coming soon. Hope one day I can try at least of the items on the menu.

M4tpM4_utpVqG5YgS58uTw.text: I am amazed that this place has won the Best of Las Vegas multiple times and is currently ranked as one of the best breakfast spots in Vegas...  The service just met my expectations, not bad but nothing special.   The ambiance reminded me of an old fashioned diner. The decor was very dated and to be honest the place felt dirty to me.  My husband and I both ordered omelets, the Jamm's specialty omelet and the Ruben omelet both notated as favorite items on the menu. Maybe we just ordered the wrong meals as both left a lot to be desired. The home potatoes were inedible. It's a shame I was given such a large portion. The meals do however come with a "pot o' bread'. You can choose cinnamon raisin or white bread. These reminded me of bread my grandmother used to make at Thanksgiving, just plain ol yeasty bread. This trip down memory lane gave Jamm's the extra star.   To be a good breakfast spot, the coffee needs to be spot on. This was another failing aspect of Jamm's. They use Illy coffee which I find to lack the robustness I love about coffee, almost watered down. I know many people love Illy though so this might just be a matter of preference.  Overall, I will probably never return to Jamm's. I typically give places two chances to win me over but on a good day Jamm's could probably only muster one additional star out of me.

HZr3XR2m8gZ6iN9sEhpowQ.text: Second visit and I am amazed by the over the top service. I had the opportunity to meet with Ronnie, the owner, and really enjoyed the pleasant conversation. I enjoy patronizing establishments with great service, who also take good care of their staff. I can tell that with long time staff, this place is extremely well run with the positive customer experience being foremost of importance. Thank you Ronnie and crew!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of menu!

kKQKSld48GNoxGRnjXk45A.text: Super friendly staff and a menu I look forward to continuing to explore!

cECigMVc3yrV8l_Gf0BYZA.text: Excellent food & service, thank you Roni! First time in on a Tuesday, a medical professional came in and took a seat at the counter, "hellos" & "hi" came from the wait team and they called him by name! Like I said excellent service, my home away from home!

KSgZ4FCVDY4OFlYDgudNHg.text: Rounding up for Jamms since I really had a nice experience there getting breakfast. Crispy bacon in the omlette was key and you got a lot of avocado too - no skimping here!  Service was prompt and I would say I like Jamms more than Mr Mamas where I've been to a lot.  It's a bit further out from the Strip if you are a visitor to Vegas (as I frequently am) but worth it!

XXbUvs66_GNZg0HTtprflA.text: Love their fat fries with a side of ranch! I usually get their jamms american breakfast sandwich or their BBQ chicken sandwich or their amazing Denver potato pancakes. Love this place. Definitely me and my husband's go to place for brunch!

X9F9S7K1XrWJgcYYr7Zy-g.text: Love the pot o bread, and the cali eggs Benedict. Need to buy the place next door and open up more seating, it's always packed, but it's because it's so good.

Md--gRMoJ_Bj0EwbtQ3PVg.text: Fun and good. The reception from the time you walk in the door it's extremely friendly, each of the servers the same delightful approach. Menu is interesting in original and the food is delivered to the table is wonderful.

2z_brypOOBLSDP-qVe6klg.text: This is probably the best place to eat if you are feeling for something homey. Sandy omelette brings joy to your taste buds and the corn beef hash is simple but it won't taste the same anywhere else. The coffee is freshly brewed served in great looking jamms mugs that you can purchase while checking out. The staff is very friendly and attentive giving it the feeling of small town dinner.

zSfVj2k-_uN9lVdrHbbPkA.text: Awesome as always! We never miss coming here for breakfast when we visit Vegas. Great food, service, and prices.

vCd4AeoP89MjaX6qAtcOJQ.text: Service is wonderful the food is the best thing I have ever tasted. U need to visit u won't go away hungry

Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the food

mY8pEEDEA-1RFMRb0tBTlg.text: Best breakfast I've had in forever! Had an omelet with a side of biscuit and home made potato chips that were amazing  also customer service was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Favorite breakfast place in all of Vegas! This time I went in around 2pm and had the burger and again, best burger ever
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Built your own omelet with home made potato chips

6b8jENHjkMhminxW0OTUPQ.text: I would go back.  Reminds me of a mom n pop stop.  People were friendly, service was pretty good.  The food wasn't anything to write home about but I did enjoy my meal.  I liked the casual setting and it's in a convenient complex with plenty of parking.

OcKLuM9K1kxuDkOwHwOWkQ.text: We came on a rare Sunday we were actually awake. The place had a steady queue, a sign of good food. There isnt much in waiting area and I hate creating a clusterfuck in front of the hostess booth where people are trying to ojt their name and check out. it was too cold to hang outside so we left our number with them to sit in the car instead.  We decided to share  Rueben Benedict -I was expecting more like chunky pieces of corned beef but they use deli cut for this but guess that makes sense too. Overall solid Benedict as the Hollandaise was perfectly done.  We got their home froed potatoes which was pretty good flavor with peppers and onions. Only I might ask to get a bit of it crisped up next time.    Jamms Signature Omelette - this isn't the fluffiest of omeletttes and is stiffer but still good. This has onions, mushrooms, peppers, steak and cheese in it topped with bernaise. It wasn't plentiful on the thin sliced steak (think like philly cheese or gyro), but all the components were decent. We also got home fried potatoes with this and this comes with a bread choice.    Seeing as they are famous for potted bread we chose that.  They always have plain or cinnamon and rotate a flavor of the week. Vanilla caramel was this weeks which soinds like everything we liked. It is similar to brioche crisp on the top and fluffy inside and theu fave us a whipped butter frosting like spread.  Yeah,  Im a fan of the bread.    Service was always friendly, and definitely on top of things. They are quite speedy here, our food was out in no time and drinks refilled stat.   I can see why people like this place.  Its solid, no frills American hearty portioned breakfast with good service. I'll be back if I ever wake up early enough again.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamms signature omelettte (steak, cheese mushrooms w/ bernaise sauce)
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rueben Benedict
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel Vanilla Potted Bread

Xz5A7XQBg_5wUcfTwRHnBw.text: Unlike a lot of other reviews citing huge portions, there was nothing extraordinary and infact, the chicken fried steak was one of the smallest I have had anywhere. So the 'Huge Portions' thing is far from real. Next, cold eggs and film/skin on top of both gravy and maple syrup is for rookies like Denny's, not the type of place the Food Network personalities film an episode at.  Very sub-par, below average and will most likely be removed from our Las Vegas Best Breakfast website!

6AIWe2vGqjyylrmzrNbIfQ.text: Delicious breakfast!! Love the cinnamon pot bread !! Omg to die for  & the waitress was so kind & her laugh was soo contagious 10/10

cPLQdJ1_CkCoiw6h5CXq6g.text: Great spot for breakfast. The service was fantastic. Definitely worth the short drive from the Strip.

5TthoZyHiye8wJBGH7rwXQ.text: Excellent gem found here in heart of Vegas. This place is your one-stop for great food!

zdEEzZwADBSLU4lRIiNpkw.text: Best breakfast in town. Jamms is a throwback to old Vegas. Great service,  great omelettes, and don't forget to order their famous pot of bread.

wQ8R70C0OW8qNxUUCtLb9A.text: My husband and I love this place for breakfast! Definitely a gem in the desert. Highly recommend. Rainbow and Charleston.

3E-Hfz6qdzqz7ZbAg-qorg.text: What a great place to have breakfast or lunch! The staff is so friendly and the food is great at a reasonable prices. Definitely a nice place to sit and chat for a bit. If you get the chance, ask for Shirley, she's amazing!

wKlLx9m_qedID33p-VWbrw.text: The first time i went here the food was awesome. Today it was horrible..hair cooked in my fries..and my daughters panini had next to nothing in it compared to the last time we were there. After telling the waitress about it she apologized by saying..hair flies around..we all have it and she would rather have a bug in it than a hair. Enough was enough but then she proceeded to tell us they found a frog in the spinach once. Not sure what her motive was but in the end she took 2.00 off for the fries. After finding hair i had only ate 1/4 of my wrap. My stomach turned at this point and made me sick. I dont go to a restaurant to order hair in the food and this should of been entirely written off the bill. What a disappointment!

gFyaAg1IKdpqiCnz8teSaA.text: Best Brunch restaurant in Las Vegas! Highly recommend the eggs Benedict and Chinese Chicken Salad  Enough to take home for later

AbgfoB_8d0jdG2qcWxN8tQ.text: Great food, great service! Loved the bread. Had to order more to take with me. Haha  The whole staff were serving anyone that needed anything, no Gidding in the corner pretending to not notice you. Very friendly people with wonderful smiles.

JFqvmUROuy8j2DoOqUenWQ.text: This place is amazing! First off, YOU MUST ORDER A POT OF BREAD! If you don't, you're doing yourself a disservice (its amazing). I got the California eggs Benedict and it was fantastic. But what was the best was my dad got the Jamminator, which I highly recommend! The pretzel bun is crazy good and the crispy fries are fried to perfection.

no5kAfS1sg6GMhGVf9w-uQ.text: One of the best breakfast places I've been to in Vegas. There was a long wait but it was totally worth it.  There's a reason places like this get packed. Their signature item, the Pot Bread, was just ok. We head the cinnamon raisin and it was good but nothing really special.  My husband had the meat lovers omelet and OMG meat.  I had the reuben benedict, the English muffin was nice and crispy, eggs well cooked, hollandaise was missing a bit of bite and the whole thing was a little under salted but most things are for me. The coffee cups are huge for a diner and they have great coffee.  Great service and pricing is on par with larger breakfast chains like IHOP. Overall great experience, will definitely be back.

twYvSzdKZGx1RLCEwh9trA.text: This is probably the best place for brunch in Vegas. Let bed the French press coffee and the toot toot omelet was over the top.

Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best French press, EVER !!

VdSvf4mano-iaL0BQyxVRg.text: After 26 years in Vegas, I've eaten a lot of breakfasts at a lot of places at all hours of the day and night. Jamm's remains my all-time favorite. Coffee is always hot and strong, food is always delicious, and the service is always excellent. Toast schmoast...get the famous Pot of Bread!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eONEAoTySzDuP-QnFtJAzw.text: My brother and I stopped here for a late brunch after hiking at Red Rock, it was exactly what we wanted. It was Sunday around 2pm and they were still serving breakfast so I ordered the bacon, avacado omlette, it was delicious! Nice home cooking and generous portions. It seems like a family-run restaurant with a classic diner feel and the staff we encountered were friendly. It may not be in the most exciting location (in a strip mall) but if you're after a filling breakfast/brunch and in the area it definitely does the trick!

mimqEzkDk7H1qMranu7HaQ.text: I got the Irish skillet and my wife got the pancake combo.  Both meals were very delicious!   The pictures look great but the taste is even better.   The wait staff and atmosphere are great 5/5

z3aTr6-q50K1qhX384LD1g.text: My favorite breakfast place. Great coffee, awesome pancakes, great service. Have been coming here for years and it's consistently good.

ahnklENeKNAISS6yFKuevg.text: Excellent food and the service is awesome. A small Mom/Pop Linda place. My kind of place.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I like the mugs. I want one.

4qwKd3Tu4ZSKGaxvG2PMgw.text: Best time to go eat here is during the week. Saturday and Sunday you will be waiting a while. All their staff is so kind. The pot o bread is always delicious. I had salted caramel today and it did not disappoint. I always get the same thing, eggs Benedict, and it's always as good as the last time. Love how their food is consistent and delicious every time.

RodE5b_xtZ2RBQxNuyRBqg.text: Amazing food, fast service, lovely spot. Loved the biscuits and gravy. Amazing coffee as well.

_XMfmfK7PxHAhewbAVRafA.text: Really good service and food. One of my favorite breakfast spots. You must try their famous pot of breads. Cinnamon raisin is my favorite.

Os5xKxKh5E_js5YKhzni4Q.text: My fiance and I love this place!! A little far from our house in South Las Vegas but so worth every minuate of the drive. I always get upset at many breakfast spots because they are small and crowded but at Jamms they have plenty of places to sit and the food come fast!   Keep up the great service! See you this weekend

f2bHxG0NBA6c0-_SDBbKNw.text: Wow what can i say. This place is very good and service from Shirley was great she did a wonderful job. We will definitely be back here again. Thanks Jamms

18y3Tg4E0YHsmOLt81M9jA.text: The food was good and the staff was wonderful. The place was not to bad on a Saturday morning at 8am. So get here early to get a good seat. After about 9 this place is starting to get busy. OK the food is good but not great. I probably will not be going back. My omelet was to full of feta cheese and spinach, I get that's what was in it at least chops them both up in smaller pieces.  I will not tell u to go and I will not tell u it's the best food in town. I would have rather gone to hash house a gogo. Now that food has good taste. That's it the food did not have a lot of taste maybe it was what I had to eat. I like to taste my food. One more thing I forgot to tell the waitress that I had a free pot of bread so I told the lady as we were checking out and she was not the nicest. I had told her it was no bid deal but she was not very nice about it. What ever....... And if u post on yelp in another social media place u will get 10% off u need to show the lady when u check out.

ToeKtbiovdNL0ltCZeH4hw.text: Decided to stop here for breakfast about 1pm on Saturday. Place was fairly busy, but easy for a single like me to get seated. Menu looked like it had some interesting fair and some variety on old favorites. I decided to go with a Waffle Benedict for $9.99. $2.75 for an ice tea is a bit high, all the drinks were priced in this range. No offer for refill while I ate.   Service was quick, and my meal was served inside 10 minutes of ordering. Crispy hash browns were cooked to my liking. The hollandaise sauce didn't have much to it, no taste of lemon or anything. Pretty bland. I ended up squeezing left over lemon from my ice tea on it to get a little bit of taste. The waffle was good, the eggs poached right and the canadian bacon a little small. Nothing that would make me want to come back for but I will try another meal here of something different.

7TikgoiyIbHs02uGGZRwZw.text: In typical Las Vegas fashion, do not be fooled by a store front.  So often I find that a strip mall with a nondescript doorway will lead to some wonderful experiences.  Point in fact for Jamms Restaurant.    It was my birthday and I wanted to try something new.  Hubby is always ready to please me and so my Yelp search begins.  After all the nice things posted about Jamms of course we had to visit.  This is a homey kitsch diner.  It is a throw back to years gone by, but do you know what else is a throw back to years gone by?  Their SERVICE.  I found where all good service has gone.  They have come to Jamms.  Warm welcoming smiles are the first thing you notice as you go through the doors and it continues with the wait and service staff.  Just old fashioned goodness.  Then comes the food.  HELLO YUMMY.  The food is old fashioned, homemade, deliciousness.  I ordered the Denver Potato Pancakes, first of all there is no way I could ever finish this dish on my own.  It is massive and not only in size but in flavor.  I could taste EACH AND EVERY ingredient in this dish.  So fresh and made to order.  I would drive miles for this dish.  Hubby and our guests ordered the skillets and only one gentleman was able to finish his meal.  They were big on size and flavors again.  Excellently prepared.  Hubby ordered the homemade bread with his meal.  Today's flavored bread was a Chipotle, Cheddar concoction and it was D E L I S H...  I highly recommend that you order their homemade bread, especially if you are a popover fan.  They are very much more like popovers than a typical bread.  This may have been our first visit here, but will definitely not be our last.  PS I spied a crunchy french toast whizzing past us.  It looked wonderful.

Bp1U2CEtc7vutsD1IueNCQ.text: Food was great. Came out quick. Waiter was ok, had to ask to place my order and my check at the end because she took a while coming back to the table. Maybe because it was Saturday morning and busy. Overall, great experience, friendly, and great food with affordable prices!

JA8xh4F3mKtXMQRfg0ob0g.text: The corned beef hash with egg whites and the pot o' bread are my go-to selections at Jamms.  A neighborhood breakfast/lunch eatery, the staff is always friendly, albeit a little slow on the service at times.  I think I've only been here on Fridays, so it's not too crazy busy and we've rarely had to wait for a table.  The pot o' bread is Jamms signature, basically a big yeasty dinner roll that comes with most of the breakfast platters, as well as getting a free one with your Yelp check-in.  Customers can choose the standard plain, cinnamon raisin, or the pot o'bread of the week; today's choice was triple chocolate brownie.  I had that pot o' bread plus the cinnamon raisin one that came with my corned beef hash breakfast--carb loading indeed!  If you haven't been here and love bread and breakfast like I do, give Jamms a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6/21/14: Bacon with caramelized onions and cream cheese pot o bread, free with Yelp check-in.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon with caramelized onion and cream cheese pot o bread
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6TuB99IBCLvSGJPgYL58nw.text: Great price, good food. A little off the strip but well worth the drive if you have a car. Its a local place. Only problem is many people know how good it is so it stays pretty busy. Our wait wasn't that long though for me and my three kids.

HA7uy-0lDt9e-GwSfFznyw.text: This is the place for breakfast and brunch slash comfort food. Every week they have a unique flavor of potted bread which is offered as a side to most entrees.  I like the omelette selection.  The wait staff is attentive and very nice. At peak hours there's usually a short 15-30min wait for a table. I like to burn time at Dead Poets Used Bookstore also located in the same strip mall.

KdbE9PK5wxN7bv6HP0ntlg.text: Delish!  Can't wait to come back!  Blueberry/lemon pot of bread.  My hubby had the bananas foster pancakes...huge portion

sNzHlv9jjrRqZ6PPJujIRQ.text: My wife and I enjoy finding local places when we travel, especially for a great breakfast.  We found that Jamms easily lived up to its five star rating on Yelp.  The bread in a pot was extraordinary and clicking on Yelp made this complimentary.  The day's special was banana chocolate which was delicious as was the cinnamon raisin. We shared a veggie omelet.  It was fluffy and delicious.  My wife is a connoisseur of breakfast potatoes.  She said the Jamms was among the best she has ever had.  Our waitress told us that she had worked there for 14 years.  That says alot about the quality and management of the restaurant.  One suggestion we offered was to provide real maple syrup at an optional upcharge for the pancakes which were terrific but loss some quality with the imitation syrup offered.  All in all, Jamms is worth the few minutes drive from the Strip for a great a reasonably priced breakfast.

JAgsaY0Ng-RW0j1kUVBETw.text: My girlfriend and I have been here a few times and everything is great here. Last time I went I got the s'mores French toast and it was awesome. Also customer service here is excellent especially the busboy who gets u drinks, he was great.

C3ms8O1zZQrzV4DqgJBG0w.text: Staff is awesome mostly there at least 7-8 years though 2 newer females in front were less than pleasant- if we weren't regulars since 2003 & these 2 were my first impression we would have walked.  A pathetic attitude from the cashier like she's hot shit does not match the great service the waitstaff provides.  The food is fast & consistent- a bit over priced but we obviously haven't stopped driving 20min to get there for a reason Try any omelette (or red velvet pancakes my sister in-law got today)

vFmMI22uXlutcmDcVpEs-g.text: Awesome great corn beef hash . Tres Leche pot of bread amazing. Will stop by again if in Vegas ;-)

1-vUvcguzXNY-DWTfb9Oog.text: After sitting 30 min, our server comes to our table to let us know the kitchen never got our order.  Not once during that time did she come to our to to refill our drinks. Not to mention she didn't think to ask the kitchen why our order wasn't up yet. Will NOT return. Such bad service.

I0ntW2jAm5B9Cv_VtfHbuQ.text: Excellent!  We were staying on the Strip...wanted a great breakfast and found the friendly and delicious Jamms.  we did get to see more of the real Las Vegas driving there, but the food was worth the trip!  Do it!

P-4PP1Wt0y2c9423eNNTjA.text: Great service! Our waitress was so nice and friendly. No problems getting a Benedict exactly how I like it... I basically made up my own favorite toppings and it came out PERFECT! So glad we came here on vacation. Thank you!!!

ZPnXepauj7rbd08YPgokiA.text: My wife asked me, "Do you think you can adequately describe the nirvana you just reached?"  The short answer? No.   I ordered a liberally cheesed dish called the Irish Skillet. I've been to Ireland, but I don't remember having anything this good.   The pot full of bread is an awesome idea and the Cinnamon Raisin is very good.   Service is incredible and though the atmosphere is a little lacking (what do you expect for a homey feel?), the sum of all parts more than makes up for it.  Short story - go here. Home cookin' never tasted this good.

93uZ0BTtQDxtgLO6VDclNw.text: Oh my god! Their food is amazing! Homemade goodness!! Service was great an friendly. Place was busy but we still got out food quick!! On our honeymoon an so far this place was the best

rZ-Tjn9eUykfQb9siCsraA.text: Excellent food, I really loved the corned beef hash. Very well spiced and cooked crispy on the griddle just before serving.  The waitress was friendly and had a folksy attitude which seemed appropriate.   Coffee was a bit weak, but better than you would expect for a diner.

AtsidgU0BHKZklDdGt7oRg.text: The staff is always friendly and usually very quick to help you. We eat here once a week and the food is alway delicious and delivered in a timely manner. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a new breakfast spot. The wait is usually about 30 minutes on the weekends but it is well worth it. Their food is reasonably priced and superb.

LGG8W74Q3Mgh0MzNB7qkeQ.text: Not sure what the draw is here. If Las Vegans think this is the ultimate breakfast hotspot, then they have never been to an ultimate breakfast hotspot.  When we arrived the place was crowded and there was about a 10 minute wait. no problem.  When we were finally seated, it took the server nearly 10 minutes just to get to the coffee. Now I know the place is busy but it's never too busy to serve coffee in a timely manner. But in all honesty, I have to say that once the ball was rolling, we did not have to wait for refills. Maybe there was a little redemption there.  The location. What is up with that? It was a big ugly strip mall which I think is a weird place for a restaurant but Las Vegas is so full of big ugly strip malls, there's just no place else to put a restaurant. It's bizarre.  The food is nothing beyond mediocre. I had a veggie omelet that was so loaded with cheddar that it just became a big greasy mess and worse by association, death on a plate. I tried to push as much of it to the side as I could and by the time I was finished, it was quite a pile.  The next time I'm in Vegas, I'm going to do some research and come up with my own breakfast spot

VTg2YeiKwWepFiyEsC_ImA.text: This was another pick based on good Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint.  Again coming in late I expected a delay, but we were seated within 10 minutes.  The service was prompt and the staff was polite and helpful.  I had a standard sausage and egg breakfast which isn't too exciting. But being gluten intolerant I don't have a lot of choices that aren't some combination of meat, eggs and potatoes.  Still, it was well done and the server let me make substitutions for the bread item.  My wife had the chicken fried steak and eggs, and a "Orange Creamcicle" bread pot.  I was jealous because the bread pot looked like it would be really good.  Additionally she said the entire meal was delicious.  If you don't have to pick and choose like I do, their menu has a huge variety of choices.  Since they were mostly bread items I didn't spend much time with it, but they had an insert menu that offered small portions for less money so you can sample a large variety of their offerings without ordering multiple meals or eating off someone else's plate.  For the sake of the review I should have paid more attention to exactly what they called it, but this would be a good place to go to sample a variety of breakfast offerings.

2x66-kBFJOA3G_G5IsVNuw.text: How is this place rated so high?  Meatlovers omelet. .does not come with cheese???  What holds it together??  Nothing!!!  Very bland.  Jamms French Toast is cereal coated bread dipped in egg milk and fried..no flavor at all.  Home Fries were potato mush with peppers and onions. Coffee --no flavor.  The Bacon was the only thing that was enjoyable.  Off The List!

0YN2csqZTGaw3O2Xk3mbKA.text: This place is just on the o.k. side, but really nothing special. Far better breakfast places just miles south down Rainbow. The great breakfast places are Baby Stacks, Egg Works, and Cracked Egg. Try these places and you will see the difference.

j56zHXjvMmbrSDrnE2InLQ.text: Trying something new off of yelp recommendations never fails! This place has excellent service, number one. And the food is an even tie. We all had something different, and every dish was delicious. Our waitress was so kind to tell us the specialties to help us decide. A little wait, but SO worth it!

qkDjv2wAcL-K0yYYfCgPIQ.text: Nice place to get breakfast away from the strip. Great pancakes and eggs. Although, I thought the coffee was a bit watery and weak. Would like to go back and try the french toast.

VL9pjADmy-HcKtDc3oBG8A.text: The Pot o Bread was fabulous. Irish Skillet was great! Everything was really good! Service was quick and pleasant!

o-i0a4n4tLoTADgky84fSg.text: Bacon was crisped perfectly.  Pancakes were delish.  Corn beef hash was made from scratch - I love it!   Great cup of Joe.  Glad my wife and I came to have a great breakfast here.  Definitely a must if you wanna have a good ole breakfast without the hustle and bustle of the Strip.

RGVbcp42sZgk8gpSHuuD7A.text: Loved the early morning atmosphere and the pot of bread. Coffee and company is awesome!

K8z5xSTrZkzcqpPBn9cjdg.text: The decor could definitely use some upgrades. However, I enjoyed my Mushroom omelette, home fries and cinnamon raisin pot bread. Although, there is nothing special here, I would still more than likely return.

SNwyZ-lAfqL2cNPPltOCLQ.text: This was an amazing stop on our Vegas adventure. Love off the path finds. The pot of bread is amazing, so worth the trip. It's also a great atmosphere

454Lq5-bbkPPV9D4WTjYSg.text: great service,Shirley was crazy good food was fantastic. It's great to have expectations for a down home meal met or in this case exceeded

j9w9qagM48_g_SUMX7gVCQ.text: Was on vegas for a mini vacation from los angeles but wanted to try a breakfast out of the strip... So i decided to give jamms a try... I can honestly say it was worth the drive... I can honestly say the have the best corn beef breakfast... Yummy.. I recommend this place

5RgbaH8XQ8WmSLwFeLM9iQ.text: If you eat here, pay cash.  Someone decided after I left that I should be leaving a 40% tip.  Just found the altered charge.  Service was ok, but someone @ Jamms is definitely over valuing themselves at that amount.  I won't be going back.

bFsw0XuGrKxbYn7c6n2W4w.text: Jamms is da Bomb!!!  The food here is so Ono "good"  today we had Philly Cheese Steak and eggs Benedict.  Both very good Wonderful!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CYyMJexKreKcEZUTp0gGDg.text: Excellent crispy hash browns, but average omelettes and terrible coffee. Staff was efficient. Figured we'd try something new this side of town, but next time will go back to Egg and I. Otherwise an okay place.

g_meGE2otiRMDUHZ5BUVOg.text: I've been here a couple times. There is usually a small wait, however worth it every time. The staff is friendly and helpful.  Fair prices and great food are a delicious combo. I've had Maddy ' s country Benny and simple sausage and eggs, all of which were hearty meals that left little to no room for the free pot o bread with the Yelp check in.  The salads are top notch as well. You can't go wrong with Jamms.

gXEHGyIaxM_C_objU_Hdjw.text: I was a bit disappointed when I ate at this establishment. I've a huge breakfast fan, and am always looking to try new places.   It was pretty packed when I got there, and so I had high hopes. Busy places usually mean good food.   Service itself was just bad. We were seated and given our menus, but no one came around after that for at least seven minutes. And when our waitress finally did come around, she had a very snide attitude.  I ordered the chicken fried steak. The steak was good and flavorful, and not the least bit dry. The gravy however, which was put on heavy handed, was disappointing. It had no flavor and added nothing to the dish. The scrambled eggs I ordered with it, were very dry. Which is a big pet peeve of mine. Scrambled eggs are probably my favorite thing to eat, and ruined eggs just ruin my meal.   The Sandy omelet was ordered by a couple others that I was eating with. Both of which said their omelets were dried out as well. And that it was just disgustingly full of bacon.   The Cinnamon raisin pot of bread was probably the best thing that was served to us.   I definitely don't see myself going back to this establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon raisin bread
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef hash

8a0PZ9I_ufuXo7nAdBH-WQ.text: Great recommend on the potato cakes by our busboy (busman), Jose. The food was slow getting to us but good when we got to it. The waitress was slow in responding to anything we asked for, but Jose was Johnny on the spot, and has a great personality. He really should be moved up to waiter.

j0pNln46Ibk211Kszj4Mhw.text: homefries and corn beef hash are one of the best i have had  specially bread was excellent  worth the trip off the strip for breakfast

U5L3-OlWlbnMr5mrsqGwug.text: Amazing friendly service! Great food! I have yet to have something I didn't like. So yummy!

POZmsk8dWWW4M79Tn0xiqg.text: So...after the servers stopped kissing all the regulars, I was able to nom on some very delicious food.   Prices reasonable. Food delicious! Servers VERY friendly.   On a side note, I would highly suggest that the owners expand into the vacant space next door. I would also get rid of the booths and replace them with small tables. It didn't make sense to me that two people sit in a 6-8 person booth when the restaurant is busy.

pdRsEHvL13MCrmVr-JRDDg.text: It's just so darn hard to find really great breakfast food.   I was actually really happy with my order. I had the Sandy Omelet with sweet potato fries and it was pretty good. I was interested in ordering the pot of bread, but I forgot and ordered toast the first time around, but got it on my second visit. I don't really see what the hype is all about, I preferred the toast, actually.  The price was right, but the service was spotty. Hit or miss on my two trips here. Sometimes hard to get the servers attention and often would have to remind them two, three or even four times to get me a refill.  All in all, I'll probably be back, but I'm still on my quest to find the best breakfast in town.

GQV9w1iLYdVctmMGWY2oBA.text: The food and amazing service was well worth the 15 minute wait this busy morning. I ordered the biscuits and gravy and fell in love. My son enjoyed his BLT waffle sandwich very much.  Vegas is lucky to have this amazing diner.

KmTPqpF3UXPLNBj0sujJxg.text: My idea of a perfect yummy brunch! Everything was wonderful and I plan to go back soon to try more!!

d4vIVjjmqQ81SUEuI3TVyw.text: Food is delicious and service is Fabulous!! The cinnamon raisin pot bread is amazing! If you're ever in vegas be sure to find this place...it's definitely worth the trip! !

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak &amp; eggs with cinnamon raisin bread and side of bacon. Food is delicious and service is Fabulous!!

dXwTB67T0xOBtQSy_jJLGQ.text: Service is good a little bit gruff.. Pleasant atmosphere food was just good. Grits were not cooked long enough and French toast was just breaded and fried and greasy. For a home cooked kinda place was just average. Coffee was large cup hot and tasty. Possibly a better coffee and pie kinda place!

uxqMxRnh793U-nq4g2GvJg.text: Vegas offered so many food options, and we drove out of our way to come here. It did not disappoint. Great food, large servings and decent prices.  We were given a table immediately and our wait staff were on the ball. We will definitely be back next time we're in town.

syOtC8NLYwq8y7K9IRtptA.text: I absolutely love their pot of bread! If you don't mind packing on the extra carbs eat as much as you can. The servers are attentive, kind and prompt. It does get super busy (in the weekends in the morning) to the point where people are even waiting outside to be seated. Oh and there's not much parking directly in front of the restaurant either (only during rush hour) so you might have to park closer to the Albertson's shopping area.

buDg6HfjO7992hwpGqG-Kw.text: best food we ever had yet in vegas for breakfast. great prices. huge plates. awesome coffee. good people work here. devyn was the best server ever.she made our day! gave us a great first time visit! love her humor and excellent attention even when busy. we will never spend our hard earned money anyplace else.  thank you for being here!!!!

oqhMmfTU6g0SKKv0_8dM1w.text: We're so happy when We find a new place like this  The food was so good and the flavor really fresh the service was very nice. my server was devyn she looked very joyful while taking our order.  Of course we  will be back.

6QLtuY-3xuRbT7aSSiLLuA.text: What a lovely place for breakfast! We had just came from church and was craving some nice fashioned American breakfast. The staff was so friendly and welcoming. The location gets very busy so I recommend you call in advance to reserve a table if your party is bigger than five. Would definitely come back. Jamm's Omelet are the best!

Kc_Onj2Dx7hrA2LsGMR14g.text: Jamms is that typical Vegas diamond-in-the-rough restaurant find. Tucked away in an unassuming strip mall, is this fantastic breakfast eatery. When it comes to breakfast, my eyes are always bigger than my stomach and I want a bit of everything. Jamms' red plate tapas-style option is the perfect solution. I ordered one of the eggs Benedict (perfectly poached), the French toast sticks (ordinarily not a fan because at most places they're frozen...but here they were delicious) and the waffle (also delicious and fluffy). Don't miss out on the pot of bread either. Can't wait to come back!

nGdwzeYGs9ExqxjoSfG1Cg.text: Service is great and a cute mom and pop eatery indeed.  There popover bread is why we come here occasionally.  It was served in a ceramic pot before but now in a tin cup which seems to get the popover bread out quicker.  We have tried their Sandy burrito, eggs benedict, and pancakes. All good.   They have a $5 small plates menu, which I love and allows for you to sample a few choices.   Expect a wait over the weekend and definitely try their popover bread, they have seasonal ones and original which is my favorite.   I am not sure why they are called Jams, but if I were to guess without asking I would think they are known for their homemade jams which unfortunately I have not experienced here, only the typical packets of Smuckers

5NRQzwPLmOEJkAKiC8U1Qw.text: Wasn't as impressed as I thought I would be. Omelet was VERY good! The pot bread I should of stuck to the original vs the one they had that day (it was awful) the sandwich they are known for is a grilled cheese Ruben - it was anything but! I'm willing to try again and maybe stick to something more common. The staff is very attentive and kind

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can you find the spelling error?

rAU_Hc3fBiuSD3ejxXiPyA.text: Arrived and was seated quickly. Service was excellent! I had the Reuben omelette and it was to die for! I will be back!

JDCPljVGz1_ybLzETPLEOA.text: This place is great! I was here for breakfast about one month ago. I like it because it is no nonsense. First of all, do not expect fancy because you're not going to get that. So what should you expect: you may have a little wait because it is that busy. You can expect good service in a diner like setting. The best part: you can expect an awesome breakfast. The menu is vast with all kinds of choices, from healthy to sinful. Everything is delicious and they will prepare to your liking. The prices are incredibly reasonable which never hurts. I ordered an egg white omelette with feta cheese and spinach that came with house potatoes. My friend ordered the farmers omelette with the hashbrowns. Someone else at the table ordered French toast fries which are incredible and served with an incredible maple syrup sauce. I can go on... anything you want for breakfast... They have! Highly recommended.

qE0G3OLgU6iX8YAvWCbiig.text: Just realised I've never left a review for my fav corned beef hash spot!  I go to Jamms at the very least a couple times a month.  I loooooove their pot of bread. It's so adorable and warm and delicious. We usually get all three flavours when we go.  They have some of the best egg beni's in town. And I usually get mine with corned beef hash on top. Which by the way is freaking ridiculously good.  I don't think I'll ever stop coming here.

s8YwS3WrvkoknBammCsQpw.text: This was recommended by an Uber driver. I said, "Dude, I need a place where people act like normal humans, don't speak like valley girls or modern Brooklyn people, and I can just relax." His top recommendation was Jamms. Happy we went. My wife enjoyed her vegetable omelette and my White Castle omelette was awesome. It legit tasted like a White Castle cheeseburger. Service was excellent. Each time the coffee got down about half way, someone was there to pour more. Loved it.

ChWMQRNKOtrb9WE-Fd3BjQ.text: This is definitely one of my "go to" restaurants all the time.  I normally get the steak and eggs or corned beef hash.  For lunch I get the tuna sandwich.   But this time I went out of my comfort zone and went with their signature omelet with  slices steak with onions, mushrooms and cheese topped with our homemade bearnaise sauce.  Delish!   And of course I always get the Cinnamon raisin pot of bread.  Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JtgLFL15gwaRbXDMTFcgIw.text: Great options. Great food. We had a large party of 18 and the server was great. She accommodated our separate tabs and made the visit great!! She was on top of everything! Very attentive. Great customer service. The food was great. Prices were reasonable and there was something for everyone from our picky kids to adults.  We will be back next time we visit vegas.

c8bFCLCgGi0mUuiavr-oEw.text: Great food love eating here breakfast for lunch is the best the pot o bread is the best

dZ6NKYZTwkVk1KyE6hkD-A.text: Our server is Sherlie and I am so grateful for her service waiting us. We didn't have to keep asking for anything, she is amazing, kind and thinks ahead! Deserves a raise

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WebMDuJ3CeMjjGfvi6aKlw.text: Well as I have said before this place gets it right. I usually have breakfast here and they just do it right. Love the same plates and as always the coffee mug is always kept full and hot. Can not go wrong here for breakfast. Working on trying their lunch items soon.

Vx2iL159s9h_hI1Lhtiw2g.text: If you are anywhere close to Jamms, stop what you're doing and go! Go now and get the Jamminator! It is beyond awesome!  The restaurant was packed, the service was great, and the food was amazing!  Great find on family vacation!

The food is always delicious and always large portions, I've never had anything bad here and we always bring friends, family, out of town visitors, ect because this is our go to breakfast place!   We always appreciate how fast and friendly the staff are to us and how quickly the food is delivered! We appreciate how the food is always amazing and we are always taken care of here!

9AkOI8iGPyS-YhWjpA3hIQ.text: I found my new favorite breakfast place!!   It's 9:51 am right now & im almost done eating my delicious snack. I got out of class at CSN at 9:30!! This place is fast, and efficient. The California Benedict is the best Benedict I've had in my life - and I've tried some super ritzy breakfast spots.   Me love Jamms.  Me love bread.   Eat the California Benedict now!!!!!!!!!!!! Just do it

8JT7a75wZbVGfZumgE7c9A.text: I was craving for buttery biscuits all week and decided to have breakfast here. As I walked in there were lines and I waited for 10 mins for a table. It was like a diner and the place is small but housefull which is a good sign.   I ordered their Jamms Signature Omelet~  Sliced steak with mushrooms, onions, and cheese topped with their homemade bearnaise sauce $10.29  And also got their Chicken And Waffles to go.  I was expecting Fried chicken but it was crispy chicken fingers on a Belgian waffle served with syrup and whipped butter $10.59. When I opened the box, just a couple of chicken tenders on top of waffle. My bf says it looks sad LOL!  I was excited to come here since I had it bookmarked but the food was just ok. The pot of bread, which made them famous was nothing special, not a lot of flavor.   The waitress Shirley was attentive and fast.

qtDa3WvqY2p3Oy4fPoPWUA.text: Absolutely horrible. If you want butter that is soaked in canola oil this is your spot. Otherwise stay away. What brought us in was pina colada and the promotion of 10% off if we posted about them on social media. Our server said they stopped doing that a long time ago The best part of my French toast plate was the bacon. The bacon was crispy and so were the eggs with the egg shells.  Before adding butter to my French toast I tasted it because it looked odd. My palette was filled with the nasty taste of canola oil. The maple syrup tasted nothing like maple syrup it tasted like thick water with a synthetic blend.  The actual bread for the French toast was old and stale. The best part of the French toast was the heavy powdered sugar probably to cover up the horrible taste.  Stay away!

6-9_QcaLsMRJOEudeJY4Pw.text: Food was outstanding! The service was just as good! The pot of bread is a must try and super addicting!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jammy omelet

HGz8gr68R67vKBtY9raZNQ.text: If I could give y'all 87 stars out of 5 I definitely would!!!!!!! Jamm's French toast was incredible as well as the pot of bread. I can't wait to come back!!!! Thanks for the incredible service, most definitely my new favorite brunch spot in Las Vegas!! A True hidden gem

k1XZE9-kwxfqd01iQMPpgg.text: Bring your own seasoning.  This place is a little hole in the wall. It has a relaxing color scheme but not much charm beyond that. The waitstaff have the social graces of a high school anime club member. We kept reminding them to bring things we ordered to the table.  The denver omelette was fine, nothing I'd wrote home about. A bit overstuffed as the peppers and onions did nothing but slip out. The poatoes were terribly underseasoned. I have no idea if they're going for a low sodium thing but one bite made me reach for the salt shaker immeadiatly. The homestyle, french fries, and hashbrowns were all like this.  My sib got steak and eggs, medium rare on the meat. However whoever puts it down on the grill needs to learn to pick it up- clearly over well done.  The tuna melt was more of a tuna crisp. Though the chilaquiles were ok; they know how to cook egg whites.

qstQlqgfNUnumO6vNg1dfQ.text: Great restaurant for breakfast and worth the drive from our southeast side of town. Service was fast, friendly and the food was delicious!  I found a good vegetarian options: Old fashioned oatmeal with raisins (no milk), an English muffin (dry)with a side of avocado to make avocado toast, and a bowl of fresh berries and bananas!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tJpOtB7a9UWp4czupt6fyQ.text: This place is amazing! I build my own breakfast burrito. Sooo good and the service is implacable

3Mps0qhB1KwctWIg4xxIlQ.text: One of my go to breakfast spots!  The service is awesome, everyone that works there very nice, quick, and help each other out.  The food is amazing every time. The build your own breakfast burrito is legit but have never had a bad meal here. Also have good coffee which is feel is rare for any restaurant that doesn't specialize in coffee.  Their pot bread is what they are know for and definitely worth getting.

CrKpzDtRLZ2jWLBNI7HUYA.text: We had some time to kill this morning so we decided to stop in for some breakfast. It was very busy, although we did get there before it got crazy busy. The wait staff is very attentive, prompt, and very friendly. It isn't the largest restaurant, and the area to wait for a table is extremely small with only four seats. The food was ok, however, the fries were not seasoned at all. We also got the 'pot of bread'. It was fairly good; just a little too crispy at the top. I would recommend them if you're looking for a good 'home cooked' breakfast/lunch.

CSGFjs4ziPuyUABMVY72QA.text: Great food! We had the Rueben Benedict, country Benedict, and the apple cup o' bread and lived every bite. If you need a great place to eat where the food comes out fast and the staff is friendly, come here!

nTyVnJXDV4zz_cnPi1BeBA.text: Wow! Fantastic breakfast spot! You will not be disappointed.  The place was packed but we walked  right in and were quickly greeted and seated. We had the steak n eggs, California eggs Benedict, and egg salad bacon club sandwich. Everything was delicious, the portions are huge, and the coffee was flowing!  We even bought 2 of their coffee cups!! Thank you Jamms! We will definitely come back next time we visit Vegas!

Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Must try - cinnamon raisin pot o bread!

9AQS8a2-5rgR1vbms_kNrQ.text: Great service and food was perfect. Homie feel. We enjoyed it. Worth a visit. We are going back for seconds!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hangin out..gettin ready to Grub down!!

BYkK8APTtn67zFXd100Tig.text: First time here and 'twas delicious.  Great way to start my Saturday morning.  Boyfriend and I wanted to try a new breakfast spot and of course we hit up Yelp.  We both decided this would be it.  This place is what they all say it is.  From the waitresses to the dishes.  Service here is kind and prompt.  Has an old diners kinda feel.  Organized but could use some more detailed cleanliness with the on your table things -- such as your jam holder, etc.  Some of them were sticky and some light dust stuck to them.  But overall the food was fantastic.    I ordered the Texas Omelet:  Has homemade chili and lots of cheddar.   Chili was hearty, smooth and cooked perfectly.  The amount of Cheddar they put in this sucker is perfect.  Perfect ratio.   The bread in a pot was good but not as moist and soft as I thought it would be. Sadly. Because I was so excited to try this cute little thing of bread.   I ordered the orange cream--- the frosting was good.  But that was it-- no biggie.   The boyfriend enjoyed himself the  Jamms omelette--- their specialty.   I had a bite and ohhhhhh goodness was it delicious. I'm having that next time we come to have breakfast.  The meat was very tender, juicy, and was paired perfectly with the sauce that is placed on top.  Creamy. It was so so good.  He also ordered himself 1 S'mores pancake.    It looked to me as if it was too sweet.  I'm more of an original pancake kinda girl.  I don't like my pancake smothered with sugar upon sugar.  But he made me take a bite and to my surprise it was actually not overwhelmingly sweet.  There was balance.  You could actually still taste the pancake.  Was actually really good.    All in all.  Was a great visit.  Loved it.  Will be coming back.   Our total bill was 26$, not bad.  You won't leave hungry and your pocket will still feel full.  Can't beat that.

Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sz1_NVLiU8gt04XD4PwEfg.text: Always great food. Also free Pot o bread when you post on Yelp. Can't get enough good food and service hete.

KFS_V6Iz73J9j9YmIx_Xig.text: This is not anything like the hype. Not friendly. The clean is so much bleach in the bathroom I burned my lungs. The butter has rancid tasting oil added and ruined the taste of all the food. We were all complaining to each other that the food tasted greasy. Then we tasted the butter separately and that was it. Ruined everything!  French toast was a complete disappointment. No pina colada French toast that was advertised. Also the website stated 10% off for social media posting.  The Waitress told us that was no longer happening. They really need to update the website. Not worth the time or money. Very disappointing in every aspect. Mc Donald's is better. Pot of bread was flavorless yeast ball in a tin. HGTV did me wrong on this place.  Stay away unless you like the grease of a greasy spoon. Old fashion, outdated, and disgusting.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Website offering 10% discount which they say they no longer offer. Need to update website.

nWHIGxsxcGoq4V2FGborWA.text: This was another recent stop on my Hubby and I's breakfast tour of Las Vegas. It disappoints me that I have to drive to the other side of town to find places like this - can someone please get on that and start expanding to Henderson? We only have "fancy" breakfast places in this area!  Anyhow, this is more of a "divey" kind of place - nothing fancy. It's loud, crowded and full of hustle and bustle. The food was great, the service was OK (not a big deal) and the prices were great. Our daughter enjoyed sharing my meal with me (she eats a lot for a little girl!).   Don't let the wait scare you off - we were originally told it would be around 30 minutes, but ended up seated almost immediately because people in front of us either left or didn't have their entire party there (everyone in your party must be present before they will sit you). Also, the tables turn over quickly.

ZGoD29fF5rafxwFFXr7p2w.text: My boyfriend and I came here for our first time to try it out and it was amazing!! Loved the environment and of course the food. The service was great. Wil be coming back for sure.

UfGxe_kOcLyXsQDrJtJlEQ.text: Feel Good Food Establishment:  Every now and again Life can you hit you with an upper-cut. Whether you took it on the chin like a champ or whether you saw stars and started bawling like a baby - There are places in the world you can go that will make you feel better about that punch to the face you just absorbed.  -Mine is Jamms.  Friendly smiles as soon as you walk in the door and an atmosphere to match. The menu items include Breakfast and Lunch options. I'm slowly working through them.  As of yet: French Toast: with the option of with or without crunchy cornflake topping. Additional options:  How bout Nutella French Toast, Apple Cinnamon French Toast, too name a few  You Like Waffles? Jamms like waffles too... so much they make a WAFFLE PIZZA!  Omelette anyone They have over 10 different types.    A new item: Their breakfast burrito that will make you question all others.  This place is real a Gem.   After a French Press coffee and Banana Fosters pancakes I always leave feeling much better than how I came in.  That is the magic of Jamms.  Don't believe me?  Order their Pot' O Bread for the day and you too will be saying,"What Punch to the Face?"  They get busy, and rightfully so, but it is worth the short wait for the quality service and food you will experience.  Jamm On ;-)  .

EpZEULdjycErnDR_9-SKUg.text: Great place Great food. Shirley our server was the best! Will definitely recommend and come back

SBkQDqrZyiT1Ez_uCriWmw.text: One of the best places to eat when I come home to Vegas! The staff and owners always show lots of love !!!! #lovethisplace

56H1zwpRTdfOsQ9fkxsvOA.text: I always enjoy having a great breakfast with the whole family when it's possible. Though I wish it was an every day thing, but that's not the case. So in those times where we can a few times a month we enjoy trying different spots, but since the first week tried this place over a year ago we knew we'd be back again and again.       With all the different choices and every which delicious and we'll priced I was already satisfied. The service is just as good really making you feel at home I recommend this to anyone looking for a great breakfast experience.

FKPzLmtcgH1wKEIiT8GOQQ.text: I love this place their bacon is to die for, and their jams French toast is amazing. You can't forget about the sausage it was fantastic.

zQU9WRwkvmqnsUtTa7_Juw.text: this place is always busy (which is a good thing), so I came prepared to wait, however - the staff made room for me, as I ate by myself. The service was prompt & accurate. The server gave me the right amount of checkbacks - so I was happy about that. I didnt even have to ask for a refill - the assistance were right on it. The food was hot & portions were good sized. The chicken fried steak was plump & flavorful, Hashbrowns were golden & crispy and my eggs were perfectly cooked I wished I had more room to try the bread specialties, but alas, I had to bank it for the next visit. I highly recommend Jamms.

I had the steak and eggs and it was perfectly cooked. One of best places to eat forsure!

wpo0g0yPWLC2oB0jEpwamg.text: Great food and service was excellent. The pot of bread is definitely a winner and breakfast lovers will enjoy the selection

dFg3pg895IRRGWBXc36n1A.text: Loved the little Pot of Bread!  We tried the Cinnamon Raison and the Plain.  Both were delicious!!  Husband had the Hash, ordered an extra egg and I have him two of mine, then it was perfect (he likes lots of egg cut up in it)  I had the Chicken Fried Steak and it was very tender, not enough gravy and the gravy needed flavor.  Will most likely go back, there are a few other menu items we want to try!

J9hrLOQzXv40B8x4RQm6dA.text: I don't even have the words to express how great this place is. Sandy was our waitress and was excellent despite the packed restaurant. We decided to sit at the bar to avoid the wait and the staff was quite exceptional. Not only was the service remarkable, the food was fantastic! Thank goodness there is a "tapas" menu because I wanted to try everything! I ordered three different tapas and loved every single one of them. My boyfriend ordered the corned beef hash and that was delicious as well! We will most definitely be returning to this restaurant!

lphmJzDVdz3VHdjzNvuebw.text: Jamms is one of the first restaurants our family found when we officially moved to Vegas. OMG this place is amazing. Their pot breads are absolutely to die for, and their service is the BEST! They are busy, busy, busy but they can keep up with it; the servers are absolutely on top of it and sweet to boot. Our food has always been fresh and delicious and we have loved everything we've tried. Our two year old loves coming here too; they give her a bucket of crayons and coloring pages and she's set. Great family atmosphere! We love this place!!

LQeV747ERStHnbwHwdUO2w.text: Go try it no matter where you're staying - best on your first day so you can come here every day after that. LOVE the pot of bread. Also they have nutella! The earl grey tea was not so good, but the rest makes up for it. On the weekends (we went on friday and saturday - had to wait only on saturday) you might have to wait but it's worth it.
