Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter (twice), maple syrup and nutella on the side.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plain pot of bread - great with nutella!

4yENyzfnLJ4MjmojOoLwGg.text: This was our last day in Vegas and after we checked out of hotel we decided to grab some breakfast. My wife looked online and found the top 10 breakfast places in Vegas. We were on our way to jamms. I didn't expect much but when we came it the place was packed but we were seated within 10 minutes. Great menu with great prices. I got the hungry lion breakfast. 2 eggs 2 bacon 2 sausage and ham 2 pancakes.  It was amazing. Best pancakes ever.  Also the potted bread it out of this world good.  So if you're looking for s place away from the strip for breakfast I would highly recommend Jamms

w490lO8S-uTv90C7V6Rl_w.text: Repeat Jamms, and I think the secret is in the pot of bread. However, I did not get a pot of bread because we've been sticking to wheat. The highlight is the "everybody knows your name" service. The place is packed with regulars, and everyone knows everyone, which is super charming. For the food, my omelet was filled generously, but the overall flavor and stiffness factor weren't my ideal. I think I need to try something other than an omelet next time. Note: They serve Illy coffee, and you can even have it in a French press.  But, what I really wanted to let you know is that on Fridays they have fish and chips, and my husband went googley-eyed and inhaled the giant pieces of fish filet with boyish delight. Our waitress said they usually sell out before the end of the day, so get there early!

Mf9wxI02CRHqbBpNYWuSUQ.text: Ya, this place Jamms and the food is good. Make sure you get the French press coffee, delicious.

Dux_k-4mziGuRC3m7d27ew.text: I drove far and wide to try this place. The reviews everywhere I looked seemed to be on fire and to be honest, breakfast is my jam. I feel like I ordered almost every breakfast item on the menu. I'm a small girl with a Man vs Food appetite when it comes to brunching. As expected everything was beyond delicious. They serve their homemade bread in it's own little dish, have you ever heard of anything so cute?  Everything was fresh, comfy seating, friendly staff and top notch delicious fluffy pancakes. If you don't love a good fluffy pancake then you must be a monster. Go to Jamms now. Go on. Calories don't count there, or at least that's what I tell myself.

ZdO8c1gIOGVxxL4Zvpm3xw.text: This is my favorite place for breakfast and all of the staff is pleasant and friendly. Shirley is one of the best waitresses we have had and love her energy and attitude. She makes the place feel like home.

MLc8oUgynrrGbtHCia0d3Q.text: Gr8 omelettes and other breakfast items.  Pancakes and waffles are good.   Lunch is less impressive.   Bread seems smothered in butter so ask for dry.  Service is efficient and friendly.  Gr8 coffee.  Good specials.

7NTBiWDQ9NidPWBawimlvQ.text: Delicious!!! We were in vegas and Friends that live there took us here for breakfast I want sure about it by it's looks but I loved it the ham was delicious and the pancakes everything I will definetly go back

czBU-uo1mjk9L79vRV2Iwg.text: Wow- so good! The service is wonderful. The menu has EVERYTHING for everyone - even a sample menu for those who want it all. The fresh corned beef hash is the best I ever tasted. Light and filled with meat and flavor. The biscuit and breads are fresh light. My friends omelets were "yummy and perfect". Oh And the coffee is great!!The Price is Right - Jamms is JAMMIN!!

QMlTu-g2n8BuW0X_pN7cZA.text: Literally my go to place for breakfast. Everything is always cooked to perfection & served with a smile. The place is so down to earth & relaxing which is pretty surprising for a small restaurant. It's cozy in a great way (:

CJTiHeA4XGFrIDJajvBDkA.text: We waited a long time to get a table, food was good, service was good and the people were nice.  Overall it was a average breakfast place.  We will go back.

5MPHkfIy0GwoLlOIHMu3Tw.text: Long overdue. I stopped by with my husband on September 4th. We were in Las Vegas celebrating our first Anniversary, traveling from Sacramento, Ca.  The food here is amazing. I had the homemade Chicken Soup and a turkey sausage burrito. My husband tried their pot bread and the crunchy french toast. The food was perfectly prepped and seasoned.  The atmosphere was loud but we knew it was because it was busy. Must be because its popular. Certainly interested in coming back if ever I am in the area again!

5iUbdbYKsdrDPKGltQPgXw.text: Very friendly and attentive staff. Had French toast combo that was great! Pot of bread was tasty!

t8D_JIrWI6OSdQ6zaQlxPg.text: I love this place! I have been going here for years. My father introduced me to this place. Expect a wait it's that good. Thankfully it is never too long of a wait. The employees are very friendly l. My niece and nephew can get messy sometimes during meals. We order the french toast sticks. This seemed like a good idea cause it's a finger food and they could dip them in syrup. Turned into a sticky mess. The waitresses were helpful and also brought the kids stuff to color. The food is extremely good and reasonably priced.

Ksz8ViS9O5VelIxxG97KBw.text: At first it's deceiving when you drive up but once you get inside it has a small diner feel to it. Expect to wait at least 15 to 20 minutes  for a table then 10 minutes more once you sit down to order because it is that popular and busy.  They have very tasty food and they are humongous portions. We ordered chicken fingers for the kids and the flavoring was really good and they we very crispy.  My husband ordered a bowl of their homemade chicken noodle soup and it was really good and the serving is over 2 cups. I ordered the French dip and it was super yummy, normal size but still yummy. This place has 2 very unique things you can do for a discount and a free item. If you check in on yelp, you can get their pot of bread and if you do get the cinnamon raisin bread, you won't regret it. To score a discount all you have to do is clean your plate. Sounds easy but it can be a challenge because of the huge portions. I highly recommend this place. A must eat in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge fries with homemade ranch
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Children chicken fingers with homemade ranch
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French dip

MmkEJPNDndza7wraasZqqw.text: Awful.    The wait was about an hour on a Sunday - which is actually perfectly fine with me.  Why?  1. You know that a breakfast place is good when there's a line and full tables 2. I'll wait for a good meal, no problem  Problem was - the service was horrendous -- and so was the food.  It took the waitress 15 minutes to get to our table after being seated to ask us for drinks.  After we put in our drink order, it took another 10 minutes for us to actually get our drinks.  We spent so much time looking around trying to flag someone down (just with looks as I despise the whole hand waving thing that people do).    When our drinks finally came, the waitress asked if we were ready to order.  As I ordered, she rushed me through any questions that I had.  For example, her question -- "wouldyoulikebreakfastpotatoeshashbrownsortoast"  She ran that sentence so quickly, I automatically "uhh....-ed" my reply.  When I said "breakfast pota----" she cut me off with a huff and replied, "it has onions and peppers and is stir fried."    Anyhow, she continued on being rude, abrasive and hasty.  But enough about the ordering fiasco.  When I got my "signature" omelet - the "signature" sauce was dabbled on.  I mean, it literally looked like the cook took a teaspoon of the sauce and drizzled it over the omelet and left it be.  I asked for extra sauce.  The extra sauce arrived.  It was disgusting.  It tasted like clumpy flour boiled in egg yolk.  The omelet itself was dry and overcooked.  The steak inside of it was bland, chewy and grey.  My fiance's eggs benedict.  Disgusting as well.  No other way to put it.    My niece ordered mac & cheese.  She said it was really dry and wanted to pour her milk in it.  Serious?  After our "meal" was over we paid our bill and walked on out.  The hostess tried to give us a discount of 15% for a future visit.  I politely told her she could keep it.

CS7lRZ7W2_QorQaLUDASyw.text: Good traditional breakfast the baked muffins are excellent and food portions are just right.

2zMxebBWoa6PVhM5Jg0dAw.text: We had great time and our waitress Shirley was outstanding. Thank you guys and we will back soon!!

1ple4FfzI9OQYsN3yXMY2g.text: so hard to decided what to order since everything looks good!   We shared a mini Sandy omelet and smores waffles.  Both were awesome but the omelet was to die for.... lots of bacon.  And we each had a pot of bread...I had the cinnamon apple....yum!!!

tVudW9tlQfn31LeHdjTNrg.text: I love breakfast food and I must admit, its hard to find a really good breakfast place. I came here with the bfriend and we ordered:  *Matty's Country Benedict:  2 biscuits at the bottom with 2 sausages and 2 perfectly poached eggs on top, covered with creamy light yummy gravy!  Also came with a choice of hash browns or fries. *Country Skillet: fluffy scrambled eggs with sausage pieces, diced sweet onions, shredded hams, sliced mushrooms, diced potatoes.. covered with their creamy gravy on top.  The service is two thumbs up-- quick and friendly. The waitress came back several times to ask if we needed anything and if everything was okay. I really enjoyed their breakfast and the gravy topped off everything perfectly. Loved it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Matty&#39;s Country Benedict: biscuit, sausages, poached eggs, topped with gravy. Came with choice of potatoes--hashbrowns.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Skillet: mushroom, potatoes, scramble eggs, onions, sausages--topped with gravy and a choice of bread--pot of bread).

MV_pH7f6HzBYlc0hsSEPFw.text: I really wasn't impressed. My husband and I stopped in on a Wednesday morning on a recent trip to Vegas, we were seated immediately by a friendly hostess. I was really excited to try it due to the great reviews, it's a way off the strip and wasn't worth the drive.   I had the Breakfast Combo thing with eggs, ham, sausage, bacon, and pancakes. The pancakes were doughy and not cooked through, the eggs were a spongy egg-replacement, and the rest was average.   My hubby had the Corned Beef Hash Eggs Benedict at the waiter's recommendation and it was really slimy and the English muffin basically drowned and dissolved in all of the sauce. His hashbrowns were greasy and left a lot to be desired.   We ordered the S'mores pancake to try it and it was just a pancake with chocolate chips and marshmallows sprinkled on top, it was gross. Our waiter didn't take it off our tab or bring us the cinnamon raisin pot of bread we ordered.   Not worth coming back, and no clue why it is so highly rated. Cost us $25+ so not cheap diner food either...

ChfNCDF_M0uc1QiunGG_Bg.text: Really good breakfast. I ordered the Hungry Lion breakfast and everything looked great. Service was great and our server was very friendly. Good atmosphere too.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiger Lily Omelet
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hungry Lion breakfast

51nyfLxK22TwUj15jtmnNQ.text: The servers are always so nice and welcoming and the food is awesome! I recommend the corned beef hash as it is the best I have ever had and the Sandy omelet makes my grandmother very happy!

Vp6G56tAtqhXp-hhvtCDIA.text: Loved their classic breakfast!! The old school hash brown and their cinnamon raisin pot of bread got me!

YXvGSI2rdenvdgITTNmMbA.text: Fantastic meal and the free pot bread for checking in on yelp is awesome. Will definitely be back to eat here soon. So many thing on the menu looked great. Today I had the biscuits and gravy with bacon. Everything was great!

GBNYruiZp_KK8YE4BPpfxA.text: Delicious food every time I go! Love the variety, so there is something for everyone. Large portions, which allows for leftovers. Very friendly staff. Go early, as there is usually a wait.

DraThs7Qkv2mdFbGdzIwmA.text: This morning's breakfast was a huge disappointment.  It was busy-but Jamm's is ALWAYS busy on the weekend.  I ordered my favorite-The Sandy omelette.  The omlette part was a bit skimpy & it was bursting with bacon (some slightly crispy, some slightly undercooked)-almost too much bacon but the avocados were PERFECTO! Perfectly ripe and huge luscious slices. Sadly my potatoes were undercooked and very greasy  : (  The Pot O bread was great as usual.    My hubby ordered the irish skillet.  He said it tasted "fine" but from my view it also looked undercooked in places and I was not even tempted to ask for a bite as I normally do.    I liked our waitress-we have had her a few times (I don't recall her name).  I asked about the potatoes.  She advised us to order extra crispy but did not offer to take them back... Maybe we could have had a small adjustment?    This is the closest place to where we live.  I think we will put our other places back in rotation for now.

zL5NjvnGkmzLSBX3CB7lGw.text: The girlfriend and I where in vegas for a small vacation, and while we where in town we wanted to get off the strip. So hit up some friends, and they said we had to try Jamms out. And so we did. Well worth it.   In a strip mall, and perfect size. Also very popular! So recommended times to show up, try around 8:30, after 9 you have a 15 min wait. which is well worth it. The decor is fun and light. The staff is incredibly nice, which was awesome. The menu has a lot to chose from, which can be hard to chose from. LOL.. I got the chicken freid steak, which was delicious, and the girlfriend got the multi grain pancakes, which where awesome, I had a few bites and was hooked. The second time we went there I ordered the jamms french toast, which is french toast covered in con flakes, it was awesome.. The girlfriend loved the multi grain pancakes so much, she got that again. Fresh coffee, and the staff was on top of refilling the cups non stop. Bottom line, its the local spot for breakfast. So if youre looking for a pretty cheap and quick breakfast, hit up Jamms!!!

9B1TZWDpfIJ_67ldwBIUvw.text: Come to this place all the time. Very delicious, great feeling, and amazing staff. Can't ask for more. My girlfriend loves the breakfast, and I love the lunch. Great place.

I_kbJZHp23IgkJWCKCjPbg.text: This was a pleasant surprise.  Kind of a drive from the north end of town, but totally worth it if you like a homey family diner kinda place.  Very family-friendly atmosphere.  It was a little while ago, but I remember the food was really good (and inexpensive!!) and in generous portions.  We were there for a weekend breakfast and I think we got a free pot of bread because we mentioned we found them on Yelp.

i0Qqhv7u55VzQNRi9DoOkg.text: I had the smores pancakes they were great. The orange juice tasted like orange juice from the stor

6KL3HshqqX3YhfV6yn7nkg.text: The service is always great, the food is very good. Eat here atleast once a week. I highly recommend Jamms.

-UcL2p7EeopeJI6KwOhDjw.text: The food was great ...once we sat down. Make sure your whole party is there when you request a table. If you say a table you better have 3 present or you have to wait until they get there before you get seated.  Frenchtoast was perfect, the best I had in a while. Eggs cooked to perfection and huge fluffy pancakes. The country fried steak was reminiscent of that served in my school cafeteria, terrible. Biscuits were perfect and the gravy was pretty good. I would go back but never have the country fried steak again.  Our waitress was great

qRT2S0lAclFBDwxLpzrDRg.text: One of the many things I love about Vegas is all the little breakfast places they have all around town. It's nice to know that I've got options if I don't want a Grand Slam breakfast from Dennys.   My husband and I came here for one of our Sunday breakfasts. I'm a fan of Corned Beef Hash so when I read Russ V's review on it I decided to give it a try. I liked this corn beef because it wasn't salty and I knew it was fresh because it didn't have the mushy consistency that canned corned beef has. My order came with scrambled eggs, and house fries with a side of sourdough bread. I'm a little weird when it comes to breakfast I usually will put the eggs and the corned beef hash on the toast. Once the toast runs out I save the rest and take it home. Corned beef on top of white rice is yummy! The portions are huge here so there is enough for like three small meals! I was also very full because before the meal came out we had the free Cinnamon Pot bread. Just mention Yelp and you too can get a free one! It was slightly salty on the top but once you get inside the bread it's nice and soft. It's tastes really good with coffee.   My husband had the Sandy Omelet that comes with bacon, tomato, avocado, sour cream and cheddar cheese. I sampled the omelet and it was really good too! It reminded me of the Cracked Egg's North Shore Scramble but in a Omelet.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sandy dollar
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Hash
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The free pot of bread that you get if you mention Yelp .

t_-S4EnrHmTsMDiL2g_zOw.text: Good breakfast. Sometimes a long wait and it's not soooo good that I would wait in that line again. But the pancakes were fluffy and the eggs were done the way I like. The waitress was attentive and pleasant. The price was fair.

zd42T51EFvk5PjrqCbLPHQ.text: I plan on coming here for almost every special breakfast meal. The food is always good, the service is always good, and I haven't been here and become disappointed. It's an old fashioned little joint where their main interest is being the best service possible. I ordered the French Toast sandwich and was amazed at the quality of the Jamm's signature french toast! On top of that, I never had to ask for coffee. And the best thing about this entire place is that it's relatively the same price as Ihop or Denny's.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L2RfpQQf99TT0bumFh62Gg.text: Amazing had the sandys omelette, french press coffee, and sweet potato fries. Friendly great service and delicious food...large servings at a reasonable price. Definitely will return!

wSVp-nTTol0MCNY2MIoHUA.text: Food was very good. Nice quiet atmosphere. Staff were extremely friendly. Hidden gem off the strip.

pTZ1Zm0aTeckpsEqeIhOaQ.text: This place made my stomach happy:) Good service and generous portions. I will be back for my breakfast fix. Yum

UEYqEhk0h27wN76rh_2vRA.text: Great food! Excellent service. The pot of bread mmm.mmmm.a great way to support locals.

O91AFQg4RBIehwBD7ApHOg.text: When you go to Jamms it's like going home to family and friends. Great food like hot chicken fingers and fries for the teenagers who have been coming since before they we're born 19 years plus a few before for myself. Have seen people come and go but the food is still the same.

2TCmw0J_ZLYpzGIlsHgLMg.text: horrible!  sat at the counter, hoping to get quick service, man was I wrong! nearly 10 minutes before server stop to acknowledge... simple breakfasts order placed: coffee, eggs, hash browns, toast: 20 minutes later received cold/old coffee, burnt eggs, and not fully cooked hash browns... finished meal, and ready to go, but had to wait nearly 20 minutes for the check!

8yU9efLe1VWT6J3U0_Sb8A.text: This place hands down is the very best breakfast place I have ever ate at in my life! It's so fresh and delicious! This place 100% deserves all the over a thousand 5 stars! Keep up the great customer service, amazing fresh food, and overall amazing experience!

l-8ktgOvzoeXN2VvWIbDgA.text: This place has some of the best food we have eaten in a long time!! Excellent tasting, excellent pricing and great service!

xCcwLV-kFqwI7ot35-7A8g.text: Love this place for breakfast. Sunday mornings there is always a wait to get in.  The wait staff couldn't be more accommodating. All the food is great. Especially love that this place has real hash browns and not the "breakfast potatoes" that so many places have.

PEHhv-BGvHO8YLxevW9dGQ.text: Great food and great staff! The menu had just the right ratio of traditional and unique. I went there with my bf and they were slammed but still seated us almost immediately, and also got our orders and brought our food out in a timely manner. We had the stuffed French toast and the Irish skillet and they were delicious! I would recommend this place for breakfast to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WGsB68IDgUVpq531JP8POg.text: First time here Their complimentary Pot Raisin Cinnamon Bread with Cream Cheese spread a great way to start off a meal. Simply said one of the best breakfast places in all Las Vegas. And for you coffeeholics their coffee is Excellent. Thank you for the great food, great service, great experience. I am a big fan!! after just one visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qw9-Uws5JGCw5kKDmEMXVg.text: One of the best diners.  Great food and service.  Best coffee cups     Went again this past weekend.  Food for me just average. My partner loved her omelet

8PuJ49-QinZFyD-xpsXLNA.text: Love the people and the food. This is one of my favorite places to get breakfast. The pots of bread are my favorite. So yummy.

MTFhS1f5NBW6wDgv9HSUhA.text: Still awesome! We come here every time we visit Vegas. I encourage you to also!! Pot Of Bread alllll day baby!!

wuP01Z2xlxkYqgukN7NZFw.text: Best breakfast in Las Vegas!! Reasonable prices and great coffee. My son had the s'mores pancakes and they were incredible.

GVuPziYSPxSCdBqPSni2fg.text: I can't believe in the years I've been coming here I have never reviewed Jamm's. This spot has been voted Best of LV numerous times and for great reason. I have never had anything here except breakfast, regardless of the time of day. Their Irish Skillet is to die for, potatoes, corn beef, bell peppers, eggs and cheese. It's definitely my go to meal. I've also had the Jamm's French toast (coated in crunched corn flakes) and a few of their breakfast sandwiches. I have never been disappointed and will always come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish Skillet

A-sJLcCuGJP8zLd-WC6z_A.text: Food was okay, but service was great! Really friendly and chill environment. I got the signature omelet with a side of potatoes. It just didn't taste as good as it looked honestly. It wasn't terrible, but I just don't think I'll be back!

EDp4lmZZ5Fo2DA_CvhPEsw.text: A diamond in the ruff.. My husband actually found this place on yelp. It's very close to the house so we decided to check it out. I am so glad we did not only does this place have a cute atmosphere but it also has amazing food. The service is impeccable and everyone is so nice and always smiling. When you first walk in you can smell the yummy goodness of the pot of bread cooking and your senses come alive. It's not a very big place and there's usually a line but it moves pretty quick. I suggest if there is a line waiting because you won't be disappointed with the food. Most everything they have is great and I've tried quite a few of their items on the menu. But their signature items are a must try as well. The jamms French toast which is dipped in cornflakes is my absolute favorite. You also have to try the pot of bread!!!  They have the  cinnamon pot of bread With cream cheese icing and they also have seasonal flavors which no matter what you have to try those as well. This has become one of our favorite breakfast places . They're open from 7 AM to 3 PM every day as it's just breakfast and lunch. So if you haven't tried this place you must go by and try the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamms French toast
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TuP7Mk1DYuk2rJnwmxNI_A.text: Best breakfast in town! Best bread too! I had the Denver omelet and the creamy strawberry pot of bread, which was the special weekly flavor. So good can't wait to go back

UCZyAO6lSwmV_gjqSG9t3w.text: Yummy food! My go to breakfast spot every time! Always go with the Jamms French toast, delicious and Quick service!

DJrW_vwBQ4nNuG0w7jzeuQ.text: We ate there as a family last Sunday. The reviews looked good but our food was just ok. Husband ordered their egg/bacon/pancake special and asked for 3 eggs and both the bacon and the sausage even if extra. She brought out 1 and 1 and 2 eggs. My husband asked about the eggs and said he wanted 2 bacon and 2 sausages and I said it's ok if it's extra  and the waitress told him 3 times that he didn't order that. Why sit there and debate what she heard or understood. Just say ok and add it. That was a big turn off. My daughter ordered chicken and waffles and it was a joke. It came with 2 chicken nuiget looking strips straight out of some box. We've had chicken and waffles at Rocco's and Metro and this was a joke. The pancakes, french toast and grits were fine. We saw some sandwich orders come out and maybe that's their forte because they looked better than what we had

3SIcNpeFwf-JW-_xiaUAtg.text: Been awhile...but as always perfect!!! Thank you Sandy for great fast friendly service  This place is a hidden jam in Las Vegas  Must recognize the bussers...super on point be back soon

hpX3de_uCKTorJT1IUTCgw.text: Jamms was poppin' when we came in! My friends and I made a pit-stop here for breakfast on our way to LA. We were able to get a table about 15 minutes after getting there, and the food simply hit the spot. Great prices here, as it's a small fam restaurant. Our server was a bit all over the place, but she was great considering it was so stinkin' busy.   If you're using Yelp, don't forget to get your free pot of bread! It's so worth it.

wAQr8dwQ-u0tbyBNR84zqQ.text: We just moved down the street and tried this place for the first time. It does have a homey diner feel. Maybe it's what we ordered, but we will not be returning any time soon.  3 stars: The prices are reasonable. The place was clean. The staff was friendly and attentive.  Where they really disappointed was the food. I ordered a Belgian waffle combo, eggs and sausage. The eggs were sad (overcooked and lifeless), sausage was ok, and the waffle was cold and tough. My husband ordered the chicken fried steak, it came with country potatoes and eggs. He said it was just ok but the sausage gravy, that makes the dish, was no good.  I know they ask if everything is good, but how could I say we didn't really enjoy any of it? Normally I do speak up, but when you just don't like their food, it really can't be fixed. We were hungry, so we politely nodded and ate.

5e1VyYmRDjEpC1bctogM8g.text: This is such an amazing breakfast restaurant! It's a very homey, everyone knows your name kind of place which I love. Everyone is friendly and the menu is pretty extensive. They have so much to choose from!  Their omelettes are huge and they really stuff them. A lot of their menu items come with their pot of bread too, which they have different flavors in all the time. That had strawberry Nutella when I went and it sounded (and was) amazing.  I ordered the California Benedict with hash browns and it was a great amount of food and super tasty. It had turkey and avocado which drew me in.  I'd definitely recommend coming here! It's a small place near Albertsons. It's usually busy so be prepared - but it's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California Benedict
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread

qM4sQJNhlsauwIYxSkDgAw.text: This is a cute little breakfast place that I decided to take my mom to before work. We took a look at the menu and there weren't too many options but luckily we weren't looking for anything extravagant.   My mom ordered a short stack and I ordered a corn beef skillet with a side of a pot of bread. The pot of bread came out first, which was perfect since I was a bit hungry. It was a nice filler for the wait for our food.   Our food came out and it looked good! Only thing I would say about my skillet was that it was a little salty? But I assumed that come from the saltiness of the corned beef. I did notice the potatoes were a bit over seasoned so it could be from that. My mom was satisfied with her short stack but it's kind of hard to mess that up!   All in all, Jamms is a good place for a quick breakfast with a friend or family member. Make sure to get a pot of bread you'll be pleasantly filled!

fkC0rPeIz58T3fEqqazXIQ.text: It was our first time and we were served by Shirley. She was so bubbly, knowledgeable and provided a good service. Her busser was also very attentive I apologized  I didn't get his name. They don't wear a name plate but it was a good 1st time experience. It made us feel almost at home.  We ordered steak and eggs, pancake combo and for a check in with Yelp you get a free pot of bread. We chose the orange marshmallow one it was sweet, tangy and soft. It was delicious. They are known for their pot of bread too!  We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their signature mug
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EIrirI_wmr8XDO_ZxrrYEg.text: Cool diner, we got seated pretty quickly for a Sunday morning! Service was great, the French toast was perfectly crispy, and I liked the idea of chilaquiles, but it was way too saucy, so the tortilla chips were just mush. However my family loved the Reuben Benedict and the Reuben sandwich. I had a bite and it was pretty tasty! Fries were also good.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles &amp; Jamms French Toast

dF0DRCxv1RgeF33R_NEhJw.text: When in doubt about where to eat in a new city, just ask a local! The woman who helped us out at Triple AAA, sent us here. She said locals travel from all over to eat at this restaurant. They have something special called "Pot of Bread." It is an individual size pot with fresh bread baked special everyday. I tried the Chocolate and Carmel bread. This comes with the salads. It was so tasty and good! I also had  cabbage soup and a half Turkey sandwich. It was cold in the restaurant, the soup warmed me up and was delicious. The Turkey sandwich with sourdough bread was also good. It hit the spot for a light lunch. My husband had Chefs Salad with ham, turkey and cheese. He enjoyed it.   While your eating music from the 60's is jamming in the background. It was fun to hear songs like Wendy, Downtown and Mana Cats. Service was excellent. We will definitely return here on our next trip to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate and Carmel Bread
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cabbage Soup and half Turkey Sandwich

5CZqv5oeci-v0FUMHMoe3g.text: I came here one Saturday with my husband and son. We got sat right away, no wait at all. The server was really nice and super friendly. The food was just okay nothing special, the pot of bread was the best part of the meal! I had the Tomato and mozzarella pot of bread  and it was delicious!

D1B0lVWzMDpwYWywXL_l6g.text: Great place to grab a bite. The whole staff is on top of it. The food as usual is fresh, tasty and quite satisfying !

HCJWf2afHwDYtSpzg6Lu0Q.text: We went for breakfast this AM.   Pot bread=SO freaking good.    Service=Excellent! My husband ordered an omelette which he felt was just okay(ingredients weren't all mixed together like he prefers). I had a bacon avocado skillet which was pretty good but had too many potatoes. I don't know if we would make it a huge point to drive across town to go, but would likely return if in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon raisin pot bread
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet

6EXrMiyJNnASL2vp67-MYg.text: I now make it to Jamms at least twice a month as I have found a real appreciation for their home style breakfast, wonderful service, and delicious pot o bread.  Jamms is a very solid diner and offers more character and unique offerings than the 'egg' restaurants out there.  Better coffee too :).

HcUwXdkezpuD6o6oJ3gh0Q.text: I was in the area and happened to see this spot with their "best of Las Vegas" awards painted on the window, and saw the good reviews, so decided to give it a try.   I ordered the chicken blt waffle sandwich.  When it arrived, the waffles were room temp and a bit soggy/limp. The inside consisted of two previously frozen processed chicken strips; they were lukewarm.  The lettuce, tomato, and bacon tasted good, but the thin, processed chicken was too much of a detractor.    The Jamms salad on the side was very good!  Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing, but a restaurant with this high of a rating shouldn't be serving the cheapest-available processed and shaped chicken strips.  I will also add that all of the staff was very friendly and attentive!  They're the only reason why I didn't give Jamms a lower rating.

J2IPFIl36ctk92Iag93wbg.text: One of the best breakfasts I have had in Las Vegas! Jamms has awesome food selections and the nicest staff I've encountered in LV. The portions are huge, so come with an appetite. We had the green waffles sandwich and the Irish omelet-both were amazing! I highly recommend coming here instead of one the chains we have in LV, you won't regret it.

2BQKZmMHO0vf1l2foXyrjg.text: Was looking for a nearby brunch place before I went to donate blood at Vitalant (three blocks away). This place had good reviews so I decided to check it out. I checked in and got a free pot of bread. I ordered the cinnamon raisin and it was delish! For the main dish, I ordered the Jamms french toast with eggs and bacon. Their french toast contains cornflakes which was cool and gives a crunchy consistency. It was pretty good, but I think I prefer the original kind that has cinnamon.  Service was good - the waitress was friendly and attentive, as well as the bussers.  The best part about this restaurant is their pot of bread!

zkluDlwDXb9FjmNdgwClzg.text: Oh. My. Gosh. Literally the best breakfast I've had in YEARS. We found this place on the Yelp app because we were sightseeing Vegas in the morning and it was worth the 20 minute drive to get here for a real breakfast. My heart flipped over When I saw the Texas omelette; chili and cheese omelette with hashbrowns. #MyFavoriteBreakfastEver The coffee is good and comes in really big hearty mugs. Service was old-school efficient and friendly by a lady who reminded me of Flo from that old show Alice (I mean that in the sweetest way!!) The bus boy kept us with hot coffee  and Cold water and cleared our plates quickly. We made friends with two tables around us, even. Mom loved her "pot of bread" cinnamon raisin bread.

The roll was a sweet brioche/challah type that took away the taste of the rest of the sandwich.  The Taylor ham was sliced much too thin to appreciate the taste of this New Jersey gem. On a high point, now I know where I can get REAL HOMEFRIES!!! I'll continue coming to Jamms, but the Taylor Ham has to be improved.

ev25GoSL8Drz7-fI5UWrhg.text: We stumbled into this place after being in Vegas for over 10 years.  Our server was Shirley and she was a delight! We order pretty much everything we could off the menu. The French toast and waffles were so light and fluffy with the right amount of crunchiness.  The pot of bread was the real deal! So warm and moist with a slight dusting of cinnamon. I had the breakfast meats and they were cooked well and weren't too salty. I highly recommend this place if you're sick of they typical breakfast fare.

-zgiwJADFR1yphDt0g1TFQ.text: Food is amazing! Large portions for a reasonable price! Staff is extremely fast, attentive,& sweet

Eahasx1pTzF5d_KQ3wp7Eg.text: The sweet potato fries at Jamms are probably the best I've ever had! I wanted to come back the next day and the next day and the next day just to get an order of those delicious fries. The cheeseburger was just as good. I began to describe this place as old-fashioned until Shirley (long time waitress) quickly corrected me and said "Please don't say OLD, just say it was your parents favorite spot and their parents as well." It's a breakfast and/or lunch place so they close early. Definitely coming back!

G7b8Rv0KzyRcp7I37gLwcQ.text: My husband and I came here because of seeing the Man finds food episode in vegas. The Jamminator sounded too good to be True!!: French toast fried brioche bun, pastrami, sauerkraut, cheese, omelette patty! The result was something that I don't think was made with any love. The meat was skimpy and so was the sauerkraut. I was very underwhelmed.  Everyone is raving about the pot of bread, which I got for free for checkin in, it was good but not amazing. Should've been served warm, ours was cold.  Our service was good, the waitress was fast and attentive.   I don't see myself coming back but it was worth a try!

6piZdPttMBWYf90Oc3mKKA.text: Fabulous, everything we have ordered has been great. Friendly staff. The pot of bread fabulous

LhekqV4_MycITKl-i_bGIA.text: I'm not usually disappointed with restaurants, but after continuous rave reviews and legends of the Pot of Bread, I think I expected a little more than meh.   I went into Jamms with an open mind and was immediately struck by the prices. Over $2 for hollandaise? $2.75 for coffee? Almost all entrees at least $10? Jamms at least makes it up to you by providing a large portion for every full size meal you order. However, on a light wallet, I decided to stick to their small plates menu, which was actually quite a good value.   For $4, I got half of a Smores waffle, complete with honey, chocolate chips, and marshmallows. The toppings were great: it's hard to screw up chocolate and marshmallows, after all. However, the waffle was shockingly stale. Every bite I took, it seemed as if it was getting harder and harder to chew, until eventually, I was having a hard time even cutting the waffle into pieces. Luckily, the chocolate and honey masked the almost tasteless and stale waffle. Still: not a good sign.  Next, for $5, I chose the option of the Reuben Benedict, a supposed fan favorite take on the typical eggs benedict. It was your typical benedict, with an english muffin, an egg, and hollandaise. This version, however, replaced the Canadian bacon with some corned beef. (Thank god: I eventually tried the normal egg benedict, and the ham was chewy and cold.) For a signature menu item, it fell flat. The english muffin had a strange rancid taste, and the corned beef was lacking in both amount and flavor. While the Canadian bacon might have a worse taste, it at least was a better value!  My girlfriend had the Bananas Foster pancakes, and while I personally didn't try them, she commented on the poor quality bananas and insisted that the IHOP version was superior.  Finally, my ultimate disappointment was in the $1.95 Pot of Bread. This is the thing Jamms is known for. It's the thing I was excited for, and the thing I had heard so much about from my companions. And, unfortunately, it was the thing that sucked the most. I ended up with the cinnamon raisin pot, but the expanded bread on top was stale and difficult to eat. For such a small pot, I was amazed at the struggle. It simply tasted old, and I wondered how long it had been sitting in the kitchen. The only "soft" part was at the very bottom, and there surely wasn't much to go around. The cinnamon doesn't add much, but I shudder to think of how it tasted without it. I also tried some of the peppermint Pot of Bread, and while it was remarkably better, it may have been because of the outlandish amount of frosting coated on the bread. The Pot of Bread may have been the worst $2 I've spent all month, and, quite frankly, the free bread at Outback has far more flavor and is actually consumable.   Jamms was a fun attempt at trying something new, but breakfast foods can be hard to get right, especially with such a limited menu. The service was great, but I had hoped for a bit more. Instead, I left wishing I had gone to Denny's.

kNEWUJWVzroaWkW3SkTQ5w.text: Having Awesome Food with Mom at Jamms (my new favorite Breakfast place) Chicken and Waffle BLT. Sooooo Good!!! and the service Rocks SHAY went above and beyond

0s_A54GwIiQ4cO5lpVuNsg.text: I've been coming here for 10 years now. I'm not the biggest fan of breakfast but Jamms is the place to be. They always have  great service and great food. They are small and always have a line but it goes by fast and it's worth the wait !

ALqWVRDXPGphUPe4WM7Q6A.text: So I  heard about this place and had to try it. Great food and attitudes from everyone made the atmosphere amazing. Pot O' bread was awesome. Recommending to friends.

Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reeses peanut butter cup Pot O&#39; bread. This weeks special flavor. Yum!

QdnOFCiYnyHLRA1YnHQzlg.text: I wrote a review about a month and a half ago for this restaurant. We had a disappointing experience. The Owner of the restaurant read my review and wasn't happy, so she invited us back for complimentary lunch or breakfast to try and make up for the experience I had. That is excellent customer service and really shows they care about the experience of their customers.   We came back and the experience was better. We both ordered something different this time. I had the Wild West Burger and she had the French Toast. The burger was cooked as I liked it at. The chili that came with it was good. I tried the french toast and it was cooked great!  Here's what I've found in my two experiences here: They have a wonderful staff who are friendly and seem dedicated to customer service. The food is cooked very well. Everything is cooked exactly how it should be. But my problem is the food does not wow me. There isn't any thing unique or special about it. The food isn't bad, it's just not something worth 4 or 5 stars.

U5JPaOmiH4tKk_edITk7Ww.text: Visited here on my first time in Vegas. I am still so grateful my friend showed me this gem.   You really feel the love in this place! I still dream of pots of bread. Just like having a home cooked meal with your grandparents. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle!

LLEvblH8l4VYlAlfpTGHVg.text: First and foremost, the staff here is just delightful! They have a regular crowd, everybody knows each others names, it's really welcoming. They're always very friendly, even when busy, and they take care of you as if you were family.  I've been here a handful of times as it's close to campus and I focus better in class when I'm happily stuffed. I've gotten breakfast all but one time in which I ordered the French Onion Soup and a salad and it was a total miss!  The French Onion Soup has a light broth with way too much thyme in it. The bread was a cheap generic white bread, so it got sort of slimy once it soaked up the broth. The onions were a thick slice and were not meltingly soft. The salad which was Jamms House Salad was a cabbage salad with an "Asian" dressing. By cabbage salad, I mean, chopped green cabbage. That's it. The dressing itself was alright with some sesame oil and rice wine vinegar, but it was too heavy on the sugar.  That being said, the only thing I've eaten here for breakfast is omelets! The reason? Simple: The cheese. Oh my goodness, the cheese!! The omelets here are delicious but they definitely cheat by adding A LOT of cheese, which I'm a total sucker for. I usually eat healthy breakfasts, but the cheesy omelets here do me in every time. So much cheese you have to chew it well. It's glorious! The Margie is my favorite omelet they have. It comes stuffed with mushrooms, tomatoes and artichoke hearts. Sometimes I add green peppers, sometimes I add spinach, but I always get egg whites which is a slight up charge ($1). They saute the vegetables before putting them in the omelets, so the tomato gets a little cooked which I love. It comes with your choice of potato (fries, hashbrowns, home fries) and bread.  Their bread selection is unique in that they offer a "pot of bread." If you like dinner rolls, you'll love this. Their pots of bread are really soft, pillowy, yeasty white breads. They offer seasonal flavors (I once had a divine raspberry and lemon), white, and cinnamon. Or you can get toast of course. I usually get fruit instead of potatoes and no toast or bread (at an up charge $3). The fruit here is always a medley of melon.  Great service, and amaaaazing gooey cheesy omelets! Coffee is decent.. just decent.

t3SeNL_tBCLMHU7QThKESw.text: Breakfast is my favorite meal and I have lived in Vegas a long time now and have yet to visit this spot until recently. The pot of bread is delicious. My omelette was stuff full with huge pieces of broccoli. Would have liked a lil less cheese in it but it's easy to eat around it. Coffee was good for a breakfast spot and the server was very attentive.

LcDHRjXBKo_S7Pe9ceh53w.text: Wow - just noticed the last time i reviewed this place was in 2008 !!! I'm guessing i've been to JAMMS at least 10 times since then.  I'm also guessing the exact same employees work there now since i first tried JAMMS in 2008.  As the gf and I walked in we debated whether or not the place was freshened up with new paint - i generally don't look at decor but given our upcoming move to a new house and being bombarded by all the design/decor ideas coming from the gf for the new house, i've suddenly taken a closer look.  As usual, the service is spot on - water and coffee at our table within a minute, Flo taking our order within minutes and the food served within minutes ... honest !   Gf standard breakfast - veggie omelet - no seasoning, no oil , packed with 4-6 veggies, and of course, egg whites - given the large number of veggies, her food usually costs between $12-$15 at the various breakfast places we visit.  Surprisingly, no extra charge for the garden of veggies that the gf requested - but a $1.50 upcharge for the fruit side.  I believe her omelet cost $10.  She proclaims JAMMS is the only breakfast spot that consistently prepares her omelet correctly.  My ham and cheese omelet ?  All good - i like that they put the cheese on top the omelet AND inside the omelet.    IF we lived closer to JAMMS ( and with the upcoming move, we will ) I suspect this will be one of our top breakfast spots.  pics included

x42NSOVO9hE6jAczVrzNBg.text: We searched YELP for a good neighborhood breakfast spot and decided to try JAMMS which is about a 15 drive from the Strip but worth the drive. If you don't have access to a car consider renting one to drive to this gem. The "pot of bread"  (preferably flavored) with the honey butter is mandatory eating. My wife and I both had the make your own omelette ($9.99) which comes with a "pot of bread" and choice of potatoes. (Consider a little basket of sweet potato fries if you want something different than hash browns.) I planned on attaching pics of the food, but after one taste it was gone before I remembered that I wanted to take pics. Don't tell anyone about this place otherwise it will likely he too crowded as more people venture to this prized breakfast location.

xWdTXi1aBspUtv6HIeVC8Q.text: My husband and I look for a few things when we go out: friendly service , drinks refilled and nicely portioned great tasting food.  We definitely found all of these at Jamms! My Jamm's steak omelet was very tasty with fluffy eggs and the home fries were seasoned well and didn't skimp on the portion. My husband's chicken fried steak, home fries and 3 eggs over easy were equally as delicious.  The cinnamon raisin pot of bread was tasty and tender. His ice tea and my coffee were never empty. Our wait time was nil as we were seated as soon as we arrived at 10:30 on a Wed. We will definitely be going back as there are many more dishes we want to try.

hUR6ILsHPz7GfaKpt4qVIw.text: Wasn't bad service. The pot bread was delicious but they messed up on my order. I asked for no tomatoes in my breakfast burrito but it came with a lot and the egg Benedict was just basically a hard boiled egg.

0QoaP19gwR_592BWm5jYNg.text: 1st time here.   Won't be the last.   Awesome food    Breakfast or lunch    It's the bomb.

J4M9QB8mH8QZsduTf-dV6Q.text: Good place to eat, food is delicious, staff is amazing, will definitely comeback again

upoX38LzlJ4lc_iY0dnXpw.text: I have been to this hole in the wall several times now and I am always pleased and satisfied with what I choose. First let me mention there are a ton of options so it may take you awhile to choose. Also the portions are large-size so come with an appetite or be prepared to take leftovers. I was please to find they added tapas portions, smaller plate styles at half the cost.      This particular time I got the Rueben omelette (corned beef,sauerkraut, and Swiss cheese.) The tender corned beef really went well with the tangy sweetness of the sauerkraut. Also I got the pot of bread (cinnamon and raisin with side of cream cheese icing) yummy! They did come out with a pistachio pot of bread I'm dieing to try. When you check in on yelp they give you a free pot of bread but they said they were out of pistachio which is odd because they offered it to the table next to us so I don't know. Nonetheless my meal was great.     Now my boyfriend ordered the steak and eggs. I warned him about ordering steak at a place that doesn't really specialize in that bc you can't expect much from a small breakfast joint but he took the risk lol. Of course I was right the steak looked like a chewed up oversized piece of bacon. He said it was tough, chewey, and tasted kind of like an old belt. However the scrambled eggs were plain and to be expected. The pancakes were really good and fluffy.     Overall everything was great on my behalf and you cant beat the cost we spent under $30. Word of advice stick with breakfast it's what they are known for and don't order the steak.....obviously.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grits with butter and salt
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rueben omelette, steak and eggs, side of pancakes
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon and raisin pot of bread

ucLvmtTR3xI3y_1Mtea1cQ.text: Trying out a new breakfast spot in town was a good choice. Although this is in a shady neighborhood, don't judge a book by it's cover. What's inside is what counts. There was a short wait but as we were there I notice the wait got longer and there was a steady flow of customers coming in. I also noticed waitresses that spoke to customers by name, telling me there are regulars here. Those were all good signs to start.   I got the veggie omelette which is my go to breakfast item of choice. This omelette really impressed me with large chunks of vegetables. They also cooked the onion and bell pepper prior to putting it in the omelette. I really liked this extra step and appreciated it. Having ordered this at many different restaurants, I can say that this was above the rest when it comes to giving me some actual veggies I can see in my omelette. Other places it is just tiny chopped pieces of veggies with no veggie taste. I also really enjoyed the hash browns. The bread that came with it I was not that impressed with. It was kind of dry and bland. We had the cinnamon.   We also ordered red velvet pancakes to compare to others we have had, and these were different. They were huge, really thick and fluffy, and a little on the "less sweet" side which is a good or bad thing, depending on what you want.   Service was good and quick. I think this is a good choice for a simple all American breakfast.

a253grccr1mAlEQRf-hZzQ.text: We were here with family.  Great service.  The food was okay,  average = 3 stars.  I had the Canadian bacon, eggs, and home fries.  I was hungry so I ate it.  Nothing that I'd need to pass up a Dennys or an Ihop to  try again.

d0yqVAdUJZsqRyoQWiGCGA.text: Great little place! The food was good and the grits especially were awesome! We also got the chocolate strawberry pot of bread, yummm!

lNLbFv70eFZH2Ste6t0PYw.text: Great food: Love the corn beef hash for breakfast. Always as for extra buttery hash browns and they come out delicious. Service is quick and friendly. Tip: wait after 1pm to eat here as the big breakfast rush is over and I get seated very quickly.

Y3r0PHWMNWF2eddarz7jcw.text: I just don't have anything to rave about or to recommend. The food was below average, it is just a locals regular breakfast spot. The advertised pot of bread was under-cooked and tasteless. The veggie omelette was watery. The coffee was bitter and watered down. Not what I had in mind after reading the reviews.  The waitress was very sweet but her service did not continue to the front of the restaurant. The cashier was not polite. She refused to give me a receipt that showed paid for my cash transaction. I do not think this is standard practice of restaurant sales. Why would she not be able to give me a receipt showing paid in cash? Is there a reason why this specific restaurant cannot provide a customer with a paid receipt? I was not content with their overall experience.  For the price and the reviews ... I expected more.  Will not return nor recommend.

pyO5ISViFlQAaWpWORHVrA.text: A favorite go to for breakfast and lunch!! Amazing omlettes and the signature french toast is to die for!! Of and if you love a great ruben sandwich...this is the place. Server, SHIRLEY is such a sweetheart and always has a smile on her face!!

BWRIkazapsHHbrdA7VZrLg.text: Great breakfast spot. Diner style with great options and great service. The potted bread is a must have.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ylWZpYTzJl6Amo3MqdM9OQ.text: So good you have to try the bread it's to die for and the breakfast Omelette Coke with bread and my favorite powder sweet potato fries

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries with powder sugar so healthy and Jamms omelette
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best bread

JaTWysUErbyfdz2sev-2ZQ.text: The service is always wonderful. We were promptly greeted at the door and shown to our seats. Just as we were sitting they came to take our drink order. Our waitress Sandy came by not to long after we received our drinks to take our order.   We were there early so it wasn't quite as packed as it usually is on a Sunday. I loved seeing those with their football jerseys on. The new paint on the door and Windows is fabulous I love Frankenstein.   My husband had the California Benedict with home fries. It was beautiful to look at. He said it was glorious. It had a fresh taste but was also rich with their hollandaise sauce that he loves so much. The tomato and avocado were perfectly ripe. I had my usual French toast combo. The bacon was extra crisp exactly how I like it. They have a Jamms French toast or a traditional both are good options but I do prefer the traditional. My eggs were over medium, which is what I asked for. We also shared their weekly pot of bread this week it was pineapple pumpkin. My husband  greatly enjoyed the pot of bread, but it was my favorite but that's the joy of having a different flavors to try every week.   We love that they offer discounts of you check in on social media or yelp. Our waitress was very attentive throughout the entire meal and we were very satisfied with our experience there as always.

03baku5k-3a3IdCWQ7XnRw.text: This was my first stop at Jamms. The chicken fried steak was very good and the eggs were perfectly cooked over medium. I enjoyed the chipotle cheddar pot of bread too. The service was great and the coffee cups are BIG. Only really need one cup that way. Thanks Jamms for a great breakfast.

lntfXad8nRaL14n_j8aeaA.text: Always a great breakfast spot. Pot of bread is delicious and the flavors are different every visit. Super nice service and friendly faces.

C79PXL08du7siX_HUMvTIA.text: The Little Foodie and me were finally up early enough to eat Breakfast!    When we arrived, I figured I would go with the tried and True breakfast classics, but I was told about the brand new Chicken & Waffles!  Seriously, the day I went I was told they were added to the menu...so how could I pass that up??  Well I should have done that...passed them up.  Chicken and Waffles ($10). This was very disappointing! The waffle was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. There were only two pieces of what seemed like frozen chicken fingers, overcooked and bland. Pass!   Yes, I know they aren't a Soul Food kind of place, so my expectations weren't too high, but looking at all the other positive reviews, as well as all the personal recommendations (the reason I was there in the first place), I was underwhelmed.  I'm sure I will be back to try the traditional breakfast items, and I foresee a much more positive visit than the last.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles ($10). This was very disappointing!  Two pieces of frozen tasting chicken fingers, overcooked and bland :(
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon Raisin Pot of Bread...check in bonus! It was good, light and fluffy bread with just the right amount of seasoning.

nLlLpq0mV-dL87g3Q6D3nA.text: This is my breakfast place of choice.  I love the food.  They have these French toast stick fries and they are awesome.  The service has always been good and never been disappointed any time I have ever been here.   A few times it has been busy but the staff seamed to get everyone fed and happy in no time.  I would recommend this place to anyone who likes good food.

TKGMqj3_8RK5CC-YcL439A.text: The food is great but not friendly service.  These ladies are on a mission....and you better know what the outcome want the second they ask or they yell I"'l'll be back!"  Ten minutes later!  They actually told us we needed to hurry eating.....people were waiting and they needed our table!"  They close at 3 p.m and at 2:45 pm they tell you to pay the bill!   These ladies want the hell out of there!  Good great!  Service....desperately need waitresses with friendlier better attitudes!

U2v5vrxItMjs0RuIALmZmA.text: Went in to this place today for a late lunch with family members. It was super busy but that doesn't stop us from being seated promptly. It also didn't impact the service! We were treated kindly, respectfully, and promptly.  As a vegetarian Jamms let me subsitute vegetables for meat ingredients at no extra charge.  We all ordered different types of food. I ordered breakfast and some of my family members ordered lunch entrees. The portions were enormous!!! I noted that I would take a to go box for my omelette I would be able to eat off of for the next couple of days :-)  All servers and workers make patrons feel as though they are " regular" customers.  They also give a small discount if you post on social media which shows they are in touch with the social media aspect of our culture.  If you are looking for a casual, cool place to eat that has a down home feeling , I would highly recommend this place! Definitely will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. As a vegetarian Jamms let me subsitute vegetables for meat ingredients at no extra charge. Plus, portions are huge!

Bh9bQwCEYZrQD-bBPn2FTA.text: Average at best.  We were "welcomed" in by the hostess whose only words were "For two?" ...yes. Seats us at our table, sets the menus down and walks away. So much for that welcome.  Our server was the best part of our experience. I believe her name was Sandy. She, unlike the hostess, was very welcoming, friendly and answered all of our questions as first time guests. Our food (including gratis Pots of Bread) was brought out promptly, so we appreciated that.  My Waffle Benedict meal was a 3/5.  Pepper flavor of the home fries was a little overpowering. Waffle was light and fluffy, Hollandaise was creamy and flavorful. But the Canadian bacon was way too thick for a Benedict. It was like chewing on a piece of leather. In my humble opinion, Kailyn's Kitchen still wins for best Benny in town. In addition, I have to add that I was not offered a refill of coffee until our check came. Big deal. They would've scored those points back had they provided a restaurant-style thermos with more coffee at the table, if they're too busy to check up on us...come on, even IHOP does that. Yes, I went there.  We were passed with the check and thanked by Sandy. No message to pay at the register, so we sat awkwardly with our payment for several minutes before having to figure it out ourselves. We get to see the lovely hostess again, who says nothing as we give her our card and check. "Would you like your receipt?" Is this McDonald's? Yes we would. Handed our check without so much as have a nice day.  Perhaps it was an off day for these people. Unfortunately not a great impression was left for us as first timers. Consistency is the key to the success of a small business, and if you can't master that art, you will miss out on a lot of opportunity.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon raisin Pot of Bread
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffle Benedict and home fries

Et_URtOIPZzn2LCub9q6zg.text: First time here and I loved it. Service was awesome. Our waitress, Sandy was the best. The food was very good. Jamms French Toast was crunchy and fluffy at the same time. Loved it. Homemade Corned Beef Hash was pretty good too. We'll definitely come back.

GbwdEk3fLqfykgy_299o3Q.text: I love this place, food is always great, pots of bread are amazing, Shirley is always a delight and treats us like family, we've been coming here for years!!! I bring all of our out of town guests here for brunch!!!

Je98UncDnErwmMmRkGdmSA.text: We are back for lunch.  We were not disappointed.  Beef dip and fries were great.  My wife had the Club with sweet potato fries.  She loved it.  Service is still great as is the food. Everyone is so friendly.  Nice way ti get out of the heat.

Aj9-EOOhttdU7FzDaFMM2g.text: What do three Yelpers do after a double hike at Mount Charleston?  We look for a place to refill our depleted nutritional content.  We first went to a restaurant that had a 35 minute wait.  We opted not to wait and started Yelping on our smart phones to find somewhere else.  On the way to a 2nd suggested place, Warren P. found Jamms and since it was nearby, I piloted the car to Jamms.  What a nice stop for idea #3.  The three of us started out with a free pot of bread, just for mentioning Yelp.  They have plain, cinnamon, and the flavor of the day was green chili and cheese which is what I got.  It comes with a cup of softened butter and was tasty.  I had the S'mores pancake.  That's pancake batter with marshmallow and chocolate chips in the batter.  It's topped with some extra chocolate chips--for good measure-- that soften from the hot pancake.  There is also a drizzle of caramel sauce on the pancake.  I got the single pancale and it was a perfect ending to a great hike.  Service was excellent.  I'll be back here for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread flavor of the day - green chili and cheese
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores pancake

e7-No79z_8kh-GMyZlI6_Q.text: This has been my regular breakfast spot for years.   Sometimes it's a bit long of a wait to get in but normally the wait is worth it. My only real complaint about this place is the grits (way too watery) and the fact that many minor issues will come up if you have a special prep on your order (like simple substitutions or asking to leave items off) if they are busy. Don't think this is an waitress issue as its pretty consistent so maybe the kitchen is just willing to take the recourse. They really are minor but then again, I don't have allergies. That may be an issue for someone else.

T179JmCs02JYwUpIxXvx7w.text: Damn, I LOVE Jamms!!!! I am JUST finding out about this place. I am going to keep taking people until I have to go alone!   PROS: *Jamms Signature Omlet - steak, cheese, fresh mushrooms topped with               bernaise sauce. ( I substituted egg whites).              Hamsteak - sweet and savory              Pot bread - Party in a tin pan!!!              Family owned AND operated

6blXX-TmMirPqnbh2-7uOQ.text: The absolute best place in town for a hardy breakfeat! You have to try to pot of bread when visiting. The TEC sandwhich and waffle chicken blt is also a favorite. The service is always fantastic :) if you come on a weekend do expect a wait, however rest assured that it is worth it!

A-kzIcW7aysqBRIxZTUQMw.text: Best breakfast around town!  Shirley was such a joy!!  If your an outta towner head this way!

lBHgys10H2YZAz2fQTPI3Q.text: After a long day of traveling we wound up in Vegas hungry for a good breakfast. We found Jamms to be all that we wanted and more.  Friendly service, great food And the bread bowls were delicious and innovative.  I like their menu that has classics and creative dishes for all the "Foodies" out there.  We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread bowls galore!  Delicious!

9Ddyo4CWGreJhTpBxSimfA.text: Ok so today was the day to check out what all the fuss was about!   Went for breakfast this morning, this "greasy spoon" restaurant is comfortable and casual with booths.   I ordered a Denver omelette and the country potatoes, of course the raisin cinnamon cup of bread.   Yikes I was not aware they loaded their omelette's with cheese, was a bit overwhelming to say the least. They saute the Denver ingredients to oblivion, onions, ham and which should be green bell pepper as for a "traditional" Denver omelette, they used red. I like my Denver omelette with a bit more crunch of the onion and bell pepper. Way too much cheese about 1/2 pound it seemed, was basically a cheese omelette with some ingredients. It was insane the amount of cheese.  Anyhow, I will be sweating cheese for the next week, eek.   The country potatoes and cup of bread was awesome, and the coffee is also good with plenty of refills.   I will give them another shot and order something different next time, perhaps the french toast.  I have to say the service was awesome! We had a waitress that was sweet, charming and on top of things! She is one of those that calls you sweetie, honey, etc. I love that and eat it up, she got a hefty tip! lol

dOy61hlchCF11MBqs9T_VQ.text: Very good! We had breakfast everything hot and yummy, even the syrup, For my french toast that was nice with vanilla and just the right amount of pieces (4). Bacon thin sliced and not over cooked, perfect~    Coffee is in a generous mug and they are asking for refills promptly.    All servers and staff quite friendly. The pot of bread a nice option and 1 is definatly  enough for 2 people.    We live in Henderson so this was a bit far for us, but it was with the drive and if we are on the area would surly return.

jvrf8xoxalepkDruEYu0Mg.text: This is my favorite place to eat breakfast! I always order the same thing. Just can't seem to try anything else on the menu because I love Joe's omelet with ham so much! The pot of bread is always delish and a surprise flavor is offered each day in addition to the regular one. Come check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HWLrl5wtkI5E4syIZh3B3Q.text: While we were told the wait at 11am on a Sunday would be 15-20 minutes, I was pleasantly surprised when we sat after only about 8 or 9 minutes. They do indeed turn tables quickly, but at no time did we feel rushed. The staff hustles, our waitress was efficient and cheerful, the coffee was hot and eye-opening.  My daughter had Jamm's French Toast which is battered then encrusted with corn flakes before frying. She says I will have to make mine this way from now on. I had Jamm's Speciality Omelet which has steak, grilled onions and mushrooms and lots of mild cheddar. Guests get their choice of hash browns or home fries and a bread selection - English muffin, toast, their signature pot o'bread. I chose the home fries and the special of the day pot o'bread with cream cheese frosting.   The long and short of it is that we both left stuffed and happy, several wait staff wished us a good day and that we'd be back soon. We don't get to Vegas very often (about every 2-3 years) but we will certainly come back to Jamm's again.

pP0DMcxXpjElwQTfgK2sqA.text: Love this place! We have been there a few times now when we head to Vegas. It might even beat our previous favorite breakfast spot in Hash House. The portions are more reasonable than Hash House delivers, which we appreciate and the price tag is less than hash house too. This mom and pop place has more of a truck stop feel and the fair is unique and special. Things you won't experience anywhere else. I love the little bread bowls with fun flavors of the week to choose from. The bread melts in your mouth. The hot chocolate is wonderful. And I haven't had a bad breakfast item yet. They have some really nice variations on how eggs are done. The flavors are homemade and wonderful. I haven't tried lunch or dinner here yet but breakfast is always the bomb! We will be back again and again!

zAole1n4K-wemTl-6d1VuQ.text: Jamms is one of the best breakfast/lunch restaurants that I have been to here in Vegas. From their larger than life pancakes, to their soups and sandwiches; this is the place to be! Whenever you check into yelp you receive a free pot of bread. The pot of breads are really tasty as well. The waitresses are professional and have a great demeanor. Make sure to come early because this place fills up quick. I suggest ordering their chicken noodle soup which has thick noodles and large chucks of chicken as well as soft carrots and celery. Jamms is the place to be for a great meal, affordable, and perfect for groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet creamy cherry pot of bread

8FRchZhEGgPL7WP5b9zL-w.text: James is my favorite breakfast spot. The service is always prompt, friendly, and create a family feel. The food is always delicious and they will alter your order to fit your needs... it my not be on the menu but they will try. I love Jamms!

D6s9lJPDhIrmcTRvEKI6dw.text: The Pot of Bread was pretty good. My husband and I both had the country skillet and it was just ok. Service was very good though.

MjAHl6lLOX29Bpf74zQDHw.text: I ordered the Ruben Eggs Benedict, they where not greedy with the corn beef and it came with hash browns cooked to perfection. My friend ordered The White Castle Omlette and they where not shy with the beef inside at least 1lb of beef in the omlette. She also got a side order of a Biscuit with gravy for only 75 cents it was perfect also. We both licked our plates clean it was that good. The service was very good, Jasmine our waitress was excellent. We ordered our food and with in 10 minutes it was delivered hot and ready to destroy. If your looking for a good breakfast in the Vegas community this is definitely a hot spot. Good job Jamms I will be back!!!!

IdGrd1Tb3buHZlcrFiOp-w.text: Outstanding customer service and delicious food! This will definitely not be our last time you coming here!

dAKJtAfBvvJ6hyw1bBaEhg.text: Had breakfast there on Saturday 11/17/18. Arrived a little before 9am w/wife and we only waited a few minutes. We ordered omelets, mine was a meat lovers and it was good. The customer service was very good. The next time I return, I'll try their french toast. ***Highly Recommend this restaurant***When we left, there were quite a few people waiting to get in.

IpYs_w3TpgyuPBZMFqomXw.text: I am writing this review because the pot of bread told me to. I will dream of the pot of bread until I can go back and have some more. I have lived down the block from Jamms for months already and I am disappointed I didn't come sooner! The service is great and the workers are so friendly, I felt extremely welcomed and cozy. The food was delicious! I ordered the waffle combo with strawberries and whipped cream. They didn't hand the check until they knew I was done eating which was great because I didn't feel rushed. I will be coming back literally every week. Also, I love the pot of bread so much.

tX_4CjFQngReApfwtbtmiA.text: Good location for quick diner Breakfast. Fast tuen around. Few chairs at the bar for singles. The food is EXPENSIVE for what they serve. The bread bowl is basically a cinnamon roll or bread/biscuit in a muffin cup. If you live here you know where to go. If you don't and are willing to spend 11.00 for eggs go for it.

Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach ham tomato and 1 single slice of provolone. NO cheese inside. WTF.

2HRxovrNgCSGyW8blqaBjg.text: Great breakfast.  Had the French toast and it's extra yummy.  The pot of bread is also real tasty.    Definitely coming back again.

cb9kF2SsHtCNO_7hKDmBCA.text: I will admit that I feel that my experience here was subpar because of my own choices. I should have stuck with ordering a breakfast dish.   I will say that this is the setting of a real diner. The restaurant isn't fancy or really decorated. The staff are warm. The food options are what you would expect at a diner.   Our server was wonderful. She was attentive but never rushed us, which I really appreciated.   I ordered the chicken panini. I'm not convinced the chicken was cooked all the way, so I pretty much peeled it out of the sandwich. The bread was far too crisp, and I am pretty certain there was not any pesto on it. I was severely disappointed. The potato wedges were good, but they're like any you can buy frozen.   Overall, I won't be back. Sorry, Jamms.

s1Ny1LqxLUlS9-ai3QmdmQ.text: Delicious! Definitely recommend!! The Irish omelette was super huge and filling and you must must get the pot of bread!! So yum!!!
