96cHwrg9wJXX0yLfvQFYeg.text: Love this place! Their service is amazing on their wall it says you enter as strangers and leave as friends it's very True! They are very warm, welcoming, and very attentive to my family and I. Shirley and Juan are amazing great customer service!! 5 stars for their customer service and 5 stars for their food! The food is so delicious for their price the pot bread is delicious as well I recommend getting that!! Overall great experience I will be coming back again for sure! My family and I left happy and satisfied!! Thank you guys!!!

XrknvGfJcYSUnR4ob4efOA.text: The staff is very nice and friendly. It's a small restaurant, diner atmosphere but very warm feeling. The food is great. It's perfect for breakfast or brunch with plenty of options.

eELWgvQvqRyiXDE9qhFpLw.text: Jamms is like dining at Grams.   Top to bottom with that old school look, closed-in booths and seating areas, plus that dated decor that is at everyone's grandparent's house. But just like your gramm gramm's house, you tend to eat all the food because it's just that good.   No fancy frills, just down home cooking that's definitely not diet friendly, especially with what I decided to eat, The Country Skillet. A heart stopping meal filled with scrambled eggs, sausage, ham, onions, mushrooms and covered in home fries with gravy. I also got the Pot of Bread, which is on the house with a Yelp check-in, free carbs!  The skillet is huge and a very heavy meal that's perfect for sharing or that horrendous hangover that just won't seem to go away. The home fries added a great crunchy texture, which is definitely what this plate of needed with so many soft food items. Gravy, gravy, gravy, it was the perfect addition to the mushrooms and eggs and brought everything together.   Like I said a free "Pot of Bread" with a Yelp check-in, and they offer three choices; original, cinnamon raisin and a savory flavor that I believe rotates.  I went with the basic "POB" and it was amazing. Soft, pillowy, and all of that melt in your mouth goodness, trust me check-in and be happy.   Jamms is well, the Jam!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast stick. Pretty tasty.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced coffee.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of Bread. Original style

M0ORsZo_r0OG3WE80DBqig.text: Always good every time my wife and I go!  My wife and I love going for breakfast on the weekends.

kEiISOqrJ_9VZC1jEuB5dQ.text: If you are local and live on the west side of Las Vegas you have probably been here.  I have been going here for years.  So long our favorite server (Shirley) knows we order the same thing.   We don't even have to tell her. Rather than spend time with the menu we get to chit chat and get the "above and beyond" personal service.  The kind of service you would expect in a small town where everyone knows each other.  This is a traditional "mom & pop" type place.  Quality and service is always tops.  We try to get there for breakfast right when they open.  There is always a line waiting after that.    Omelettes are great and you have to try one of their fresh baked "pot-a-breads",

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham/Cheese/Mushrooms Omelette, Fresh baked Pot-a-bread (Cinnamon &amp; Raisin), Sweet Potato Fries, and Coffee.  My favorite breakfast.

-HgBhdkFzew_s2pi6r0hLA.text: I will have the French toast and a cavity.   How have I just discovered this place of nearly three years living in Vegas?  I checked into Yelp, and got a free Pot of Bread. Score. Um...yeah it's scrumdillicious.   I got the Jamm's French Toast.  It was really good. It really would have been hit out of the ball park with real maple syrup, but no one around here serves anything other than Aunt Jemima or Mrs. Butterworth and being from upstate NY where they serve nothing but the real stuff, I am a bit of a spoiled brat...I can dream about it being smothered in real maple syrup...it was still very satisfying with knock off syrup.  I got home fries with a side of sour cream. At first it looked a little unappetizing but looks can be deceiving. Best home fries I have had and that is saying a lot since the competition around these parts is stiff.  The coffee is strong.  Like STRONG! I needed sugar and more than I normally use...I asked for more sugar and they don't mess around...   So basically the next time I come here while everyone's food-seeing the omelettes almost made me want to change my mind and one of those, looked amazing I am seriously coming here just to engorge myself on pot of breads and potatoes.   Yes, come here, do it.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravaged home fries..can&#39;t stop eating them.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread- scrumdilliciousness for your face.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More sugar for my coffee.

UXvmBrFFTgzMimGu8agRnQ.text: The food was just as amazing as the first time, so that's not why this rating dropped. The rating dropped because during us dining in, a waitress (?) came up to me and my boyfriend and put her arms around us. She told me to quit using the "f bomb" because it was a "family friendly" restaurant. I was in such shock that I didn't say anything (I also cannot stand to be touched by anyone that I do not know). It was so uncomfortable.   First of all, that's assault. You had NO RIGHT to touch us. The fact you even did is reprehensible. It was uncomfortable, unprofessional, and I have PTSD that could make it where I'll have a panic attack and freak out. That isn't very family friendly, now is it?  Second of all, my right to free speech trumps everyone else's feelings, and if you have an issue with that, go fuck yourself. Not to mention it was so loud in there the only people who could hear me were right next to me!  Thirdly, this is Vegas. If you're going to tell me that none of those parents curse in front of their children, you're stupid. What makes a stranger saying it any different? Get off your high horse.

Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra bacon because hell yeah.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious.

HDWkFceUNvftvgdxQIj6xQ.text: We are here in Vegas on vacation and wanted breakfast somewhere that the locals eat and off the strip. We were not disappointed! The staff was very pleasant and were right in top of re-filling our drinks and coffee. The food was very tasty and the serving sizes were more than sufficient.  So sad that we are headed out of town tomorrow.

w5puezUyXRPEociJ1IaJ3Q.text: Large plates, very tasty. We were referred by my husband's coworker. We will go back some day.

pylQkrJBEhYbFjzzhSvSug.text: Still loving this place. This time, we brought relatives from Hawaii who just arrived on the red-eye, so we skated right in on an early Sunday morning. Jamms delivered as usual, hot pots of strawberry-coconut bread (flavor of the week), with multiple refills of good hot coffee.  We appreciate a good cup of coffee--nothing pretentious, just a decent complement to the food. Again, the breakfast selections are varied and it does take time to settle on something from the menu. Orders included the grilled corned beef hash & eggs, which was savory with a nice crunchy exterior; the iconic Joe's Omelet with fresh spinach and plenty of beef and mushrooms; fluffy pancakes and eggs cooked exactly as requested.   Our visitors were happy with being brought to this local spot to have a very satisfying breakfast.   By the time we left, there was a line of people waiting to get in. The usual Sunday morning scene. But it's worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iconic Joe&#39;s Omelet with fresh spinach, plenty of beef &amp; mushrooms
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunchy exterior, savory corned beef hash

w2HwN1cLL5wYsgkK5jvP6A.text: I've been coming here ever since I was a little kid. They treat you like family here and if you are unpleased with your meal or experience they try their best to make it up to you. We always left satisfied and wanting more the next morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZABdpHSjeki1Wm17NX1COA.text: This was our 1st time there, the food was good, I came with two friends who I haven't talked too in a long time so we wanted to eat & chat a little however we felt like we were being rushed when we were done eating a waitress came right away as if they were watching us finish our food and said if you guys are not going to have you're coffee refill anymore we would need the table !!!! We couldn't believe they were asking us to get up & leave !!! Unbelievable however we decided to get up & go !!! My friends & I will definitely NOT come back we felt horrible & humiliated !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

tnCMJJ8DybuN0QcHmf2NaA.text: Large menu with great selections. Customer service was great out waitress was very attentive. I ordered Eggs Benedict, Very yummy and there signature "Pot of Bread" is delish.. I will be returning...

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamms eggs benedict..
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamms Cinnamon Raisin Pot of Bread

P8V6FmHIdUrz0LjT1G95dQ.text: My Girlfriend and I had our first date here, and we keep coming back because Jamms is hands down the best breakfast place in Las Vegas. There are other good places for breakfast in Las Vegas, but Jamms is the best in my opinion.  If you want a good breakfast at a very reasonable price, Come here. The service and staff are also excellent too.  They have fresh baked bread of difference flavors, The eggs are always awesome, Homemade corned beef hash, bisquits and gravy is awesome, and they make a mighty fine pancake.

A38ZEdfUq0CM1oC5oNyk5g.text: This is my favorite breakfast spot! I live in San Diego but EVERY TIME we are in town we have to stop in!

8s3IvshlYgkCFS8_jYmuTg.text: Great food! Great Service! Clean! The Potta bread was amazing so we're the waffles! Very nice place!

ZUWQbVYPercued4j2g4cqw.text: A - OK pretty much sums it up.  I had a grilled cheese so it wasn't too hard to mess up.  Service at our table was good, but the hostess seemed a little rude.  We called ahead and they said there was no line, when we arrived 5 minutes later there were probably 5 or 6 parties waiting.  Could it have been bad timing and all of us arrived at once?  Possible, but unlikely.    We got a free pot of bread with our Yelp checkin but I wasn't too impressed with that either...  it's bread.  Am I missing why this is such a novel thing?

EANRAlPEhG6JMKtduUK2qw.text: The Jamm's French Toast was some of the best french toast I've had in my life, and the ham steak was half the size of an entire plate! Pot-o-bread is similar to Alton Brown's Popovers, poofy, soft, and flavorful bread in a little muffin tin. Service was friendly and overall the food was excellent. Will definitely be back many times!

zKemCDPMV1SSToSDbP4OWw.text: Such a great breakfast with excellent service! I got the Mediterranean omlette and it was supurb! Will definitely be coming back. Thank you!

8gu-bZHz4GC6HZSWHIlQHg.text: Man I had a hard time deciding how many stars to give this place.  We actually found this place by accident.  I wanted to try a place in the same strip mall and I won't give the name because that's another review.  Let's just say they sell poultry cooked different ways.  I let you do the math.  As I was bummed out driving I see a window blasted with "Best of Vegas" stickers.  I was about to eat my foot so we decided to stop in to the breakfast/lunch establishment.  As we were walking in I noted the best of stickers were kind of old.  I figured well it can't be that bad.    We walked in  and were immediately greeted.  If I were to base the review only on the service and how friendly the employees are, then I would give it more stars.  The waitress was friendly and the guy who was filling our drinks was even more friendly.  Our 1 year old was a little fussy because she was probably hungry too.  They noticed this and brought us some crackers.  This was great!  If you are a waiter or waitress and notice a fussy kid and you know the little things that help parents then you instantly max out your tip.  Just a little piece of advise, go ahead and write that down.    Let's take a look at the food.  I ordered the Jamm's omelet.  It had steak in it covered with a sauce.  When I looked at the steak and keep in mind I am not expecting fillet Mignon here it looked like the steak um's meat you get in your freezer aisle.  I didn't like it at all.  I think I really didn't like it because the omelet was about $10.  I guess I was just expecting more.  I did get the pot bread and it was really good.  My wife ordered the french toast and she thought it was tasty.  My daughters just at eggs and toast.  We emerged from the restaurant paying $30 for breakfast.  Ouch!  Overall I am sure at one time this place was great but as new restaurants opened it probably took away from this place.  There are a lot better breakfast places out there. Cheers!

Z0TyS16jFCpSMrdVdDKqBg.text: Classic and reliable breakfast food provided by friendly and responsive staff. The pot of bread is a fun diversion from the usual-usual. The Country Skillet was delicious and well balanced. There was a good amount of meat/egg/potato mixed together (some skillets at other places are 70% potato and few ingredients). The scrambled eggs were fresh and fluffy. Their omelets are also hefty. The Sandy Omelet packs in a lot of flavor and should satisfy your hunger.  All in all, an easy and pleasant experience.

PWi7scy3EnsfHqlrhpy51A.text: We found this restaurant on Google Maps when shopping on rainbow.  We were so hungry and a Pot of Bread sounded perfect.  We were not disappointed. The serving sizes were perfect and the prices are reasonable.  The pot of bread is great. This will be somewhere we visit again.

rKpj1rEDzKMZQ_536f1n2A.text: French Dip was very good They got a good breakfast too

weokfR8A360ApVqIOUvS5Q.text: Me and the wife's favorite breakfast spot. There French toast is very good. But by far the best thing about jamm's is there weekly pots of bread. Each week a new kind. Chocolate coconut and salted caramel were my two favs. Would recommend to anyone who's hungry

09b9K0gc2_fyK_nX4szglg.text: Nothing bad to say. Have your group ready to be seated when you get there. Food choices are outstanding. Quality is superior, service quick and friendly. Portions great, hot, fresh. Priced RIGHT!!! Many regulars there each visit & they know all the friendly staff. Won't go anywhere else now for breakfast! Hostess Devyn is the best! Hated The Griddle :-(

lYjSwTQiJEmYQfmU9SPd7w.text: I've been coming here since 2012 and the food is not consistent. I expect some great food for the price but that doesn't happen!  Oh and depending on what waitress you get will depend on the price you pay.  Temperature of restaurant is always freezing.

Xj_JEF_pIEgfg9jDR2nWBg.text: Dine like you are in a New York Diner for breakfast. I am so thankful for Jamm's. I taste the quality. Take in the atmosphere. Jamm's makes me feel like I am enjoying myself in Manhattan each breakfast

prRkJkE-DUY1jjyb-QO-QA.text: Jamms is one of the best breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas---always friendly service and lots of choices of delicious food.

XDWubGvUJBvOflkDpAZhVA.text: Great food and service! If you can't make up your mind, try the "Red Plate" selections. A little of a lot of different flavors. I have come here for years and never have had a disappointing meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Lr6iZL1qHsqnmdOt_gkGJg.text: I'm not a big fan of breakfast but Jamms turns me into a maniac. The service, the old school feel and best of all the  yummy food. One of my favorite places to eat and my only breakfast joint. Highly recommend!!

DcWFlwt5s0799AP24Z-igQ.text: The only reason I joined yelp was to tell everyone how horrible, crapy everything about that place was. I have actually been going there for years, and have noticed how service, and the food was going down hill. Everything is greasy. I mean everything. Today was crowded I will give them that. But the service sucked. And to top it all off I ordered a sandwich to take home with me. Now I know leaving it behind on the table in a doggie bag was my fault. I had returned no more than b a few minutes later to find out that they threw it away. I could deal with that.  But the way the they handled the situation with such a no care in the world to bad so sad attitude. Will guarantee that I will never go back to that hole in the wall sleazy place. You want a good clean classy place to have some breakfast. Go to the new York beagle cafe on buffalo.  You would never want to go back to jams agian.

e4zyKL-rBXKl2epR9bnw6A.text: Great little place! Stopped by here on our way to the Natural History museum. Had medium rare steak & eggs, very yummy and great price. Waitress was friendly and attentive. Great place to stop :)

Inw0Iwra5JRpn6GmXDdB8Q.text: This was my first time dining at Jamms and I was very impressed! My party and I came on a Saturday morning. The wait time was about 20 minutes, which we expected for a weekend. We were seated in less than 20 minutes.   The menu is huge! There was a ton of options and you can try many different items, which made it easier to decide. The 1st server came to our table and took our drink order. The drinks were brought back promptly. The 2nd server took a while to take our order. I could see that the server was busy, but an acknowledgement from the server would have been appropriate. The server took around order after about 10-15 minutes.  We ordered our meals and the famous pot of bread. That was absolutely delicious! It was fresh, warm, and tasteful. Our food arrived a little erratically. Myself and 3 others received our food while the 4th person had to wait another 5 minutes for his meal. We dug right in when we got our food, but felt bad that the other person had to wait.  The servers were very attentive with drink refills and pre-bussing our table. We received our check quickly and got cashed out fast.  Overall, I will definitely dine here again. The 1 star deduction is for the small wait time for our order to be taken and the wait time for our friend's food.

Thw5fLqH8fWR0eCy66PkRQ.text: The staff was friendly and the food good. We went at 11a on a Tuesday, and it was insanely busy, so plan accordingly. The Margie's Omelet was great - best part of what we ordered.

HHTDWi4VK00ydyU0klqJ9Q.text: We were here visiting from out of town and we like to Yelp hometown places to eat. Once again Yelp did not fail us. The food was great and the service was outstanding. Sandy was our server and she was right on top of things. My hubby had the hash and eggs which was probably the best we have ever eaten and I had the chicken enchiladas with green sauce and they were excellent, not to spicy and not to mild. Only negative I would say is that the refried beans that came with enchiladas were a little dry but there was plenty of enchiladas to fill me up so I just didn't eat the beans. I would highly recommend this place.

IjCBs7CWEdsH79NOFrBAjQ.text: Pina Colada French Toast was delicious! Rueben Omelet was delicious! Staff was so customer friendly. Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pina Colada French Toast Yumm

up77mNhkudzZ5CIDDmJaLA.text: One of my favorite places for breakfast.  One house special is the "Eggs Benedict" - of which there are several varieties (including one that is served with a waffle rather than with an English muffin). They are all good.  The house coffee is Illy brand, which is an awesome way to start the day.  Prices are fair for what you get. The food is delicious. Do not miss the "Pot of Bread" - fresh, hot white bread served in ... a pot ... what else?  Also, it is just a few steps away from the Dead Poet Bookstore - Vegas'  largest and best used book emporium. Plan on spending the rest of your morning there.

t_NyQespOVIsE0A6BW9hjg.text: Sorry! Wasn't a fan. Went here with my gf and her family and so my hopes were high especially since I recommended this place based on reviews here. 3 out of 4 of us ordered the "hungry lion" which consists of eggs, sausage, bacon, ham steak and pancakes. Eggs and pancakes were pretty good, nothing special, ham steak ok, bacon and sausage bad! Bacon chewy like rubber and the sausage was unlike any other I've ordered in a restaurant. They were the kind you get at the cheap breakfast buffets that are snappy and are kind of gross without much flavor. So, to sum up, not too impressed. Service was nice though :)

sCIEUxOEHELpioyj2FVW8Q.text: This is our second time here and the food is great so we came back for seconds. However this time a girl in a red shirt greeted our table, brought drinks and we sat for about 5 to 10min in an empty restaurant. We flagged the girl in the red shirt from across the room (signaling we would like some kind of service) she just pointed to the front of the restaurant at our server. She could have easily walked over and let her know. Such a rude way to carrying on business especially since she was just standing there.

AwKs4NZJTW40BfHncF1h6A.text: I'm going to say one thing to you yelpers pot of Bread.  yes you read it right pot of bread. They always have cinnamon raisin and they have a daily special when I went it was chocolate caramel now I have to tell you that was a little over-the-top for me you could only taste the chocolate not even the caramel but the cinnamon raisin... amazing and the pot of bread is just what it sounds like.  don't be fooled by the butter on the side no no no no it's not just  butter it's actually cream cheese icing. That's right cream cheese icing on the side of your pot of bread. I don't think I need to say anything else. I do remember ordering other things but I don't remember them not like I remember the pot of bread

pPOX0-ZTf_e2GF2E8wjNNA.text: The sweet, creamy goo is the perfect compliment to any warm muffin, but smear it on a fresh pot of Jamm's bread and OMG! It's like a party in your mouth. This fresh little pot of bread is like nothing I've experienced anywhere other than Jamm's. The cream cheese icing is the best. The goodness doesn't stop with the bread and icing, though. We were greeted with a plate of fresh fruit while we browsed the menu and sipped our fresh coffee. This time I opted for the signature omlette and it was awesome. Sliced steak and bearnaise sauce with crispy hash browns and another little loaf of heaven. The service was great, as always. We had a couple of first timers with us and they were both impressed with the service and quality. One of them ordered a bowl of grits, which looked like a meal unto itself. Pretty thick and tasty as well. Ask for a cup of coffee to go and continue to enjoy Jamm's on the way home or back to the office.

J_FDNR-bCst0NIJ9J63HmQ.text: I lived in Vegas for 6+ years but actually had never been to Jamm's so was excited to try it while visiting after reading all the positive reviews. Nice place, comfortable setting, good service but very average food at best. The free bread was the best thing they served my friend and I but it was really nothing that special. The eggs, hash browns and pancakes were very blah and average taste wise. I must say I was surprised by the lackluster flavor and experience after reading the plethora of complimentary reviews. It's definitely a head scratcher.

v8Y7MK8Wwjp_VWFPKKFLAQ.text: No matter how hard I try to behave when I go eat at Jamms, I just can't seem to do it! The biscuits and gravy never fail me! And today I had not one, but two, of the famed pots of bread. I chose to sample the Cinnamon Raisin pot and the Pumpkin pots today. Topping the bread with the scrumptious cream cheese frosting made me weak in the knees. Jamms KNOWS breakfast!!

QSPy0ULtzmE6vKzEsmuI-A.text: Met my buddy here for breakfast, recommended by him. I have to say I was very impressed.  He said anyrhing I order will be good. So I go for the country fried steak. It was simply scrumptious.  Then the hash browns. Oh my, cooked perfect. It's one of my indicators to knowing a good cook in the kitchen. Also hanb the bread in the pan. This is one of their specialties. Great stuff. Needless to say this will be another one of my must stop places while in Las Vegas and will be bringing all who come.

PWzI8iYMPR_A-RmR20mfww.text: Great food, price, and service!  FOOD: Four of us went to Jamm's based on one of the guys recommendation. I'm glad we listened to him. We all thoroughly enjoyed our meals. It was my first time having french press coffee, and it was awesome. We each ordered the Pot of Bread - one guy had the cinnamon raisin, and the rest of us got the special Oreo version. It was so good. The taste and texture of the bread reminded of a soft dinner roll, but the Oreo added a really nice sweetness, and it came with a side of sweet cream frosting/glaze. For our main breakfast dishes we ordered the Cornflake-crusted french toast, and the Irish Scramble, which is corned beef hash with peppers, onion, eggs, topped with cheddar cheese. Sounds yummy, right? Well, it was!  SERVICE: We went on a Tuesday morning just before 8am. We were seated immediately, and had great service throughout. The waitress and busboy were friendly and attentive.  I'm rarely in Vegas, but next time I visit I will definitely try to come back to Jamm's.

O1ZpDcR9pGrniS2-UGHPYw.text: Cute place.  Plenty of food and plenty of choices.  Sandy is an excellent waitress.  Very efficient and friendly. Pots of bread a nice touch.

N3iHIrbQyrXGa8MJ_0A5sA.text: My son and I are huge fans of biscuits and gravy. We have been on a mission to find "edible" B&G in Vegas. Loved Black Bear Dinner but the last 2x we ate there we found black hairs in our food...twice!! So never going back there again!!! Now for Jamms...waited 30 mins not too bad. Service was incredible!!!! Never had an empty glass and she brought my son their famous pot of bread at no charge. Food was very good...still haven't found B&G like they make in the south but Jamms is pretty close. Will definitely be back!!

n6bwfKs89k-jV23fDgegJA.text: As visitors to Las Vegas, we find Great food and really good service here. For us it's worth driving off the strip. They're friendly and flexible. The little pots of bread are so cute

HBMq2JZ4KDpOKXvpz2L9og.text: I've eaten here quite a bit with my dad as he likes it but I think it's just an alright breakfast spot. If you sign up for their e-mail list you can get coupons for 10-15 percent off your bill or a free pot of bread.  Anyway I recommend ordering the Irish skillet and a pot of bread.  I still haven't been able to find a great breakfast spot in Vegas, i've been to Cracked Egg, Egg & I, Hash House A Go Go, Babycakes, The Bagel Cafe, Blueberry Hill, Pancake House, etc. I like The Bagel Cafe, Blueberry Hill and Pancake House out of all of those but those are all pretty expensive and the Pancake Houses in other states are better than the ones here for some reason. Hash House is the worst out of all of those.

Wye9Xaec0UdLFE_9C_psMA.text: What a great little diner. This place makes you feel at home with the newspaper,and the great waitresses. Reminds me of better days.  There are so many good things on the menu it is always hard to decided. This time I wanted to do lunch and the NJ Sloppy Joe-a triple decker sandwich with pastrami,corned beef,and turkey w/cole slaw & 1000 island sounded good. BUT....  so did the French Dip sandwich with steak fries and au jus.  I got the latter and it was damn huge I knew right away I was at best gonna make it through Half.  The beef was tender & tasty. The Roll was soft and buttery but firm enough to hold up to being dipped.  The fries were seasoned and very tasty.  As expected I barely made it through half but there was no way I was leaving this one behind!  If you like that small town feeling when you go out to eat. THIS IS THE PLACE!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. french dip &amp; fries

a93Gy_e72THMggVWJav1Kw.text: Went in on a Saturday around noon. We were seated immediately. Waitress was great. Food was great. Very casual atmosphere. Not for the snooty. Overall a great place to bring the family to breakfast. Will definately be back!!

clU_jM3c6AN_7Tdkybnpkw.text: Jamms restored my faith in finding a breakfast spot which feels like home.

bF4AFshUQUDxYe6MAC_uUg.text: We came here for breakfast on a Vegas trip, my husband likes to find local mom and pop places rather than the usual tourist traps.  My son ordered the smores pancakes which are actually chocolate chip pancakes with caramel sauce and whip cream.  I tried a bite and they were delicious.  The pancakes were light, airy and chocolatey.  I was surprised they weren't overly sweet.  I ordered the french toast with strawberries.  It was very good with fresh strawberries instead of limp soggy thawed berries and they were plentiful.  The french toast is drudged in crushed cornflakes so they had a nice bite to them and no soggy bread.  My husband ordered the corn beef  hash, this is where they lost two stars.  What arrived looked like browned sliced pieces of lunchmeat.  He told me it was so salty he couldn't even taste anything else.  To make sure he wasn't being overly dramatic, I had a small taste.  OMG it was the saltiest thing I've ever eaten and I like salt.  I drank my entire drink after that small bite.  It literally tasted like someone spilled the entire salt container in the hash and fried my taste buds, glad I was done with my french toast.    Bottom line, don't go anywhere near that hash if you have functional taste buds and anything but perfect blood pressure.  Get the french toast.

m0fcttwJ9V8b9oL9BiwNPA.text: Pot of bread is so yummy!  The Reuben omelet is also delicious!  My husband go the Denver omelet and it was chocked full of ham and veggies.

Cruafs-jCuOm99zWVtWfTw.text: This is my go-to spot for breakfast on the weekends.  Their Irish Skillet is amazing and doesn't have that icky corned beef from a can...it's real.  Their pot of bread is my favorites thing here.  Service is good.  Wait can be long on the weekends but it's worth it.

9Qi8T4wU5HlCnR5ArSNr6g.text: By far one of the best places for breakfast in Vegas. If the locas love it it has to be good. Not crowded with tourists, so crazy kids or weird people here. The food is served it very generous portions and I love the olmelt skillets with gravy. The last time I was there they started doing fresh corned beef hash, wow!  By far the best hidden gem close to the strip.

5tk2DsgjHW4dOEpQfY9AWw.text: Just tried out their night menu - they have an awesome selection of unique hamburgers, some other sandwiches and wraps, a few salads and a short list of appetizers.  The choices of sides are many - seasoned fries, skinny fries, sweet potato fries, potato salad, coleslaw, cabbage salad and a regular side salad.  The drink selection left something to be desired, but they do carry the essentials. (Coke products for sodas)  While the items are definitely not standard, it *is* a smaller overall menu than most places.  A recent addition (I don't remember seeing it on their lunch menu) is "The Jamminator" - a whopping 24 oz burger with your choice of toppings.  If you take the challenge and can eat it all in one sitting, they give you a free t-shirt.  After seeing how big their regular burgers are... that thing has to be monstrous.  I had the Egg Salad Burger.  (Yup - a 10 oz burger with a scoop of egg salad on top, plus the normal fixins.)  It was fantastic, but super big.  Definitely something to cut in half and take part home for later.  For my side I chose the sweet potato fries; they came spinkled with powdered sugar.  I think I could've just eaten a plate of those by itself and been satisfied.  Super delicious, and a nice sweet change-up from normal fries.  The waitstaff is super friendly, almost to a fault.  Great group of people, though.  Comparing what you get for the money you spend, this is easily one of my favorite diner-style restaurants in town.  Expect to spend about $15-$20 per person if you go all out with drinks and dessert.  It's definitely worth it.

v6x9PLlQagTYxrDfr11u_Q.text: Not good at all.  I was excited about the pot of bread because of the reviews, but it was plain and dry.

uzW2Cmbf1jMkcbqxN7lJpQ.text: This is a great place for Breakfast! The decor is ho-hum but the food makes up for it, as does the great service and friendly staff. The omelets are huge! And come with choice of potatoes and pot bread ( super yummy ) or English muffin or toast for around 9 bucks! I went there with my husband daughter brother and dad. For all of us with drinks and coffee was about 56 bucks...a bargain if you ask me =) We left happy and full. I suggest the pot bread french toast...mmm.

ZtRnGhvUSQc_WAp7CBNh2A.text: Pot thingies...yummy and free if u mention yelp...but I have to say as someone that is not really a breakfast person the egg salad club is the best egg salad other than mine I have EVER had....I mean insanely good...and the Irish scramble...omg...the corned beef soooo soft.  The hostess barks at you but eh...it's Vegas right?  Lol.  YUM!

7uHqPbfFIbmH6czBcOtY0g.text: We found Jamms on a fluke and absolutely love this little restaurant... It has a family feel to it and while not fancy- the food is amazing! I recommend the signature omelet- unlike many breakfast food chains, it delivers on not only the steak, but the mushrooms as well! I've also tried other items on the menu and they never fail to impress!

7O7EbDL9x_qI3Euzw7nxqw.text: We gave this place a try in place of our regular restaurant for breakfast: Hash House A Go Go. Its a great hole in the wall. Very friendly staff and the food is fantastic.

-doIbj3HeQrmu76PNRAT4w.text: Nothing fancy or pretentious, which is exactly what they seem to want. Just good food, reasonably priced, and friendly attentive service. If you're looking for more then that, go to the Strip

qaAZibSRL4uaOxyL2CJCXw.text: This place has a homey feel. Same waitress, same hostess. Great vibe. Must try at least once. Love the sweet potato fries and pot of bread! Can get pretty busy. Lots of regulars.

zoU9D2MVPsv2FAymzwfLFw.text: Excellent breakfast spot. Pot of breads are awesome (they are really just breads baked in cupcake size). Had an omelette, customized however you like. Huge portions, friendly service, and quality food!

jF-DELZZ30gMwhYelIclnw.text: We have been going to Jamms for years!  The food is amazing and the staff are even better.  Try the pot of bread, the omelets are fabulous.  MY favorite is the mushroom delight, cream cheese in a omelet, so good.   My husband's is the white castle omelets, ground beef, onions and cheese.  So Yummy.  Don't forget the biscuits and gravy!

ein6J2YiUqPfTFryL2PF0A.text: Went with the hubby today- we both ordered corned beef hash based on these glowing, stellar recommendations of fellow yelpers!! ...and we were not disappointed!!! He loved his plain pot of bread and my cin raisin one was awesome. Fresh coffee, great service. Really glad this business has survived the sucky economy. Will definitely re-visit! :)

jSsx9u-HhGk2Fnvqf-oPtQ.text: Good just got better. We've been going to Jamms for years, as we love their large selection of yummy omelettes and their pot of bread. We went a couple of months ago and learned they now have cinnamon raisin pot of bread. Yum!

vYWyj30Ym7YO8PTqe_Oh7g.text: If you like omelettes, this is your place. If you like old-school genuine hustling service, then this is your place. Don't expect any bells and whistles, nothing "fu-fu" about Jamms, but the "Sandy" omelette was one of the best I've ever had. If you're in Vegas, go have an omelette at Jamms, you won't be disappointed!!

DcJjTeC5_DRQ4ymgxuM2pg.text: I wasn't too impressed. The eggs didn't seem to be scrambled fresh. Likely bladder eggs. We went to Mr. Mama's the day before it was excellent. Highly recommend there instead.

xf6Ksnb9Rhk4mF9oCYN6sQ.text: I like jamms.  It is good, they have a great little thing called a pot of bread.  The regular pot of bread is good, but I tend to like there special one for the week.  They have really good pancakes, and decent burgers. The staff is friendly, but they really do get crowded on the weekends. Especially on Sunday morning. The staff is friendly, and the prices are okay.  I do love the smores pancakes, and the cornflaked French toast.  You should give it a try you will love the home kitchen feeling and friendly staff

92cN5BF1JLvDAGJa8v_0QQ.text: The best home style restaurant you'll find anywhere! Amazing food, great portions. The best country fried steak in Nevada and the best place to find grits!

QVKsBQh3PLmNVS4fPq7xvw.text: We went on the 8th, around 10am. Not to busy, waited about 5 minutes for a table. Thought we scored. Wrong! We were seated and the buser came over and took our drink order. And that was that! 20 minutes later without a server ever coming by our table, we paid for our drinks and left. So I can't review the food. Service sucked.  Doubt will go back there again, especially since we went out of our way to go there, only to be ingored.

VFKcYyg5NMvTAVOzC0ClLQ.text: Outside of the place being freezing, the staff was nice enough and the food was good. The Cuban sandwich was excellent and the French dip was just okay. The pot of bread is a good signature appetizer. We would go back if we are in that part of town.

V9AE7-8B2gvNLpwSoDGtrg.text: Great food and a very wide selection of items on the menu. Go early they get real busy around 9 am.

fCQ3BD1bclbUARESeuNwmQ.text: Erika's small plates is the greatest thing ever for a breakfast restaurant. There are so many wonderful menu options this gives you the opportunity to try multiple omelets without the sides getting you full. Sandy is a great waitress and always friendly.

pYjjiYhizkCR9PasKa3DBA.text: Excellent food! Our waitress Staci was genuine and funny, also knowledgable and gave great recommendations. We had the French toast, breakfast burrito, Belgian waffle, and Reuben eggs Benedict....all was amazing! What a cool hole in the wall breakfast spot. Less than 10 minute wait on a Saturday morning. Will be back next time we're in Vegas.

LbSDEadnKeK6nTs6vTO0Bw.text: Perfect breakfast. I am a huge fan of breakfast, coffee, and sausage gravy and all of these items were spot on. We will be back. Erin got the tuna melt and it was truly perfect. The tuna was grilled also as it should be. Why haven't I heard of this place? Go try it now!!

GIq85TFuCkxHepRoaOE2hg.text: I love this place.  I have been here for breakfast and lunch.  However, no matter when I come in I rarely deviate from the delicious homemade biscuits and gravy.  Absolutely to die for!  I highly recommend!

DfAf2uNubet5fX0tnoZHuw.text: If I were asked by my friends where is a good place  to eat, I would say Jamms. Nice attitudes, nice busyness and workers moving around, lots of good attention and service, great food. Made my day. Great waitress named Sandy.

YkOxGyeVJ9OWHgqXQg_oSw.text: This place seems more like your at home! When checking in on yelp you get a free pot of bread! We tried the cinnamon and raisin, very moist and warm with a cream cheese icing (I think). It's just the perfect amount so you don't just keep eating bread. My mom ordered eggs and ham Benedict and I ordered a build your burger. The eggs Benedict came with hash browns and my mom was happy with it, I didn't taste it so not sure- she wished it came with toast. On the burger you get a choice of 3 buns, 3 meats, cheeses, 3 toppings out of 8, and some sauce. I got provolone cheese, mushrooms, avocado and jalapeno mayo sauce. Tasted better than an average burger and I would come back for another one. I wished the jalapeno mayo was blended. It was literally mayo in a bowl and a chopped jalapeno in it haha I could've done that! Also I got wedge fries with the burger and these are probably the best fries I've ever had! They weren't greasy at all and I loved that they didn't have salt all over them! Soooo gooddd!  Ps if you post on social media they give you ten percent off your bill, it's on every table so don't miss out!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon and raisin pot of bread with icing
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of the jalapeño mayo
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham eggs Benedict and hash browns!

P0LK5T-xpsYQjXoevmKAaw.text: Jamm's is always perfect. They have the best corned beef hash that I've ever had, the best fresh bread, the best coffee, the best everything. If you're in Vegas you need to go to Jamm's at least once. I come here every chance I get. And it's relatively inexpensive.

MgoBM22-gQ08pe-E0RQMVQ.text: Amazing breakfast. Portions were big, hot and fresh. The Pot of Bread is a homemade muffin type of bread that is amazing. So fresh and hot. Best home fries I had in a long time. I recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham and home fries with wheat toast.

XSH09c5GivBCeZgxnkYX7w.text: Fun, local place! LOVE the french press coffee and the pot o' bread! We had to wait a bit for a table - we knew that was a good sign! I don't live far from this place and WILL be back.

vkulkS86qV4Uhm7j71PrzQ.text: The food was really good but it was so stuffy and hot in the restaurant. Burnt toast smell got a bit noxious.

XRu0vaxlDYYwUwyfF4VB6w.text: I've been to Jamm's twice and both times I was impressed. I found out on the second occasion that I could check in and get a free pot of bread. Not feeling adventurous I chose the white bread over the orange creamsicle flavor of the day. The bread was super fresh, tasty and hot out of the oven. I loved it.  As for breakfast the three of us ordered biscuits and gravy, an order of the French toast sticks and a New York strip with eggs. All of the items were cooked perfectly including the medium rare strip steak. I will remember not to attempt to eat an entire order of biscuits and gravy again. The portion was huge.   I find their coffee mugs sizable and the staff is always available for a quick refill. This is a great spot for breakfast without a huge wait time. We hit them on Mother's Day weekend and the place was packed but there wasn't a line out the door or anything so we were promptly seated.

0N6KM_VtURFmCywO0LAieQ.text: Best Breakfast by far in Las Vegas! Been coming for years to Las Vegas and decide to trust my YELPERS. Once again, they have not failed me. I'm from San Diego and wish we could have a Jamms restaurant down here! Till next time! Highly recommend the breakfast! Service was awesome, friendly and quick!

oGsEbUGCsGTRE3p349YUkg.text: I love this place for breakfast!!!!! I come here with my boyfriend and the food is great and completely affordable. It's great for a Sunday morning breakfast.

1xeOl6RxzActHAWv1_xYeQ.text: Went to grab a nice breakfast with friends. Food was delicious, customer service was great and the prices were reasonable. I'd go back to try another food item.

HsBUOWrTNntTT4iqEreH1A.text: First time here and the service was really polite food was awesome, decor was cozy, recommend for anyone who is trying to grab something off the strip

0jVmSxfYtDtIWZZG0BatTw.text: I've been coming here for years. Great place for breakfast and lunch. Highly recommend.

JcxbVa7DMSYO9oa9A9NF2Q.text: I've been coming to this place for years they have an amazing breakfast with a price that is very reasonable I recommend this place to anybody that wants to sit down and have a good time with their family

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice place for breakfast

l_kkZCb6svi30gDxyfouWw.text: I want to go back to Vegas NOW! There are ways to tell if I'm having a good meal. One of them being is that I will moan a la Meg Ryan Sleepless in Seattle. I met up here with a woman who I consider to be a second mother. It had been more than 15 years since I had seen her and this is where she chose to eat. Thank you mama Cheryl!!  The place is small, but what it lacks in size it makes up for in great service and food. Our waitress was a sweetheart! I ordered the cinnamon pot of bread and the corned beef hash breakfast. My hubby ordered the French Toast breakfast.  DELICIOUS.  ORGASMIC even.  I need to go back to Vegas, nao!

h785z6Mfi9hnkggx-wJTfg.text: Had a omelet with artichokes, tomatoes, onions and lots of cheese. Place is a very nice place for breakfast. Great potted bread

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelet with artichoke,mushrooms, tomatoes and cheese. Plus hash browns and raisin pot bread.

Tp4JuV2didJFfmue0qjLpA.text: My all time favorite brunch place whenever I'm in Vegas. Love their coffee, sweet potato fries and omelet.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best omelet

Q7WV-HlJawJNaVcofBg_5w.text: WONDERFUL AS ALWAYS!! I absolutely cannot get over how great this place has been over the years!! Literally our most favorite EVER!!!

xbDNgC8pVpT6z3AVux2jBQ.text: Great breakfast, great prices, great service! Stopped in on a Sunday around noon and ordered the French toast combo with bacon & a side of homefries. The food was all five stars. French toast was sweet but not too sweet. Homefries were crispy but not too crispy. I will be back for sure

g2_v96rd1gPVlqWUr0rTmg.text: My favorite breakfast place in town! We love the huge menu and the pot of bread! We go here every month. Kid friendly!

K9aPkO0lopLMg-rvvQvKsw.text: Jamm's is a great breakfast/lunch option tucked in a shopping plaza on the corner of Charleston and Rainbow. Although there are a lot of options for this type of fare, Jamm's remains one of my favorites for a simple, but well prepared breakfast.  I have a couple of criterium for an acceptable breakfast restaurant, those including good coffee, has waffles, and offers crispy, shredded hash browns as a potato option.  Jamm's offers all of these (although I wish they had thinner waffles as well as Belgian).  They do; however, serve their coffee in a nice large mug and are somewhat known for their pots of bread (a sweet yeast roll marbled with different flavors).   My favorite order is the waffle with a side of their bacon. It's always served perfectly crisp. Although I do not eat eggs, the other half loves their omelets and always has a cinnamon raisin pot of bread.   Jamm's remains one of my go-to breakfast spots in Vegas because of their traditional menu, good service, and easy location. It does get very busy on the weekends, but it's easy to figure out when the wait will be the most manageable and try them... I'm sure it won't be your list visit!

9SZiBcc2xpc0LODQuSp9vQ.text: Let me start by saying order the pot bread, it was excellent and definitely fresh baked. The rest of the good was good as well. Good service no wait to get in on the day we went. Only regret I had was not ordering more bread to go

OyjCsf33duDgammboIRwaA.text: Great place! Cozy and friendly.  Great food and great service and really nice and big selection! There is an option to taste in small portion everything that's on the menu.  Highly recommend:)

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VCPwK0_uM45Iydobv7noKQ.text: Hanging out at Jann's with my favorite girl and glad we made the choice to hang because we were greeted by our beautiful friend Kim who is always the hostess with the mostess!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love this woman sooooo much!

TzsCWu8j-BKIPFJoRAQCNQ.text: The cinnamon bread pot is so good! This is a great small restaurant off the strip that we decided to try! We were vary pleased with the customer service and food! I highly recommend for a filling and fair priced breakfast after a long night out lol!

SzNhJARljiD8dc3MH3gq3w.text: Super yummy. Excellent portions, fabulous customer service. . Hidden gem, totally amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato pancakes,  biscuits and gravy.. they are NOT shy with gravy:)

J05rYrskBlG7CV3MJn3xjg.text: Wow  no good no gluten free items. For starters....the floor was so dirty from days ago who knows how long the ham was there because when I put my foot down it was crusty and it was on my new shoes :-(  I ordered a side hamburger  patty with a fried egg on top... with a side of COLE slaw clearly the cook top was dirty with old grease my fried egg had old particles on it .. yuk...the COLE slaw was soggy like you could smell it was old and not crispy like it should be and no flavor needed a hint of salt...oh yes ordered side sweet potato fries like it was eating cardboard not that I know what cardboard tastes like. Lol But not even salted that would of helped. Needless to say we did not complain left and will never go back!!!!!

ax4oeWDUQlBmfLAmGMjOfQ.text: Just moved to las Vegas and went here for the first time with my dad that was visiting, our server Devin was awesome! I ordered the chicken and waffle BLT with skinny fries and she recommended ranch with them.  The whole meal was delicious. And the service was fast and accurate.  Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pMqm-1p4L-aHKRJxvGfDeA.text: The food was amazing!!! Literally 20seconds away from my mom in laws house can't beat that! I must say the Jamms French toast crusted with corn flakes bomb.com got it with a side of bacon and my bf had the California beni and mom Inlaw had the sandy omelette with sweet potato fries with the cinnamon bread super delicious!!!, staff super nice and attentive it was a first timer for me and my bf and we must say we will be back definitely very cute lil breakfast/lunch spot must check while in the area! Aloha from Hawaii!:)
