ANCApq12bFM_UOuWTARNMA.text: Omg so full! The food was amazing and still had food to take home! Then lastly u want to check in and show then that u post to social media and they give u a  discount!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini french toast sticks from the kids menu... $3.50 now the beauty of this is the toast is TEXAS style thickness! So worth it!
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancake combo with side eggs and ur choice of meat..fluffy fulfilling pancakes omg
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef and hash with side eggs....the corn beef is the real corn beef sliced and chopped thinly and cooked into a hash patty

zRq9lHNY4hTrpt5OdnRpMQ.text: Very good breakfast place to eat. If you come here definitely try the pot of bread comes in 3 different flavors and is fresh daily. The service was excellent from the time you walked in to the time you checked out.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2FLGqeq4v4Q7JujR9v0XnA.text: Since visiting Jamms it is now in my immediate arsenal of go-to breakfast places. The food is just stupid good, even just an omelet is so so tasty  - not to mention they give you the option to make any omelet into a burrito- which I don't know about you - but the only thing that could make breakfast better is wrapping the whole damn thing up in a tortilla. Also their signature pot o' bread - YUMTASTIC. I love this unique element as it really sets their brand as a breakfast place apart from the rest. Sorry Denny's, I'll be at Jamms.

EqowBYTJdPHsMpx0lBg0lw.text: I love the fact that most of their menu can be put as a small plate option.  Avocado, bacon and cheddar omelet. Delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tc-UcPb80LfiXZySNxdmxQ.text: Small little restaurant tucked away in the Albertsons shopping center. Portions were good and the service was great. They are always very attentive. They make their own bread there which is kind of cool.  The only reason they could not get 5 stars it was because the waitress that was serving us could not give us a clear answer on what was good. Has a first-time customer partner and I I asked her how was a particular item and the answer to each item was fantastic. If everything is fantastic I will not know what you decide so I got what she recommended was the best omelet in the house. I'm going to have to argue that it was kind of bland. I was expecting fantastic.

_tmAA9whzG6iVUWNU03row.text: Just fantastic. From the host to the waiter and even the bus boys and runners, everyone and everything was great.   When my wife and I arrived we almost shied away from eating here because it looked very busy; there was a small group of people outside even. But that group disappeared fast so we went on in. We were greeted quickly, had our name taken down by the hostess and were seated in probably less than 10 minutes. Shortly after, we were brought some water. A few minutes after that our waitress came and grabbed our orders. I mentioned we had a coupon from Yelp for a free pot of bread for checking in. I showed her my phone and she returned a minute later with the orange cranberry version, which was really good; fresh and still warm.   For our orders, my wife got an omelette, hash browns and some toast. I got the Hungry Lion breakfast which is your standard breakfast platter of 2 eggs, 2 sausage links, 2  pieces  of bacon, 2 pancakes and a big slice of ham (bonus points for putting the butter for the pancakes in a little cup and not glopping it onto the cakes themselves). We also shared a french press of coffee which they brought out before the food. Again, everything was great. Coffee, food, everything. And it's all super inexpensive! For the two of us we spent less than $25. You can also get an extra 10% off if you show the hostess that you checked in on Yelp.   I made sure to tip the waitress really well, she deserved it. Overall, you can't ask for better service, better food, and better prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hungry Lion (I ate one of the bacons).
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French press coffee; enough for two people

lVS3ovfORHKxcDaU3fNqZw.text: Best breakfast ever. We eat here every time before the drive back to L.A.   The chicken BLT green waffles are amazing.   Coffee is yummy!   Love this place.

d8TkZAR_YYUMPhh1tRTJ-Q.text: Service was good, food was nothing like I expected. Yet again the great reviews on Yelp failed me. Not worth going back to.

XNldMbsXORgmBX8pJFiQ8A.text: Just visited Jamm's. Great breakfast stop for our family of six.  Everyone enjoyed their meals and we are stuffed!!!  Friendly fast service. Great location off the strip and on our way to Red Rock Canyon. :-)

peIpb9UkQWnGhGC8Z7mPHQ.text: Came here on a Sunday after working out at 24-hour.  Must have been early enough (around 1030AM), as we were seated right away.  Coffee was good, food was good.  We got a small stack of the grain pancakes, which was actually a pretty big stack.  They were good, but nothing to write home about.  Also got an omlete with cheese, bacon, and avocado.  Minimal avocado, tons of bacon and cheese.  After working out, would have preferred the reverse.  It was tasty though and came with a heaping side of cottage cheese and tomoatos.  Food tasted as expected.  Service was ok.  Not too spot on for a Sunday, which one would think would be the prime breakfast day.  Cost was around $20 for above mentioned food and 2 coffees.  Wish I would've ordered that cinnamon roll in a mug- looks divine!  The crowd must come around 11AM, as there were 4 or 5 parties waiting for a table.

Cu22QJ9y3Tyo5nSwSZ9kZw.text: So far the best breakfast we've had in Vegas! So many omelettes to choose from! I had the sandy omelette (bacon & avocado) with the cinnamon raisin pot of bread.  Crispy bacon, perfect amount of avocado. A healthy portion, I was Almost able to finish it.  My company had the spinach florentine, beautifully poached eggs.  And their coffee cups are BIG.  Made me wonder why all restaurants don't use big cups? Staff here moves fast, tables turn quick and food flies out of the kitchen.  I never had to ask for a refill someone was constantly filling our coffees and waters. Glad we got here early a line started quickly but I can't imagine anyone waited more than 10 minutes.  I was so satisfied with my meal but when I saw a waitress carrying some French toast covered in glazed apples I almost wanted to sit down and eat again!  And then I heard there was a chocolate caramel pot of bread.. So much more I want to try! We will definitely be back again during our stay here. Also, There was a 10% discount for posting on social media! Great place.

YG8QElXZb6mqLiQ4NKXphw.text: Jamms is definitely one of my favorite breakfast places.  I love the menu's variety.  There's always something that catches my attention, even when I'm not really hungry.  My go to item is the "Denver potato pancakes".  They're less like pancakes, and more like shredded hash browns mixed with diced ham, and vegetables, but they are absolutely amazing.  The portions here are huge, too.  You can get two meals out of most of the entrees here. I'm not in love with the country kitsch grandma's kitchen decor, but considering the fact that a lot of their customers ARE grandmas, I can't complain too much.  Especially when the food is that good.

vTfVcjXVXlg4kVLS2-rl7w.text: After yesterdays encounter we wanted to revisit a friendly place that we know we can get a nice meal and great service.  Jamms once again provided us with top notch service, very generous portion sizes.  We joined them early in the morning for breakfast to which we were promptly seated and drink orders were taken immediately and brought out right away.  Other than my wife getting a bagel instead of an english muffin, which she didn't mind getting, it was great!  My drink never dropped below half full.  Great staff and great food.  Waiters and waitresses in Vegas could learn something from a small ma & pop place like this about customer service and attitude.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

jsgvOFp1tzEr8h80igedqg.text: So, if you have visiting European tourists and want to introduce them to an authentic, tasty, FILLING American breakfast, THIS IS THE PLACE. They're big enough to share. So, if you order the ham and eggs and your friend orders a shortstack it would be plenty. That's not what we did however. We had the corned beef hash and eggs, ham and eggs and a shortstack. The hash was as people claim one of the best restaurant hashes...not as good as my own, though. :P The ONLY thing that was pretty terrible was the coffee....or dishwater.

MQ6d3_wRY5KVpmR3-tkmvA.text: Best corned beef hash I've ever tasted! Even the English muffins were amazing! Also had the pumpkin cream cheese pot of bread which was also really good. Service was amazing! Definitely want to come back to try more dishes.

yHws8ytTDPadmZ1XtkRDhw.text: This is a LONG time family favorite of ours. My mom has been going here for 15+ years. My best friend and I take our kids in now, at least once a month.  The service is outstanding! It's always the same group of ladies, and they remember everything. Kids names, drink orders, our regular menu choices. It's impressive to say the least!  The menu is vast to say the least. My all time favorite is the Sandy omlette. Think BLT with avocado wrapped in fluffy eggs, melted cheese and sour cream. You have your choice of bread side- but I would recommend the pot of bread. It's always slightly under baked, which we have grown to love.  Make Jamm's you family favorite, and let me know what you think!

jHr-UQhLtCr0vGJe34M8KQ.text: They charged me for my supposed" free pot of bread" that you get by checking in on yelp.

LIutUHgHr9O19YncUlk5bQ.text: I've dined here four times.....  The first time: I ordered the turkey, swiss and pear wrap........WTF?  Flavor explosions with every bite.  So good, I knew that it could easily become a "go to" item when decisions had to be made on the fly.  Also, on the side, I order their famous bread in a pot.  If you LOVE fresh bread and carbs as much as I, you'll flip for this warm, doughy goodness!  (sigh)  The second time: I ordered the Jamms breakfast sandwich; scrambled eggs, ham, cheese, Texas toast.............typical flavors for a typical breakfast sandwich.  Yet again, I ordered the bread in the pot and it melted in my mouth!  It is the business!!!  The third time: I was craving good 'ole steak and eggs so I made my way to the closest breakfast joint.  No, I'm lying, I wanted the bread in the pot!!!  =)  I'm a medium-rare, over medium kinda girl, and when the steak came out chewy and well done and the eggs, over-hard, I was terribly disappointed.  The only thing that was eaten that meal were the hash browns (you can't mess up potatoes, can you?) and the POT OF BREAD (of course)!  On my most recent visit to Jamms, I decided to order my "GO TO" turkey, swiss and pear wrap........decision well made, THANK GOD!  As usual, I ordered the POT OF BREAD, and LOVED every moment of it! =)  ~The service is wish-y wash-y at best.  One time I'll have over the top exceptional attention, and other times I'll be flagging the server down because I've gone 20 minutes (literally) without any sort of look my way. ~The menu is large........nearly 20 omelets alone! ~The POT OF BREAD is what keeps me coming back!!!  I dream about that bread!  Every time I drive past Jamms (which is often) I think about that bread!  UGH...........I want some NOW just writing about it!!!   =) ~I'll continue to give this place a shot......they can thank the POT OF BREAD for that!  =)

VPDHZScmwzGWezkwI3vkYw.text: In my quest to find a new breakfast spot as I was growing tired of my usual places I found Jamms Restaurant. I wish I could say that I believe Jamms Restaurant is jammin' or had some delicious  and wondrous homemade jam, however I cannot but that is alright just like how the restaurant is alright.  Mostly certainly it was a miscommunication between myself and the name of the restaurant as I thought that perhaps the restaurant would serve some awesome jam, but to my dismay only the pre-packaged Knott's jam is available.. darn.  The menu consist of your typical breakfast items, omelets, sandwiches, corn beef hash, pancakes, but you don't need something extraordinary as long as the ordinary is consistently delicious. Although during my visits I was not particularly impressed by my dishes. Reason being is that I felt that my Jamm's signature omelet which was composed of steak, bearnaise sauce, murshrooms and cheese was somewhat bland and my steak was difficult to chew. I also had a piece of my friend's Jamm's french toast which was battered and covered in corn flakes, my impressions are that I will probably stick with the normal french toast as the specialty is a little mushy for me.   The service was jammin' though, the waitress were friendly, helpful, and refilled my water often. My dining companions went MIA after ordering but the waitress was very understanding and patient with that, always monitoring when my friends would come back to the table. However I would like to mention that the waitress had no clue what I was talking about when I mentioned the Yelp special nor did the cashier, which made things a little embarrassing for myself as I had to explain their special promo to receive my free pot of bread.. the jammin' stopped there unfortunately.  Maybe in the future when I am tired of my usual breakfast places again I will give Jamms another try or perhaps for lunch I could jam with the California Club

ENIUySO-tJeFqVCXDya59Q.text: Jamms has the best chicken soup in the world!  : )  The owners are extremely friendly and so are the waitresses.  They always remember that i drink ice tea with extra lemon and always go the extra mile!

L-EAOwue4xX4RRdmeRtWJg.text: Yummy food!  Homemade chicken soup and bread bowls!  Great local place for breakfast or lunch!

7KJMAaGvsyVPmhaqw48jvg.text: This place was great, my brother brought us there for breakfast and it was excellent!

Eb3cMQJPiG-OYEOWjfQ4Iw.text: You HAVE to come here when you visit Vegas. Old school decor, sweet waitresses.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ot6rVWLlQq58-G-wLH5UdA.text: First off, they are not a chain and I LOVE that!!  You must try the blueberry pot of bread. It is amazing. It is a special, so you have to catch them on the right week. Their plain pot of bread is just as good though.They have the best ham around.They grill it perfect! The owner is always there to greet you when you walk in.The waitresses are always friendly. I have never had a bad meal here. They are known for their pot of bread, so make sure to order one when you stop in!  Also, I think it is a cute touch that they offer you gum, instead of those red and white mints everybody gives you on the way out.

uaqU6vXR6U-iq-ZDfZyUtQ.text: Have been going here for...  hmm probably 10 years.  I live around the corner and I love this breakfast spot.  Service is good, prices are reasonable, food is tasty.  They also deal REALLY well with specialty orders to the point where they know..  eggs benedict, dry english muffin, sauce on the side, fruit instead of potatoes lol.

MIFd0hRwjNX3PTJaMVqHjg.text: Went there for a late breakfast with the family.  Place was "Jamming", but only had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated.  Service was friendly as always.  I had the Jamms Special, with a cinnamon raison pot of bread and it was devine.  The pot of bread was mouthwatering and the omelet was huge.  They have some the best house coffee in town.  Will be going back again.

q1JikVlqXyG1QoinhK2osw.text: My family and I have been going to this restaurant since I was 12, that is currently 11 years. There are 3 people who I see everytime I go that have been there since before we first went there and they always greet me with and extra big smile. I recently took my wife and her parents and our nephew and there was not one complaint about the whole meal. I was suprised that my super picky fatherin law who is also an amazing cook did not say 1 bad thing about the meal and that was a shocker, he always complains. This restaurant is wonderful, the pot of bread is to die for (if it's fresh) and they are aware of the Yelp, free bread deal, and the waitresses are always so very nice. It is definitely 1 of my favorite places to eat in Vegas.

lihxFRzUcV-5-TqrMuEeag.text: My wife and I ate at Jamms this past weekend for breakfast, and let me tell you, this is somewhere we will be coming back to all the time because it was amazing.  We had one of their pot breads to start (cinnamon raisin), which was awesome and free with yelp checkin! The sweetened butter was fabulous too.  For our mains, I had the breakfast burrito which was a perfectly prepared burrito filled with eggs, onions, and cheese and some delicious hash browns.  It was excellent.  But as good as that was, my wife's Jamms breakfast sandwich was better.  It was easily the best breakfast sandwich I've had.  Ham, cheese, eggs, thick Texas toast.  It was fabulous.  The home fries were delicious as well.  With that said, I also have to comment on the outstanding service provides by the employees at this establishment.  From the moment we came in and the hostess took our name to the end of our meal, service was friendly and outstanding.  We were greated promptly, sat at a perfectly clean table as soon as it was ready (there was a line when we arrived, as the place is deservedly popular), and our drinks (coffee and water) never reached empty.  Orders were taken quickly, food was brought promptly, it was a tour de force of outstanding service. And, to top it all off, this place is a great value.  Prices were extremely reasonable!  Overall I cannot recomment this place enough.  Go here and enjoy.  You will love it!

VfEKsJdZu0Sk2uho9eDONg.text: I enjoy this little place.  I think a lot of other people are too!! Packed this morning.

07mzH3yixDhqkVdgXKLJPw.text: I love breakfast food!  This place is amazing and looks to have been around for a long time!  I think it's a hidden jem!  Took family here to eat breakfast once and now everytime they visit, we have to go to Jamm's at least once...even their friends came here on a recommendation!    The omelettes are huge and so the the pancakes.  They both taste great also!  They are even able to do egg subsitute upon request!  They offer sides with the main breakfast items and I recommend the "pot-of-Bread".  It's soooooo good!  They always have cinnamon raisin and plain...but they also have their "special" which ranges from jalapeno chedder to s'mores!  All of it is great!  Price is reasonable, wait is reasonable, wait staff and hostess are always happy and helpful!  Give it a try if you're ever on that side of town!

r4-tpA_JSNHP9jYPh_rg8Q.text: We went here for breakfast. It is a Mom and Pop place. It is a ways off the strip, but the food is worth it. It has good food and the service is quick here. Got a omelet that had a lot of bacon and cheese. My husband got a scramble and it really filled him up. Everyone is very friendly and recommend great things to try. We will be back here again.

lYJNMq9_EWhNcTTIqPP5mQ.text: I love this place!!! I first got to know about this little piece of breakfast heaven from my co-worker. We had breakfast here before heading to the desert to go off-roading.  So let's start with the location.. It's located on Rainbow and Charleston. It's way off the Strip. But it sure is a local favorite. Finding a parking spot close enough is not always easy but it can only mean one thing.. Jamms is packed! They do get really busy and you might have to wait a few minutes to be seated but I'm telling you it is worth your while.  About the service. Nothing but the most jolly and caring people. It's like coming to breakfast at grandma's or your aunt. The servers always have a big smile on their faces and you are always greeted warmly. Nothing can beat that to start your day!  Then there's the food.. Big generous servings. Since I checked-in on Yelp on our 3rd. visit (this morning) we got a FREE pot of bread.. You can choose either plain, cinnamon & raisin, or the special. I chose the special which for today was Peanut Butter & Spice. It was served with what I believe is a cream cheese butter spread. Oh, it's to die for!!!  We also got half a serving of their biscuits & gravy and OMG! It was delicious. I ordered Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs cooked over-medium (that's how I always have my eggs).  It came with hash browns and another pot of bread. This time I asked for it to be plain. And of course it did not disappoint. I finished my whole plate!!! I was so full.  My fiance ordered a Panini Bread with a side of Steak Fries and he said on his first bite, "Oh my God! This is a great Panini!" And he doesn't always pay much compliments about sandwiches.. Only the well deserving ones.  All in all, our dining experience at Jamms is great as always! We shall come back again sometime soon.. I strongly recommend them for people looking for a good straight-forward and unpretentious breakfast/brunch for cheap with awesome service.

lIPxOLhzaq8SNCE9gy-jTw.text: This breakfast spot is awesome I live in California but visit family frequently and always try to come here . The food is delicious and service is great definitely a family tradition coming here now to put one by me would be great :).

PK1GTVmKfKe_m-0gDWrpWA.text: Jamms is family friendly, with great food and better service. Everything comes out hot. This visit we wanted chili cheese fries & my mom is diabetic so she asked if she could have them on sweet potatoes instead, they told her sure. They tasted great.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili cheese fries made with sweet potatoes! Thanks Jamms

YOEv5d1Mb6Zlzo0JTd_SIw.text: Everything was fantastic the atmosphere was great and the service was on point. Everybody was really friendly and will come back again soon.

W3AyB8Z6xv49FkISZj_m1Q.text: Very good Friendly good food fair pricing my only negative comment would be the floors need to be replaced the carpet is done for ! All in all that would not keep me from coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy just yummy common bread with cream cheese a must have !!!
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice little dinner I was impressed with their friendly service and wide variety of drinks. Free pot of bread yummy! Decent price

wzb_6gJRlxgx5XWj5tKiXw.text: Best breakfast I've ever had in LV.  Large portions of heavenly goodness!   Don't miss the pot of bread...out of this world.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Couldn&#39;t eat it all, but wish I could.  Best Omelette ever!

_HQpIzvafHIz0tVmRyqHQQ.text: Well this used to be our every sunday breakfast  spot.  We stopped coming for awhile due to the quality of food we felt was slipping. Today we wanted to give it another try. Service was a little slow and the food came out cold. Staff is always friendly

FwQ0LNuTgWQDcBtxTSaLPw.text: This place was average. I was excited to try the food but my boyfriend and I thought it was somewhat bland. We walked in as first timers and waited for a while before I had to approach the hostess myself that was up front starring at customers/walking around but not asking if she could help them..it was awkward. The pot bread was the only thing worth mentioning but the country skillet and eggs Benedict with sausage was again avg. Gravy wasn't very flavorful neither was the sausage. The waitress forgot our side order but she took it off the bill. At least the food was reasonably priced and we didn't have to wait..meh

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country skillet. Have had way better
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict w/sausage..tasted ok

hYvbHZSV_g8tMMJtawDwHA.text: Nuh not impressed with this place. Wait was to long service was ok. Food? Oh well I have had better food at other places. Their favorite pot of bread they say its so delicious was just meh. Weekly choice was cherry cream cheese, nothing to rave about to be honest. Coffee was just normal cup of coffee. (Free refill)  The portions are big sizes but I dont care about the size I rather have small portion but tasty instead of huge size but no taste. Waitress was nice, front people were nice, but wont be going back.

1b2UqmROxCtKOWRjyfaRog.text: Absolutely love this place! Not only is the food delicious, the portion are great, and the menue is always updating with something new! Try the pot of bread, especially in the fall!

axlNornu6SxxPhL2kz_SYg.text: Good basic breakfast joint.  I ordered "tapas" style breakfast.   I had a classic egg Benedict and the Babalama omlette.  Great concept

g8V3oaA-Y22hcTEk6hDL5g.text: Loved our breakfast!! The service was great and the food was yummy as usual..I had a breakfast burrito ans my fiance had the egg breakfast.. so good

bUCa_uvJJe6hoeQDC0-8Wg.text: The food was good. They have a lot of unique breakfast options. The best part is that they serve breakfast all-day. Where can you get breakfast on a Monday after 12? Also love that they have a tapas menu. People like me usually want everything on the menu but don't want to overeat or spend too much. So the tapas menu is perfect.

bYce-SR5TlFqDqfAdrrYRg.text: I've eaten here many time, but have only tried 1 menu item. I get the  N.J. Sloppy Joe every time I go. It has three layers of rye bread filled with roast beef, turkey, corned beef, coleslaw and 1000 island dressing. Awesome!

mRsM2u1V0EgIJjSc1EBD2g.text: Jamms is our favorite local breakfast joint in town. Great food and the best server's ever!

udX-jRA_ffH4eCHurkhWBA.text: Very courteous and prompt service.. Food was exceptional. Will return! Chicken and waffle is so good

_x_bbfCf6f1tKjSXAesRfA.text: I have to say that the staff here, to a person, was very polite and cheerful!! No exaggeration!!  I have mixed emotions on my breakfast choice, though. I asked for soft scrambled eggs but got them no where close. Near the end of my meal, an unidentifiable but conspicuous particle was in my eggs.  It could have been egg white in my scrambled eggs or a very small piece of wet paper. Even the waitress was unsure. Stuff happens. All in all, I will try to visit again as this was my first visit- and there is no understating how Jamms clearly trains their staff to greet and serve the public well.

yr6zkZCODjrUgZXHGVVGCw.text: I wish this was closer to me because I really enjoyed their food. I went there a few months ago with my husband and his brother and sister in law, and I wish I can go more often if it wasn't for the distance. I ordered the corned beef egg Benedict, and it was great! I've had quite a few egg Benedicts, and I would say this one is definitely the best. We went there on a Sunday, and there wasn't a long wait to get seated. Maybe we just got lucky? I don't know, but I definitely approve.

B87bIKv4TuSb7gzJLWgqWA.text: This is a great breakfast or lunch place. Good selection of favorite foods,  good coffee and the pot of bread is always fab. Break it open and let the fresh-baked aroma make you happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hearty breakfast before a blood donation or just come for the coffee and bread.  Yum.

R0e-JoPRmoMUDVtwhBOWVQ.text: Great service! Great food! Had the pot of bread, sweet potato fries, and an amazing omelet!!! Recommend for brunch!!! Worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plain pot of bread, sweet potato fries, and a personalized omelet!!
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast

zx0han8fN4FdLB7d6tF11A.text: Great tasty food, too bad you can only have breakfast or lunch here. Asked for steak and eggs, and it was awesome. Coffee was delicious too. It'd been better if they would've taken the order quicker, almost 10 min later after sitting, and still the lady took the order from someone who sat after we had been assign a table...

qPhir40Y8Oa5-b1AqjxH_Q.text: Lovely food. Fast service. Great price. Very home style feel. Good portion size. Not too loud. If ur craving breakfast/brunch, this is THE Spot to go

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D0kdmZbLc4q0v9a9XqmI2g.text: Ewww weee. Some good food. We come from Los Angeles and make a way out to this spot. That hot bread though! I'd rather eat at the locals suggestion than those buffets st the casinos.

kxazLZYfPQEcWjc28SuLTw.text: Was going to try another place but it was not quite open so sad this on Yelp and so glad I stopped it. The Pot of Bread special was a yummy Peach, I devoured it. Also had the Corned Beef Eggs Benedict which was so tasty,  I had to take 1/3 of this dish home since I was so full (rich delicious coffee too) and it was even better the next day.  Very friendly and attentive servers also

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned Beef Eggs Benedict with Hash Browns Extra Crispy

dC_XWYmlCmDFf0NTws6lmQ.text: This is a great place for a person who wants to have some of all the breakfast foods, they have these great little "tapas" red plates where you can order a small amount of each thing you want. They also have specialty homemade breads every day.  Very good and very short wait.

8RB_plLoaoRuBccssi0YzA.text: Best local breakfast spot in Vegas. Massive portions, tasty pot-of-bread and limitless coffee. Son had the S'mores pancake, and it was ridiculous (in a good way). I come here at least once every time I'm in town, and that's at least 4-5 times a year.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ridiculousness.

RzERAQZ0k1puePHcDjnUQQ.text: We are from Thousand Oaks CA and we are in town this weekend visiting a family nember. A very nice man struck up a conversation with us and we talked about the recent fires in California. As we were leaving he quickly picked up our check and said it was on him! We want to thank this kind person for his generosity and kindness! Thank you!

d0wiBnddvzEYJUe1dxVwJw.text: 1st time here and what a great visit it was. Food is delicious, prices are affordable and best of all THE staff is super cool and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

C6vlDXTu_P0B96PL2x2Wiw.text: Well, back again at Jamm's that never fails to satisfy with its great variety of food. Definitely is a good place to go for delicious breakfast food. I am currently trying their specialty omelet: the bearnaide sauce is what makes this item special. Try their Pot of Bread - always a good accompaniment.

-SDCvjSSSCiL6wjS98s_cw.text: Just dropped in after reading the reviews. This place didn't disappoint.  My hubby and I shared a build your own omelet and it tasted great. Their French toast is nice and crunchy. Their raising in a pot is very tasty. Will come here again.

Uzf48Qkf49htBJksh02VDg.text: Now I didn't know what a 'pot of bread' even was before I got here. I don't even know if that's a Jamms specialty or not. It's fantastic. The 'pot of bread' is the type of treat that breakfast places offer that I have a particular fondness for. They have a selection of other breakfast type foods that aren't bread and that don't come in pots (or little aluminum cups).   The corned beef omelette is what I decided on. It was deemed a house favorite and I thought it could be risky. You think corned beef wouldn't be too hard, but I've had my share of salt with a touch of corned beef before. The beef was delicious and this meal all held up pretty well. They do sauerkraut and cheese in the omelette as well as the corned beef. The sauerkraut wasn't wet or overpowering, a nice compliment to the beef. There were hash browns I wish I could tell you more about but I inhaled them. Gone almost as quickly as they arrived. I think you already know my feelings about that soft, supple, raisin 'pot o bread' with the whipped butter that spread like like love on top.  The one touch that really had me was the kindness and the cheer from the staff. Nothing but smiles and friendliness. When we went, it had been raining pretty much all morning. I could hear our waitress tell other tables (and us) when we left to be safe driving out there. You just can't help but smile on that thoughtfulness. Definitely feels like you are eating in your grandma's kitchen and that's an amazing place to be.

gdGhA4Hhqv27Tw05dhaLNQ.text: Attractive decor. Very friendly staff. I had the country eggs Benedict. They were good. They and the potatoes lacked seasoning. Both needed salt. I am from the south  and am used to Country gravy that has a good amount of black pepper. I will go back and try some of the other awesome sounding plates.

I2FMTlN4Rn7i8cZ7U1XI-A.text: Great food.  Kind people.  I had eggs Benedict, the hubs had country omelette.  Would recommend both.  Will go again.  Pot of bread was delicious.

BXNJkycLqvf7gI045jATgg.text: First time here, and totally coming back! Thank you to my Yelp flock for never leading me astray! I read your reviews, I heard you loud and clear!   We came here 10 am on a Sunday morning. The wait turned out to not be bad since a lot of people in line before us had given up. Sad for them, awesome for us!  We were promptly seated, brought menus and coffee, and greeted by our enthusiastic server, Sandy (Hi, Sandy!). I told her I was checking in on Yelp and she was thrilled to tell me that I got a free pot of bread.   We ordered: - White Castle omelette - $5 small plate egg white/no cheese omelette - Pot of bread - flavor of the week was strawberries and cream  HOLY POT OF BREAD! These are amazing. It's like angels from heaven came down and manifested themselves into a gooey, fluffy, warm pocket of bread.   $5 egg white omelette was the perfect size! I try to eat a healthy breakfast, but when portions are gigantic, it's impossible. The veggies inside were nicely cooked. It is a great small bite to order.  THEY HAVE SUPER HUMAN BUST BOYS! Twice we watched bust boys catch dropped plates in mid-air. It was really quite impressive.   I had such a great dining experience here, and will be back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Castle omelette
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small bite. Egg white veggie omelette

9kNWyGCQay5jSXauhaQW0w.text: First time to this establishment to get a great breakfast experience.  Customer service is friendly but attention to customers is low.  Trouble getting water and coffee refills.  When confirming we were ready to order waitress took it as a no because we were trying to ask a question about menu item and walked off.  Food is fair at the very most.  Just plan even when ordering things like Jamm's French toast which 1/4 piece was enough to know it was a bad choice. Ruben Omelette had no seasoning and had no resemblance to a Rueben sandwich.  So I fail to see the real interest.  Too each his or her own, but would never be compared to home or southern cooking.

bOAhmWP9qhmi9r31koK0Rw.text: I always love Jam's  Just make sure they r opened before u arrive :) Thanks guys!!! Their biscuits and gravy remind me of my small town childhood like Dorothy,

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flew in from SF for this :) So happy

uF3Jz-AtrALkhqE8uzNsXQ.text: Didn't care too particularly for the food. Pot of bread isn't what I thought, too much hype.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wanted to try finding new for breakfast. They were alright. Pot of bread was not what I expected.

DArxHhlq6tlPluS56RHQUw.text: Great atmosphere, old fashion feel and great service. Food smells fill the air and reminds me of the old fashion diners my grandfather took me to

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fast Service Fresh Food great place to eat
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple juice looks freash

gKTXwDLdnE0xM9Xm_iXJNA.text: I came here one weekend morning while out and about. The wait was about 10 minutes for 2 people. The place was packed. Wait staff was busy trying to keep up with the demands. Food was pretty average. The jalepeno pot of bread was very tasty. Service was friendly.  My big gripe was all the yelling that took place during our meal. The ladies at the register trying to seat parties and the wait staff yelling when a table was cleared and clean. It was just not a very relaxing environment. If I wanted to hear all that squawking, I would go to my in-laws. I think there are too many other breakfast places around town that have a more warm, welcoming, and relaxing vibe that I look for.

eUiQt_QW9DP6Zu487jFD_Q.text: I just don't understand the hype.   I found everything to be just ok. Vegas has so many great breakfast options. I much rather Eggworks/Egg & I, Hash House a gogo, or Babystacks.

sopZGoi0Ggwih8H9NHgVxA.text: So after many years of coming to this place with awesome food I was very disappointed with the end of our visit yesterday morning we got told to order something else or get out since they needed the table ... hadn't been more than 10 minutes since we finished our food ... so sad very disappointing!

rBV26VY52a4NJh4dI-_QWQ.text: Went here super excited to try the food especially the bread.  Walked in... the place was adorable, smelled delicious, and the initial interaction with the staff was pleasant.  We were immediately greeted with drinks and told our server would be with us shortly.  Out of nowhere, a lady with short gray hair and glasses says are you ready to order?  My gf answers no but had questions for her about a couple of the meals.  Before she could ask anything the lady was gone.  About a minute later she comes back and says what was it that your were going to ask me?  My gf says what are your recommendations she says then I am walking away and proceeded to walk away.  At this point we're thinking she joking... nope!  She never came back to answer the question but later came back and said did you decide yet?  We again answered no and she walked away again.  Y'all I have never experienced anything like that in my life!  There are far too many food places to choose from to eat!  I refuse to give any business my money that treats their customers like that!  She was very rude and very unprofessional.  We got up and left! Came to the Omellette House and the treatment was night and day and the food was amazing!

iWb24RNdt-7tHwqDeqzG8w.text: We came here on a Monday around 11:30, Presidents' Day. It was pretty busy for a Monday. We waited about 10 min to be seated and then another 15 min until someone came by and said hello to us. Once we placed an order the food came out fast and was very good but my husband kept commenting on the service that he wasn't happy with. Overall, I would recommend this place because the food is good, it's a local business off the strip and we might have been there on an off-day for service.

Q0G9zpGIGXNIvYAK7_JBig.text: There is nothing that the staff here could improve on. perfection is achieved! love this place, so good! large portions, delicious food, good people!

s7d5ALh932c50eMVUgLVUQ.text: Dining at Jamms is like a meal at your grandmas. You feel at home, the food is familiar and has that home cooked look and taste. It's comfort food. Chicken noodle soup, as simple as it is can be the True test of a proper kitchen. Starts with the broth. You know it's from scratch from the first spoonful. You also get tender chicken, and an assortment of fresh veggies that are cooked just right, not soggy. The half BLT, although small was packed with bacon, the thick kind that you can bite into. Just a simple classic lunch combo that fills the belly and warms the heart.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rWVVYDaJPVSZAtNgZFVdRQ.text: How have I never tried this place?  It was awesome.  Food, service, selection all great.  The portions are huge.  The pot of bread is tasty.  I could just make breakfast a few of them and I'd be happy.  This will definitely be one of our go to places from now on.

8h1euS0YSGC8bmJeKTprMQ.text: Whenever I come to Vegas, I have to make it a point to come visit and eat here. I always get the Reuben omelette. So delicious!!! And I love their pot o bread

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ywkPl5ycELQUzmabKr1UlQ.text: Jams is all ways a perfect breakfast place. Pot of bread is fantastic all the employees are very nice, Sandy, Shirley and Jose. They have the best chicken noodle soup lunch... our 3rd check in at Jams and again food was perfect. Sandy, Shirley and Jose are the best. Pot of bread is wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

870hFpPOM3tW_aGhOBZ2aQ.text: Fantastic breakfast spot located in this side of town! My boyfriend and I were in the area this morning and decided to stop in here for a bite to eat. Although it's been a few years since we've been back to Jamms, I do have to say that this place is still as good as I remembered it to be. The service is quick and the staff are super friendly. Our waitress was very attentive and always checked on us frequently. My boyfriend ordered the ham steak & eggs and I ordered the Florentine benedict with a a request to add Canadian bacon to it. Everything came out hot and fast. The food was delicious (especially the pot of bread). In addition, the prices are reasonable and the portions are huge! Btw, remember to check in to get a free pot of bread. I highly recommend this place! We will be back for sure.

p_7n7S6OrX7jKS-i38iAmQ.text: I am not sure why this restaurant has such raving reviews.  Maybe because there aren't that many breakfast joints in this neighborhood, but I definitely did not enjoy my visit here.  And I definitely came here with an open mind and ready to love this restaurant since it is so close to my office.   Visited on a Saturday morning and it was busy but we didn't have to wait long for a table.  It took a while for our drink order to be taken and then a while longer for our server to take our food order, but it wasn't that big of a deal.    We had the seasonal pumpkin roll, the no-longer-on-the-menu french toast sandwich and the pancakes combo.  Nothing was spectacular or worthy of writing home about.  The only thing I enjoyed there was my coffee, which was better than average.    Our server did not check up on us once except when she took our order and when she gave us our check.  However, we noticed she checked on all the other tables around us.  Again, it's not that big of a deal since we are relatively low maintenance, but it was an interesting observation.    Maybe the other Jamms-goers know something we don't know, but unfortunately I won't be returning to this establishment.

Az-1vkwUVADKSaAYaRDsVQ.text: Pretty standard breakfast/brunch/diner spot. I didn't pay close enough attention to reviews or the menu on the coffee, make sure and order the fresh pressed coffee!!!!!! Otherwise you get a cup of light brown water with a hint of coffee aroma attached. Seriously I could see completely through to the bottom of the cup. The large orange juice was infact quite large.... a small carafe. I had the Jamm's Breakfast Sandwich with Ham. It is thin sliced ham, cheese, and scrambled egg on Texas toast. It comes with a side of hash browns or breakfast potatoes.  This was okay..... not great, not bad. Probably wouldn't order it again. My hubby had the Mattys Country Benedict. Two poached eggs, sausage patty on a biscuit covered with country gravy. He said his was okay.  Again, not bad...... but with so many other options, I can't see us coming back anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamm&#39;s Ham Breakfast Sandwich with Hashbrowns

TAQJ4SDdByvVjjjAmmz-Cw.text: Arrived on a Sunday morning at around 8:30 am and it was already crowded. Waited about 15 minutes for a party of 6. This place is good. It's no wonder why they've won Trip Advisor Best of LV for four years in a row. If you're looking for an affordable brunch in LV, it's a must try.  Coffee - good.   Pot of Bread - lots of hype, but all air - literally. If you must try it, do so. If you don't, you're not missing much.  Breakfast Burrito - delicious especially with all that cheese and potatoes. Lots of going in this burrito, but you won't be disappointed.   Fried Chicken Waffle Sandwich - the star in this dish is the waffle. The fried chicken was crispy as was the waffle. The waffle had a sweet and cajun-like seasoning. Yummy. The tomatoes and lettuce tricked your mind thinking this sandwich was actually healthy. Regardless, it's good.  Corned Beef Hash - Different, but good. It's homemade with ample bits of cured ham. It could have been more "hashy", so it worked more like a skillet. The potatoes were good, but wasn't integrated well into the ham. Again, different, but tasted good.  French Toast - tried the the traditional french toast as well as the french toast sticks. This was my favorite dish. The french toast was made with thick toast and battered and fried to a nice crispy outer texture. The inside of the french toast was fluffy and moist. The french toast sticks were fun and easy to eat. Again, crispy outer and moist inner.   Service was courteous and prompt. You get 10% off with Yelp check-in.

IuMx5tVvljv9CYQaqvs8oA.text: Brought the kids in for a weekend breakfast.  They were pretty busy but we were seated quickly.  I ordered the Reuben Benedict and the kids all got the Lumberjack Jr's. Another element or two of the Reuben would have improved it.  The kids were happy with their meals.  Service was ok.  They were busy so I don't really fault them for that.  Overall I would give them another try if I was in the area.    They don't take Discover.

0NTumkjfNzG08Er8BOlfiw.text: This is probably one of my favorite breakfast joints on the west side. Don't let the size of the restaurant fool you. As small as it is, they make up for it by serving generous portions!   The service is top notch and even though it was pretty busy since it was a Sunday morning, our waitress was super attentive.  The food came out quickly and tasted amazing. I'll definitely be back for more breakfast food because their they have such a big breakfast menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XsYpKwdy3IrvQVA_EQ7Uxw.text: Oh no- what happened to Jamms? Used to be my fave brunch spot but after today, No more! I ate the Pot of Bread which was very good; But, my eggs were so over cooked and the potatoes were not edible. Hard on the outside and mush on the inside. So I left paying $12 for a soft drink and pot of bread. The food has really gone downhill in my opinion. Never again for me. I'll cook my own eggs next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuck!

F_kLxESkcYtUW9Tvpt3hUQ.text: I don't get it. The only thing that I would order again was the pot of bread, which is essentially a dinner roll in a muffin tin. I tried the cinnamon raisin and the peaches and cream. They were both good, and slightly undercooked, which makes the dough delicious, but it's not worth coming back for. The cinnamon raisin was the normal white bread roll with cinnamon and raisins sprinkled on top after it was done cooking, and the peaches were the same way: white roll with a spoonful of cooked peaches dropped on top after baking. Meh.  The other food we got was mediocre at best and the ingredients were clearly low quality: canned mushrooms andcanned black olives, frozen spinach, what seemed like reheated Arby's meat, and precooked egg patties for the omelets. They were just the spongey egg patties like you might get at subway (except larger) and then some low quality ingredients warmed up and placed inside like an egg taco. Service was okay but I felt like they waited a long time to bring the check, which we felt guilty about because there were people waiting for tables. Everyone was friendly, and it was bustling, but I don't understand why it's so highly rated. Wouldn't go back.   Update: since the owner of the restaurant responded with saying that the ingredients are fresh and there are a whopping six eggs in each omelet, I just feel like it's worth stating that there's no chance in hell thats True. So I don't know if this was actually the owner, and he has no idea what's happening in his kitchen, or if that was written by someone hired to pretend to be the owner and respond to negative reviews... but either way, I'm not an idiot and I know when I'm looking at canned mushrooms and canned olives. I've made a quickie pizza a time or two. Also, yesterday I made 5 eggs scrambled for my son and I. Again, I'm not an idiot and I have some frame of reference to understand what a certain count of eggs looks like in a skillet. There's absolutely no possibility that six eggs were used in my omelette. I think it would've been a lot better on the part of the restaurant to own up to the cheap ingredients instead of lie to defend their kitchen. Dropping this review to 2 stars from 3.

jIhGExHHpItB9I5SQ4lQcQ.text: Perfect for all ages. The food was fresh, fast and delicious. My service was polite and friendly. This is a great find! I will be back.

c3wWlQ5M9zSV1KTWuqHeHQ.text: All but one day in all the years I've been coming here, I've had EXCELLENT service, and the food has always been EXCELLENT!!  I come here every time I'm up in this area.  It's a real gem....if you haven't been here, you really need to try it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dNOKm8dD90oSeDiVW8OFvA.text: I've had the pleasure of eating at this gem of a diner only twice. I make it a point to have breakfast here whenever I come to Vegas. Believe me it's worth the trip. The pot of bread is delicious and at the time we got it free with a check in. It was so good we bought 3 more to go. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the potatoes were crispy. Can't wait to go back to Vegas and more importantly Jamms.

PuBTl0L_jxENU9JAUFiOBw.text: Food is good and service is good. The one thing that stuck out as an irritant, was the price of soda. This place charges over $3 for a soft drink. I eat out quite a bit, and most/better restaurants charge $2 for soft drinks. I know this is a little thing, but I found it irritating. A glass of soda cost the place between 18-26 cents per glass, making that percentage of profit off one item is somehow insulting. I may eat there again, because the location is convenient for me, but no more soda with lunch.

svAl5L0X_pjb01pMLSA0vQ.text: Every time we make a Vegas trip, we squeeze Jamms in. Their breakfast is great. My personal favorite is the Jamms French toast. It's off the strip but a great place for breakfast. I can't speak on their lunch items but breakfast is pretty good.

vqKSNZ1CDaB0igmV2GvuHg.text: We had a really good breakfast here. I especially enjoyed the cinnamon raisin pot of bread. We will definitely be returning to enjoy another meal at this nice little restaurant.

HHlhEs11XfCATjPdilYP2g.text: Had breakfast at James and it was great.  Staff was awesome and the food was too.  The owls school dinner feel was priceless.  The whole experience was over the top.  Look forward to my next trip to Jamms.

SPD2kiAxivt9lPLfuiYeew.text: Great meal, the food was very tasty! Great portions, I couldn't eat everything and had to take a to-go box.  The service was excellent.  I would eat here again!

KAvmp1IKp0u8T5M2PrHujw.text: It's Denny's, village inn, not quite ihop  Cheap greasy ingredients, orange juice from a machine ffs. Look if you are going to try to be a better breakfast place, try fresh local ingredients, try fresh orange juice. Coffee was terrible, sausage came out cold, wheat toast was fried not toasted and lathered in grease.  The people are nice but I could have gotten the same exact thing at Denny's for half the price! Oh and $2 additional to add a couple of slices of banana to oatmeal?  Won't be back, terrible.

ebvLA5OH1IQn_qrl9M5kXQ.text: The service is your typical diner experience service. Everyone working is fast, friendly, and efficient. It did take a little while for us to get our orders in, but they were slammed on a rainy Friday morning/afternoon.   We started off with French toast sticks, and then I had the Florentine eggs Benedict. The spinach tasted frozen and had the freezer after taste to it, so that kind of turned me off a little. My cousin seemed to like her pancakes and eggs breakfast.   After we were finished, the waitress forgot to drop our check so we awkwardly sat there trying to get her attention until we finally went up to the cashier, and let her know we didn't have a check. I kind of drove out of the way because I was craving a gluttonous breakfast, but I think I'd stick to my Blueberry Hill staple next time I want pancakes and coffee.

OSoG9xNDR_8Updq5DLlKdA.text: When I lived in vegas I would always come here for breakfast.  Now every time I visit Las vegas I always have to come here.  The food is amazing and also the staff.  Sometimes there is a little wait especially on weekends,  but what do u expect with delicious breakfast/lunch? Love this place

nSPZ1nS0aPFMLVY5ND-3NA.text: My wife and I had come here previous with a friend and loved it. We came back a couple months later and it wasn't as good as I remember. The service lacked, no refills and food was cold. Plus, we saw our waitress drop the utensils on the floor they use for the bread and pick it back up and put it back in the butter. Needless to say, we won't be coming back.

lBRxmtPcu1yPoVOTgUFXLQ.text: I love Jamms! My mom and I usually split the Irish Skillet. The portions here are super generous so I find half sufficient. It's absolutely delicious! We also share the french press coffee, which is also delicious! I do wish they would bring pots of cream to the table instead of the mini creams, it seems wasteful to me.   The staff is really friendly and nice, and they are very accommodating. The service tends to be pretty quick as well! Plus they have a Yelp deal if you check in! 10% off your entree with drink purchase!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute new menu

Qn9RyaRFBLNMrcCaTxp0MA.text: My second visit to Jamms and I might be hooked! As an east coast girl, I grew up on diner breakfast and have been scouring the country for that homestyle familiarity. The LAST place on earth I thought I'd find it is Vegas.   Bringing my visiting PA native parents here at an off peak time (very important to avoid a long wait at this popular spot) we were seated immediately by friendly staff. Our waitress came over promptly and took our drink order. Consummate coffee drinkers, my family complimented Jamms regular brew. I've had their French press prior, and that was just as delicious.   Mom and Pop took forever to decide but two words on the menu immediately decided for me: taylor ham. This Jersey breakfast staple is impossible to find outside of the Mid-Atlantic!! The Taylor Ham breakfast sandwich with (gasp!) REAL griddled potatoes was my choice. One bite and I was transported back to college and better days. Listen, I'm not an asshole that waxes poetic about food for no reason, but I'm not kidding--the sandwich was bomb.   Mom got the 2 egg breakfast with bacon and hashbrowns because she's boring and a picky eater. It was as good as it gets with eggs over medium cooked perfectly. Dad got Joes omelet which was big enough to make him think twice about finishing the whole thing (he did though, because he is a machine).   The pot o bread--a fluffy roll baked in a muffin tin--was phenomenal. Do yourself a favor and get the flavored ones. Cinnamon raisin is a delicious choice!!  Our food was served almost immediately after ordering, and server Jasmine was perfectly attentive without being overbearing--a hard balance to master. This place is popular for a reason so be prepared to wait but trust me, it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food so good I forgot to take a picture first!

-iWHf5qTpAOXHI6zJA5YqQ.text: Pot of bread is great and the pot of bread french toast is amazing! They are busy but efficient. Wait time on a busy Sunday was only 10 minutes.

6CJMcyrAZ_ANLsvnc-q4Gw.text: Surprisingly we got seated right as soon as we walked in. I ordered the Jamms breakfast sandwich which had cheese egg and ham. It was very yummy but I did expect it to be a bit bigger. Instead of hash browns I ordered the home style fries which looked like mashed potatoes with bits of tomatoes and other stuff; didn't really like them. Over all the service was great and food was good for a quick breakfast stop. Super affordable too!

WYGvfNaZi80t4Ew_ZGCkFQ.text: I had seen Jamm's on Instagram and wanted to take my husband out for Father's Day breakfast. We arrived at 7:03 and the place immediately went from three people to nearly full in a few minutes. I was amazed at the menu choices. My husband ordered chicken fried steak and a biscuit. He liked the crunchiness. Coffee was good. I ordered the chicken waffle BLT which includes the very fresh tomato and lettuce. I liked the concept. The chicken was ok; the waffle was better. Bacon was ok. Our server, Jasmine, was very helpful and attentive. I am giving this cafe four stars for Jasmine and the atmosphere of very hard working employees and clean, old school decor. The food is a solid 3, and it is a pretty good option for breakfast.

zakTYrW76aZXJ-FURu2SbA.text: The food here is delicious and the service is on point! They are very attentive and make you know exactly what you're getting! This place is definitely well worth the visit!

kA99ZIVsFM-SFobF5aZRQA.text: Great service, friendly people an yummy food. I recommend to everyone. The sandy omelette is amazing or if you wanna do simple I also love the two egg breakfast!

YffHyv3rl0bFJrnNoI70kw.text: Boyfriend and I love this place! Even though it's far from where we live in the east side of town, we chose to go because of the great food and service. We always build our own omelette because they have a great variety to chose from! The servers and bussers are always nice and attentive, there's one server in particular that is great! I don't know her name but she's awesome! The cinnamon pot bread is delicious as well. Looking forward to my next visit to Jamms!

ugBX_1BjJjSvCm5FttTwhw.text: Great hometown feel...Wonderful service...Food amazing & plentiful. We will be back. If ever in the area encourage you to stop in.

IN2QtbPluhLbSaqyY3_90g.text: Looking for a place to eat breakfast at and stumble upon this hidden gem off the strip.    The tinted window hides the beauty of the inside.  Once you go inside its bright and modern.    Greater and was seated immediately and handed a menu.  A guy with coffee pot goes around asking if you want coffee or some other beverages.  The service was fast!!!   We ordered:  Corn beef hash and eggs with hash brown - it was so tasty and delicious.  Along with a day special of pot of bread - strawberry coconut fluff - it's to die for!   Ruben eggs Benedict - fiance said it was yummy and delish!! It's genuine.    Also ordered French toast sticks-- they were very filling and heavy.  I only ate one stick.    The food comes in good portions.  Our tummy are full and satisfied!! Oh and when you check in on yelp, you get  pot of bread for free and they have a promo when you show the server that you Instagram your food and tag them, they take 10% off your bill!   Definitely will come back to try the other favorites on their menu next time I'm in Vegas!!   By the way, I came in at 8:10 and was driving away at 8:40, that's how fast the service was.

Which was from the first bite insanely delicious. I had it w the hollandaise. My god.   Ran me 9.99 and they gave me 10% for three square donation. Shay was sweet... On it... And gone when she wasn't needed. I really recommend bringing a family member or someone you love and just relaxing like it's Sunday morning.   12:30pm on a Thursday and got a seat right away, but it was busy. 0ewo6M9Yg-a4Knn0glxheg.text: The bread, oh the bread. You have to get their bread. It tastes like the rolls my grandma use to make, so light and fluffy and rich. The food was good quality and what I expected, but I would go again and again for the bread. The bread comes in little muffin tins and they have different flavors with little sauces. They also have this option where you can try more than one thing by getting smaller plates, perfect for someone who can't make up their mind. But the bread is divine.

xVjCeJsLrj3OVqu6kqqR_Q.text: Unfortunately this is one of the very few good diners in town. They nail the temperature on the eggs pretty much every time. I love the cinnamon raisin potted bread. It's my favorite. Very good coffee.

kSdHHoskmyGs3jfTmHXJDw.text: I had a great breakfast here. Many low carb options, which is nice.  Great, friendly service. I had a delicious omelette with tomatoes, cream cheese, mushrooms and green onions.  My only complaint is about their coffee. Oh dear. It does not taste good.  I have been hear years before and had the bread pot and remember liking it. This time, I had to pass.

TjnvkmNPUqEYDongPuZCAA.text: With its homey atmosphere and tasty selection of breakfast favorites, Jamms Restaurant comes out to a respectable 4 star rating.  Service: 5/5 Our servers were polite and helpful when it came to selecting drinks and foods from the menu.  The food came out very quickly even though the restaurant was at full capacity, and the coffee was also given to us nice and hot.  We received a free pot of bread for checking in on Yelp!  Food: 4/5 Our main dishes were on our table less than 10 mins after we ordered it.  Somewhere before it came, we received our pots of bread.  I've had better, but it wasn't too bad.  It was just tad heavier and drier than what I personally prefer.  The food was decent.  I'd say its a tier above a typical Denny's or IHOP for sure.  Location: 4/5 The atmosphere of the place has an early 80's late 70's breakfast diner sort of feel to it.  Very warm with some character.  It pairs nicely with their breakfast selection, and I could see this place being a regular breakfast joint for people to go to and start their mornings in.  Overall: 4/5

It is a super cute mom and pop restaurant, and has a traditional American feel with delicious food. The cinnamon raisin bread pot was delicious. We both got a breakfastRito and some waffles to share. All was delicious! We definitely plan to return to this restaurant again for lunch!

e3CcciBKTIWxmYT0KLga8Q.text: I almost gave this Place 4 stars because the service is outstanding, I believe we had "Sherie" a talented server with a very unique voice and from what we witnessed she is well liked because many customers were coming to her and giving her a hug. We were at Treasure Island And a Guest recommended this place as the best breakfast in the area. The service is outstanding the Pot Of Bread we liked , but that was about it, I had the Chicken and Waffles, I wanted to be blown away, left half on the plate, Wish the Chicken was homemade. The French Toast Fries are a great a idea and not bad,My wife enjoyed the Hollandaise sauce on her benedict , My daughter  did not finish her Reuben Sandwich, Overall Jamms is a fun place with Great Service, I will ask some friends that live in the area to check it out, just in case we got them in a bad day

ryWo6rwqSCKWr5KaPmMh-w.text: I would have normally given a much better review but my father and I went by there just a bit ago today - I get that they close at 3 and I'm not trying to be one of "those people", it was a few minutes before 3pm when we arrived and I literally just wanted an order of biscuits and gravy (being 32 weeks pregnant I had my mind set on what I wanted). My father and I weren't looking for the whole sit down and be served experience, just the biscuits and gravy which we would have gladly taken to go if it had even been an option but the woman at the counter quickly snapped that they were closed/done for the day.   Fortunately there was a knowledgeable patron just outside that noticed I was pregnant, even he was a little surprised they wouldn't allow us to order anything, not even to go. He suggested we try Hash House A Go-Go, that's where my father and I are right now and the baby and I got our biscuits and gravy so we're happy again.

jH6VcNJXFRQdxiXn6NIhBQ.text: Yummy! The pot of cinnamon and raisin bread was a perfect way to start the beginning of fall. The Ruben is one of the best I've had in town. It's a great sign when they ask your preference of corned beef or pastrami.  The portions are very generous and the prices very reasonable. Be prepared to wait for 10 to 15 minutes to be seated but it sooo worth it the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5xxBZRGKgc20xr3IqLlH4w.text: I've been coming here for breakfast for almost 20 years. An old local told me about this spot and it's been my go to. I live in CA, and my best friend and I have driven to Las Vegas for breakfast. Lol. I know, sounds insane. But it's so good. Now I get to have it a few times a year and it's great. Not much has changed over the years, the food is always consistent and service is great. Thank you for being my favorite breakfast place ever.

kL9DAT_GXiurZyfJaFUp6Q.text: Decent food is served here at affordable prices.  We came during the middle of the week for breakfast after reading so many positive reviews.  Was looking forward to trying one of their pots of bread that we read so much about.  We came at a good time because we had no wait at all.  The restaurant was about half full.  Our server was terrific, friendly, attentive, and fast.    There are many choices on the menu.  We were getting confused because everything sounded so good.  I finally decided on Jamm's French Toast.  My wife ordered an omelet.  So, what did I think of the food?  Overall, it was okay.  Maybe, we did not order the best food off the menu.  Would I come here again?  Probably not.  There are so many breakfast places yet for us to try in Las Vegas.

qBtzpM-uu5s0bbwPxM0iww.text: A great place for breakfast!  I've had a couple different things on the menu and it was all great.   The restaurant is pretty outdated and really needs a renovation, but that won't keep me from coming here.

rTL9rUkIo8rpJLNKdPpKRw.text: I come here all the time i love the french toast sticks ....my fav and the chicken fried steak bomb sooo good not watery just yum yum yum

cAUFqlQH4X1qhVPzTPO-cw.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots in town! The Corned Beef Hash...just no words, it's so good. Oh and you have to get a pot of bread because if you don't there was no point of you coming to Jamm's, the bread is where it's at!

WAj3gQ0rMaD-vtESxi4yzA.text: We have come here for years and years.  You really can't beat the place and the service is over the top.  What a great place to have, we are lucky.

DWuqTTpmhKPOP_J0WVyF2A.text: A really good, of the strip place for breakfast.  I've found there's not a lot of places to grab breakfast on the strip, unless you're talking a buffet. Too many people still asleep I guess. But if you stay off the strip and are looking for a non-cookie cutter restaurant Jamms is it.  I had the eggs Benedict, which was perfect, and my girlfriend had the steak and eggs. We split a strawberries  and cream pot of bread which is really a must if you go here.   Service was friendly and fast. Prices were reasonable. We'll definitely come back on our next Vegas trip. Highly recommended.

eWtj8AEODflmCkKsgkpqRQ.text: I am a breakfast person! It is my favorite meal so I try breakfast places all the time. I stumbled upon this place when looking for Sundays breakfast. First I went to babystacks but they had a 45 minute wait.   Me and my boyfriend came here and there was no wait.   I ordered the mushroom omelete which had tons of cheese :) and a bagel with cream cheese  The service was perfect and very helpful our waitress was lenore.  Their coffee is excellent and we ended up getting a pot of bread (the nutella peanut butter one) sooo goood!!!

vNTk1x7pmEucv-fbJ6isuw.text: Got the individual tapas items for breakfast. Had the Reuben eggs benedict very good. Great service too.

yzidT-lcFLQKTjgNYKISWA.text: I've been going to jamms since before I can remember, and I mean how can you go wrong with piping hot mini loafs of fluffy perfect carbs rising out of cute little tin pots!  They always have the white and cinnamon pot of breads and monthly they change the third flavor this time we had chocolate chip banana!   This place is consistently good, and the people are always nice. I Usually have an omelet provencal and joe's omelet are my fave :)

j9U75cJYUCBd5J9vkTv0Rg.text: Great savory and sweet breakfast items and awesome service. Tried the Nutella pancakes, Reuben omelet. Also got the free pot of bread! This will definitely be my new go to breakfast place. :)

EO9ekKoOiYAkJ2MIrBIGOA.text: Ate here on a Monday at lunch...the business was steady, not too busy. The decor is way outdated. The carpet is supposed to be red but is black because it's so old. The portion sizes are good but all of the food lacked seasoning.  I order the country version of eggs Benedict, which consists of a biscuit, sausage, poached egg and gravy with a side of country potatoes. I was so disappointed that the white gravy looked and tasted like it came from an instant mix...definitely not a good quality sausage gravy...it had no flavor. The country potatoes where crispy but again lacked any seasoning. Bottoms line...will never go back
