MTMorTLmhZvJWF34Bfdn8Q.text: I came here last week when I was on my road trip. I wanted to stop and see Las Vegas for a bit, even though it was so hot. I decided to find a local place to eat. Jamms Restaurant was on the top of the recommended lists on various websites. I definitely do not regret my decision to come here... The service was very good, even though the waitress accidentally forgot my honey mustard, but she apologized for it and still did a good job otherwise. I ordered an omelet with home potatoes, along with the plain flavor for the pot of the bread. It was a good experience. I will stop by the next time I come to Las Vegas. It'd definitely be a good hangover breakfast for those who choose to party and gamble at the night.

B5pfcXG2ApXvD1qboSxobA.text: This place is hands down the best place to go and have breakfast in Vegas. Everyone is so friendly and the food is extremely fresh!!

B_8WexGD4WKv5rHJOGqWvA.text: Loooooove Jamms!! The food is always amazing :) highly recommend! It's definitely always busy for a reason!

qXx-UtMyLEL6Xy8d3Q47Aw.text: Shay was my server and she was friendly and helpful. Tim, the server assistant I think,  was great and quick on the refills. Food was outstanding, and I'm a vegetarian, if that helps anyone. Their veggie omelet and veggie breakfast burritos are top notch. I'm stuffed because I just had to finish that huge burrito. Time for a nap. =)

ojr5073EsSd8KjcRQr0rXg.text: We had a fantastic time at Jamm's! The food was excellent (we had breakfast) and the service was very attentive without being overbearing. I recommend you go for a small portion if you eat the smores pancakes- our friend, who can eat - could barely eat 1.5 pancakes. We also enjoyed the "pot" of bread which was very fluffy and light; we had the cinnamon raisin version.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White towel... Thrown.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores pancakes... HUGE!!!

rAwKT1sHtdfFyMN4_cWlYw.text: This is the best brunch spot on Charleston. I'm very happy to have found this place and will definitely be back. The place is constantly busy. If you want breakfast on the weekend, you better get here early. This place rocks. If you have the opportunity, stop by Jamm's because it's pretty sweet

-JxijwtssjlqPcPeRaNcuA.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots. My favorite waitress is Shirley...she's full of life, very friendly, happy and a great waitress.  I'm a regular here :)

H5F4I8PRvjUFMCWAmYq-0w.text: The wait is crazy, 20-30 minutes (went on a Sunday). I was on Yelp looking at breakfast places and this is one place we were excited to try.   It was worth the wait, I'll tell you that. Great customer service and the food was great!  Don't want to leave a full review because I know I'm going to be coming back here.   Will return whenever I'm in town.

diezO7NqeI6E4n1rFPeFHg.text: Food was great. Server was ok...she was friendly, but it took her awhile to come to our table. I waited tables for years and even though it's busy, "I'll be right with you" is always appreciated. However, the bus boy was on top of everything, including keeping our coffees filled. He deserves recognition for his hard work!

3E6dcJddOcwN3JlQ-YBCdA.text: Hello! First time to Vegas and I find this place! What a gem! They have huge portions and very reasonable prices. In the 4 days I was in Vegas I went there twice. That's how good it was. And the waitress remembered us. That's how a diner should be. Their French toast is deep fried and covered in corn flakes!!! Not to mention they have what is called pot'o bread. Brilliant! I got the special for that morning which was strawberry s'mores. Yes that's right. STRAWBERRY S'MORES! Together in perfect harmony. Why haven't we combined these favors years ago?!? I could never live in Vegas but if I had to, Jamms would make it a little less unbearable.

eG5hZeaPPpeJheeu7yj5Kg.text: Breakfast joints tend to disappoint me, but not Jamms. The service was great. I felt like i was being served by clones of my mom. You know how that is. Food was good and reasonably priced.

eBUmtSRwiQcuEDlwLLIyDQ.text: Great food and service! Place is small but comfortable. As soon as we sat down we had someone come to us for drinks. I will definitely go back to try some of the other menu choices.

lJ5QDGykyFUuaEo67FXgwA.text: we've been to Jamms twice in the last 2 weeks. they are right by our house and perfect for our "lazy Mondays" when we don't feel like cooking. they present themselves with a Paris-cafe-esque feel. its cozy & comfortable. my hubby & i have plant-based diets, and although the vegan-options are few, we still love enjoying a vegetarian meal here. their bread-pots are delicious and we've enjoyed all food items we've ordered. the waitresses seem to commit to the Jamms claim "enter as strangers, leave as friends". we've had great servers & all great interactions w/ the staff. we always feel welcome and valued.

DKKcMskapcNuADQr9T-P2A.text: Love this place. I started with the specialty pot of bread, which was red velvet and it was great. I had the corned beef hash and it was the best I ever had, made with real corned beef. My other dining companion had the French toast, egg and sausage combo. Portions are large, service is great. Very busy place, expect to wait, but it is so worth it. Please open another location in the northwest, I will be back.

eCBn-jV-IE4AgvRf4p4xxQ.text: I have been missing out! The pot of bread is reason enough to keep coming back. My omelet & home fries were delicious! Service was quick and the waitresses were friendly. I'll definitely be back!

xExVrggGsNhJ5aPb-8AUBQ.text: We loved this place!  Everything on our table was hot, tasty, and exactly as ordered.   We loved Shirley too!

O3D982QIqWZBH8Jw7GclRw.text: I love this place. The decor reminds me of the mom and pop restaurants back home. Recently tried the Irish Skillet. It was awesome. My wife doesn't even like hash and she liked this item. I haven't tried anything on the lunch menu yet because I am always in the mood for eggs and bacon. If you go on the weekends prepare to wait. It is a bit small and always busy.

TvHizv5QvZCtvJSTdTi47A.text: Cant go wrong with this place, very creative menu and super delicious.

DZ7Ol-3Z5EL572KE5gK-hA.text: Not bad for a breakfast place. Very friendly staff.

qHmDT2AKHmtNTOWG1EWpOg.text: Had the Denver omelette and it was very tasty! Coffee was great, service was good, overall good experience.

wqMDy5czmO9to_S8dDdgyQ.text: This place was great. Food was delicious, pot of bread was very cool concept. I liked the cinnamon raisin plus the strawberry lemonade bread. I would for sure go here again to eat. Loved the atmosphere and the waiter was super nice too.

C6i-g8impn6pNpD7Ql0N-w.text: Decent food at a decent price. Friendly staff who remember you is always a plus.

oHGT-6PjQwAKLcayFqUFIw.text: Excellent breakfast foods with good company. The place was packed so we did some quick shopping nearby. Ate our free pot of gingerbread bread, eggs bene on a waffle, and a straight-up waffle with some powdered sug for the lady. No complaints!

yn-Dbqt-oDnRWPZgfLmoVA.text: Service was great- food was great - wife got the corn flake french toast & is probably the best i've ever had- I got the steak omelet & it was good as well- the icing for the bread bowl was great not to sweet - We will be back

OEXu1wB87xSLKk1Yo3YRvg.text: We ate here in February and we all enjoyed our food. We all ordered omelets this time and were disappointed. The egg was fully cooked with the ingredients stuck in the middle and the Denver omelette had more cheese than egg! Too much.

Fml0xbUO3q0sg_fpI04gqg.text: The best mom & pop breakfast& lunch spot in town. I don't even want to review because it's my favorite little secret.

3qD80K7oh8fB3mOHPsiv1g.text: 6/20 just had breakfast here Veggie Omelet was tasty. Ham and Cheese Omelet was ok. Server and cook did a fine job pretty speedy.. We will be back for more because Im happy... I approve this message J K KUHL...

iyZ5azwc7-qmZo17F-6ixg.text: I'm a sucker for breakfast food. If only the appropriate time for breakfast was like... you know, 4pm... I'd be great.  So on the rare occasion that I AM up early for breakfast, I kind of like to reward myself for it. And as I was driving from my bank, I see this little restaurant in the plaza, and it's been rated Best of the LVR-J for 4 years, and it's only open until 3. Well I have to try it, I thought.  Best discovery on the Westside in a long time. The atmosphere is cozy, like your mom's kitchen (if she had an industrial kitchen). Knick-knacks and country sayings adorn the walls, and the staff treats you like you're in their house. Try the Texas Omelette (with chili con carne and cheddar cheese) or if you're daring, the White Castle Omelette (with ground beef and grilled onions -- yes, like a Slider!). They're famous for their "pots of bread." It's soft and doughy, and if you order the Cinnamon Raisin pot of bread, it's like eating a cinnamon roll.  They also have lunch items, which I'm sure I'll try someday, when I can get past the breakfast pages without choosing something.

zTHg4QOSoYTI3uZmXnnLYg.text: Jamm's was smart to offer the Yelp deal of free bread.Those are DELICOUS. I am not even a big bread fan. I liked the cinnamon one the best. It wasnt heavily drenched in sugar, but just enough. The portion is a good amount. I had Joes omelet which was actually a little heavy on the mushroom but not enough meat, but overall it was still great. Not to mention the  hash browns were pretty tasty. The coffee is OK but not the best. I would definitely recommend it again.

R1_GKphCPfQch4FJY5O12g.text: Our favorite goto place for breakfast.  Excellent food...Excellent staff.  The pot bread is an excellent addition to the meal

8l_k9GdI79IP0tZtGAww8g.text: This restaurant has been a family favorite since Jamms first opened. I grew up as a child right behind Jamms!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yFFAGgXB_GhXdRpQesfepg.text: This is the cutest little restaurant hidden away. And the waitress, Shirley is just so pleasant. She reminds me of the old school waitresses you see in the 50s dinners. The food was also good as well.

9MuOTaTZT2Du7KxRMX26PQ.text: After having dined here multiple times over the year (2013) I was recently shown my previous review, which was a two liner and felt ashamed I have not updated my pathetic first review.  JR is always a front runner in any Friday "where are we going to breakfast" discussion.  The reasons being you are always going to get a great breakfast, happy service and great coffee.  The omelets are a group favorite and I seem to focus on the Jamms Signature Omelet.   It consists of pieces of sliced tender steak, onions, mushrooms, cheese.  All covered with a wonderful bearnaise sauce.  JR is known for their pots of bread, which is FREE when you check-in on yelp.  The benefit  has yet to expire because every time I check-in.....there it is.  CHECK-IN!  ON my most recent visit some ordered the grits.  Now I can take or leave grits.  But I would kiss these grits all damn day until I died of a heart attack.  Heart attack?  YES!  the are covered in cheese and comes with butter! You can get the LARGE or you can get a "monkey size" which dials down you cholesterol a tad.  Be sure to grab a stick of Juicy Fruit at the counter when you settle up the bill.  Be sure to add this to your list of breaking the fast spots!

bU3JjH9-u8TJvD_IOyxVtw.text: Jamms was a great surprise. Everything was great- the atmosphere, the menu options, the workers. I love their pot of bread. It's so adorable and warm and delicious. We usually get all three flavors when we go.

OzcAq7VLXOkuGiQrGi-Gag.text: Dang, are they busy. I shouldn't be surprised though since it was a sat morning. Wasn't too long of a wait considering we have six people in our group. Ten minutes maybe?   Checked in and received my free pot of bread. Pretty cool. I love free items. The cream cheese frosting isn't too sweet and I tried the new chocolate chip cinnamon raisin bread.  We all were starving so I only got a few pictures in. I will talk about the food I did try.  The Belgium waffle is large and tasty. Actually, all the plates are huge, so come with a huge appetite, or expect to take food home. Apple cinnamon French toast is ridiculously big and sweet. Too sweet for my liking but it might just hit the spot for those of you with a huge sweet tooth. Large enough for two or three people to share. I got the biscuits and gravy, which were delicious. I practically had to lick the plate clean. If it weren't for the biscuits and gravy this probably would have been a. Three star review.   Everyone else loved their items, but I didn't get to try them. Next time, I say!  Waitress was great at constantly topping off our coffee and bringing more creamer too. Considering how busy they were I would have never known considering how often she visited out able. Great!  For a good, home cooked, large portioned, home type feeling restaurant this is your place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Take in effect that this is only half, after I had hit it full force
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Belgium waffle

yFF16grQkG2auH5ZwP-ywg.text: Service 5/5 Real friendly host, servers, bus boys.  Top notch.  very friendly.  They flip the tables pretty quick.  so there was a wait when we got there but we only waited 10 minutes on a holiday with a party of 8.  Corned Beef Hash (4/5)  Real corned beef (not the canned stuff).  Tasty Country fried steak (4/5)  Ellis Island is way better but it's good here. Pot O Bread (1/5)  Too small.  So you don't get much and because it's so small there isn't enough chewy inside to combat the crisp outside. Pancake combo (4/5)  Tasty pancakes. Hash browns are perfect here.  I'd expect when you go over $10 that your portions would be a bit bigger for being off-strip.  It's pretty pricey here for being so far from the strip.  We went here on the way up to Red Rock canyon (half way from the 15 to red rock)  You get 10% off for social media but that just offsets the higher prices.

4WORliId2sIatRqXjFwZ7g.text: Delicious breakfast. Great Service. Amazing place to bring the kids and family when visiting Las Vegas.

KQxd6F4-RQEoLiDx6YDYOg.text: We stopped here because of the high reviews, and everything, from food to service, was 5 stars all the way.   The small plate option is awesome. For someone like me who doesn't always eat so much for breakfast, I was able to get an omelet that was just the right size! The small plate omelet is about half the size of a regular omelet and also half the price.   We also got their famous "pot of bread" (got a free one for checking in on Yelp!). The weekly special was jalapeno mozzarella and the classic cinnamon raisin. Both were super yummy!  Sandy was our server and she was great- very friendly and efficient with bringing our food, refilling coffee, and checking on us. I wish more places were like Jamms!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon raisin pot of bread with icing on the side. DELICIOUS!
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small plate veggie omelet on the red plate, regular Denver omelet on the white plate.

bGSXEj98M0NOlFbd1vJAUA.text: The French toast fries are TO DIE FOR! As well as the pots of bread are fresh and so perfect every time!

iLYBp4WByIZOUCt2_FPnyg.text: It is my first visit here and the first thing that pleased me was their excellent buser named Victor. Great customer service is very hard to come by especially during busier times of the day.  Immediately greeted my party and I with a genuine smile and catered to us the entire time we were here.  Their food is good and comforting. But what made the visit great was Victor and his hard work.  I watched him take care of other parties with the same passion and care & you can tell her truly loves his job here.  Great asset to the establishment, our food server was also great and courteous. I didn't catch her name however but she greeted normal customers by their names.  Very welcoming atmosphere.  From start to finish. The hostess was also very nice and welcoming. Thank you for a great first visit I will be back in the future for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9nQCItuvyrNv0HFdU39B5g.text: We came in on a Tuesday morning around 11 and the place was already hoppin'. We waited for a few minutes by the counter - they have a couple benches there and it's a quick turnaround.   Shannon (Shay) was our server, she was incredibly nice and very attentive. I ordered the corned beef hash ($6 side, $2.75 coffee) and loved both - 5 stars. I mixed the seasoned salt and mild Tabasco together (both on the tables) and had the saltiest, corned beefiest, hashiest breakfast ever. So good, and so unassuming of a menu item. The omelettes get much more play.  My bf ordered an omelette, and I thought the steak was pretty dry (losing a star), but it had a ton of cheddar on it. The hash browns are definitely made in-house and are delicious - I recommend pairing them with the hash. :-)   Very cozy atmosphere that gets busy, but is an excellent spot for families. I also like that they give out free gum at the counter. I saw a lot of grandmas today, and they all looked pretty stoked.   Free "Pot of Bread" with check-in. Give em' a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steaky, cheesy Signature Omelet ($10). Not too shabby!
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of Corned Beef Hash ($6)
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamms signature omelet ($10)

70QOlJy3Wh4zLjEnt66Jpg.text: The hot coco is the greatest hot coco ever!! The French toast fries are amazing as well.

viG8WTet0cRwDvMsxamp3Q.text: My husband and I decided to try this out since it's down the street from where we live, we went in there around 11:00 am and the place was pretty packed already. We didn't wait too long so that was cool was a good thing.  Once we had sat down, someone had come over to take our drinks right away. And if you're a big coffee person, this place is for you. They make sure that your coffee is never low or out during your whole dining experience.  My Husband ordered the Corn Beef Hash with a side of toast, which tasted really good. It wasn't too salty like most placed that we have tried. And the hash browns were a good sized portion and very crispy.  I had ordered the Country Fried Steak with the famous Pot Bread on the side, and the Steak was good, but the gravy tasted like packaged gravy to me. It was also a little bland and it's sad to say I had add a little salt and pepper on top to add some flavor. But everything else was delicious. My Hash Brown were just as crispy and delicious as the one my husband had. Oh and the pot bread... I've never tried anything like that before and it was super tasty, I got the cinnamon raisin pot bread and OH MY GOODNESS, DELICIOUS. it came out warm and it wasn't too sweet even when I added the icing on top. Yum.  Overall I had a good dining experience here at Jamms except when My husband and I received our food it wasn't as hot as I expected to be. I felt that they were so slammed that they might have forgotten about our food because the table besides us got sat 15-20 minutes after we did and got their food the same time. But we will be back though, because everyone was so sweet and we love Mom and Pop Shops

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cinnamon pot bread with the icing on the side. It was really good. Nice pastry
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was my whole meal- Country Fried steak with eggs over medium, hash browns, and a side of the cinnamon raisin pot bread

YvY3SE3Zh6feogZuOmD65w.text: ***Local Vegas Breakfast Spot***  #LocalFlavor  There is a basket of Juicy Fruit and Big Red Stick gums at the hostess counter to sweeten up your taste buds before or after breakfast because guess what? I did pick up a stick or two to chew on while waiting about 20 minutes before and another stick after an awesome meal.  I've ordered their Irish Skillet which consist of corn beef hash, bell peppers, onions, potatoes scrambled with eggs and melted cheddar cheese, it didn't disappoint! I know a good skillet meal when I try one when it all just melts in my mouth, but hey the potatoes on these were not dry but almost light as butter, the scramble mesh well the all the toppings that made it a hearty meal for me.   Addition to the experience my wife's Ruben Benedict was delicious! English muffin topped with corned beef, two poached eggs covered with hollandaise sauce? whats in that sauce?! it was creamy and it added some flavor, the corned beef was sizzlin'! and I love corned beef!  No coffee this time! but I've ordered the specialty Mexican Cinnamon Hot Chocolate/no whip cream which was good it's almost a horchata, just not as sweet. On the side, I recommend giving their Bacon Ranch Pot of Bread a try! It's a small bread with bacon bits pouched inside with butter spread, very tasty along with the softness core to bite in.  The ambience inside is like one of those old school diners with spacious booth seating and of course awesome service. Our server reminds me of some lady in the Simpsons because she had that friendly lovely voice.  I highly recommend this spot to do away classy Vegas eats for breakfast time.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish Skillet yum!
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ruben Benedict
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican cinnamon hot chocolate without the whip cream

o2eJ0YRQeft7l6YqHgFm3g.text: Excellent alternative to Vegas buffets.  The service is friendly and professional.  The food is delicious.  Worth the time to find it.

r0YpWekP9KMJ2x8wi03xWg.text: Awful awful awful service and food! What a waste!!!!!!! We will never return to this place that we fell in love with not too long ago. This is my 5th visit here and it was so awful that I do NOT want to ever return! First off we saw our food sitting in the window for a long time and of course it was COLD! My friend didn't even eat her entree and when the awful waitress picked up a full plate of food she didn't even ask if there was anything wrong! We ended up paying that entire bill and because my friends are waitresses they believe in karma and still left that lazy no good waitress a $5 tip!  Our Irish skillet was so awful I only ate a few bites. The pot o bread was doughy and not fully baked! Even the hot water to the hot tea was warm! Really?!?!?!  AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!  Never again!!!!!!

g5X_ICXfCtR1Z98_ic09Cw.text: Very good and great portions too. We are regular guests. Everyone is very friendly and working fast.

CNO_peEmM1a5_MXgOARfKg.text: We're visiting from out of town.  We didn't want to eat breakfast on the strip,  so we decided to try Jamms based on the reviews. The outside isn't much to look at but don't let that fool you.  Amazing customer service.  Friendly staff and even better food! My kids got some specialty pancakes and waffles.  I got the California eggs Benedict.  Everything was delicious.  Great prices too.  I highly recommend.

YJP0uBD7IjFGGX-PcTeJYA.text: This is a gem in the Vegas locals breakfast/brunch circuit. I've been meaning to try it out and when I did, I could easily see why. The staff is very attentive and friendly, you have that family friendly diner atmosphere and the coffee is just eye opening, literally!  I enjoyed a tasty breakfast burrito with their homemade salsa. It definitely didn't disappoint and I'll be sure to return to try some more of their other items in their very extensive menu.

o8qLs2bWabeCl_466V_D1Q.text: Jamm's breakfast was vey affordable and WOW is the food great!

Qy85asBE7c10X65kH4qLiA.text: Ate a traditional BLT sandwich. Quite tasty. Had wedge steak fries. Very tasty,as well. Highly recommended for breakfast and lunch.

bIborvFJPO0MrSispmQtbA.text: Had the sandy omelet and let me tell you that thing did the disappearing act.  Pot of bread was the holiday cranberry flavor.  I can't give Jamms enough love, I want to skip the silverware entirely and use my fingers next time.  Old fashioned homey atmosphere, huge portions, great service, family owned.  They also will do platter portions for carry out for you to supplement your next party!

VKzDdf-zaCsb-N7OAKGmHg.text: Great hole in the wall eatery. The food is good staff is really nice and attentive. Sat thru morning rush on a Friday. Tables stayed full.

XV62ZaJKus_EO3xsWZm0PA.text: Good traditional breakfast.  Fast service and good coffee.  Cornbeef was tasty but a little too salty.  Hubby's french toast was good.   We'll be back...

NKJ1YM_KHjsHvlc8b_s5vQ.text: My very first yelp review. Had to do it, because if you haven't tried jamms, you're missing out.   It's located on rainbow and charleston by the albertsons. Blends in well, I've lived in vegas my whole life and just discovered this place recently.   My girlfriend and I have only gone for breakfast a handful of times, and each time we were impressed with the price and quality of food. I got the bumper omlette; fluffy eggs, mushrooms, broccoli, cream cheese, and topped with hollandaise sauce. I added bacon to it. AMAZING!! The service was pretty good, especially considering how busy it was. My girlfriend had a pretty customized order, and they had no problem with it.   I would recommend Jamm's to anyone who likes breakfast food, and is tired of Dennys and ihop. Be sure to go early though, as they are only open for breakfast and lunch and close at 2pm!  P.S. You have not lived until you get a "pot of bread" from these guys!!!

ey6S22xRHeFbnaNQ5s25yw.text: Consistently good.  I have never been here when I wasn't greeted like a friend.  Sometimes it is so busy that I don't have enough time to wait.  They try to wait until your entire party is there before they sit you which is annoying if you are trying to save a seat but wonderful if you are a party of two trying to get in.  The food is home cooked and genuine and the Pot of bread is an added bonus.  I had the sausage and egg breakfast with home fries.  The eggs were over easy perfection and the home fries were seared with a crispy lightness that was satisfying.  Today the special pot of bread was creamy peach served with sweet cream cheese frosting on the side.  If this were close to my home I would come here a lot more often.  MMMMM!

_ow2ibthLgJa7mmnvRd0TQ.text: I've been going to Jamms for YEARS. It's been my favorite breakfast place since I was in high school.  A lot of the staff has been working there since I've started going there as well, which I think is amazing. I've never had a bad experience here and I've never found anything as delicious as pot of bread anywhere else.. Ever. I love Jamms so much!!

_XVZqCNHNRucGalVD4bODA.text: We will be coming back my 4 hungry picky kids loved it.  All of our food was made fresh.  Love this plAce

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy this place is a winner

UKX47ltN0FBqj9kSey2Xsw.text: Food was good as usual but service was not as great. The server was sweet but they brought out our food a couple of plates at a time. Mine was the last and about 15 minutes after everyone else's so they were pretty much done. We also ordered a small plate of French toast sticks that they never brought out and she didn't come back enough for us to say anything.   Later, the waitress told us she realized she forgot and removed it from the check but never apologized or offered to get us any which I thought was a little rude. At that point, we were over it and didn't really want them.   Other than that, food was good just maybe not in a big group.

bxcbASy_uN2DFwO8xCsH0A.text: Went in for their well-known omelets, but ended up with the french toast...and absolutely no regrets! My friend had one of the skillets, and that was a lot of food!  The lunch menu looks just as good, will have to try it.   The place was busy, but we got seated quickly, and the service was good. Basic ambiance, but plenty of parking (strip mall) and easy to find. Will definitely put it in the rotation.

apHYXh4pHxDV_VofzoVb-Q.text: This place is Amazing!  I love to find great restaurants that are not a chain and this one is awesome!  Over the pot of bread and the breakfast burrito!

1AvFeUX2V-nKj0paPW-i0Q.text: Got a free pot of bread through check in.  There is a reason why this place is constantly crowded.  The food is delicious, a service is speedy, and waiters are nice.  I've got nothing to complain about this wonderful establishment.

v-X_Xirk4yjtPwyONjiWuA.text: A great weekend breakfast or brunch spot! A little pricey, but it's all worth it. Their pot of breads are worth it alone!

yyIKDBctULpHr8Uo2PSPuQ.text: Saw this place on the Travel Channel and had to try it out. When you first walk in your greeted with a smile and the place is all a chatter. No wait and I'm at my seat. Looking around its clean and everyone is smiling. Ordered my food( Texas Omelette) and was here with in 10 min. The food was great and the waitress was nice. This is a place that I can return to no questions asked.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm Texas omelette

A1YRLtN0mmXCkBlezBqLsg.text: For a Saturday morning, there was only a 5 minute wait.  The first thing that caught my eye was the French Press coffee. This was a first for me and it was so incredibly good. They even offered a to go cup for what we didn't drink. The corn beef hash is hands down the BEST EVER!!!!!! It was what my husband had, along with the carmelized onion, bacon, cream cheese pot of bread. Dayyyyum!!! My next trip I'll be trying the S'mores pancakes. Sounds like a little piece of heaven.  The servers were on point with everything!! Check it out!

Lwe3h5xdQFPC_lgw2E6OCA.text: This was my first visit.  I went with my son who's been there before.  A slight delay but nothing to ruin the experience.  Plus you have to expect some of that for such a popular restaurant.    We were seated in a comfortable booth and approached immediately by staff for our drink order.  The coffee was so-so but good.  I ordered Jamm's Signature Omelet and it was very tasty.  Totally forgot to get a pic of it as it looked just like the pic in the menu.  Medium to large omelet and very good tasting.  I also ordered the Pot of Bread and it was very good.  Prices were comparable to IHOP and Denny's but the quality and flavor was way better.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot O Bread..
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Bacon and Spinach Salad with sliced steak.  The bacon is the flavor of dressing.  No actual bacon.
Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamms Fruit Salad w/cottage cheese

jR6i65smayEd508yoGEsQg.text: Darlene and I just had great brunch at Jamms  Pumpkin pancakes Cranberry orange bread bowl Corned beef Benedict  Yum -o

m2Zm441fJERO8tVsydMRZQ.text: Love breakfast at this place! The corned beef hash is amazing. The staff is always so friendly and I have yet to eat anything I didn't like off the menu and we've tried lots of thing. And the tapas plates are such a great idea!!

MG4FMjglBig1G5-vQvgQ6Q.text: This place has gone downhill. The first couple of times I went here, the food was great. So was the service. But my last couple of times eating here, the food was lackluster. The service is still good, but there 'pot of bread' was cold & bland when brought to me. Boyfriend ordered the chiliquiles & the chips were all soggy.

photos.caption: Photo of Jamms Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Irish skillet. Pretty good. Decaf coffee tasted like nothing.

6t8k11aqNSy6RlwWjuoaLQ.text: My brother and I were both up at 8am and wanted some breakfast.  He found this place online and wanted to try it due to some awards they received from Best of Vegas.  I then looked it up on here and read about the special offer for a free pot of bread.  I love bread and was excited to find out what it was exactly and to try it.  After our waitress took our orders I mentioned Yelp and asked about the pot of bread.  She didn't seem familiar with the offer, but didn't question it at all and brought me one.  In case you're wondering, it's a personal sized piece of bread that comes in a little round bowl and resembles a large cupcake.  I got the cinnamon-raisin one and it was definitely the best part of my dining experience.  The top was just a little toasted and the middle was soft and chewy.  If that were all I ate I'd have given them 5 stars, but sadly it went downhill from there.     I ordered an omelet with avocado, bacon, and cheddar and it was a big disappointment.  There was quite a bit of bacon inside, but it was all way overcooked and a little thick, so it was rock hard.  The avocado was good but it was all on one side, so I had to open it up and spread it out.  Also, the only cheddar I found was a few shredded pieces on top.  Like I said, very disappointing.  In hindsight I should have sent it back and either gotten something else or had them remake it. They give a choice of hash browns or home fries and I had the latter.  They were good and had bits of onion and bell pepper mixed in.  Overall, I can see how this place could be good, but my experience wasn't the best.  I'd give 'em a mulligan tho.

UDSWoRjrLswr6oMkiqX8Xg.text: Best breakfast ever!!  Shirley made us laugh and had great recommendations. If you're close, don't miss this little gem.

W0V3dPKgq0FosMtyTlNBkQ.text: Solid breakfast food at reasonable prices. I got a "reuben omelet" and enjoyed it very much. The portions are large, the service is friendly, and they keep the coffee cups filled. What more can you ask for from a simple place like this? Great job, Jamm's. I'll come back whenever I'm in Vegas....

eOJtygEbnI2ZBDCpPMQRyg.text: The food was OK, service OK (she never smiled once), prices abit high for the product. Then while paying.....our bill was 44 and change and they wouldn't accept our $50.00 bill. Told us to go break it at the store next store. There was no sign posted either. I'll never go back there when there are so many better places in this city to go.

VwU5Oi_KRDc7unLsa6C9hg.text: We enjoyed a delicious breakfast here.  Loved the fresh-baked cinnamon bread!  Service was great.

GTXuI5lkZEE8Cy5TvWPqAQ.text: We went over the weekend with my extended family hoping to get some yummy breakfast, but were very disappointed. We called ahead to make reservations since we had quite a few people and were told the wait was 15 minutes. We got there and the wait was 20 minutes, but we waited over 30 minutes before we went in and asked for an update. There was a large empty booth that we requested, but they said they would not allow us to use it since they didn't think we would fit. They didn't even let us try, and the majority of our party was small children, so we would have fit. They then told us the only way to let us eat was to put us at two tables at opposite sides of the restaurant. It was very frustrating. By that time we had been there about 40 minutes and everyone was getting very hangry. We ended up having to just go somewhere else. We wish they would have just told us they didn't have room for that many people when we originally called so we didn't waste our time. None of us will be going back after the horrible service we received.

BGqx3D2l3ETEbk6BtwrAtQ.text: The pots of bread are awesome! Plus I had the country style eggs benedict, best eggs benedict ever. After visiting Portland this summer, we were looking for something like that in Vegas and this is it.

B9-LMvjg5hSRwrnDaxa6OA.text: Ok, so after being a regular here for a few months, I can update my review a bit.    By and large, their food is pretty good.  But there is room for improvement.  The omeletes are decent, but I prefer the kind where the ingredients are cooked into the eggs, rather than just piled in and folded over.  NO big deal though.  I will leave this at 4 stars, as I think the food could use a little more refinement, but all said, I am pretty happy with the place.

0Xuf_UQtGJlVf59Qhsx94g.text: Chose this restaurant for Sunday breakfast based on other Yelp reviews.  Was not disappointed.  Excellent, reasonably priced food.  Friendly, attentive service.  Sticks of gum at the register are a nice touch.

rUxq_f6viqa2I30p-D_fnA.text: Can't disagree more with this overall yelp rating!   Strike 1: coffee was served in a dirty mug with lip smudge marks still on it.                Strike 2: I order jams French toast and got waffles instead. I read it off the menu to the waitress . She argued with me when the wrong dish came out and said "are you ok " as though I am crazy.                           Strike3: the waffle was baaad , it was grainy and tasted like it was never mixed.The worst waffle that I ever ate. The bacon was cheap buffet quality . My bill was $17 with tax and tip. It was $16.99 too much. Keep away from Jamms, go to the omlet house or original pancake instead.

swa2Xe1jsM6CWFd2Ox8HXg.text: My  adult daughter and niece, mother in law, wife and I ate here while in Vegas.  Well worth the drive away from the strip.  Excellent food And service, full of locals.  Try the bread bowls.  Everyone  left full and happy while saying only good things  about this gem

uYD5hQ680k3drAAhxXQp4g.text: Amazing!!! Food is great, they were busy but food came out fast and was delicious!!! Donna was our server she was amazing!!! So helpful and always checking on us drinks were never empty!

LQ9PkhHAL2FNSR_uZnSSzw.text: Great local hole-in-the-wall with a friendly diner atmosphere.  We ate breakfast there.  I had a meaty omelet and my wife had the eggs Benedict.   Both were tasty and reasonably priced.  We were headed out of Vegas going North, and it was an easy stop before getting out of town.    They are apparently famous for their bread bowl, wish we would have gotten that.  We didn't notice it until we exited.  I had whole wheat bread with my omelet and it was amazing.  Pretty sure it was homemade.  The texture was soft yet chewy and buttery... man that was some good bread.

h8tDuuanA7PRipESsIp09Q.text: I tried the Chicken Fried Steak with Biscuit and Gravy.  I thought this was the best CFS I had in Vegas.  The steak is a deep fried variety.  The batter is thicker than others and has a good crispy crunch while being soaked with gravy.  It's not easy having that last bite still crunchy.  The hash browns were not over cooked or undercooked.  They were golden brown with a nice crisp exterior and nice soft interior.  The biscuit was very soft.  Melts in your mouth.  Coffee was good too.

ZeJZSITWf1WEM_9mrGjoVg.text: I'm a big fan of the breakfast place. I'm especially fond of off-the-beaten-track, magnet for the odd-bird-local breakfast place. This place fits the bill. Not long ago, I was yearnin' for somethin' different than my regular rotation and decided to check out this place. There was a steady stream of people heading in at 9am, which is a smidge earlier than a typical rush - a good sign. The decor is... well.... Bridges of Madison County meets sponge paint meets truck stop.  Once you get over the momentary shock of that, you know you're at a place that feels like home. The menu has a lengthy omelette menu which includes the likes of a White Castle omelette. Being from Chicago, I was filled with warm fuzzies.  I settled on the house special omelette, which was steak, onions, sauteed mushrooms and provolone cheese.  The omelettes are done just like I happen to like them, with thin egg wrapped around sauteed yummies in the middle.  The bread in a pot was a nifty surprise as well.  Home baked white bread in a little white ramikin served with softened butter.   All in all, it was a hit. Go to Jamm's and find yourself in breakfast heaven.

Bl6VRv12jZFB8fGi8NROCg.text: Great service, food and atmosphere! If you like French toast get the Jamms French toast it has little bits of cornflakes on them, it's amazing

0H8mVXzBatnqp37i81zi1w.text: I had the best omelet (the babalama - bacon, tomato, avocado, and cheddar) of my life here.

mOS8EYgPPkK7sErA_gD8JA.text: This is a comfortable homey restaurant. Everything is great. The potted bread option can be a meal in itself but you won't want to pass up one of the great omelets. The southwest hamburger is a real treat. Friendly staff does whatever you need to enjoy your meal. Prices are very reasonable.

faghgKk6TlRvpq0ihlx9sg.text: I really enjoyed eating here. Cute decor, warm and friendly wait staff, and great food. The only thing is that I wish my breakfast had a little less salt, but I have to give them props for using FRESH CORNED BEEF for their corned beef hash! Their Cinnamon Raisin pot of bread was excellent and it was enough for us to take back to our room and heat up for the next day! :) YUM!!!

sdND2O3jzFh35MDdFcHgWA.text: I just had the best omelet! It was a mushroom, brocolli and cream cheese omelet...cooked to a PERFECT fluffy consistency. It wasn't gooey like some other omelets that I typically get. They used chopped mushrooms (not canned) and yummy chunks of fresh brocolli. It also came with hashbrowns and their famous "Cup of Bread." The bread was flaky and buttery--delicious on its own or with jam. My friend ordered their Philly Cheese Steak, and she loved it too! Service was great...really friendly team.
